human_translation: Rav Ḥinnana said: “Take up the stumbling block from the way of My people” Rabbi Yehoshua, son of Rav Idi, said: “And you shall show them the way in which they must walk”
llm_translation: Rav Chinana said: "Remove the stumbling block from before My people's path." Rabbi Yehoshua, son of Rav Idi, said: "And you shall instruct them in the way they shall go."

hebrew_text: מָר זוּטְרָא אָמַר: ״וְהִזַּרְתֶּם אֶת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מִטּוּמְאָתָם״. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: ״וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם אֶת מִשְׁמַרְתִּי״ — עֲשׂוּ מִשְׁמֶרֶת לְמִשְׁמַרְתִּי.
human_translation: Mar Zutra said “Thus you shall separate the children of Israel from their impurity” Rav Ashi said “And you shall keep My charge” establish a safeguard for My charge,
llm_translation: Mar Zutra said: "And you shall separate the children of Israel from their impurity." Rav Ashi said: "And you shall guard My charge" - make a charge for My charge.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: ״וְשָׂם דֶּרֶךְ אַרְאֶנּוּ בְּיֵשַׁע אֱלֹהִים״.
human_translation: Ravina said: “And to him who orders his way, I will show the salvation of God”
llm_translation: Ravina said: "And He will set a way for me in His salvation."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כׇּל הַשָּׁם אוֹרְחוֹתָיו — זוֹכֶה וְרוֹאֶה בִּישׁוּעָתוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְשָׂם דֶּרֶךְ״, אַל תִּקְרֵי ״וְשָׂם״, אֶלָּא: ״וְשָׁם דֶּרֶךְ״ — ״אַרְאֶנּוּ בְּיֵשַׁע אֱלֹהִים״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Whoever appraises his ways merits seeing the salvation of the Holy One, Blessed be He, as it is stated: “And to him who orders his way.” Do not read vesam , rather, vesham , him will I show the salvation of God.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: "All who walk in His ways - merits and sees the salvation of the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is stated: 'And He will set a way,' do not read 'and He will set,' rather 'and there will be a way' - 'I will see him in the salvation of God.'"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יַנַּאי הֲוָה לֵיהּ הָהוּא תַּלְמִידָא דְּכׇל יוֹמָא הֲוָה מַקְשֵׁי לֵיהּ, בְּשַׁבְּתָא דְרִיגְלָא לָא הֲוָה מַקְשֵׁי לֵיהּ,
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai had a certain student who would raise difficulties every day On Shabbat of a Festival, would not raise difficulties,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai had a certain student, every day he would challenge him, but on Shabbat eve he would not challenge him.

hebrew_text: קָרֵי עֲלֵיהּ: ״וְשָׂם דֶּרֶךְ אַרְאֶנּוּ בְּיֵשַׁע אֱלֹהִים״.
human_translation: read about him: “And to him who orders his way, I will show the salvation of God”
llm_translation: He reads upon it: "And He will set a way for me in His salvation, God."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מְצַיְּנִין לֹא עַל כַּזַּיִת מִן הַמֵּת, וְלֹא עַל עֶצֶם כִּשְׂעוֹרָה, וְלֹא עַל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְטַמֵּא בְּאֹהֶל. אֲבָל מְצַיְּנִין עַל הַשִּׁדְרָה, וְעַל הַגּוּלְגּוֹלֶת, עַל רוֹב בִּנְיַן, וְעַל רוֹב מִנְיַן הַמֵּת.
human_translation: the Sages taught do not mark of an olive-bulk of a corpse; nor of a bone barleygrain-bulk; nor of item that does not impart ritual impurity by means of a tent But they do mark the spine the skull, the majority of the structure or the majority of the number
llm_translation: The sages taught: One does not mark a grave neither on an olive's size of a corpse, nor on a bone the size of a barley grain, nor on something that does not convey impurity in a tent. But one does mark on a lintel, and on a skull, on the majority of a building, and on the majority of the corpse.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין מְצַיְּנִין עַל הַוַּודָּאוֹת, אֲבָל מְצַיְּנִין עַל הַסְּפֵיקוֹת. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן הַסְּפֵיקוֹת: סְכָכוֹת וּפְרָעוֹת וּבֵית הַפְּרָס. וְאֵין מַעֲמִידִין צִיּוּן בִּמְקוֹם טוּמְאָה, שֶׁלֹּא לְהַפְסִיד אֶת הַטְּהָרוֹת. וְאֵין מַרְחִיקִין צִיּוּן מִמְּקוֹם טוּמְאָה, שֶׁלֹּא לְהַפְסִיד אֶת אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: And they do not mark of certain but they do mark of uncertain And these are the uncertain Overhanging boughs, protrusions, and a beit haperas . And they do not erect the marker over the site of the ritual impurity, so as not to cause a loss of ritually pure Similarly, they do not distance the marker from the site of ritual impurity, so as not to cause a loss of Eretz Yisrael,
llm_translation: And we do not establish markers on certainties, but we establish markers on doubts. And these are the doubts: Sukkot, Parot, and Beit HaPeras. And we do not place a marker in a place of impurity, so as not to lose the purities. And we do not distance a marker from a place of impurity, so as not to lose the land of Israel.

hebrew_text: וּכְזַיִת מִן הַמֵּת אֵינוֹ מְטַמֵּא בְּאֹהֶל? וְהָא תְּנַן: אֵלּוּ שֶׁמְּטַמְּאִין בְּאֹהֶל — כְּזַיִת מִן הַמֵּת!
human_translation: Is it so that an olive-bulk of a corpse does not impart ritual impurity by means of a tent? But didn’t we learn These are that impart ritual impurity by means of a tent, an olive-bulk of a corpse?
llm_translation: "And like an olive from a corpse does not render impure in a tent? But didn't we learn: These are the ones that render impure in a tent - like an olive from a corpse!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הָכָא בִּכְזַיִת מְצוּמְצָם עָסְקִינַן, דְּסוֹף סוֹף מִיחְסָר חָסַר. מוּטָב יִשָּׂרְפוּ עָלָיו תְּרוּמָה וְקׇדָשִׁים לְפִי שָׁעָה, וְאַל יִשָּׂרְפוּ עָלָיו לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Here, we are dealing with where is exactly an olive-bulk, which, will ultimately diminish it is preferable that teruma and consecrated items be burned because of it for the time being, and not be burned because of it forever
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Here we are dealing with a small olive, for ultimately, it will be lacking. It is better that terumah and holy items be burned on it temporarily, rather than be burned on it forever.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ הֵן הַסְּפֵיקוֹת: סְכָכוֹת וּפְרָעוֹת.
human_translation: And these are the uncertain Overhanging boughs, and protrusions,
llm_translation: And these are the "s'fekot": "s'chachot" and "pera'ot."

hebrew_text: סְכָכוֹת — אִילָן הַמֵּיסֵךְ עַל הָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: Overhanging boughs a tree that hangs over the ground
llm_translation: "Sukkot - ilan hameisech al haaretz."

hebrew_text: פְּרָעוֹת — אֲבָנִים פְּרוּעוֹת הַיּוֹצְאוֹת מִן הַגָּדֵר.
human_translation: Protrusions protruding stones that jut out from a wall
llm_translation: Par'ot - avanim peru'ot hayotz'ot min hagader.

hebrew_text: בֵּית הַפְּרָס, כְּדִתְנַן: הַחוֹרֵשׁ אֶת הַקֶּבֶר הֲרֵי הוּא עוֹשֶׂה בֵּית הַפְּרָס, וְכַמָּה הוּא עוֹשֶׂה — מְלֹא מַעֲנֶה מֵאָה אַמָּה.
human_translation: beit haperas as we learned One who plows a grave, renders a beit haperas . And how much does he render The full a furrow, a hundred cubits.
llm_translation: House of the Plowing, as we learned: One who plows a grave, behold, he is making a House of the Plowing, and how much does he make - a space of one hundred cubits.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הַפְּרָס מִי מְטַמֵּא בְּאֹהֶל? וְהָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מְנַפֵּחַ אָדָם בֵּית הַפְּרָס וְהוֹלֵךְ.
human_translation: Does a beit haperas impart ritual impurity by means of a tent? But didn’t Rav Yehuda say Shmuel said: a person may blow upon the beit haperas and walk
llm_translation: House of Persa, who defiles in tent? And said Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: One who blows House of Persa and goes.

hebrew_text: וְרַב יְהוּדָה בַּר אַמֵּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּעוּלָּא אָמַר: בֵּית הַפְּרָס שֶׁנִּידַּשׁ — טָהוֹר!
human_translation: Rav Yehuda bar Ami said in the name of Ulla: A beit haperas that was trampled, is ritually pure,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah bar Ammi, whose name was Ulah, said: If the house of Persia is breached - it is pure!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּשָׂדֶה שֶׁאָבַד בָּהּ קֶבֶר, כָּאן בְּשָׂדֶה שֶׁנֶּחְרַשׁ בָּהּ קֶבֶר.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: not difficult, Here, a field in which a grave was lost, There, a field where a grave was plowed
llm_translation: Rav Papa said, it is not difficult: here in a field where a grave was lost, here in a field where a grave was plowed.

hebrew_text: וְשָׂדֶה שֶׁנֶּחְרַשׁ בָּהּ קֶבֶר, בֵּית הַפְּרָס קָרֵי לֵיהּ? אִין, וְהָתְנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה בֵּית הַפְּרָס הֵן: שָׂדֶה שֶׁנֶּאֱבַד בָּהּ קֶבֶר, וְשָׂדֶה שֶׁנֶּחְרַשׁ בָּהּ קֶבֶר, וּשְׂדֵה בוֹכִין.
human_translation: But is a field where a grave was plowed called a beit haperas , Yes, and so we learned There are three beit haperas A field in which a grave was lost a field in which a grave was plowed and a weepers’ field.
llm_translation: The field that was plowed in it a grave, is it called a "field of the plow"? No, and we learned: There are three types of "field of the plow": a field in which a grave was lost, a field in which a grave was plowed, and a field of thorns.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״שְׂדֵה בוֹכִין״? רַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בַּר אַבָּא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּעוּלָּא אָמַר: שָׂדֶה שֶׁמַּפְטִירִין בָּהּ מֵתִים.
human_translation: What is a weepers’ field? Rav Yehoshua bar Abba said in the name of Ulla: A field where would take leave of the deceased,
llm_translation: "What is 'a field of weepers'? Rav Yehoshua son of Abba, whose name was Ulah, said: A field in which the dead are buried."

hebrew_text: וְטַעְמָא מַאי, אָמַר אֲבִימִי: מִשּׁוּם יֵאוּשׁ בְּעָלִים נָגְעוּ בָּהּ.
human_translation: And what is the reason Avimi said: due to the despair by the owners touched it.
llm_translation: And the reason, what is it? Abimi said: Because of despair, the owners touched it.

hebrew_text: וּשְׂדֵה שֶׁנֶּחְרַשׁ בָּהּ קֶבֶר לָא בָּעֵי צִיּוּן? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: מָצָא שָׂדֶה מְצוּיֶּנֶת וְאֵין יָדוּעַ מָה טִיבָהּ, יֵשׁ בָּהּ אִילָנוֹת — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁנֶּחְרַשׁ בָּהּ קֶבֶר. אֵין בָּהּ אִילָנוֹת — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁאָבַד בָּהּ קֶבֶר.
human_translation: And does a field in which a grave was plowed not require marking? But isn’t it taught If one encountered a field that was marked and it is no known what the nature of the was, if there are trees in it is known that a grave was plowed in it, If there are no trees in it is known that a grave was lost in it,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And a field that a grave was plowed in it, does not require marking? But it was taught: If one finds a field that is well-known but its quality is unknown, and it has trees - if it is known that a grave was plowed in it, it does not require marking. If it does not have trees - if it is known that a grave was lost in it, it does not require marking.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא שָׁם זָקֵן אוֹ תַּלְמִיד, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין הַכֹּל בְּקִיאִין בַּדָּבָר!
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: unless there is an Elder or scholar as not all are experts in this matter,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Until there is there an elder or a student, for not everyone is proficient in the matter!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא, בְּשָׂדֶה שֶׁאָבַד בָּהּ קֶבֶר דְּצַיְּינוּהָ. יֵשׁ בָּהּ אִילָנוֹת — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁנֶּחְרַשׁ בָּהּ קֶבֶר, אֵין בָּהּ אִילָנוֹת — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁאָבַד בָּהּ קֶבֶר.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: When that is taught, a field where a grave was lost they marked it. if there are trees in it is known that a grave was plowed in it, if there are no trees in we know that a grave was lost in it
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: When it was taught in that Mishnah, in a field where a grave was lost in it, if there are trees in it — it is known that a grave was plowed in it; if there are no trees in it — it is known that a grave was lost in it.

hebrew_text: וְלֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא אִילָנוֹת מִגַּוַּאי וְקֶבֶר מִבָּרַאי?
human_translation: But let us be concerned that perhaps the trees were inside and the grave was outside
llm_translation: And to be concerned lest perhaps trees are from the valley and graves are from the mountains?

hebrew_text: כִּדְאָמַר עוּלָּא: בְּעוֹמְדִין עַל הַגְּבוּלִין, הָכָא נָמֵי: בְּעוֹמְדִין עַל הַגְּבוּלִין.
human_translation: as Ulla said where are standing along the boundaries, Here too where are standing along the borders.
llm_translation: As Ulai said: when standing on the borders, here it is stated: when standing on the borders.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא טוּמְאָה מִגַּוַּאי וְאִילָנוֹת מִבָּרַאי?
human_translation: But perhaps the ritual impurity was on the inside and the trees were on the outside,
llm_translation: And perhaps it is impure from the bodies and the trees from the creations?

hebrew_text: בִּמְסוּבָּכִין. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, הָא אֲמַרַן: אֵין מַרְחִיקִין צִיּוּן מִמְּקוֹם טוּמְאָה שֶׁלֹּא לְהַפְסִיד אֶת אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: scattered And if you wish, say we said one does not distance the marker from the site of ritual impurity, so as not to cause a loss of Eretz Yisrael.
llm_translation: In the discussion. And if you wish, say: Did we not say: We do not distance the marker from its impure place in order not to cause a loss to the land of Israel.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא שָׁם זָקֵן אוֹ תַּלְמִיד, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין הַכֹּל בְּקִיאִין בַּדָּבָר. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן דְּאִיכָּא בְּמָתָא — כׇּל מִילֵּי דְמָתָא עֲלֵיהּ רַמְיָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: only there is an Elder or scholar as not all are well versed in this matter, Abaye said: Learn from this there is a Torah scholar in the city, all affairs of the city are thrust upon him,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: Until there is there an elder or a student, for not everyone is proficient in the matter. Abaye said: Learn from it the lesson of the rock from the Sages that there is in the city - all matters of the city are dependent upon it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: מָצָא אֶבֶן מְצוּיֶּנֶת — תַּחְתֶּיהָ טָמֵא. שְׁתַּיִם, אִם יֵשׁ סִיד בֵּינֵיהֶן — בֵּינֵיהֶן טָמֵא, וְאִם אֵין סִיד בֵּינֵיהֶן — בֵּינֵיהֶן טָהוֹר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: one found marked stone, underneath it is ritually impure. two If there is lime between them, between them is ritually impure and if there is no lime between them, between them is ritually pure
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: If one finds a recognizable stone - underneath it is impure. Two, if there is lime between them - between them is impure, and if there is no lime between them - between them is pure.

hebrew_text: וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּלֵיכָּא חוֹרֶשׁ? וְהָתַנְיָא: מָצָא אֶבֶן אַחַת מְצוּיֶּנֶת — תַּחְתֶּיהָ טָמֵא. שְׁתַּיִם, אִם יֵשׁ חוֹרֶשׁ בֵּינֵיהֶן — בֵּינֵיהֶן טָהוֹר, וְאִם לָאו — בֵּינֵיהֶן טָמֵא!
human_translation: And even though there is no plowing But isn’t it taught If one found a single marked stone, underneath it is ritually impure. two If there is plowing between them, between is ritually pure; and if not, between them is ritually impure.
llm_translation: And even though there is no plowing? And it was taught: If one found one stone that is recognizable - underneath it is impure. Two, if there is a hole between them - between them is pure, and if not - between them is impure!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הָכָא כְּשֶׁהַסִּיד שָׁפוּךְ עַל רָאשֵׁיהֶן וּמְרוּדֶּה לְכָאן וּלְכָאן. אִי אִיכָּא חוֹרֶשׁ בֵּינֵיהֶן — בֵּינֵיהֶן טָהוֹר, דְּאֵימוֹר מֵחֲמַת חוֹרֶשׁ הוּא דְּאִיקְּפַל, וְאִי לָא, סִיד דְּבֵינֵי בֵּינֵי הוּא וְטָמֵא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: here, where the lime had been poured on top and it is spread thinly this way and that. if there is plowing between between them is ritually pure, as one say was peeled off due to the plowing; But if no the lime was between is ritually impure.
llm_translation: Rav Pappa said: Here, when the lime is poured on their heads and it is spread to here and to here. If there is a plowshare between them - between them is pure, for it is said: because of the plowshare that is used, and if not, the lime that is between them is impure.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי מֶצֶר אֶחָד מְצוּיָּן — הוּא טָמֵא, וְכׇל הַשָּׂדֶה כּוּלָּהּ טְהוֹרָה. שְׁנַיִם — הֵם טְמֵאִין, וְכׇל הַשָּׂדֶה כּוּלָּהּ טְהוֹרָה. שְׁלֹשָׁה — הֵם טְמֵאִין, וְכׇל הַשָּׂדֶה כּוּלָּהּ טְהוֹרָה. אַרְבָּעָה — הֵן טְהוֹרִין, וְכׇל הַשָּׂדֶה כּוּלָּהּ טְמֵאָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Asi said: one border is marked, is ritually impure while the entire field is ritually pure. two they are ritually impure while the entire field is ritually pure. three them are ritually impure while the entire field is ritually pure. four are ritually pure, while the entire field is ritually impure.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Assi: One Egyptian onion found - it is impure, and the entire field is pure. Two - they are impure, and the entire field is pure. Three - they are impure, and the entire field is pure. Four - they are pure, and the entire field is impure.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר מָר: אֵין מַרְחִיקִין צִיּוּן מִמְּקוֹם טוּמְאָה, שֶׁלֹּא לְהַפְסִיד אֶת אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: As the Master said One does not distance the marker from the site of ritual impurity, so as not to cause a loss of Eretz Yisrael,
llm_translation: The Master said: We do not distance Zion from a place of impurity, so as not to cause a loss to the land of Israel.

hebrew_text: וְיוֹצְאִין אַף עַל הַכִּלְאַיִם.
human_translation: And even go out to the diverse kinds [ kilayim ]
llm_translation: And they go out even on the festivals.

hebrew_text: וְאַכִּלְאַיִם בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד נָפְקִינַן? וּרְמִינְהוּ: בְּאֶחָד בַּאֲדָר מַשְׁמִיעִין עַל הַשְּׁקָלִים וְעַל הַכִּלְאַיִם.
human_translation: Do they go out to diverse kinds during the intermediate days of a Festival? raises a contradiction On the first of Adar issues a proclamation concerning the shekels, And with regard to diverse kinds
llm_translation: "And Akilaiim in its weekday of the festival we go out? And they raised a dilemma: On the first of Adar they announce concerning the shekels and concerning the Akilaiim."

hebrew_text: בַּחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר בּוֹ קוֹרִין אֶת הַמְּגִילָּה בַּכְּרַכִּים, וְיוֹצְאִין לְקַוֵּוץ אֶת הַדְּרָכִים, וּלְתַקֵּן הָרְחוֹבוֹת, וְלָמוֹד הַמִּקְוָאוֹת. וְעוֹשִׂין כׇּל צוֹרְכֵי רַבִּים, וּמְצַיְּנִין אֶת הַקְּבָרוֹת, וְיוֹצְאִין עַל הַכִּלְאַיִם.
human_translation: On the fifteenth of the Megilla, is read in the cities, and they go out to clear thorns roads, to repair the streets, and to measure the ritual baths And they tend to all public needs, and they mark graves and they go out to the diverse kinds.
llm_translation: On the fifteenth of the month of it, they read the Megillah in the villages, and go out to uproot thorns, and to repair the roads, and to learn the mikvaot. And they do all the needs of the public, and mark the graves, and go out to the prisons.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא, חַד אָמַר: כָּאן בְּבַכִּיר, כָּאן בְּאָפִיל. וְחַד אָמַר: כָּאן בִּזְרָעִים, כָּאן בִּירָקוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina One said: Here, the early crop, there, the late crop, And one said: Here, grains there, vegetables,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina, one said: Here in the firstborn, here in the dark. And one said: Here in the seeds, here in the vegetables.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין נִיצָּן נִיכָּר, אֲבָל נִיצָּן נִיכָּר — יוֹצְאִין עֲלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Rabbi Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: They taught only where the blossom was not recognizable But the blossom was recognizable they go out
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Assi said Rabbi Yochanan: They only taught that if it is not recognizable, but if it is recognizable, one may go out with them.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד דְּנָפְקִינַן? אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִשּׁוּם שְׂכַר פְּעוּלָה דְּמוֹזְלִי גַּבַּן.
human_translation: What is different about the intermediate days of a Festival that we go out Rabbi Ya’akov said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: due to the wages they reduce for us,
llm_translation: What is different on the eve of a festival that we go out? Rabbi Yaakov said, Rabbi Yochanan said: Because of the reward for the labor of the craftsmen.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב זְבִיד וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, כִּי יָהֲבִינַן לְהוּ שָׂכָר — מִתְּרוּמַת הַלִּשְׁכָּה יָהֲבִינַן לְהוּ. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ מִדִּידְהוּ יָהֲבִינַן לְהוּ — מַאי נָפְקָא לַן מִינַּיְיהוּ? כֹּל כַּמָּה דְּבָעוּ לִיתֵּן לְהוּ!
human_translation: Rav Zevid said, and some say Rav Mesharshiyya said: Learn from this that when we give wages, we give to them from the collection of the chamber. As, if it enters your mind we pay them from theirs, what would we derive from However much desire, they should pay them.
llm_translation: Rav Zevid said, and some say it was Rav Mesharshya: Hear from it, when they give them a reward - they give them from the contribution of the chamber. For if your mind is inclined towards them, what difference does it make to us from them? Give them as much as they ask for!

hebrew_text: וְעַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יִצְחָק, כְּאוֹתָהּ שֶׁשָּׁנִינוּ: כׇּל סְאָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ
human_translation: And how much Rav Shmuel bar Yitzḥak said: like that which we learned Any se’a that contains
llm_translation: And until when? Rav Shmuel bar Yitzchak said, as we learned: "Every se'ah that contains"

hebrew_text: רוֹבַע זֶרַע מִמִּין אַחֵר — יְמַעֵט.
human_translation: a quarter of seeds of a different type, one must reduce
llm_translation: A quarter seed of a different species - diminishes.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ מַפְקִירִין כׇּל הַשָּׂדֶה כּוּלָּהּ! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן קוֹדֶם תַּקָּנָה, כָּאן לְאַחַר תַּקָּנָה.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught ordained that they should pronounce the entire field ownerless, This not difficult. Here, before the ordinance; there, after the ordinance.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: They established that they should make ownerless the entire field! It is not difficult: here before enactment, here after enactment.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ עוֹקְרִין וּמַשְׁלִיכִין לִפְנֵי בְּהֶמְתָּן, וְהָיוּ בַּעֲלֵי בָּתִּים שְׂמֵחִין שְׁתֵּי שְׂמָחוֹת: אַחַת שֶׁמְּנַכְּשִׁין לָהֶם שְׂדוֹתֵיהֶן, וְאַחַת שֶׁמַּשְׁלִיכִין לִפְנֵי בְּהֶמְתָּם,
human_translation: as it is taught At first, would uproot and cast them before the livestock the property holders would rejoice for two One, that weeded their fields for them one, that they cast before their livestock,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Initially, they would uproot and throw before their animals, and the homeowners would rejoice with two joys: one when they plowed their fields, and one when they threw before their animals.

hebrew_text: הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ עוֹקְרִין וּמַשְׁלִיכִין עַל הַדְּרָכִים. וַעֲדַיִין הָיוּ שְׂמֵחִין שִׂמְחָה גְּדוֹלָה שֶׁמְּנַכְּשִׁין שְׂדוֹתֵיהֶן, הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ מַפְקִירִין כׇּל הַשָּׂדֶה כּוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: ordained that should uproot and cast on the roads. would still greatly rejoice that weeded their fields ordained that they should pronounce the entire field ownerless.
llm_translation: They established that they should uproot and throw onto the roads. And they were still rejoicing with great joy when they would fertilize their fields. They established that they should make the entire field ownerless.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: מוֹשְׁכִין אֶת הַמַּיִם מֵאִילָן לְאִילָן, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יַשְׁקֶה אֶת כׇּל הַשָּׂדֶה. זְרָעִים שֶׁלֹּא שָׁתוּ לִפְנֵי הַמּוֹעֵד — לָא יַשְׁקֵם בַּמּוֹעֵד. וַחֲכָמִים מַתִּירִין בָּזֶה וּבָזֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: one may draw water from tree to tree And provided that he does not water the entire field. plants that were not watered prior to the Festival, one may not water them on the Festival But the Rabbis permit this and that
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: One may draw water from one tree to another, provided that he does not water the entire field. Seeds that were not watered before the appointed time - one may not water them at the appointed time. And the Sages permit both cases.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: אִם הָיְתָה שָׂדֶה מְטוּנֶּנֶת — מוּתָּר. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: כְּשֶׁאָמְרוּ אָסוּר לְהַשְׁקוֹתָן בַּמּוֹעֵד, לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא בִּזְרָעִים שֶׁלֹּא שָׁתוּ מִלִּפְנֵי הַמּוֹעֵד, אֲבָל זְרָעִים שֶׁשָּׁתוּ לִפְנֵי הַמּוֹעֵד — מוּתָּר לְהַשְׁקוֹתָן בַּמּוֹעֵד.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: If the field was moist [ metunenet ] it is permitted That is also taught When they said it is prohibited to water them on a Festival, they said this only with regard to plants that were not watered before the Festival. However, plants that were watered before the Festival it is permitted to water them on the Festival
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said: If the field was irrigated - it is permitted. It was also taught similarly: When they said it is forbidden to water them during the festival, they only said this regarding seeds that were not watered before the festival, but seeds that were watered before the festival - it is permitted to water them during the festival.

hebrew_text: וְאִם הָיְתָה שָׂדֶה מְטוּנֶּנֶת — מוּתָּר. וְאֵין מַשְׁקִין שְׂדֵה גָרִיד בַּמּוֹעֵד, וַחֲכָמִים מַתִּירִין בָּזֶה וּבָזֶה.
human_translation: And if the field was moist it is permitted And one may not water a dry field on a Festival. But the Rabbis permit this and that,
llm_translation: And if there was a field fenced in - permitted. And one does not irrigate a field of grain on the festival, and the sages permit in this and in this.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ הַאי תַּרְבִּיצָא שְׁרֵי לְתַרְבּוֹצֵי בְּחוּלָּא דְמוֹעֲדָא. שְׂדֵה גָרִיד מַאי טַעְמָא — דְּאַפְלָא מְשַׁוֵּי לַהּ חָרְפָא, הָכָא נָמֵי — אַפְלָא מְשַׁוֵּי לָהּ חָרְפָא.
human_translation: Ravina said: Learn from here that one is permitted to sprinkle a garden [ tarbitza ] on the intermediate days of a Festival. What is the reason a dry field turns a late crop into an early crop. Here too, turns a late crop into an early crop,
llm_translation: Ravina said: Learn from it, this bundle is permitted to bundle on the festival of Moed. What is the reason for a field of cut grain? - Because it changes its appearance to disgrace, here too - it changes its appearance to disgrace.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַרְבִּיצִין שְׂדֵה לָבָן בַּשְּׁבִיעִית, אֲבָל לֹא בַּמּוֹעֵד.
human_translation: The Sages taught One may sprinkle a field of grain during the Sabbatical Year, but not on the a Festival.
llm_translation: The sages taught: One may fertilize a field with manure in the Sabbatical year, but not during the festival.

hebrew_text: וְהָא תַּנְיָא: מַרְבִּיצִין בֵּין בַּמּוֹעֵד בֵּין בַּשְּׁבִיעִית! אָמַר רַב הוּנָא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב, הָא רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught One may sprinkle both on a Festival and during the Sabbatical Year? Rav Huna said: This not difficult. This Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, That the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: One may spread out a cloth both on a Festival and on the seventh year! Rav Huna said, it is not difficult: this ruling is according to Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, and this ruling is according to the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: מַרְבִּיצִין שְׂדֵה לָבָן עֶרֶב שְׁבִיעִית כְּדֵי שֶׁיֵּצְאוּ יְרָקוֹת בַּשְּׁבִיעִית, וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁמַּרְבִּיצִין שְׂדֵה לָבָן בַּשְּׁבִיעִית כְּדֵי שֶׁיֵּצְאוּ יְרָקוֹת לְמוֹצָאֵי שְׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: It is taught another One may sprinkle a white field on the eve of the Sabbatical Year so that vegetables will sprout during the Sabbatical Year; and not only that, but one may sprinkle a field of grain during the Sabbatical Year so that vegetables will sprout upon the conclusion of the Sabbatical Year.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It was taught in another Baraita: One may irrigate a field of white crops in the seventh year in order for vegetables to grow in the seventh year. Moreover, one may even irrigate a field of white crops in the seventh year in order for vegetables to grow after the seventh year.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ צָדִין אֶת הָאִישׁוּת וְאֶת הָעַכְבָּרִים מִשְּׂדֵה הָאִילָן וּמִשְּׂדֵה הַלָּבָן כְּדַרְכּוֹ בַּמּוֹעֵד וּבִשְׁבִיעִית. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מִשְּׂדֵה הָאִילָן — כְּדַרְכּוֹ, וּמִשְּׂדֵה הַלָּבָן — שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכּוֹ.
human_translation: One may trap moles ishut and mice in an orchard and in a field of grain in his manner, on a Festival and during the Sabbatical Year. But the Rabbis say: In an orchard in his manner, but in a field of grain, not his manner.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may hunt game and catch mice from the field of the forest and from the field of the white (grain), in the usual manner, during the festival and in the Sabbatical year. And the Sages say: From the field of the forest - in the usual manner, and from the field of the white (grain) - not in the usual manner.

hebrew_text: וּמְקָרִין אֶת הַפִּירְצָה בַּמּוֹעֵד, וּבַשְּׁבִיעִית בּוֹנֶה כְּדַרְכּוֹ.
human_translation: And one may seal a breach on a Festival, and during the Sabbatical Year one may build in his manner,
llm_translation: And they read the breach on the festival, and on the seventh one builds as usual.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי אִישׁוּת? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: בְּרִיָּה שֶׁאֵין לָהּ עֵינַיִם. אָמַר רָבָא בַּר יִשְׁמָעֵאל וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב יֵימַר בַּר שֶׁלֶמְיָא: מַאי קְרָא? ״כְּמוֹ שַׁבְּלוּל תֶּמֶס יַהֲלֹךְ נֵפֶל אֵשֶׁת בַּל חָזוּ שָׁמֶשׁ״.
human_translation: What is ishut ? Rav Yehuda said: a creature that has no eyes, Rava bar Yishmael said, and some say Rav Yeimar bar Shelamya said: What is the verse “As a snail that melts and disappears; like the fall of a young mole [ eshet ] that has not seen the sun”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the definition of a "man"? Rav Yehudah said: A creature that has no eyes. Rava son of Yishmael said, and some say it was Rav Yeimar son of Shelemya: What is the verse? "Like a snail that melts away, like a woman's miscarriage, they never see the sun."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: צָדִין אֶת הָאִישׁוּת וְאֶת הָעַכְבָּרִים מִשְּׂדֵה הַלָּבָן וּמִשְּׂדֵה הָאִילָן כְּדַרְכּוֹ, וּמַחְרִיבִין חוֹרֵי נְמָלִים. כֵּיצַד מַחְרִיבִין? רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: מֵבִיא עָפָר מֵחוֹר זֶה וְנוֹתֵן לְתוֹךְ חוֹר זֶה, וְהֵן חוֹנְקִין זֶה אֶת זֶה.
human_translation: The Sages taught One may trap moles and mice in a field of grain and in an orchard in his manner, and one may destroy ant holes How does one destroy Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: One brings soil from this hole and places it in that hole, and they strangle each other.
llm_translation: The sages taught: One may trap weasels and mice from a field of white figs and from a field of carob trees in the usual manner, and one may destroy ant-holes. How do they destroy them? Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: One brings dirt from this hole and puts it into that hole, and they suffocate each other.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יֵימַר בַּר שֶׁלֶמְיָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי: וְהוּא דְּקָאֵי בִּתְרֵי עֶבְרֵי נַהֲרָא, וְהוּא דְּלֵיכָּא גִּשְׁרָא, וְהוּא דְּלֵיכָּא גַּמְלָא, וְהוּא דְּלֵיכָּא מִצְרָא.
human_translation: Rav Yeimar bar Shelamya said in the name of Abaye: And this When are on two sides of a river, when there is no bridge when there is not a plank and when there is not a rope
llm_translation: Rav Yeimar son of Shelemya said in the name of Abbaye: And he who stands between two rivers, and there is no bridge, and there is no rope, and there is no boat.

hebrew_text: עַד כַּמָּה — עַד פַּרְסָה.
human_translation: Up to what Up to a parasang parsa
llm_translation: Until how much - until the thigh.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מִשְּׂדֵה הָאִילָן כְּדַרְכּוֹ, וּמִשְּׂדֵה הַלָּבָן שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכּוֹ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כֵּיצַד כְּדַרְכּוֹ? חוֹפֵר גּוּמָּא וְתוֹלֶה בָּהּ מְצוּדָה. כֵּיצַד שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכּוֹ? נוֹעֵץ שַׁפּוּד וּמַכֶּה בְּקוּרְדּוֹם וּמְרַדֶּה הָאֲדָמָה מִתַּחְתֶּיהָ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: In an orchard in his manner, but in a field of grain, not his manner. The Sages taught How in his manner? He digs a hole and hangs a trap in it. How not his manner? He inserts a spit strikes with a spade, and removes the earth from beneath it
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: From the field of the tree according to its way, and from the field of the white chalk not according to its way. The Rabbis taught: How according to its way? One digs a pit and sets a trap in it. How not according to its way? One sharpens a stake, strikes it into the ground, and softens the earth beneath it.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: כְּשֶׁאָמְרוּ מִשְּׂדֵה לָבָן שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכּוֹ, לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא בִּשְׂדֵה לָבָן הַסְּמוּכָה לָעִיר, אֲבָל בִּשְׂדֵה לָבָן הַסְּמוּכָה לִשְׂדֵה הָאִילָן — אֲפִילּוּ כְּדַרְכּוֹ, שֶׁמָּא יֵצְאוּ מִשְּׂדֵה הַלָּבָן וְיַחְרִיבוּ אֶת הָאִילָנוֹת.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: When they said in a field of grain not his manner, they spoke only with regard to a field of grain adjacent to the city, But in a field of grain adjacent to an orchard, even in his manner, lest leave the field of grain and destroy the trees
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: When they said "from a white field that is not in its usual manner," they only said this regarding a white field adjacent to a city, but regarding a white field adjacent to a forest—even in its usual manner—lest they come out from the white field and destroy the trees.

hebrew_text: וּמְקָרִין אֶת הַפִּירְצָה בַּמּוֹעֵד. כֵּיצַד מְקָרִין? רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: בְּהוּצָא וְדַפְנָא.
human_translation: And one may seal a breach on a Festival. How does one seal Rav Yosef said: With palm branches [ hutza ] and bay tree [ dafna ],
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And they read the breach on the festival. How do they read it? Rav Yosef said: With a proclamation and a fine. English translation: And they read the breach on the festival. How do they read it? Rav Yosef said: With a proclamation and a fine.

hebrew_text: בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: צָר בִּצְרוֹר, וְאֵינוֹ טָח בְּטִיט. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא כּוֹתֶל הַגִּינָה, אֲבָל כּוֹתֶל הֶחָצֵר — בּוֹנֶה כְּדַרְכּוֹ.
human_translation: It was taught in a baraita : One fills with stone, but he does not plaster with clay. Rav Ḥisda said: They taught only the wall of a garden, However, the wall of a courtyard, he may build in his manner
llm_translation: In the Mishnah it was taught: If one is in need of a wall, he may not plaster it with mud. Rav Ḥisdah said: They only taught this regarding a garden wall, but regarding a courtyard wall—one may build it in the usual manner.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: כּוֹתֶל הַגּוֹחֶה לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — סוֹתֵר וּבוֹנֶה כְּדַרְכּוֹ מִפְּנֵי הַסַּכָּנָה. הָתָם כִּדְקָתָנֵי טַעְמָא — מִפְּנֵי הַסַּכָּנָה.
human_translation: Let us say that supports a wall that is leaning [ goḥeh ] toward the public domain one may demolish and rebuild in his manner due to the danger There, the reason is as teaches, due to the danger
llm_translation: Let us say it supports him: a wall that leans towards the public domain - one may demolish and rebuild it in its usual manner due to danger. There, as it is taught in the Mishnah - due to danger.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, תָּא שְׁמַע: כּוֹתֶל הַגּוֹחֶה לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — סוֹתֵר וּבוֹנֶה כְּדַרְכּוֹ מִפְּנֵי הַסַּכָּנָה. מִפְּנֵי הַסַּכָּנָה — אִין, שֶׁלֹּא מִפְּנֵי הַסַּכָּנָה — לָא. לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתֵּיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא?
human_translation: And some say Come hear a wall that is leaning toward the public domain one may demolish and rebuild in his manner, due to the danger due to the danger yes, not due to the danger, no, Shall we say that this is a conclusive refutation of Rav Ḥisda,
llm_translation: And there are those who say, come and hear: A wall that leans towards the public domain - one may demolish and rebuild it in its original manner due to danger. Due to danger - yes, not due to danger - no. Let us say, should it be the kindness of Rav?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב חִסְדָּא: הָתָם סוֹתֵר וּבוֹנֶה, הָכָא בּוֹנֶה וְלֹא סוֹתֵר.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said to you: There, he is demolish and build Here, he is permitted to build but not to demolish
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said to you: There, one demolishes and builds; here, one builds and does not demolish.

hebrew_text: הָתָם נָמֵי, לִיסְתּוֹר וְלָא לִיבְנֵי! אִם כֵּן, מִימְּנַע וְלָא סוֹתַר.
human_translation: There too, to demolish but not to rebuild If so, he might refrain from demolishing
llm_translation: There, it is necessary to investigate and not to build! If so, from Menashe and not from Sotar.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי דַּיְקָא, דְּקָתָנֵי: וּבַשְּׁבִיעִית בּוֹנֶה כְּדַרְכּוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: the mishna is also precise as it teaches: During the Sabbatical Year one may build in his manner.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: The Mishnah is precise, as it teaches: "And on the seventh one builds as usual."

hebrew_text: דְּהֵיכָא? אִילֵּימָא דְּחָצֵר, צְרִיכָא לְמֵימַר? אֶלָּא לָאו, דְּגִינָּה. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּמִיחֲזֵי כְּמַאן דְּעָבֵיד נְטִירוּתָא לְפֵירֵי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Where If we say of a courtyard, need it be said Rather, is it not a garden, even though he appears as one who is building a protection for his produce, Learn from this Ḥisda’s interpretation is
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Where is this? If you say it is in the courtyard, is it necessary to say? Rather, it is not in the garden. And even though it appears as if one is performing an act of guarding for the fruit. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: רוֹאִין אֶת הַנְּגָעִים בַּתְּחִילָּה לְהָקֵל, אֲבָל לֹא לְהַחְמִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: לֹא לְהָקֵל וְלֹא לְהַחְמִיר.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: may initially examine symptoms of leprosy on the intermediate days of a Festival to be lenient, but not to be stringent; And the Rabbis say: not to be lenient or to be stringent.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Meir says: One should initially view skin afflictions leniently, but not strictly. And the Sages say: Neither leniently nor strictly.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: רוֹאִין אֶת הַנְּגָעִים לְהָקֵל, אֲבָל לֹא לְהַחְמִיר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: לֹא לְהָקֵל וְלֹא לְהַחְמִיר. שֶׁאִם אַתָּה נִזְקָק לוֹ לְהָקֵל — [אַתָּה] נִזְקָק לוֹ אַף לְהַחְמִיר.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Meir says: may examine symptoms of leprosy on the intermediate days of a Festival to be lenient, but not to be stringent. Rabbi Yosei says: may not to be lenient or to be stringent. that if you attend to to be lenient, you must attend to him even to be stringent.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Rabbi Meir says: One may see skin afflictions to be lenient, but not to be stringent. Rabbi Yosei says: Neither to be lenient nor to be stringent. For if you need it to be lenient - you need it to be stringent as well."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי: נִרְאִין דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר בְּמוּסְגָּר, וְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּמוּחְלָט.
human_translation: Rabbi said: The statement of Rabbi Meir appears with regard a quarantined the statement of Rabbi Yosei appears with regard to a confirmed
llm_translation: Rabbi said: The words of Rabbi Meir appear in a closed context, and the words of Rabbi Yosei appear in an open context.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: בְּטָהוֹר כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּלָא חָזוּ לֵיהּ. בְּהֶסְגֵּר רִאשׁוֹן דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּחָזֵי לֵיהּ. כִּי פְּלִיגִי,
human_translation: Rava said: With regard to ritually pure, everyone agrees that does not examine him, With regard to first quarantine, everyone agrees that examines him, When they disagree
llm_translation: Rava said: In the case of a completely pure animal, everyone agrees that they do not dispute it, for they do not see it. In the case of the firstborn animal of all, everyone agrees that they do not dispute it, for they see it. When do they dispute it,

hebrew_text: בְּהֶסְגֵּר שֵׁנִי. מָר סָבַר: בְּכֹהֵן תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא. אִי טָהוֹר — אָמַר לֵיהּ ״טָהוֹר״, וְאִי טָמֵא — שָׁתֵיק. וּמָר סָבַר: ״לְטַהֲרוֹ אוֹ לְטַמְּאוֹ״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: it is with regard to second quarantine. One Sage, holds the matter depends upon the priest; if he is pure, the priest declares him pure, and if he is ritually impure, the priest remain silent. And one Sage, holds it is written: to pronounce it pure or to pronounce it impure”
llm_translation: In the second enclosure. Master holds: regarding a dependent priest, the matter is dependent. If he is pure - he says to him "pure," and if he is impure - he remains silent. And Master holds: "to purify him or to render him impure" is written.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר, אָמַר רַבִּי: נִרְאִין דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּמוּחְלָט, וְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר בְּמוּסְגָּר. וְהָתַנְיָא אִיפְּכָא!
human_translation: The Master said Rabbi said: The statement of Rabbi Yosei appears with regard to a confirmed leper, and the statement of Rabbi Meir appears with regard to a quarantined But isn’t the opposite taught
llm_translation: Master said, Rabbi said: The words of Rabbi Yosei appear in a clear manner, and the words of Rabbi Meir in a concise manner. And it was taught in contradiction!

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי. מָר סָבַר: צַוְותָּא דְעָלְמָא עֲדִיף לֵיהּ.
human_translation: This is tanna’im in accordance with Rabbi One Sage, holds that the company of the world is preferable to
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita in the name of Rabbi. Master holds: the command of the world is more important to him.

hebrew_text: וּמָר סָבַר: צַוְותָּא דְאִשְׁתּוֹ עֲדִיפָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And one Sage, holds that the company of his wife is preferable to
llm_translation: And Mar said: The command of his wife is more important to him.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּמוּחְלָט מוּתָּר בְּתַשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה? אִין, וְהָתַנְיָא: ״וְיָשַׁב מִחוּץ לְאׇהֳלוֹ שִׁבְעַת יָמִים״, שֶׁיְּהֵא אָסוּר בְּתַשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה. וְאֵין ״אׇהֳלוֹ״ אֶלָּא אִשְׁתּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֵךְ אֱמוֹר לָהֶם שׁוּבוּ לָכֶם לְאׇהֳלֵיכֶם״. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״שִׁבְעַת יָמִים יִסְפְּרוּ לוֹ״, יְמֵי סְפִירוֹ וְלֹא יְמֵי חִלּוּטוֹ.
human_translation: Is this to say that a confirmed is permitted in conjugal relations Yes, and so it is taught “But he shall remain outside his tent seven days” that is prohibited in conjugal relations, his tent only his wife, as it is stated: “Go, say to them: Return again to your tents” ( Rabbi Yehuda says: they shall count for him seven days” the days of his counting, but not the days of his confirmed
llm_translation: In the matter of one who is in doubt, is he permitted in conjugal relations? No, and it was taught: "And he shall dwell outside his tent seven days," that he should be forbidden in conjugal relations. And "his tent" is none other than his wife, as it is stated: "Go, say to them, return to your tents." Rabbi Yehuda says: "Seven days shall be counted for him," the days of his counting and not the days of his doubt.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שִׁבְעָה יְמֵי סְפִירוֹ, קַל וָחוֹמֶר לִימֵי חִלּוּטוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: the seven days of his counting a fortiori the days of his confirmed
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda says: "Seven days of counting, all the more so for the days of immersion."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא, דַּנְתִּי לִפְנֵי רַבִּי: לִימַּדְתָּנוּ רַבֵּינוּ, יוֹתָם לֹא הָיָה לוֹ לְעוּזִּיָּהוּ אֶלָּא בִּימֵי חִלּוּטוֹ, אָמַר לוֹ: אַף אֲנִי כָּךְ אָמַרְתִּי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya said: I deliberated before Rabbi Have you taught us, our teacher, Jotham was only to Uzziah, during the days of his confirmed said to him: I too said this;
llm_translation: And Rabbi Hiyya said, I judged before Rabbi: You taught us, our teacher, Jotham did not have Uzziah except in the days of his debasement, he said to him: So did I say.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: גַּלִּי רַחֲמָנָא בִּימֵי סְפִירוֹ וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן בִּימֵי חִלּוּטוֹ. וּמָר סָבַר: מַאי דְּגַלִּי — גַּלִּי, וּמַאי דְּלָא גַּלִּי — לָא גַּלִּי.
human_translation: With regard to what they disagree? Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, holds: The Merciful One revealed during the days of his counting; and all the more so during his days of confirmed And one Sage, maintains: That which revealed, it revealed, but that which it did not reveal, it did not reveal;
llm_translation: With what do they argue? Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, holds: "Reveal mercy during the days of counting, and certainly during the days of unleavened bread." And the Master holds: "What is revealed - is revealed, and what is not revealed - is not revealed."

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דִּבְכֹהֵן תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא? אִין, וְהָתַנְיָא: ״וּבְיוֹם הֵרָאוֹת בּוֹ״. יֵשׁ יוֹם שֶׁאַתָּה רוֹאֶה בּוֹ, וְיֵשׁ יוֹם שֶׁאִי אַתָּה רוֹאֶה בּוֹ.
human_translation: Is this to say that the matter depends upon the priest, Yes, and it is taught “But on the day it appears in him” there is a day when you examine him and there is a day when you do not examine
llm_translation: In the matter of the hanging of the high priest's vestments? No, and it was taught: "And on the day that he sees it." There is a day that you see it, and there is a day that you do not see it.

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ: חָתָן שֶׁנּוֹלַד בּוֹ נֶגַע — נוֹתְנִין לוֹ שִׁבְעָה יְמֵי הַמִּשְׁתֶּה. לוֹ וּלְבֵיתוֹ וְלִכְסוּתוֹ. וְכֵן בָּרֶגֶל — נוֹתְנִין לוֹ שִׁבְעַת יְמֵי הָרֶגֶל, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: From here they stated: a bridegroom upon whom leprous symptoms came into being, we give him the seven days of the feast upon him, upon his house, or upon his clothing. Similarly, during a pilgrimage Festival, we give him the seven days of the Festival the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: From here they said: A groom in whom a blemish is born - they give him seven days of feasting. For him, his household, and his wardrobe. And similarly with regard to a festival - they give him seven days of the festival, the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ. הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְצִוָּה הַכֹּהֵן וּפִנּוּ אֶת הַבַּיִת״. אִם מַמְתִּינִים לוֹ לִדְבַר הָרְשׁוּת — כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן לִדְבַר מִצְוָה.
human_translation: Rabbi says: there is no need It says: “Then the priest shall command that they empty the house If we delay an optional matter, all the more so for a matter of mitzva,
llm_translation: Rabbi says: He does not need. Behold, he says: "And the priest shall command, and they shall clear the house." If they wait for him for a matter of permission - all the more so for a matter of commandment.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מַשְׁמָעוּת דּוֹרְשִׁין אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. וְרָבָא אָמַר: דְּבַר הָרְשׁוּת אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: What is between them, Abaye said: the interpretation of the meaning is between them, And Rava said: between them an optional matter.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Abaye said: There is a difference in the interpretation. And Rava said: There is a matter of discretionary authority between them.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — מֵהָתָם לָא גָּמְרִינַן, דְּחִידּוּשׁ הוּא,
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda, We do not learn from there because is a novelty,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda - from there we do not conclude, as it is a novelty.

hebrew_text: דְּהָא עֵצִים וַאֲבָנִים בְּעָלְמָא לָא מִטַּמְּאוּ, וְהָכָא מִטַּמְּאוּ.
human_translation: as wood and stones are generally not susceptible to ritual impurity, yet here they are susceptible to ritual impurity.
llm_translation: Since wood and stones in general do not become impure, here they do become impure.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אָמַר: אִצְטְרִיךְ, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״וּבְיוֹם הֵרָאוֹת בּוֹ״, הָוֵה אָמֵינָא לִדְבַר מִצְוָה — אִין, לִדְבַר הָרְשׁוּת — לָא, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״וְצִוָּה הַכֹּהֵן״.
human_translation: And Rabbi said: It was necessary As, if the Merciful One had written “But on the day it appears in him,” I would have said for a matter of mitzva, yes, for an optional matter, no, the Merciful One wrote: “Then the priest shall command,”
llm_translation: Rabbi said: It is necessary, for if the Merciful One had written "and on the day that he sees it," I would have said it is for a matter of obligation - no, for a matter of permission - yes, the Merciful One wrote "and the priest shall command."

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״וְצִוָּה הַכֹּהֵן״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי — אִין, דְּלָאו טוּמְאָה דְגוּפֵיהּ, אֲבָל טוּמְאָה דְגוּפֵיהּ — אֵימָא מִיחְזָא חַזְיָא לֵיהּ. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if the Merciful One had written “Then the priest shall command,” I would have said for these yes, not impurity of the body but impurity of body, I say must examine it necessary
llm_translation: If the Merciful One wrote "and the priest shall command," I would say: those - no, for they are not inherently impure, but if they are inherently impure, I would say: let him see it. Necessary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: יֵשׁ יוֹם שֶׁאַתָּה רוֹאֶה בּוֹ, וְיֵשׁ יוֹם שֶׁאִי אַתָּה רוֹאֶה בּוֹ.
human_translation: The Master said as there is a day when you examine him and there is a day when you do not examine
llm_translation: Master said: There is a day that you see in it, and there is a day that you do not see in it.

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אִם כֵּן לִיכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא ״בְּיוֹם״, מַאי ״וּבְיוֹם״? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: יֵשׁ יוֹם שֶׁאַתָּה רוֹאֶה בּוֹ, וְיֵשׁ יוֹם שֶׁאִי אַתָּה רוֹאֶה בּוֹ.
human_translation: From where may it be inferred? Abaye said: If so the Merciful One should have written On the day What is “But on the day”? Learn from here, There is a day when you examine him and there is a day when you do not examine
llm_translation: What is implied? Abaye said: If so, why did the Merciful One write "in the day"? What is "and in the day"? Learn from it: there is a day that you see in it, and there is a day that you do not see in it.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: כּוּלָּהּ קְרָא יַתִּירָא הוּא, דְּאִם כֵּן לִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא ״וּבְהֵרָאוֹת״, מַאי ״וּבְיוֹם״? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: יֵשׁ יוֹם שֶׁאַתָּה רוֹאֶה בּוֹ, וְיֵשׁ יוֹם שֶׁאִי אַתָּה רוֹאֶה בּוֹ.
human_translation: Rava said: The entire phrase is superfluous. As, if so the Merciful One should have written And when it appears. What is “but on the day”? Learn from here there is a day when you examine in him and there is a day when you do not examine
llm_translation: Rava said: The entire verse is superfluous, for if so, the Merciful One should have written "and in the mountains." What is "and in the day"? Learn from it: there is a day that you see, and there is a day that you do not see.

hebrew_text: וְאַבָּיֵי, הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ — בַּיּוֹם וְלֹא בַּלַּיְלָה.
human_translation: And Abaye, That is necessary during the day, but not at night.
llm_translation: And Abbaye, that one asked him - by day and not by night.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא, בַּיּוֹם וְלֹא בַּלַּיְלָה מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״לְּכׇל מַרְאֵה עֵינֵי הַכֹּהֵן״. וְאַבָּיֵי, הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְמַעוֹטֵי סוֹמֵא בְּאַחַת מֵעֵינָיו.
human_translation: And from where Rava during the day but not at night? He derives it from “As far as the priest’s eyes can see” And Abaye this is necessary to exclude blind in one eye
llm_translation: Rava, in the day and not in the night, how does he count it? He derives it from "to see the appearance of the Kohanim." And Abbaye, that one requires it to exclude a blind person in one of his eyes.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא נָמֵי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְהָכִי? אִין, הָכִי נָמֵי.
human_translation: But Rava also requires to this Yes, it is indeed so;
llm_translation: And Rava said: Does Rava really need to say this? No, thus he said.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא בַּיּוֹם וְלֹא בַּלַּיְלָה מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״כְּנֶגַע נִרְאָה לִי בַּבָּיִת״. ״לִי״ — וְלֹא לְאוֹרִי.
human_translation: from where during the day but not at night? He derives it from “There seems to me as it were a plague in the house” by me, and not by my light,
llm_translation: And rather in the day and not in the night how does he count it? It emerges for him from "as a plague appears to me in the house." "To me" - and not to my light.

hebrew_text: וְאַבָּיֵי, אִי מֵהָתָם הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי טוּמְאָה דְּלָאו דְגוּפֵיהּ, אֲבָל טוּמְאָה דְגוּפֵיהּ אֲפִילּוּ לְאוֹרוֹ נָמֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And Abaye if from there, I would have said this applies an impurity that is not the body. However, impurity of the body, even by light, teaches us:
llm_translation: And Abbaye, if from there, was saying: those matters of impurity that are not of themselves, but impurity that is of itself, even to its light, it is teaching us.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְעוֹד אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: מְלַקֵּט אָדָם עַצְמוֹת אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁשִּׂמְחָה הִיא לוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir also stated A person may gather the bones of his father and mother because is joy for him.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And furthermore, Rabbi Meir said: A person may gather the bones of his father and mother, because it brings him joy.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֵבֶל הוּא לוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: it is mourning for him.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: "Avel hu lo."

hebrew_text: לֹא יְעוֹרֵר אָדָם עַל מֵתוֹ, וְלֹא יַסְפִּידֶנּוּ קוֹדֶם לָרֶגֶל שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: a person may not arouse [ ye’orer ] for his deceased and he may not eulogize him thirty days before a pilgrimage Festival.
llm_translation: A person shall not awaken upon his deceased, and shall not eulogize him before thirty days.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּרְמִינְהוּ: הַמְלַקֵּט עַצְמוֹת אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ — הֲרֵי זֶה מִתְאַבֵּל עֲלֵיהֶם כׇּל הַיּוֹם, וְלָעֶרֶב אֵין מִתְאַבֵּל עֲלֵיהֶן. וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אֲפִילּוּ צְרוּרִין לוֹ בִּסְדִינוֹ!
human_translation: raises a contradiction One who gathers the bones of his father or his mother mourns for them the entire day, but he does not mourn for them in the evening. And Rav Ḥisda said: And even he had them bundled up in his sheet,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara and it was asked: One who gathers the bones of his father and mother — behold, he mourns for them all day, but towards evening he does not mourn for them. And Rav Ḥisdah said: Even if he has them bundled in his scarf!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אֵימָא, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁשִּׂמְחַת הָרֶגֶל עָלָיו.
human_translation: Abaye said: Say because the joy of the pilgrimage Festival is upon him.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Say, because the joy of the festival is upon him.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא יְעַרְעֵר עַל מֵתוֹ. מַאי לֹא יְעַרְעֵר עַל מֵתוֹ? אָמַר רַב: כַּד הָדַר סַפְדָנָא בְּמַעְרְבָא, אָמְרִי: יִבְכּוֹן עִמֵּיהּ כָּל מְרִירֵי לִיבָּא.
human_translation: One may not arouse for his deceased What is One may not arouse for his deceased Rav said: In the West, whenever a eulogizer would circulate they would say: Let all those of bitter heart weep with him.
llm_translation: "And he shall not dishevel his hair for his dead. What is meant by 'he shall not dishevel his hair for his dead'? Rav said: Just as the mourning women in the west say, 'Let all the bitter-hearted ones weep with him.'"

hebrew_text: קוֹדֶם הָרֶגֶל שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. מַאי שְׁנָא שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם?
human_translation: thirty days before a pilgrimage Festival. What is different thirty days,
llm_translation: Before the festival thirty days. What is different about thirty days?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאָדָם אֶחָד שֶׁכִּינֵּס מָעוֹת לַעֲלוֹת לָרֶגֶל, וּבָא סַפְדָן וְעָמַד עַל פֶּתַח בֵּיתוֹ, וּנְטָלָתַן אִשְׁתּוֹ וּנְתָנָתַן לוֹ, וְנִמְנַע וְלֹא עָלָה. בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה אָמְרוּ: לֹא יְעוֹרֵר עַל מֵתוֹ וְלֹא יַסְפִּידֶנּוּ קוֹדֶם לָרֶגֶל שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said that Rav Yehuda said that Rav said: incident a certain man who saved up money to ascend for the pilgrimage Festival eulogizer came and stood at the opening to his house and wife took and gave it to he refrained and did not ascend At that time, they said: One may not arouse for his deceased nor may eulogize him thirty days before a pilgrimage Festival.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said, Rav Yehudah said, Rav said: There was an incident with a certain man who gathered coins to go up to Jerusalem for the pilgrimage festival, and a bandit came and stood at his door, and his wife took out and gave them to him, and he refrained and did not go up. At that moment they said: One should not disturb his dead nor eulogize him before the foot for thirty days.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר:
human_translation: And Shmuel said:
llm_translation: And Shmuel said:

hebrew_text: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין הַמֵּת מִשְׁתַּכֵּחַ מִן הַלֵּב שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּקָעָבֵיד בְּחִנָּם.
human_translation: because the dead is not forgotten from the heart for thirty days, What is between between them where performs free
llm_translation: The dead do not depart from the heart for thirty days. What is the difference between them? The difference between them is that he is honored gratuitously.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין חוֹפְרִין כּוּכִין וּקְבָרוֹת בַּמּוֹעֵד, אֲבָל מְחַנְּכִין אֶת הַכּוּכִין בַּמּוֹעֵד. וְעוֹשִׂין נִבְרֶכֶת בַּמּוֹעֵד, וְאָרוֹן עִם הַמֵּת בֶּחָצֵר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹסֵר אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן יֵשׁ עִמּוֹ נְסָרִים.
human_translation: One may not dig crypts or graves on a Festival but one may adjust crypts on a Festival And one may construct pond on a Festival And a coffin with the corpse in the courtyard, Rabbi Yehuda prohibits unless has boards with him
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may not dig graves or tombs on a festival, but one may prepare burial niches on a festival. And they make a eulogy on a festival, and the coffin with the deceased in the courtyard. Rabbi Yehuda prohibits this unless there are carpenters with him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי כּוּכִין וּמַאי קְבָרוֹת? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: כּוּכִין בַּחֲפִירָה, וּקְבָרוֹת בְּבִנְיָן. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: אֵלּוּ הֵן כּוּכִין וְאֵלּוּ הֵן קְבָרוֹת, כּוּכִין בַּחֲפִירָה, וּקְבָרוֹת בְּבִנְיָן.
human_translation: What are crypts and what are graves, Rav Yehuda said: Crypts by digging and graves by building. That is also taught These are crypts and these are graves: Crypts by digging and graves by building.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What are "kukin" and what are "kevarot"? Rav Yehuda said: "Kukin" are through digging, and "kevarot" are through building. It was also taught likewise: These are "kukin" and these are "kevarot," "kukin" are through digging, and "kevarot" are through building.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל מְחַנְּכִין אֶת הַכּוּכִין. כֵּיצַד מְחַנְּכִין? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: שֶׁאִם הָיָה אָרוֹךְ — מְקַצְּרוֹ. בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: מַאֲרִיךְ בּוֹ, וּמַרְחִיב בּוֹ.
human_translation: But one may adjust crypts How does one adjust Rav Yehuda said: If was long he shortens it. was taught in a baraita : He lengthens and widens it
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But we may train the pitchers. How do we train them? Rav Yehudah said: If it was long, we shorten it. In the Mishnah it was taught: We lengthen it and widen it.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹשִׂין נִבְרֶכֶת כּוּ׳. מַאי נִבְרֶכֶת? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: זוֹ בָּקִיעַ. וְהָתַנְיָא: הַנִּבְרֶכֶת וְהַבָּקִיעַ! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב כָּהֲנָא: גִּיהָא וּבַר גִּיהָא.
human_translation: And one may construct a pond What is a pond? Rav Yehuda said: This is a ditch Isn’t it taught A pond and a ditch, Abaye said, and some say Rav Kahana A pond and a small pond,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And they make a "nivrekhet" (נִבְרֶכֶת). What is a "nivrekhet"? Rav Yehudah said: This is a "baki'a" (בָּקִיעַ). And it was taught: The "nivrekhet" and the "baki'a"! Abaye said, and it was stated by Rav Kahana: "Gihah" and "bar gihah."

hebrew_text: וְאָרוֹן עִם הַמֵּת בֶּחָצֵר. תְּנֵינָא לְהָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: עוֹשִׂין כׇּל צוֹרְכֵי הַמֵּת. גּוֹזְזִין לוֹ שְׂעָרוֹ, וּמְכַבְּסִין לוֹ כְּסוּתוֹ, וְעוֹשִׂין לוֹ אָרוֹן מִנְּסָרִין הַמְנוּסָּרִין מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אַף מְבִיאִין עֵצִים וּמְנַסְּרָן בְּצִינְעָא בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ.
human_translation: And a coffin with the corpse in the courtyard. We learned this, as the Sages taught One may tend to all the needs of the deceased One may cut hair for him and one may wash his clothing, for him, and one may construct a coffin for him from boards that had been cut from the eve of the Festival. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: One may even bring timber and discreetly cut it in his house.
llm_translation: And the coffin with the deceased in the courtyard. We learned in a Mishnah that the Rabbis taught: They do all the needs of the deceased. They cut his hair, wash his clothes, and make for him a coffin from boards that are planed from the eve of a festival. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: They also bring wood and plane them in a hidden place inside his house.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין נוֹשְׂאִין נָשִׁים בַּמּוֹעֵד, לֹא בְּתוּלוֹת וְלֹא אַלְמָנוֹת, וְלֹא מְיַיבְּמִין — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁשִּׂמְחָה הִיא לוֹ. אֲבָל מַחְזִיר הוּא אֶת גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ.
human_translation: One may not marry a woman on a Festival, not virgins and not widows, and one may not perform levirate marriage because it is joyous for him. However, one may remarry his divorced wife
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One does not marry women during the festival, neither virgins nor widows, nor perform levirate marriage - because it is a joy for him. However, he may return his divorced wife.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹשָׂה אִשָּׁה תַּכְשִׁיטֶיהָ בַּמּוֹעֵד. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא תָּסוּד, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנִּיוּוּל הוּא לָהּ. הַהֶדְיוֹט תּוֹפֵר כְּדַרְכּוֹ, וְהָאוּמָּן מַכְלִיב. וּמְסָרְגִין אֶת הַמִּטּוֹת, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מְמַתְּחִין.
human_translation: And a woman may engage in her cosmetic treatments on a Festival. Rabbi Yehuda says: She may not apply lime because it a disgrace to her, A layman, may sew in his manner whereas a craftsman may form temporary stitches. And one may interweave beds Rabbi Yosei says: One may tighten
llm_translation: A woman may adorn herself on a festival. Rabbi Yehuda says: She should not braid her hair, because it is considered a form of adornment for her. A layperson sews in his usual manner, while a skilled craftsman embroiders. And they may spread out the sheets. Rabbi Yosei says: They may tighten them.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְכִי שִׂמְחָה הִיא לוֹ, מַאי הָוֵי? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין מְעָרְבִין שִׂמְחָה בְּשִׂמְחָה. רַבָּה בַּר [רַב] הוּנָא אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּנִּיחַ שִׂמְחַת הָרֶגֶל וְעוֹסֵק בְּשִׂמְחַת אִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: And if it is a joy for him, what of it? Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said, and, so too, Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Oshaya said, and some say Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Ḥanina said: because one may not mix joy with joy, Rabba bar Rav Huna said: because he forsakes the rejoicing of the pilgrimage Festival and occupies with rejoicing his wife.
llm_translation: Gemara: Is it a joy for him, what is it? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel, and so said Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Oshaya, and some say: Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Chanina: Because one does not mix joy with joy. Rabbah bar Rav Huna said: Because he leaves the joy of the festival and engages in the joy of his wife.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: הָא דְּרַבָּה בַּר [רַב] הוּנָא — דְּרַב הוּא. דְּאָמַר רַב דָּנִיאֵל בַּר קַטִּינָא אָמַר רַב: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין נוֹשְׂאִין נָשִׁים בַּמּוֹעֵד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְשָׂמַחְתָּ בְּחַגֶּךָ״, ״בְּחַגֶּךָ״ — וְלֹא בְּאִשְׁתֶּךָ.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: This of Rabba bar Rav Huna is of Rav, as Rav Daniel bar Ketina said that Rav said: From where that one may not marry a woman on a Festival? As it is stated: “And you shall rejoice in your Festival” in your Festival and not in your wife.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rav Yosef: The one of Rabba bar Rav Huna — is Rav. For Rav Daniyel bar Katina said in the name of Rav: From where do we derive that women do not carry on the festival? As it is stated: "And you shall rejoice on your festival," "on your festival" — and not with your wife.

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי הַטּוֹרַח. רַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי בִּיטּוּל פְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה.
human_translation: Ulla said: due to the exertion Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa said: due to the neglect of fruitful and multiply.
llm_translation: Ulla said: Because of the burden. Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha said: Because of the cessation of procreation.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: כׇּל אֵלּוּ שֶׁאָמְרוּ אֲסוּרִין לִישָּׂא בַּמּוֹעֵד —
human_translation: raises an objection All those whom said are prohibited to marry on a Festival
llm_translation: Challenger: All those who said are forbidden to marry on the festival -

hebrew_text: מוּתָּרִין לִישָּׂא עֶרֶב הָרֶגֶל, קַשְׁיָא לְכוּלְּהוּ.
human_translation: are permitted to marry on the eve of the pilgrimage Festival. a difficulty to all of
llm_translation: Permitted to marry on the eve of the festival, a difficulty for all.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם שִׂמְחָה — עִיקַּר שִׂמְחָה חַד יוֹמָא הוּא.
human_translation: not difficult, According to the one who said because of joy, the primary joy is one day,
llm_translation: Not difficult for the one who says in the name of joy - the essence of joy is one day.

hebrew_text: לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם טִירְחָא — עִיקַּר טִירְחָא חַד יוֹמָא הוּא. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם בִּיטּוּל פְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה, לְחַד יוֹמָא לָא מַשְׁהֵי אִינִישׁ נַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: according to the one who said due to exertion the primary exertion is one day. according to the one who said due to the neglect of fruitful and multiply, one day, a man will not delay
llm_translation: To whomsoever says in the name of exertion - the main exertion is one day. To whomsoever says in the name of nullifying fruitfulness and multiplication, for one day a person does not endanger himself.

hebrew_text: וּדְאֵין מְעָרְבִין שִׂמְחָה בְּשִׂמְחָה מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַשׂ שְׁלֹמֹה בָעֵת הַהִיא אֶת הֶחָג וְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל עִמּוֹ קָהָל גָּדוֹל מִלְּבוֹא חֲמָת עַד נַחַל מִצְרַיִם [לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ] שִׁבְעַת יָמִים וְשִׁבְעַת יָמִים אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר יוֹם״. וְאִם אִיתָא דִּמְעָרְבִין שִׂמְחָה בְּשִׂמְחָה — אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְמִינְטַר עַד הֶחָג, וּמִיעְבַּד שִׁבְעָה לְהָכָא וּלְהָכָא.
human_translation: one may not mix joy with joy, from where do we as it is written “So Solomon held the feast at that time, and all Israel with him, a great congregation, from the entrance of Hamath to the Brook of Egypt, before the Lord our God, seven days and seven days, fourteen days” And if it is so one may mix joy with joy, he should have waited until the festival and made seven for this and for that,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And is it so that we combine joy with joy? From where do we derive this? As it is written: "And Solomon held the feast at that time, and all Israel with him, a great congregation, from the entrance of Hamath unto the Brook of Egypt before the Lord our God, seven days and seven days, even fourteen days." And if it comes to combining joy with joy - let him inquire to the minister until the feast, and let him divide seven here and seven there.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא מִינְטָר לָא נָטְרִינַן, וְהֵיכָא דְּאִתְרְמִי — עָבְדִינַן! אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְשַׁיּוֹרֵי פּוּרְתָּא.
human_translation: Perhaps, we may not delay where it happens we may prepare should have left a small
llm_translation: And perhaps we did not guard against the possibility, and in a situation where it is suspected - we should do it! He asked to leave a remnant.

hebrew_text: שַׁיּוֹרֵי בִּנְיַן בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ לָא מְשַׁיְּירִינַן. אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְשַׁיּוֹרֵי בְּאַמָּה כָּלְיָא עוֹרֵב.
human_translation: One may not leave the building of the Temple should have left the cubit- eliminate the ravens,
llm_translation: Builders of the Temple are not left over. It was asked: Are builders left over with a cubit, a raven?

hebrew_text: אַמָּה כָּלְיָא עוֹרֵב צוֹרֶךְ בִּנְיַן הַבַּיִת הוּא. אֶלָּא מִדִּמְיַיתַּר קְרָא, מִכְּדֵי כְּתִיב ״אַרְבְּעָה עָשָׂר יוֹם״, ״שִׁבְעַת יָמִים וְשִׁבְעַת יָמִים״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ הָנֵי לְחוֹד וְהָנֵי לְחוֹד.
human_translation: The cubit eliminate the ravens was a necessary in the building of the Temple, Rather, from the redundancy the verse. Since it is written “fourteen days,” why do I “seven days and seven days”? Learn from it these be discrete, and these be discrete,
llm_translation: A cubit of a utensil, a raven requires for building the house. Rather, from the extra verse, as it is written "fourteen days," "seven days and seven days," why do I need them? Learn from it this one for this and this one for this.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי פַּרְנָךְ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אוֹתָהּ שָׁנָה לֹא עָשׂוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. וְהָיוּ דּוֹאֲגִים וְאוֹמְרִים: שֶׁמָּא נִתְחַיְּיבוּ שׂוֹנְאֵיהֶן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל כְּלָיָיה, יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה לָהֶם: כּוּלְּכֶם מְזוּמָּנִין לְחַיֵּי הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Parnakh said that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: That year, did not observe Yom Kippur, And were worried and said: Perhaps the enemies of the Jewish people, have become liable to be destroyed A Divine Voice issued forth and said to them: All of you are designated for life in the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: Rabbi Parnakh said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: In that year, the Israelites did not observe Yom Kippur. They were worried and said, "Perhaps our enemies have caused our destruction." A Bat Kol (heavenly voice) came out and said to them, "You are all prepared for the World to Come."

hebrew_text: מַאי דְּרוּשׁ? אָמְרוּ, קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה מִשְׁכָּן, שֶׁאֵין קְדוּשָּׁתוֹ קְדוּשַּׁת עוֹלָם — וְקׇרְבַּן יָחִיד דּוֹחֶה שַׁבָּת דְּאִיסּוּר סְקִילָה, מִקְדָּשׁ, דִּקְדוּשָּׁתוֹ קְדוּשַּׁת עוֹלָם, וְקׇרְבַּן צִבּוּר, וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים דְּעָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
human_translation: What derivation a fortiori If the Tabernacle, whose sanctity is not a permanent sanctity, an individual’s offering, overrides Shabbat, a prohibition stoning; the Temple, whose sanctity is a permanent sanctity communal offerings, not all the more so Yom Kippur, punishable by karet ?
llm_translation: What is the meaning of the verse? They said, an inference from minor to major: Just as the Tabernacle, whose sanctity is not eternal sanctity, yet an individual offering overrides the Sabbath prohibition of stoning, how much more so the Temple, whose sanctity is eternal sanctity, and a communal offering, and the Day of Atonement, which involves the punishment of excision - should it not be obvious?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אַמַּאי הָיוּ דּוֹאֲגִים? הָתָם צוֹרֶךְ גָּבוֹהַּ, הָכָא צוֹרֶךְ הֶדְיוֹט. הָכָא נָמֵי: מֶיעְבָּד לִיעְבְּדוּ, מֵיכָל לָא נֵיכְלוּ וְלָא לִישְׁתּוֹ! אֵין שִׂמְחָה בְּלֹא אֲכִילָה וּשְׁתִיָּה.
human_translation: But why were they worried? There, for the necessities High, Here, the need of common Here too, they should performed they should not eaten or drunk. There is no rejoicing without eating and drinking.
llm_translation: Rather, why were they worried? There, it was a case of a high wall, but here it is a case of a layman. Here too: let them work, let them not eat and not drink! There is no joy without eating and drinking.

hebrew_text: וּמִשְׁכָּן דְּדָחֵי שַׁבָּת מְנָלַן? אִילֵּימָא מִדִּכְתִיב: ״בַּיּוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן, וּבַיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי״, דִּלְמָא שְׁבִיעִי לְקׇרְבָּנוֹת! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, אָמַר קְרָא: ״בְּיוֹם עַשְׁתֵּי עָשָׂר יוֹם״. מָה יוֹם כּוּלּוֹ רָצוּף, אַף עַשְׁתֵּי עָשָׂר כּוּלָּן רְצוּפִין.
human_translation: And from where do we the Tabernacle overrode Shabbat? If we say as it is written “On the first day” and “on the seventh day” perhaps the seventh of offerings. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: The verse states: “On the day of the eleventh day” just as a day is all continuous so too, the eleven were all continuous
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And where do we derive the prohibition of preparing the Mishkan on Shabbat? Perhaps from where it is written: "On the first day, and on the seventh day," lest one think the seventh day is for sacrifices! Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said, a verse states: "On the twelfth day." Just as the entire day is continuous, so too all twelve are continuous.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא יָמִים הָרְאוּיִין? כְּתִיב קְרָא אַחֲרִינָא: ״בְּיוֹם שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר יוֹם״. מָה יוֹם כּוּלּוֹ רָצוּף, אַף שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר יוֹם כּוּלָּן רְצוּפִין.
human_translation: But perhaps days that are fit another verse it is written: “On the day of the twelfth day” just as a day is all continuous so too, the twelve days were all continuous
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And perhaps the days are suitable? It is written in another verse: 'On the day of the twelfth day.' Just as that day is entirely consecutive, so too the twelve days are all consecutive." English translation:

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא הָכָא נָמֵי יָמִים הָרְאוּיִין! אִם כֵּן, תְּרֵי קְרָאֵי לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: But perhaps here too days that are fit If so, why do I two verses,
llm_translation: Perhaps here "days" are appropriate! If so, why do I need two verses?

hebrew_text: וּמִקְדָּשׁ דְּדוֹחֶה יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, מְנָלַן? אִילֵּימָא מִדִּכְתִיב: ״אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר יוֹם״, וְדִלְמָא יָמִים הָרְאוּיִין! גָּמַר ״יוֹם״ ״יוֹם״ מֵהָתָם.
human_translation: And from where do we the Temple overrides Yom Kippur, If we say from that which is written: Fourteen days, perhaps days that are fit derived “day” and “day” there,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "And the Temple that pushes off Yom Kippur, from where do we derive this? Perhaps from where it is written: 'fourteen days,' and maybe it refers to fitting days! We learn 'day' 'day' from there."

hebrew_text: יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה לָהֶם: כּוּלְּכֶם מְזוּמָּנִין לְחַיֵּי הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא. וּמְנָלַן דְּאַחֵיל לְהוּ? דְּתָנֵי תַּחְלִיפָא: ״בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁמִינִי שִׁלַּח אֶת הָעָם וַיְבָרְכוּ אֶת הַמֶּלֶךְ וַיֵּלְכוּ לְאׇהֳלֵיהֶם שְׂמֵחִים וְטוֹבֵי לֵב עַל כׇּל הַטּוֹבָה אֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה ה׳ לְדָוִד עַבְדּוֹ וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵל עַמּוֹ״.
human_translation: a Divine Voice issued forth and said to them: All of you are designated for life in the World-to-Come. And from where do we that pardoned them Taḥlifa taught “On the eighth day he sent the people away, and they blessed the king, and went to their tents joyful and glad of heart for all the goodness that the Lord had done for David His servant and for Israel His people”
llm_translation: The daughter of a voice came out and said to them: "You are all prepared for the life of the world to come." And from where do I know to be able to prove it to them? As it was taught in the first Mishnah: "On the eighth day he sent the people away, and they blessed the king and went to their tents rejoicing and with joyful hearts for all the goodness that the Lord had done for David His servant and for Israel His people."

hebrew_text: ״לְאׇהֳלֵיהֶם״ — שֶׁהָלְכוּ וּמָצְאוּ נָשֵׁיהֶם בְּטָהֳרָה, ״שְׂמֵחִים״ — שֶׁנֶּהֱנוּ מִזִּיו הַשְּׁכִינָה, ״וְטוֹבֵי לֵב״ — שֶׁכׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד נִתְעַבְּרָה אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּבֵן זָכָר, ״עַל כׇּל הַטּוֹבָה״ — שֶׁיָּצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה לָהֶם: כּוּלְּכֶם מְזוּמָּנִין לְחַיֵּי הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא.
human_translation: “to their tents” that they went and found their wives in purity, “joyful” they had enjoyed the splendor of the Divine Presence, “and glad of heart” each of their wives conceived a male child. “for all the goodness” that a Divine Voice issued forth and said to them: All of you are designated for life in the World-to-Come,
llm_translation: "to their tents" - that they went and found their wives in a state of purity, "rejoicing" - that they enjoyed from the radiance of the Divine Presence, "and of good heart" - that each and every one had his wife give birth to a male child, "for all the good" - that a heavenly voice emerged and said to them: all of you are prepared for the life of the world to come.

hebrew_text: ״לְדָוִד עַבְדּוֹ וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵל עַמּוֹ״. בִּשְׁלָמָא ״לְיִשְׂרָאֵל עַמּוֹ״ — דְּאַחֵיל לְהוּ עֲוֹן יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, אֶלָּא ״לְדָוִד עַבְדּוֹ״ מַאי הִיא?
human_translation: for David His servant and for Israel His people. Granted, for Israel His people, that He pardoned them the sin of Yom Kippur but what is for David His servant?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "לְדָוִד עַבְדּוֹ וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵל עַמּוֹ". בִּשְׁלָמָא "לְיִשְׂרָאֵל עַמּוֹ" — דְּאַחֵיל לְהוּ עֲוֹן יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, אֶלָּא "לְדָוִד עַבְדּוֹ" מַאי הִיא? English translation: "Of David, His servant, and of Israel, His people." Granted, "of Israel, His people" — for it suspends the sin of Yom Kippur, but "of David, His servant" — what is it?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁבִּיקֵּשׁ שְׁלֹמֹה לְהַכְנִיס אָרוֹן לַמִּקְדָּשׁ דָּבְקוּ שְׁעָרִים זֶה לָזֶה. אָמַר שְׁלֹמֹה עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע רְנָנוֹת וְלֹא נַעֲנָה, פָּתַח וְאָמַר ״שְׂאוּ שְׁעָרִים רָאשֵׁיכֶם וְגוֹ׳״ וְלֹא נַעֲנָה,
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said that Rav said: When Solomon sought to bring the Ark into the Temple the gates clung together Solomon uttered twenty-four songs and was not answered. He began and said: “Lift up your heads, O you gates, but was not answered,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: At the time when Solomon sought to bring the Ark into the Sanctuary, the doors clung to one another. Solomon said, "Twenty-four songs and no response," he opened and said, "Lift up your heads, O gates," and there was no response.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן שֶׁאָמַר ״ה׳ אֱלֹהִים אַל תָּשֵׁב פְּנֵי מְשִׁיחֶךָ זׇכְרָה לְחַסְדֵי דָּוִד עַבְדֶּךָ״ — מִיָּד נַעֲנָה. בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נֶהְפְּכוּ פְּנֵי שׂוֹנְאֵי דָוִד כְּשׁוּלֵי קְדֵירָה, וְיָדְעוּ הַכֹּל שֶׁמָּחַל לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא עַל אוֹתוֹ עָוֹן.
human_translation: Once he said: O Lord God, do not turn away the face of Your anointed; remember the faithful love of David Your servant” he was immediately answered. At that moment the faces of David’s enemies turned like the bottom of a pot, and all knew that the Holy One, Blessed be He, forgave him for that sin
llm_translation: As soon as it was said, "The Lord God, do not turn away the face of Your anointed one; remember the acts of kindness of Your servant David" - immediately they were answered. At that moment, the countenances of David's enemies turned as black as the bottom of a pot, and everyone knew that the Holy One, blessed be He, had forgiven him for that sin.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן בֶּן עַסְמַיי וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן גֵּרִים תָּנוּ פָּרָשַׁת נְדָרִים בֵּי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי, אִיפְּטוּר מִינֵּיהּ בְּאוּרְתָּא. לְצַפְרָא הֲדוּר וְקָא מִפַּטְרִי מִינֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: וְלָאו אִיפַּטְרִיתוּ מִינַּי בְּאוּרְתָּא?
human_translation: Rabbi Yonatan ben Asmai and Rabbi Yehuda, son of converts, studied the portion oaths in the study hall of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai. took leave of in the evening, In the morning they went back and took leave of him He said to them: Did you not take leave of me in the evening?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yonatan ben Asmai and Rabbi Yehuda ben Gerim taught the chapter of Nedarim in the house of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai, they exempted him with a light. To Safra, the honorable, and they were exempting him. He said to them: Did you not exempt me with a light?
