hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לִמַּדְתָּנוּ רַבֵּינוּ תַּלְמִיד שֶׁנִּפְטָר מֵרַבּוֹ וְלָן בְּאוֹתָהּ הָעִיר, צָרִיךְ לִיפָּטֵר מִמֶּנּוּ פַּעַם אַחֶרֶת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁמִינִי שִׁלַּח אֶת הָעָם וַיְבָרֲכוּ אֶת הַמֶּלֶךְ״, וּכְתִיב: ״וּבְיוֹם עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה לַחֹדֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִי שִׁלַּח אֶת הָעָם״!
human_translation: They said to him: You have taught us, our teacher, a disciple who takes leave of his teacher and stays overnight in the same city must take leave of him an additional time, as it is stated “On the eighth day he sent the people away, and they blessed the king” and it is written: “And on the twenty-third day of the seventh month he sent the people away”
llm_translation: They said to him: You have learned from our teacher, a student who was dismissed by his teacher and stayed in that city, must be dismissed from him another time, as it is stated: "On the eighth day he sent the people away and they blessed the king," and it is written: "And on the twenty-third day of the seventh month he sent the people away!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מִכָּאן לְתַלְמִיד הַנִּפְטָר מֵרַבּוֹ וְלָן בְּאוֹתָהּ הָעִיר, צָרִיךְ לִיפָּטֵר מִמֶּנּוּ פַּעַם אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: Rather, from here a disciple who takes leave of his teacher and stays overnight in the same city must take leave of him an additional time,
llm_translation: Rather, from here we learn regarding a student who is dismissed by his teacher and wants to stay in that city, he must be dismissed from him another time.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ לִבְרֵיהּ: בְּנֵי אָדָם הַלָּלוּ אֲנָשִׁים שֶׁל צוּרָה הֵם, זִיל גַּבֵּיהוֹן דְּלִיבָרְכוּךְ. אֲזַל, אַשְׁכְּחִינְהוּ דְּקָא רָמוּ קְרָאֵי אַהֲדָדֵי. כְּתִיב: ״פַּלֵּס מַעְגַּל רַגְלֶךָ וְכׇל דְּרָכֶיךָ יִכּוֹנוּ״, וּכְתִיב: ״אוֹרַח חַיִּים פֶּן תְּפַלֵּס״.
human_translation: said to his son: These people, are men of form [ tzura ] go to them so that they will bless you. He went found them raising contradictions between verses It is written: “Make level the path of your feet, and let all your ways be established” And it is written: “Lest you level out the path of life,”
llm_translation: He said to his son: These human beings are of noble stature, go and bless them. He went, found them engaged in reciting verses of praise. It is written: "Make level the path of your foot, and all your ways will be established," and it is written: "The way of life, lest you make it crooked."

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּמִצְוָה שֶׁאֶפְשָׁר לַעֲשׂוֹתָהּ עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים,
human_translation: not difficult: Here, a mitzva that can be done by others,
llm_translation: Not difficult: here in a commandment that it is possible to do it through others,

hebrew_text: כָּאן בְּמִצְוָה שֶׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר לַעֲשׂוֹתָהּ עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: There, a mitzva that cannot be done by others,
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text: Talmudic text: Here in a commandment that it is impossible to do it by others.

hebrew_text: הֲדַר יָתְבִי וְקָא מִבְּעֵי לְהוּ, כְּתִיב: ״יְקָרָה הִיא מִפְּנִינִים וְכׇל חֲפָצֶיךָ לֹא יִשְׁווּ בָהּ״ — הָא חֶפְצֵי שָׁמַיִם יִשְׁווּ בָהּ, וּכְתִיב: ״כׇּל חֲפָצִים לֹא יִשְׁווּ בָהּ״ — דַּאֲפִילּוּ חֶפְצֵי שָׁמַיִם לֹא יִשְׁווּ בָהּ!
human_translation: once again sat and raised the dilemma: it is written “She is more precious than rubies; and all of your desires are not to be compared to her” but the desires of Heaven, can be compared to her. And it is written: and all the things that may be desired are not to be compared to it”
llm_translation: The text reads: "He sat and asked them, as it is written: 'She is more precious than pearls, and all your desires cannot compare with her' — this means that the desires of heaven can compare with her, and it is written: 'All desirable things cannot compare with her' — even the desires of heaven cannot compare with her!"

hebrew_text: כָּאן בְּמִצְוָה שֶׁאֶפְשָׁר לַעֲשׂוֹתָהּ עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים, כָּאן בְּמִצְוָה שֶׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר לַעֲשׂוֹתָהּ עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: here, a mitzva that can be done by others. there, a mitzva that cannot be done by others.
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: Here in a commandment that it is possible to do through others, here in a commandment that it is impossible to do through others.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מַאי בָּעֵית הָכָא? אֲמַר לְהוּ, דַּאֲמַר לִי אַבָּא: זִיל גַּבַּיְיהוּ דְּלִיבָרְכוּךְ. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: יְהֵא רַעֲוָא דְּתִזְרַע וְלָא תֶּחְצַד, תְּעַיֵּיל וְלָא תַּיפֵּוק, תַּיפֵּוק וְלָא תְּעַיֵּיל, לִיחְרוֹב בֵּיתָךְ וְלִיתּוֹב אוּשְׁפִּיזָךְ, לִבַּלְבַּל פָּתוּרָךְ, וְלָא תִּחְזֵי שַׁתָּא חַדְתָּא.
human_translation: they said to him: What do you want here? He said to them: Father told me: Go to them so that they should bless you. They said to him May it be will that you should sow and not reap, that you should bring in and not take out, that you should take out and not bring in, that your house should be destroyed and your lodging place should be inhabited, that your table should become confused, and that you should not see a new year.
llm_translation: They said to him: What do you need here? He said to them, for my father told me: Go to those who bless you. They said to him: May the will to sow be yours, but not the will to reap; may you undertake, but not be taken from; may you be taken from, but not undertake; may your house be destroyed and your inn be established; may your interpretations be confused, and may you not see a new year.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא לְגַבֵּי אֲבוּהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא מִבַּעְיָא דְּבָרוֹכֵי לָא בָּירְכֻן אֲבָל צַעוֹרֵי צַעֲורֻן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי אֲמַרוּ לָךְ? הָכִי וְהָכִי אֲמַרוּ לִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָנָךְ כּוּלְּהוּ בִּרְכָתָא נִינְהוּ. תִּזְרַע וְלָא תֶּחְצַד: תּוֹלִיד בָּנִים וְלָא יְמוּתוּ. תְּעַיֵּיל וְלָא תַּיפֵּוק: תְּעַיֵּיל כַּלְּתָא וְלָא לֵימוּתוּ בְּנָךְ דְּלִיפְּקוּן. תַּיפֵּוק וְלָא תְּעַיֵּיל: תּוֹלִיד בְּנָתָא וְלָא יְמוּתוּ גּוּבְרַיְיהוּ וְלִיהְדְּרוּ לְוָתָיךְ.
human_translation: When he came to his father, he said to him: Not only did they not bless me, but they caused me pain said to him: What did they say to you? They said to me such and such. said to These are all blessings, you should sow and not reap you should bear sons and they should not die. you should bring in and not take out you should bring in brides and your sons should not die, which to leave. you should take out and not bring in you should have daughters and their husbands should not die, return to you.
llm_translation: When he came before his father, he said to him: "I do not need the blessings of the elders, but the blessings of the young." He said to him: "What did they say to you?" "This and this they said to me." He said to him: "All of them are blessings for you. Sow and do not cut: you will bear children and they will not die. Ascend and do not descend: ascend to a bride and your son will not die before they are weaned. Descend and do not ascend: bear a daughter and your masters will not die, and they will honor your sons."

hebrew_text: לִיחְרוֹב בֵּיתָךְ וְלִיתּוֹב אוּשְׁפִּיזָךְ — דְּהַאי עָלְמָא אוּשְׁפִּיזָךְ, וְהָהֻיא עָלְמָא בֵּיתָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״קִרְבָּם בָּתֵּימוֹ לְעוֹלָם״. אַל תִּקְרֵי ״קִרְבָּם״, אֶלָּא ״קִבְרָם״.
human_translation: your house should be destroyed and your lodging place should be inhabited, As this world is your lodging place, and the World-to-Come is your house, as it is written: “Their inward thought [ kirbam ], is that their houses shall continue forever” Do not read “their inward thought [ kirbam ]”; rather their graves [ kivram ].
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Lichrov beitach v'litov ushpizach - dehai alma ushpizach, v'hahua alma beita, dikhtiv: 'kirbam batem leolam'. Al tikrei 'kirbam', ela 'kivram'." English translation: "May Your house be destroyed and may Your inn be blessed - because this world is Your inn, and the world to come is Your house, as it is written: 'Their graves are their homes forever'. Do not read 'kirbam' (their homes), but 'kivram' (their graves)."

hebrew_text: לִבַּלְבַּל פָּתוּרָךְ: בִּבְנֵי וּבְנָתָא. וְלָא תִּיחְזֵי שַׁתָּא חַדְתָּא: דְּלָא תְּמוּת אִתְּתָךְ וְלָא תִּנְסַב אִינְתְּתָא אַחֲרִיתִי.
human_translation: your table should become confused, with sons and daughters, you should not see a new year, your wife should not die and you should not marry another woman,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Libalbal paturch: bivnei uvenata. V'lo tichzei shata chadta: d'lo temut ittach v'lo tinsav intata ach'riti." English translation: "Confuse your interpretation: with sons and daughters. And do not look for another wife: so that your wife does not die, and another wife is not married after her."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן חֲלַפְתָּא אִפְּטַר מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַב, אֲמַר לֵיהּ אֲבוּהּ: זִיל לְגַבֵּיהּ דְּלִיבָרְכָךְ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יְהֵא רַעֲוָא דְּלָא תְּבַיֵּישׁ וְלָא תִּתְבַּיַּישׁ. אֲתָא גַּבֵּי אֲבוּהּ. אָמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי אֲמַר לָךְ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִילִּין בְּעָלְמָא הוּא דְּאָמַר לִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Ḥalafta took leave of Rav. His father said to him: Go to him so that he should bless you. Rabbi Shimon ben Ḥalafta May it be will that you should not shame and that you should not feel ashamed. He came to his father, said to him: What did he say to you? He said to him: Mere words he said to me,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Chalaphta was dismissed by Rav. He said to him, "Father, go to his presence so that he may bless you." He said to him, "May it be the will of God that you not be embarrassed, and that you not cause embarrassment." He went to his father. He said to him, "What did he say to you?" He said to him, "It was just general words that he said to me."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בָּרְכָךְ בִּרְכְּתָא דְּבֵרְכָן קוּדְשָׁא בְּרִיךְ הוּא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל וּתְנָא בַּהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַאֲכַלְתֶּם אָכוֹל וְשָׂבוֹעַ וְהִלַּלְתֶּם וְגוֹ׳ וְלֹא יֵבוֹשׁוּ עַמִּי לְעוֹלָם. וִידַעְתֶּם כִּי בְקֶרֶב יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲנִי וְגוֹ׳ וְלֹא יֵבוֹשׁוּ עַמִּי לְעוֹלָם״.
human_translation: said to him: He blessed you with the blessing with which the Holy One, Blessed be He, blessed Israel and repeated as it is written: “And you shall eat in plenty, and be satisfied, and praise and My people shall never be ashamed. And you shall know that I am in the midst of Israel, and My people shall never be ashamed”
llm_translation: He said to him: "Blessed be the blessing with which the Holy One, blessed be He, blessed Israel, and it was taught in it, as it is written: 'And you shall eat and be satisfied, and you shall bless, etc.' 'And you shall know that I am in the midst of Israel, etc.' 'And my people shall never be ashamed, etc.'"

hebrew_text: וְעוֹשָׂה אִשָּׁה תַּכְשִׁיטֶיהָ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, אֵלּוּ הֵן תַּכְשִׁיטֵי נָשִׁים: כּוֹחֶלֶת וּפוֹקֶסֶת וּמַעֲבִירָה סְרָק עַל פָּנֶיהָ. וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי מַעֲבֶרֶת סְרָק עַל פָּנֶיהָ שֶׁל מַטָּה.
human_translation: And a woman may engage in her cosmetic treatments The Sages taught These are the cosmetic treatments of women She may paint her eyelids, she may remove hair [ pokeset ], and she may put rouge on her face. And some say: She may pass a comb over her lower face,
llm_translation: And a woman makes her adornments. The Rabbis taught: These are the adornments of women: Kohellet, Pokeset, and Ma'avirah Sarak on her face. And there are those who say, Ma'averet Sarak on the face of the bed.

hebrew_text: דְּבֵיתְהוּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא מִקַּשְּׁטָא בְּאַנְפֵּי כַּלְּתַהּ. יָתֵיב רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִינָּנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא וְיָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא יַלְדָּה, אֲבָל זְקֵנָה — לֹא.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda’s wife would adorn herself in the presence of her daughter-in-law, Rav Huna bar Ḥinnana sat before Rav Ḥisda, and he sat and said: They taught only only a young woman, but an old woman, no,
llm_translation: The household of Rav Ḥisda was in distress due to the anger of his daughter-in-law. Rav Huna, son of Ḥinena, sat before Rav Ḥisda and sat and said: They only taught this regarding a young woman, but regarding an older woman - no.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָאֱלֹהִים! אֲפִילּוּ אִמָּךָ וַאֲפִילּוּ אִימָּא דְאִימָּךְ, וַאֲפִילּוּ עוֹמֶדֶת עַל קִבְרָהּ. דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: בַּת שִׁיתִּין כְּבַת שֵׁית, לְקָל טַבְלָא רָהֲטָא.
human_translation: said to him: By God! Even your mother, and even your mother’s mother, and even a woman that is standing at her grave As people say A woman of sixty years, like one of six, runs at the sound of the timbrel [ tavla ],
llm_translation: He said to him: "God! Even your mother and even the mother of your mother, and even if she is standing on her grave." For people say: "A daughter-in-law is like a daughter, in a time of distress a friend."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא תָּסוּד. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אִשָּׁה לֹא תָּסוּד מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנִּיוּוּל הוּא לָהּ. וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּסִיד שֶׁיְּכוֹלָה לְקַפְּלוֹ בַּמּוֹעֵד, שֶׁטּוֹפַלְתּוֹ בַּמּוֹעֵד. שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמְּצֵירָה הִיא עַכְשָׁיו — שְׂמֵחָה הִיא לְאַחַר זְמַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: She may not apply lime because it renders her unattractive It is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: A woman may not apply lime because it a disgrace to her, But Rabbi Yehuda concedes that with regard to lime that she can peel off during the Festival, she may apply it on the Festival, as even though she is distressed now, she will be happy afterward,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Do not braid. It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: A woman should not braid her hair because it is a form of adornment for her. And Rabbi Yehuda concedes regarding a chain that she can braid it on a festival, as she is fixing it for the festival. Even though it causes her distress now, it brings joy later.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַאי סְבָרָא? וְהָתְנַן:
human_translation: But does Rabbi Yehuda accept this reasoning Didn’t we learn
llm_translation: And who holds according to Rabbi Yehuda this opinion? And it was taught:

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: נִפְרָעִין מֵהֶן מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמֵּצֵר. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמֵּצֵר עַכְשָׁיו — שָׂמֵחַ הוּא לְאַחַר זְמַן!
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: One may collect from them due to that is distressed said to him: Even though he is distressed now, he will be happy afterward,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: We collect from them because they cause distress. They said to him: Even though they cause distress now - he will be happy later!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: הַנַּח לְהִלְכוֹת מוֹעֵד, דְּכוּלְּהוּ מֵצֵר עַכְשָׁיו וְשָׂמֵחַ לְאַחַר זְמַן נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Leave the halakhot governing a Festival, all one is distressed now, he will be happy afterward.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: One who leaves the festival before its conclusion, all of them are considered as if he is in distress now, and he will rejoice later.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: גּוֹי לְעִנְיַן פֵּרָעוֹן לְעוֹלָם מֵצֵר.
human_translation: Ravina said with regard to repaying a gentile is always distressed,
llm_translation: Ravina said: A non-Jew regarding matters of financial liability is always considered a creditor.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁהִגִּיעוּ לְפִירְקָן וְלֹא הִגִּיעוּ לְשָׁנִים, עֲנִיּוֹת טוֹפְלוֹת אוֹתָן בְּסִיד, עֲשִׁירוֹת טוֹפְלוֹת אוֹתָן בְּסוֹלֶת, בְּנוֹת מְלָכִים בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמּוֹר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שִׁשָּׁה חֳדָשִׁים בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמּוֹר״.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: The daughters of Israel who reached maturity, but had not reached the age The poor smear their with lime The wealthy ones smear themselves with fine flour and the daughters of kings would smear themselves with shemen hamor . As it is stated “Six months with shemen hamor ”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: Jewish daughters who have reached puberty but have not yet reached adulthood, poor women smear them with lime, wealthy women smear them with fine flour, daughters of kings smear them with myrrh oil, as it is stated: "Six months with oil of myrrh."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״שֶׁמֶן הַמּוֹר״? רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִיָּיא אָמַר: סְטָכַת, רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַמֵּי אָמַר: שֶׁמֶן זַיִת שֶׁלֹּא הֵבִיא שְׁלִישׁ.
human_translation: What is shemen hamor ? Rav Huna bar Ḥiyya said: setaket . Rav Yirmeya bar Ami said: olive oil from that not reached one-third
llm_translation: What is "Shemen Hamor"? Rav Huna bar Chiya said: Stakhat. Rav Yirmeya bar Amei said: Olive oil that did not bring a third.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַנְפִּיקִינוּן — שֶׁמֶן זַיִת שֶׁלֹּא הֵבִיא שְׁלִישׁ. וְלָמָּה סָכִין אוֹתוֹ? שֶׁמַּשִּׁיר אֶת הַשֵּׂעָר וּמְעַדֵּן אֶת הַבָּשָׂר.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: anpikinon , olive oil that has not yet reached one-third And why do spread it that it removes the hair and pampers the skin.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: We remove it - olive oil that did not bring a third. And why do we sharpen it? To make the hair smooth and to soften the skin.

hebrew_text: רַב בִּיבִי הֲוָה לֵיהּ בְּרַתָּא, טַפְלַהּ אֵבֶר אֵבֶר. שְׁקַל בַּהּ אַרְבַּע מֵאָה זוּזֵי. הֲוָה הָהוּא גּוֹי בְּשִׁבָבוּתֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ בְּרַתָּא. טַפְלַהּ בְּחַד זִמְנָא וּמִתָה, אֲמַר: קַטְלַהּ בִּיבִי לִבְרַתִּי. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: רַב בִּיבִי דְּשָׁתֵי שִׁיכְרָא — בָּעֲיָין בְּנָתֵיהּ טִפְלָא, אֲנַן דְּלָא שָׁתֵינַן שִׁיכְרָא — לָא בָּעֲיָין בְּנָתִין טִפְלָא.
human_translation: Rav Beivai had a daughter, he spread on her limb limb, he took four hundred dinars for her. There was a certain gentile in his neighborhood who had a daughter He spread her at once, and she died. said: Beivai killed my daughter. Rav Naḥman said: Rav Beivai, who drinks beer, his daughters require smeared but we who do not drink beer, our daughters do not require smeared
llm_translation: Rav Bevai had a daughter, each limb separately. He took from her four hundred zuz. There was a certain non-Jew in his neighborhood who had a daughter. She became sick at one time and died. He said: "Rav Bevai killed my daughter." Rav Nachman said: "Rav Bevai, who drinks beer, needs a daughter, but we who do not drink beer do not need a daughter."

hebrew_text: הַהֶדְיוֹט תּוֹפֵר כְּדַרְכּוֹ. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי הֶדְיוֹט? אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהוֹצִיא מְלֹא מַחַט בְּבַת אַחַת. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר: כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְכַוֵּין אִימְרָא בְּחֵפֶת חֲלוּקוֹ.
human_translation: A layman, sew in his manner What are the circumstances a layman? of the school of Rabbi Yannai said: Anyone who cannot pull a full needle at the same time Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: Anyone who cannot form a straight seam on the hem [ ḥefet ] of his shirt
llm_translation: The layman ties as is his way. What are the characteristics of a layman? The House of Rabbi Yannai said: Anyone who cannot extract a handful of wheat in one hand. Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina said: Anyone who cannot arrange a saying in a divided basket.

hebrew_text: וְהָאוּמָּן מַכְלִיב. מַאי מַכְלִיב? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: מַפְסִיעַ. רַבָּה בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל אֲמַר: שִׁינֵּי כַלְבְּתָא.
human_translation: A craftsman, may form temporary stitches [ makhliv ]. What is forming temporary stitches? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: He he skips Rabba bar Shmuel said: the teeth of a dog.
llm_translation: The craftsman is "makliv." What is "makliv"? Rabbi Yochanan said: it is a type of hammer. Rabbah bar Shmuel said: it is a type of dog's tooth.

hebrew_text: מְסָרְגִין אֶת הַמִּטּוֹת. מַאי ״מְסָרְגִין״ וּמַאי ״מְמַתְּחִין״? כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר: פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא וְרַבִּי אַסִּי, וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּחִזְקִיָּה וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן חַד אָמַר: מְסָרְגִין — שְׁתִי וָעֵרֶב, וּמְמַתְּחִין — שְׁתִי בְּלֹא עֵרֶב. וְחַד אָמַר: מְסָרְגִין — שְׁתִי בְּלֹא עֵרֶב, וּמְמַתְּחִין — שֶׁאִם הָיָה רָפוּי, מְמַתְּחוֹ.
human_translation: One may interweave a bed. What is interweaving, and what is tightening? When Rav Dimi came he said: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba and Rabbi Asi disagree about and both of them in the name of Ḥizkiyya and Rabbi Yoḥanan. One said: Interweaving lengthwise and widthwise, tightening lengthwise and not widthwise. And one said: Interweaving lengthwise and not widthwise, while tightening that if became loose, he tighten it
llm_translation: We weave the beds. What is "weaving" and what is "stretching"? When Rav Dimi came, he said: Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba and Rabbi Assi disagree about it, and both of them in the name of Hizkiyah and Rabbi Yohanan. One said: We weave - two and evening, and we stretch - two without evening. And one said: We weave - two without evening, and we stretch - if it was loose, they stretch it.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָא תָּנֵי רַב תַּחְלִיפָא בַּר שָׁאוּל: וְשָׁוִין שֶׁאֵין מַפְשִׁילִין חֲבָלִים לְכַתְּחִלָּה. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מְסָרְגִין — שְׁתִי וָעֵרֶב, וּמְמַתְּחִין — שְׁתִי בְּלֹא עֵרֶב, הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי רַב תַּחְלִיפָא בַּר שָׁאוּל: וְשָׁוִין שֶׁאֵין מַפְשִׁילִין חֲבָלִים לְכַתְּחִלָּה.
human_translation: Is that so? Didn’t Rav Taḥlifa bar Shaul teach And agree that one may not braid cords anew Granted, according to the one who said interweaving lengthwise and widthwise, and tightening lengthwise and not widthwise, this that which Rav Taḥlifa taught: And they agree that one may not braid cords anew,
llm_translation: I? But didn't Rav Tahalifa bar Sha'ul teach: And they are equal, that we do not untie ropes at the outset. Granted according to the one who says we braid - two and intertwine - two without intertwining, that is what Rav Tahalifa bar Sha'ul taught: And they are equal, that we do not untie ropes at the outset.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מְסָרְגִין — שְׁתִי בְּלֹא עֵרֶב, מְמַתְּחִין — שֶׁאִם הָיָה רָפוּי הָיָה מְמַתְּחוֹ. הַשְׁתָּא שְׁתִי וָעֵרֶב אָמְרַתְּ לָא — חֲבָלִים לְכַתְּחִלָּה מִיבַּעְיָא?! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: However, according to the one who said interweaving lengthwise and not widthwise, tightening that if became loose, he tighten it, Now you said lengthwise and widthwise, no, is necessary cords anew it difficult.
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says we tie the bandage - two without an evening, we untie - for if it was loose, it would be untied. Now, if you say two and an evening - did you not need ropes to begin with?! A difficulty.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק לְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין: מִי אִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מְסָרְגִין — שְׁתִי בְּלֹא עֵרֶב? וְהָתְנַן, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: הַמִּטָּה מִשֶּׁיְּסָרֵג בָּהּ שְׁלֹשָׁה בָּתִּים!
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said to Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avin: Is there one who says that interweaving lengthwise, but not widthwise? Didn’t we learn Rabbi Meir says: A bed from when one interweaves three meshes in it,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak to Rabbi Chiya bar Avin: Who holds that one may weave two threads without a warp? But we learned: Rabbi Meir says: One may weave a bed with it the warp three houses!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר: בִּמְסָרְגִין כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דִּשְׁתִי וָעֵרֶב, אֶלָּא כִּי פְּלִיגִי בִּמְמַתְּחִין. מָר סָבַר מְמַתְּחִין — שְׁתִי בְּלֹא עֵרֶב, וּמָר סָבַר: שֶׁאִם הָיָה רָפוּי מְמַתְּחוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, when Ravin came he stated With regard to interweaving, everyone agrees lengthwise and widthwise. When they disagree it is only about tightening. One Sage holds tightening lengthwise and not widthwise. And one Sage holds if became loose, he may tighten it.
llm_translation: Rather, when Ravin came, he said: In the case of "metsargin," everyone does not disagree that it is permissible to drink and eat, but rather they disagree in the case of "mematḥin." One Master holds that "mematḥin" means drinking without eating, and the other Master holds that it means if one was already satiated.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: מְסָרְגִין אֶת הַמִּטָּה, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר שֶׁמְּמַתְּחִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מְמַתְּחִין, אֲבָל לֹא מְסָרְגִין. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מְמַתְּחִין כׇּל עִיקָּר.
human_translation: raises an objection One may interweave a bed and needless to say one may tighten this is the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: One may tighten but not interweave And some say: One may not tighten at all.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text you provided translates into English as follows: Challenger: They tie the bed, and needless to say that they untie it, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: They untie it, but do not tie it. And some say: They do not untie at all.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מְמַתְּחִין שְׁתִי בְּלֹא עֵרֶב, הַיְינוּ דְּאָתוּ יֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים לְאִיפְּלוֹגֵי. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שֶׁאִם הָיָה רָפוּי מְמַתְּחוֹ, לְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים מְמַתְּחוֹ נָמֵי לָא?
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said tightening lengthwise and not widthwise, this is Some say, comes to disagree But according to the one who said that if became loose he tighten it, according to Some say, he not even tighten
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says we may soak the beets without an eruv, this is what they mean by saying "to the flayers." But according to the one who says that if it was already softened, we may soak it, do they not also say that we may soak it even if it was not softened?

hebrew_text: אִין, כֵּיוָן דְּאֶפְשָׁר לְמִמְלְיֵיהּ בְּמָאנֵי — לָא טָרְחִינַן.
human_translation: Yes, Since it is possible to fill with clothing, he not exert
llm_translation: There is no need, since it is possible to say it in fewer words.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מַעֲמִידִין תַּנּוּר וְכִירַיִם וְרֵיחַיִם בַּמּוֹעֵד. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵין מְכַבְּשִׁין אֶת הָרֵיחַיִם בַּתְּחִילָּה.
human_translation: One may set up an oven, a stove, and a mill on a Festival. Rabbi Yehuda says: One may not chisel millstones for the first time
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: It was taught: We may set up ovens, stoves, and cauldrons on a Festival. Rabbi Yehuda says: We may not kindle the cauldrons initially.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי מְכַבְּשִׁין? רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: מְנַקַּר רִיחְיָא. רַב יְחִיאֵל אָמַר: בַּת עֵינָא.
human_translation: What is chiseling Rav Yehuda said: Cutting the millstones. Rav Yeḥiel said: an eyehole
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the meaning of "Gema"? Rav Yehudah said: Clearing out the smell. Rav Yechiel said: In the eye of the well.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: מַעֲמִידִין תַּנּוּר וְכִירַיִם בַּמּוֹעֵד, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִגְמוֹר מְלַאכְתָּן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אַף יִגְמוֹר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשְּׁמוֹ: מַעֲמִידִין אֶת הַחֲדָשָׁה, וּמְכַבְּשִׁין אֶת הַיְּשָׁנָה. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מְכַבְּשִׁין כׇּל עִיקָּר.
human_translation: raises an objection One may set up an oven and a stove on a Festival, provided that he does not complete the labor; the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. But the Rabbis say: He even complete Rabbi Yehuda says in the name of One may set up a new and one may chisel an old And some say: One may not chisel at all.
llm_translation: Challenger: They set up an oven and stoves on the festival, provided that they do not complete their work, the words of Rabbi Eliezer. And the sages say: Even complete it. Rabbi Yehuda says in his own name: They establish the new one and demolish the old one. And some say: One does not demolish at all.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מְכַבְּשִׁין מְנַקַּר רִיחְיָא — הַיְינוּ דְּמַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בִּישָׁנָה, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בַּת עֵינָא יְשָׁנָה — בַּת עֵינָא לְמָה לַהּ? כְּגוֹן דְּקָא בָּעֵי לְאַרְווֹחֵי טְפֵי פּוּרְתָּא.
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said chiseling cutting the millstones, this is you find to an old But according to the one who said an eyehole, why does an old need an eyehole where he wants to widen a little more.
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says that we crush the spices, it is because she forgets them in the sleep, but according to the one who says that the eye sleeps - why does it need it? For example, when she wants to apply eye salve.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא שַׁמְעֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּקָא מְנַקַּר רִיחְיָא בְּחוּלָּא דְמוֹעֲדָא, אֲמַר: מַאן הַאי? אִיתַּחִיל גּוּפֵיהּ דְּקָא מַחֵיל חוּלָּא דְּמוֹעֲדָא. סָבַר לַהּ כְּיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים.
human_translation: Rav Huna heard a certain man cutting his millstone on the intermediate days of a Festival. He said: Who is this? his body be desecrated, for he desecrates the intermediate days of a Festival. holds in accordance Some say,
llm_translation: Rav Huna, whose name was heard by that man who was smelling fragrances in the marketplace during the festival, said: Who is this? He is desecrating the sanctity of the festival. He thought to himself as if people were saying.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַב חָמָא: נוֹקְרִין רֵיחַיִם בַּמּוֹעֵד. מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ סוּס שֶׁרוֹכֵב עָלָיו וַחֲמוֹר שֶׁרוֹכֵב עָלָיו — מוּתָּר לִיטּוֹל צִפׇּרְנַיִם בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד,
human_translation: Rav Ḥama taught One may cut millstones on a Festival. In the name of Rabbi Meir he said: Even the horse that rides upon and the donkey that he rides upon, he is permitted to trim hooves
llm_translation: Rav Ḥama expounded: Fragrances are permitted on the festival. In the name of Rabbi Meir, it was said: Even a horse that one rides upon and a donkey that one rides upon—it is permissible to remove splinters from their hooves on the festival.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל חֲמָרָא דְרִיחְיָא — לָא.
human_translation: However, a donkey millstones, no,
llm_translation: But wine of Rekayya - no.

hebrew_text: רַב יְהוּדָה שְׁרֵי לְמִישְׁקַל טוּפְרֵיהּ לַחֲמָרָא דְרִיחְיָא, וּלְאוֹקוֹמֵי רִיחְיָא, וּלְמִיבְנֵי רִיחְיָא, וּלְמִיבְנֵי אַמַּת רִיחְיָא, וּלְמִיבְנֵי אוּרְיָא. רָבָא שְׁרָא לְסָרוֹקֵי סוּסְיָא, וּלְמִיבְנֵי אַקְרָפִיטָא, וּלְמִיבְנֵי אִיצְטְבָא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda permits to trim the hooves of the donkey a mill, to set a mill to build a mill, to construct channel a mill, and to build a stable Rava permitted to groom a horse, to build a trough, and to build a bench
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah permits to smooth his clay on the wall of the wine cellar, and to make the wall smooth, and to build the wall, and to build a cubit of the wall, and to build a window. Rava permits to scrape the hooves of the horses, and to build a stable, and to build a manger.

hebrew_text: רָבָא שְׁרָא לְמִישְׁקַל דְּמָא לִבְהֵמָה בְּחוּלָּא דְּמוֹעֲדָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי, תַּנְיָא דִּמְסַיַּיע לָךְ: מַקִּיזִין דָּם לַבְּהֵמָה, וְאֵין מוֹנְעִין רְפוּאָה לַבְּהֵמָה בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד.
human_translation: Rava permitted to let the blood of an animal on the intermediate days of a Festival. Abaye said to him: is taught that supports you: One may let blood from an animal, and one not withhold medical treatment from an animal on the intermediate days of a Festival.
llm_translation: Rava permitted the sprinkling of blood for an animal on a festival. Abaye said to him, "A supporting source is taught to you: We sprinkle blood for the animal, and we do not withhold healing for the animal on its festival."

hebrew_text: רָבָא שְׁרָא לְכַסְכּוֹסֵי קִירְמֵי. מַאי טַעְמָא — מַעֲשֵׂה הֶדְיוֹט הוּא. אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר אַמֵּי אֲמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: קִיטּוּרֵי בֵירֵי — אֲסִיר. מַאי טַעְמָא — מַעֲשֵׂה אוּמָּן הוּא.
human_translation: Rava permitted to scrub garments What is the reason? It is the work of a layman Rav Yitzḥak bar Ami said that Rav Ḥisda said: Tying sleeves is prohibited. What is the reason? It is the work of a craftsman
llm_translation: Rava would send cups of wine to the residents of the city of Kaskosei. What is the reason? — It is an act of kindness. Rav Yitzchak bar Ammi said in the name of Rav Chisda: Small cups of wine in a city are prohibited. What is the reason? — It is a skilled act.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מַאן דִּמְתַקֵּיל אַרְעָא אַדַּעְתָּא דְּבֵי דָרֵי — שְׁרֵי, אַדַּעְתָּא דְאַרְעָא — אֲסִיר.
human_translation: Rava said: who clears the ground his intention a threshing floor, it is permitted, his intention the ground it is prohibited.
llm_translation: Rava said: One who is careful with the knowledge of the residents of the house of study - it is praiseworthy, the knowledge of the land - it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? — מוּלְיָא בְּמוּלְיָא וְנַצָּא בְּנַצָּא — אַדַּעְתָּא דְבֵי דָרֵי, שְׁקַל מוּלְיָא וּשְׁדָא בְּנַצָּא — אַדַּעְתָּא דְאַרְעָא.
human_translation: What are the circumstances mound [ mulya ] onto mound, or one furrow into furrow [ natza ], with the intention of a threshing floor, he takes from a mound and casts it into a furrow, with the intention of the ground
llm_translation: How are they similar? - Circumcision with circumcision and discharge with discharge - the knowledge of the house of Darai, take circumcision and place it with discharge - the knowledge of the land.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: הַאי מַאן דְּזָכֵי זִיכֵי, אַדַּעְתָּא דְצִיבֵי — שְׁרֵי, אַדַּעְתָּא דְאַרְעָא — אֲסִיר. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? שָׁקֵיל רַבְרְבֵי וְשָׁבֵיק זוּטְרֵי — אַדַּעְתָּא דְצִיבֵי, שְׁקַל רַבְרְבֵי וְזוּטְרֵי — אַדַּעְתָּא דְאַרְעָא.
human_translation: And Rava said: one who clears twigs his intention the twigs it is permitted, his intention the ground it is prohibited. What are the circumstances he takes the large and leaves the small with the intention of the twigs. he takes the large and the small with the intention of the ground,
llm_translation: And Rava said: One who is meritorious, his knowledge is expansive; one who is not meritorious, his knowledge is restricted. How so? He takes large steps and covers small distances - his knowledge is expansive; he takes small steps and covers large distances - his knowledge is restricted.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: הַאי מַאן דְּפָתַח מַיָּא לְאַרְעֵיהּ, אַדַּעְתָּא דִכְווֹרֵי — שְׁרֵי, אַדַּעְתָּא דְאַרְעָא — אֲסִיר.
human_translation: And Rava said: one who opens the a water through his land his intention the fish it is permitted, his intention the ground, it is prohibited.
llm_translation: And Rava said: One who opens water to his field, the knowledge of the worms - permitted, the knowledge of the land - prohibited.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? פָּתַח תְּרֵי בָבֵי, חַד מֵעִילַּאי וְחַד מִתַּתַּאי — אַדַּעְתָּא דִכְווֹרֵי, פְּתַח חַד בָּבָא — אַדַּעְתָּא דְאַרְעָא.
human_translation: What are the circumstances he opens two gates one above and one below, with the intention of fish, he opens one with the intention of the ground,
llm_translation: "How are they similar? One opened two gates, one from above and one from below - the knowledge of the heavens. One gate opened in the midst - the knowledge of the earth."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: הַאי מַאן דְּפָשַׁח דִּיקְלָא, אַדַּעְתָּא דְחֵיוָתָא — שְׁרֵי, אַדַּעְתָּא דְּדִיקְלָא — אֲסִיר. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? שָׁקֵיל כּוּלֵּיהּ מֵחַד גִּיסָא — אַדַּעְתָּא דְחֵיוָתָא, מֵהַאי גִּיסָא וּמֵהַאי גִּיסָא — אַדַּעְתָּא דְּדִיקְלָא וַאֲסִיר.
human_translation: And Rava said: one who cuts date palm with the intention of his animals, it is permitted, with the intention of date palm, it is prohibited. What are the circumstances he takes all from one side with the intention of his animals, from this side and from the other side, with the intention of the date palm, and it is prohibited.
llm_translation: And Rava said: One who peels a date palm, if the intention is for the sake of the living part - it is permitted; if the intention is for the sake of the palm itself - it is prohibited. How so? If he takes all of it from one side - it is for the sake of the living part, but if he takes from this side and from that side - it is for the sake of the palm itself and it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: הָנֵי תַּמְרֵי תוּחְלָנִי, מִיגְזְרִינְהוּ — שְׁרֵי, מַיְיצִינְהוּ — אֲסִיר. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: כֵּיוָן דְּמַתְלְעִי — כִּפְרַקְמַטְיָא הָאָבֵד דָּמֵי, וְשָׁרֵי.
human_translation: And Rava said: With regard to these unripe dates, cutting them is permitted preserving them is prohibited, Rav Pappa said: Since they become infested with worms they are like merchandise that will be lost, and it is permitted
llm_translation: And Rava said: Those dates of Tuchlani, if they are cut – permitted, if they are squeezed – forbidden. Rav Pappa said: Once they become detached – they are like the lost axe, and permitted.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: פְּרַקְמַטְיָא כָּל שֶׁהוּא, אָסוּר. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר אָבִין: וּבַדָּבָר הָאָבֵד — מוּתָּר. רָבִינָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ הָהוּא עִיסְקָא דַּהֲוָה מִזְדַּבַּן בְּשִׁיתָּא אַלְפֵי, שַׁהֲיֵיהּ לְזַבּוֹנֵיהּ בָּתַר חוּלָּא דְמוֹעֲדָא וְזַבְּנֵיהּ בִּתְרֵיסַר אַלְפֵי.
human_translation: And Rava said: Any commerce is prohibited Rabbi Yosei bar Avin said: But a matter that, loss, it is permitted. Ravina had a business that could have been sold for six thousand he delayed selling it after the intermediate days of a Festival, and he sold it for twelve thousand
llm_translation: And Rava said: A parakmatya, whatever it may be, is forbidden. Rabbi Yosei bar Avin said: And in a matter of loss - it is permitted. Ravina had a certain business deal in which he would profit six thousand, his profits would be after the festival day and his expenses twelve thousand.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא הֲוָה מַסֵּיק זוּזֵי בִּבְנֵי אַקְרָא דְשַׁנְוָאתָא, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַהוּ לְמֵיזַל הָאִידָּנָא עֲלַיְיהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כֵּיוָן דְּהָאִידָּנָא הוּא דְּמַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לְהוּ, בְּיוֹמֵי אַחֲרִינֵי לָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לְהוּ — כִּפְרַקְמַטְיָא הָאָבֵד דָּמֵי, וְשָׁרֵי.
human_translation: Ravina had lent money to the residents of the fortress of Shanvata. He came before Rav Ashi said to him: What is to going to them now, said to him: Since it is now that you will find them, on other days you will not find them, this is like merchandise that will be lost, and it is permitted.
llm_translation: Ravina was collecting coins among the residents of the village of Shanvata. He came before Rav Ashi, who said to him: What is the benefit of the current collection for them? He said to him: Since the collection is for them, they will forget about it now, but in the future days they will not forget about it - like a lost pearl, it is found, and it is permitted.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי גַּבֵּי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא: הוֹלְכִין
human_translation: So too, it is taught with regard to idol worship like this case: One may go
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita in the name of Rabbi Nechemyah regarding foreign worship, for this is the case: they would go.

hebrew_text: לְיָרִיד שֶׁל גּוֹיִם, וְלוֹקְחִים בְּהֵמָה, עֲבָדִים וּשְׁפָחוֹת, בָּתִּים, שָׂדוֹת וּכְרָמִים, וְכוֹתֵב וּמַעֲלֶה בָּעַרְכָּאוֹת שֶׁלָּהֶן, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא כְּמַצִּיל מִיָּדָן.
human_translation: to a fair of gentiles and buy animals, slaves, maidservants, houses, fields, and vineyards And he may write and confirm in their courts [ arkaot ] because it is as if he were rescuing from their hands,
llm_translation: Descend of gentiles, and taking animals, slaves and maidservants, houses, fields and vineyards, and writes and raises in their value, because he is like one who saves from their hand.

hebrew_text: רַב שְׁרָא לְחִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי לְמִיגְדַּל אוּהָרִי בְּחוּלָּא דְמוֹעֲדָא. מַאי טַעְמָא — מַעֲשֵׂה הֶדְיוֹט הוּא, אֲבָל אִיזְלֵי — אָסוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא — מַעֲשֵׂה אוּמָּן הוּא.
human_translation: Rav permitted Ḥiyya bar Ashi to weave traps [ oharei ] on the intermediate days of a Festival. What is the reason it is the work of a layman. However, nets [ izlei ] are prohibited. What is the reason? It is the work of a craftsman,
llm_translation: Rav Shra said to Ḥiyya bar Ashi to Migdal Uhari in the secular part of the festival. What is the reason? It is a layman's work, but to go out - it is prohibited. What is the reason? It is a craftsman's work.

hebrew_text: רַב יְהוּדָה שְׁרָא לְאַמֵּי תַּנּוּרָאָה לְמִיגְדַּל תַּנּוּרֵי, וּלְרַבָּה בַּר עִשְׂבִּי לְמִיגְדַּל מַהוֹלָתָא. אִינִי? וְהָא תָּנֵי רַבָּה בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל: וְשָׁוִין שֶׁאֵין גּוֹדְלִין תַּנּוּר לְכַתְּחִילָּה! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה, כָּאן בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda permitted Ami the oven maker to construct ovens and Rabba bar Ashabi to craft sieves. Is that so? Didn’t Rabba bar Shmuel teach And they agree that one may not construct a new oven not difficult: Here, to the summer, there, the rainy season,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah would permit his mother to light the oven for baking purposes, and Rabba bar Issavi would permit his mother to light the stove for cooking purposes. Is this not a contradiction? But Rabba bar Shmuel taught: And they are equal, as one may not increase the size of the oven initially! This is not difficult: here it is referring to the days of the sun, and here it is referring to the days of rain.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עוֹשִׂין מַעֲקֶה לַגַּג וְלַמִּרְפֶּסֶת מַעֲשֵׂה הֶדְיוֹט, אֲבָל לֹא מַעֲשֵׂה אוּמָּן. שָׁפִין אֶת הַסְּדָקִין וּמַעֲגִילִין אוֹתָן בַּמַּעֲגִילָה, בַּיָּד וּבָרֶגֶל אֲבָל לֹא בְּמַחְלָצַיִם.
human_translation: One may construct a railing for a roof or a balcony the work of a layman, but not the work of a craftsman. One may plaster the cracks and roll over them with a roller, with a hand or a foot, but not with a presser,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may construct a fence for the roof or balcony in the manner of an amateur, but not in the manner of a skilled craftsman. They may plaster the crevices and seal them with a roller, using either hand or foot, but not with a tool specifically designed for this purpose.

hebrew_text: הַצִּיר וְהַצִּינּוֹר וְהַקּוֹרָה וְהַמַּנְעוּל וְהַמַּפְתֵּחַ שֶׁנִּשְׁבְּרוּ — מְתַקְּנָן בַּמּוֹעֵד, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִתְכַּוֵּין לַעֲשׂוֹת מְלַאכְתּוֹ בַּמּוֹעֵד.
human_translation: the hinge and the cylinder and the beam and a lock and a key that broke, one may fix them on a Festival provided that he does not intend to do his labor on the Festival
llm_translation: The saw, the drill, the beam, the bolt, and the key that broke - one may repair them on a festival, provided he does not intend to perform his work on the festival.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל כְּבָשִׁין שֶׁהוּא יָכוֹל לֶאֱכוֹל מֵהֶן בַּמּוֹעֵד כּוֹבְשָׁן.
human_translation: And all preserved food from which one can eat on the Festival, he preserve them
llm_translation: And all sheep that is able to eat from them on the festival, one may slaughter them.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הֵיכִי דָמֵי מַעֲשֵׂה הֶדְיוֹט? רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: בְּהוּצָא וְדַפְנָא. בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: צָר בִּצְרוֹר וְאֵינוֹ טָח בְּטִיט.
human_translation: What are the circumstances the work of a layman? Rav Yosef said: with palm branches and bay trees, It was taught in a baraita he fills in with stone but he does not plaster with clay.
llm_translation: Gemara: How are the laws of the layman's deed? Rav Yosef said: through hutzah and dafna. In a baraita it was taught: one who is in distress in a bundle and does not smear with clay.

hebrew_text: שָׁפִין אֶת הַסְּדָקִין וּמַעֲגִילִין אוֹתָן בַּמַּעֲגִילָה. הַשְׁתָּא בְּמַעֲגִילָה אָמְרַתְּ שְׁרֵי — בַּיָּד וּבָרֶגֶל מִיבַּעְיָא? הָכִי קָאָמַר: שָׁפִין אֶת הַסְּדָקִין וּמַעֲגִילִין אוֹתָן כְּעֵין מַעֲגִילָה, בַּיָּד וּבָרֶגֶל, אֲבָל לֹא בְּמַחְלָצַיִם.
human_translation: One may plaster the cracks and roll over them with a roller, Now you said it is permitted with a roller, is necessary with a hand or a foot? this is what is saying: One may plaster the cracks and roll over them as if with a roller, with a hand or a foot, but not with a presser,
llm_translation: They smooth the plaster and roll it in a scroll. Now, when it comes to a scroll, does it require the hand and the foot? This is what it means: They smooth the plaster and roll it like a scroll, with the hand and the foot, but not with the loins.

hebrew_text: הַצִּיר וְהַצִּינּוֹר וְהַקּוֹרָה וְהַמַּנְעוּל וְהַמַּפְתֵּחַ שֶׁנִּשְׁבְּרוּ — מְתַקְּנָן בַּמּוֹעֵד. וּרְמִינְהִי: עַד יָמָיו הָיָה פַּטִּישׁ מַכֶּה בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם כּוּ׳. עַד יָמָיו — אִין, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ — לָא!
human_translation: the hinge and the cylinder and the beam and a lock and a key that broke, one may fix them on a Festival. raises a contradiction Until the days hammers would beat in Jerusalem until his days, yes, but from then on, no,
llm_translation: The saw, the drill, the beam, the bolt, and the key that broke - they may be fixed during the festival. And the Gemara asked: Until his days, a hammer would strike in Jerusalem. Until his days - no, from here on - no!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בִּדְנַפָּחֵי, כָּאן בִּדְנַגָּרֵי.
human_translation: This not difficult: There, smiths, here, of carpenters,
llm_translation: Not difficult: here in D'nafachei, here in D'naggarei.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב חִסְדָּא: יֹאמְרוּ, קָלָא רַבָּה — אֲסִיר, קָלָא זוּטְרָא — שְׁרֵי! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּמַגָּלֵי, הָא — בַּחֲצִינֵי. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: כָּאן — קוֹדֶם גְּזֵירָה, כָּאן — לְאַחַר גְּזֵירָה.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda strongly objects to this: will say a loud noise is prohibited, a soft noise is permitted. Rather, Rav Ḥisda said not difficult This sickles, that chisels. Rav Pappa said: Here before the decree there after the decree.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rav Ḥisdah objects to this: Let them say, "A large voice is forbidden, a small voice is permitted!" Rather, Rav Ḥisdah said: It is not difficult: here we are dealing with a scroll, there we are dealing with a parchment. Rav Pappa said: Here it is before the decree, there it is after the decree.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: הָא — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָא — רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אַבְדִּימִי: מַאן תַּנָּא שִׁינּוּי בַּמּוֹעֵד בְּדָבָר הָאָבֵד — דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: That Rabbi Yehuda; this Rabbi Yosei. As Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Avdimi said: Who is the tanna taught on a Festival with a change, with a matter that will be lost not in accordance with Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Here is Rabbi Yehuda, here is Rabbi Yosei. As Rabbi Yitzchak bar Avdimi said: Who is the Tanna that taught about a change in the appointed time regarding a lost item? It is not like Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: כְּמַאן מְדַלִּינַן הָאִידָּנָא קִבְּיוָתָא דְּדַשָּׁא בְּחוּלָּא דְמוֹעֲדָא, כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: Ravina said: In accordance with whose do we now lift the lintel above the door on the intermediate days of a Festival In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: Ravina said: In whose opinion do we establish the law of the festive offering of the Paschal lamb on a weekday during the festival? In whose opinion? In the opinion of Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: כְּבָשִׁין שֶׁהוּא יָכוֹל לֶאֱכוֹל בַּמּוֹעֵד — כּוֹבְשָׁן. בְּדִיתָא לְבַאי כְּווֹרֵי, אֲזוּל כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא צוּד אַיְיתוֹ כְּווֹרֵי, שְׁרָא לְהוּ רָבָא לְמִימְלַח מִינַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: preserved food from which he can eat on the Festival, he preserve them Bedita overflowed, fish Everyone went and trapped and brought fish, Rava permitted them to salt of
llm_translation: "Of lambs that are fit to be eaten on the festival - they are bought. In the city of Be'ai Kevorei, if all the people of the world would come to hunt, they would not find a lamb, for Rava permitted them to salt from their own."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי, וְהָא תְּנַן: כְּבָשִׁין שֶׁהוּא יָכוֹל לֶאֱכוֹל מֵהֶן בַּמּוֹעֵד — כּוֹבְשָׁן! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כֵּיוָן דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא אַדַּעְתָּא דַאֲכִילָה אַיְיתִינְהוּ, וְאִי שָׁבֵיק לְהוּ פָּסְדִי, כִּפְרַקְמַטְיָא הָאָבֵד דָּמֵי, וּשְׁרֵי.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: Didn’t we learn all preserved food from which he can eat on the Festival, he preserve them said to him: Since they initially brought with the intention of eating and if one would leave them they would be ruined, they are like merchandise that will be lost, and is permitted.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye, but didn't we learn: if one could eat from the sheep during the festival - he should buy them! He said to him: since initially you had in mind to eat them, and if you leave them it will be a loss, it is like a lost object whose value is diminishing, and it is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, שְׁרָא לְהוּ רָבָא מֵיצָד מֵיזָל אַיְיתוֹיֵי וּמִימְלָח. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְהָא אֲנַן, כְּבָשִׁין שֶׁהוּא יָכוֹל לֶאֱכוֹל מֵהֶן כּוֹבְשָׁן תְּנַן!
human_translation: And some say Rava permitted them to trap to bring them and to salt Abaye said to him: Didn’t we learn all preserved food from which he can eat on the Festival, he preserve them
llm_translation: And there are those who say, it is permitted for Rava to bring in fish and salt from the side. Abaye said to him: But we, sheep that are able to eat from them, we acquire them!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָנֵי נָמֵי מִיתְאַכְלִי אַגַּב אִיצָצָא. כִּי הָא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל עֲבַדוּ לֵיהּ שִׁיתִּין אִיצָצֵי וַאֲכַל. רָבָא אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא, עָבְדִי לֵיהּ שִׁיתִּין אִיצָצֵי וַאֲכַל.
human_translation: said to him: These can also be eaten by pressing as in that of Shmuel, they prepared for him by pressing sixty times and he ate Rava happened to the house of the Exilarch they prepared for him by pressing sixty times, and he ate
llm_translation: He said to him: These figs are good to eat because of their sweetness. Just as Samuel prepared for him sixty figs and he ate. Rava entered the house of the head of the exile, they prepared for him sixty figs and he ate.

hebrew_text: רַב אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי רַב שַׁפִּיר, אַיְיתוֹ לְקַמַּיְיהוּ הָהוּא כְּווֹרָא תִּילְתָּא בִּישּׁוּלָא תִּילְתָּא מִילְחָא וְתִילְתָּא טַוְויָא.
human_translation: Rav happened to the house of Rav Shapir, they brought before him a certain fish, one- third cooked, one-third salted one-third broiled.
llm_translation: Rav entered the house of Rav Shapir, they brought before them a certain barrel of one-third fine flour, one-third oil, and one-third honey.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: אֲמַר לִי אַדָּא צַיָּידָא, כְּווֹרָא סָמוּךְ לְמִיסְרְחֵיהּ מְעַלֵּי. וְאָמַר רַב, אֲמַר לִי אַדָּא צַיָּידָא: כְּווֹרָא, טַוְויָיא בַּאֲחוּהּ, אַסּוֹקֵיהּ בַּאֲבוּהּ, מֵיכְלֵי[הּ] בִּבְרֵיהּ, מִשְׁתֵּי עֲלֵיהּ אֲבוּהּ.
human_translation: Rav said: Adda the fisherman told me a fish close to spoiling is best. And Rav said: Adda the fisherman told me: a fish, broil it with its brother, place it in its father, eat it with its son, and drink after it its father,
llm_translation: Rav said: Adah the hunter told me, "A beam near his trap is lifted up." And Rav said, Adah the hunter told me: "A beam, twisted in his brotherhood, engaged in his father's work, his food in his creation, his father's brother drinks upon him."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב, אֲמַר לִי אַדָּא צַיָּידָא: כְּווֹרָא, תַּחְלֵי, וַחֲלָבָא — לִיטְעוֹן גּוּפָא וְלָא לִיטְעוֹן פּוּרְיָא. וְאָמַר רַב, אֲמַר לִי אַדָּא צַיָּידָא: כְּווֹרָא, תַּחְלֵי, וַחֲלָבָא — מַיָּא וְלָא שִׁיכְרָא, שִׁיכְרָא וְלָא חַמְרָא.
human_translation: And Rav said: Adda the fisherman told me: fish, cress, and milk, let the body carry them and let not the bed carry them, And Rav said: Adda the fisherman told me: fish, cress, and milk, water and not beer, beer and not wine,
llm_translation: And Rav said, a hunter told me: "Liver, first, and milk - for the body and not for the womb." And Rav said, a hunter told me: "Liver, first, and milk - water and not beer, beer and not wine."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ מַשְׁקִין בֵּית הַשְּׁלָחִין
llm_translation: We will return to you, Mishkin, the house of the emissaries.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁהָפַךְ אֶת זֵיתָיו וְאֵירְעוֹ אֵבֶל אוֹ אוֹנֶס, אוֹ שֶׁהִטְעוּהוּ פּוֹעֲלִים — טוֹעֵן קוֹרָה רִאשׁוֹנָה וּמַנִּיחָהּ לְאַחַר הַמּוֹעֵד, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: one who had turned over his olives and mourning befell him or unavoidable accident or workers misled him, he may load the beam initial leave it until after the Festival; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: One who overturned his olives and they became mournful or damaged, or if they were misled by workers - he claims the first row and leaves it for after the festival, the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: זוֹלֵף וְגוֹמֵר, וְגָף כְּדַרְכּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: He may press and complete and plug in its manner.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: "Zolef and gomer, and gaf k'darko."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ פָּתַח בְּאֵבֶל וְסִיֵּים בַּמּוֹעֵד. אָמַר רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת: דְּבָרִים הַמּוּתָּרִין בַּמּוֹעֵד, אֲסוּרִים בִּימֵי אֶבְלוֹ.
human_translation: opens with mourning and ends with the Festival, Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, said: That is to say: Actions that are permitted on a Festival are prohibited during the days of one’s mourning.
llm_translation: Gemar opened in mourning and concluded in the festival. Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said: This is what it means: Things permitted during the festival are prohibited during the days of mourning.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר, לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא בִּימֵי אֶבְלוֹ, דְּמִדְּרַבָּנַן הוּא וּשְׁרֵי, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ בַּמּוֹעֵד, דְּאִיסּוּר מְלָאכָה מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא בִּמְקוֹם פְּסֵידָא — שָׁרוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said is speaking It is not necessary, It is not necessary during the days of his mourning, when is rabbinic, it is permitted but even on the Festival, when the prohibition against labor is by Torah law, in a case of a loss the Sages permitted
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said, he is not saying "he is not saying in the days of his mourning," for he is from the Rabbis and permissible, but even on a festival, where the prohibition of labor is from the Torah in a place of loss — the Rabbis permitted.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי. אֵלּוּ דְּבָרִים הָעוֹשִׂין לָאָבֵל בִּימֵי אֶבְלוֹ: זֵיתָיו הֲפוּכִין — טוֹעֲנִין לוֹ, וְכַדּוֹ לָגוּף וּפִשְׁתָּנוֹ לְהַעֲלוֹת מִן הַמִּשְׁרָה, וְצַמְרוֹ לְהַעֲלוֹת מִן הַיּוֹרָה, וּמַרְבִּיצִים שָׂדֵהוּ מִשֶּׁתַּגִּיעַ עוֹנַת הַמַּיִם שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi: These are actions that perform for the mourner during the days of his mourning: his olives have been turned over, they may load for him and his cask to be plugged, or his flax to be lifted out of the soaking pool or his wool to be lifted from the cauldron They irrigate his field when his turn for water arrives,
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi: These are the things done for a mourner during his mourning period: His olive trees are turned over - they are pruned for him, and his flax is beaten to remove it from the stalk, and his wool is combed to remove it from the thorn, and they water his field from the time the water season arrives.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף זוֹרְעִין לוֹ שְׂדֵה נִיר וְשָׂדֶה הָעוֹמֶדֶת לְפִשְׁתָּן. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אִם לֹא תִּזָּרַע בְּבַכִּיר — תִּזָּרַע בְּאָפִל, אִם לֹא תִּזָּרַע פִּשְׁתָּן — תִּזָּרַע מִמִּין אַחֵר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: They also sow for him a plowed field or a field set aside for flax, said to him: If is not sown in the early it can be sown in the later if it is not sown with flax, it can be sown with another species.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Also one sows for him a field of barley and a field standing for flax. They said to him: If you will not sow in the morning - sow in the evening, if you will not sow flax - sow another kind.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: זֵיתָיו הֲפוּכִין וְאֵין שָׁם אוּמָּן אֶלָּא הוּא, כַּדּוֹ לָגוּף וְאֵין שָׁם אוּמָּן אֶלָּא הוּא, פִּשְׁתָּנוֹ לְהַעֲלוֹת מִן הַמִּשְׁרָה וְצַמְרוֹ לְהַעֲלוֹת מִן הַיּוֹרָה וְאֵין שָׁם אוּמָּן אֶלָּא הוּא — הֲרֵי זֶה יַעֲשֶׂה בְּצִינְעָא.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: his olives have been turned over and there is no skilled worker but him, his cask to be plugged and there is no skilled worker but him, his flax to be lifted out of the soaking pool, or his wool to be lifted from the cauldron, and there is no skilled worker but him, he may perform in private.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: His olives are turned over, and there is no craftsman there except for him, like a bucket to the body, and there is no craftsman there except for him. His flax is for bringing up from the kitchen, and his wool for bringing up from the Torah, and there is no craftsman there except for him - he may do this with tzina'a.

hebrew_text: יָתֵר עַל כֵּן אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: אִם הָיָה אוּמָּן לָרַבִּים, וְסַפָּר וּבַלָּן לָרַבִּים, וְהִגִּיעַ עֵת הָרֶגֶל וְאֵין שָׁם אוּמָּן אֶלָּא הוּא — הֲרֵי זֶה יַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said further: If was a craftsman the public, or a barber or a bath attendant for the public, and the time of the Festival arrived, and there is no skilled worker but him, he may perform
llm_translation: Extra therefore said Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel: If there was a craftsman for the public, and a scribe and a surveyor for the public, and the time of pilgrimage arrived and there is no craftsman except him - he should perform it.

hebrew_text: הָאֲרִיסִין וְהַחֲכִירִין וְהַקַּבְּלָנִין — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יַעֲשׂוּ אֲחֵרִים בִּשְׁבִילָן. הַחַמָּרִין הַגַּמָּלִין וְהַסַּפָּנִין — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ לֹא יַעֲשׂוּ, וְאִם הָיוּ מוּחְכָּרִין אוֹ מוּשְׂכָּרִין אֵצֶל אֲחֵרִים — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יַעֲשׂוּ. שְׂכִיר יוֹם אֲפִילּוּ בְּעִיר אַחֶרֶת — לֹא יַעֲשֶׂה. הָיְתָה מְלֶאכֶת אֲחֵרִים בְּיָדוֹ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁבְּקִיבּוֹלֶת — לֹא יַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: Tenant farmers, and leasers, and contractors, those for whom others may perform donkey drivers, camel drivers, and sailors those may not perform However, if they were leased or hired out to others, then they may perform A day laborer, even in a different city may not perform a commission for others was his responsibility, even if it was by contract he may not perform
llm_translation: The plowers, the field-diggers, and the planters - others may do work for their sake. The donkey-drivers, camel-drivers, and shipmasters - these may not do work, but if they were hired or rented out to others - these may do work. A day laborer, even in another city - may not work. If he had the work of others in his hand, even though it is with their consent - he may not work.

hebrew_text: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁבְּקִיבּוֹלֶת, וְלָא מִיבַּעְיָא שֶׁאֵינָהּ קִיבּוֹלֶת?! אַדְּרַבָּה, קִיבּוֹלֶת כְּדִידֵיהּ דָּמֵי! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: בֵּין קִיבּוֹלֶת בֵּין שֶׁאֵינָהּ קִיבּוֹלֶת — לֹא יַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: even if it was by contract it is not necessary not by contract On the contrary, by contract it is considered as his Rather, say whether by contract or not by contract, he may not perform
llm_translation: Even though it is in the womb, and it is not needed, is it not in the womb?! On the contrary, in the womb it is like its own limbs! Rather say: Whether it is in the womb or not in the womb - it shall not be done.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה מְלַאכְתּוֹ בְּיַד אֲחֵרִים, בְּבֵיתוֹ — לֹא יַעֲשׂוּ, בְּבַיִת אַחֵר — יַעֲשׂוּ.
human_translation: he commissioned others his work, in his house they may not perform in another house they may perform
llm_translation: His work was in the hands of others, in his house - they should not do it, in another house - they should do it.

hebrew_text: מָרִיּוֹן בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבִין וּמָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא הֲוָה לְהוּ הַהוּא גַּמְלָא דְתוֹרָא בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי. אִיתְּרַעָא בֵּיהּ מִילְּתָא בְּמָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא וּפַסְקֵיהּ לְגַמְלֵיהּ. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: גַּבְרָא רַבָּה כְּמָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַחָא עָבֵיד הָכִי? נְהִי דְּלִפְסֵידָא דִּידֵיהּ לָא חָיֵישׁ, אַדַּאֲחֵרִים לָא חָיֵישׁ?! וְהָא תַּנְיָא: אִם הָיוּ מוּשְׂכָּרִין אוֹ מוּחְכָּרִין אֵצֶל אֲחֵרִים — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יַעֲשׂוּ!
human_translation: Maryon, son of Ravin, and Mar, son of Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, held a team of oxen between them, An event, befell Mar, son of Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, and he detached his from the team, Rav Ashi said: A distinguished man like Mar, son of Rav Aḥa, is behaving this Granted, he is not concerned about his own loss, is he not concerned about the loss of others, Isn’t it taught If they were hired out or leased to others, then they may perform
llm_translation: Marion, son of Ravin, and Mar, son of Rav Acha, son of Rava, had a certain camel of the Torah between them. An incident occurred with them regarding a matter, with Mar, son of Rav Acha, son of Rava, and he decided according to his camel. Rav Ashi said: Does a great man like Mar, son of Rav Acha, do this? He is not concerned about his own loss, but about others' loss?! But it was taught: If they were hired or rented out to others - these may be done!

hebrew_text: וְהוּא סָבַר: אָדָם חָשׁוּב שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: But maintains: An important person is different.
llm_translation: And he holds: a person esteemed, changes.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מְקַבְּלֵי קִיבּוֹלֶת, בְּתוֹךְ הַתְּחוּם — אָסוּר. חוּץ לַתְּחוּם — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Shmuel said: contractors, it is prohibited within the limit Outside the limit, it is permitted.
llm_translation: Shmuel said: Receivers of a tradition, within the boundary - forbidden. Outside the boundary - permitted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: וַאֲפִילּוּ חוּץ לַתְּחוּם, לֹא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלֵיכָּא מָתָא דִּמְקָרְבָא לְהָתָם, אֲבָל אִיכָּא מָתָא דִּמְקָרְבָא לְהָתָם — אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: And even outside the limit, we said only when there is no city in close proximity to there, but if there is city in close proximity to there, it is prohibited,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Even outside the boundary, we only say that there is no matter that comes close to there, but if there is a matter that comes close there - it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: וְכִי לֵיכָּא מָתָא דִּמְקָרְבָא לְהָתָם נָמֵי, לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא בְּשַׁבָּתוֹת וּבְיָמִים טוֹבִים, דְּלָא שְׁכִיחִי אִינָשֵׁי דְּאָזְלִי לְהָתָם, אֲבָל בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד, דִּשְׁכִיחִי אִינָשֵׁי דְּאָזְלִי וְאָתוּ לְהָתָם — אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya said: And even when there is no city in close proximity, we said only on Shabbatot and Festivals, when people do not routinely go there, However, on the intermediate days of a Festival, when people routinely come and go from there it is prohibited.
llm_translation: Rav Mesharshaya said: Is it not so that a city that is close to there, we only said this regarding Sabbaths and festivals, for people are not commonly going there, but on a weekday of a festival, where people commonly go back and forth there - it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: מָר זוּטְרָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן בְּנוּ לֵיהּ אַפַּדְנָא מְקַבְּלֵי קִיבּוֹלֶת חוּץ לַתְּחוּם. אִיקְּלַע רַב סָפְרָא וְרַב הוּנָא בַּר חִינָּנָא, וְלָא עַלּוּ לְגַבֵּיהּ. וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: הוּא נָמֵי לָא עָל בְּגַוֵּויהּ.
human_translation: Mar Zutra, son of Rav Naḥman, contractors built a mansion [ apadana ] for him outside the limit. Rav Safra and Rav Huna bar Ḥinnana happened but they did not enter it, And there are who say: Even he, did not enter it.
llm_translation: Mar Zutra, son of Rav Nachman, his son-in-law, received the acceptance of the community outside the boundary. Rav Safra and Rav Huna, son of Chinena, came and did not agree with him. Some say: He indeed did not agree with them.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מְקַבְּלֵי קִיבּוֹלֶת — בְּתוֹךְ הַתְּחוּם אָסוּר, חוּץ לַתְּחוּם מוּתָּר! אָדָם חָשׁוּב שָׁאנֵי. וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: סַיּוֹעֵי סַיַּיע בְּתִיבְנָא בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: But didn’t Shmuel say: contractors, within the limit, it is prohibited outside the limit it is permitted? An important person is different And there are who say: He provided them with assistance with straw
llm_translation: And Samuel said: Those who receive the Kibboleth - within the Techum is forbidden, outside the Techum is permitted! A person of importance is different. And there are those who say: The helpers helped with the building simultaneously.

hebrew_text: רַב חָמָא שְׁרָא לְהוּ לְאַבְוָנְגָּרֵי דְּבֵי רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא לְמֶיעְבַּד לְהוּ עֲבִידְתָּא בְּחוּלָּא דְמוֹעֲדָא, אֲמַר: כֵּיוָן דַּאֲגַר לָא קָא שָׁקְלִי, שַׁרְשׁוֹיֵי הוּא דְּקָא מְשָׁרְשׁוּ לֵיהּ, וְלֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥama permitted the bath attendants [ abunagrei ] of the Exilarch’s house to work for them, on the intermediate days of a Festival. He said Since they do not take payment are conferring a favor and we have no with it.
llm_translation: Rav Hama permitted the Avungarei of the house of Reish Galuta to engage in work on a weekday of a festival. He said: Since he did not take a wage, it is the roots that he is uprooting for himself, and we have no concern with it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מְקַבְּלִין קִיבּוֹלֶת בַּמּוֹעֵד לַעֲשׂוֹתָהּ לְאַחַר הַמּוֹעֵד, וּבַמּוֹעֵד אָסוּר. כְּלָלוֹ שֶׁל דָּבָר: כֹּל שֶׁהוּא עוֹשֶׂה — אוֹמֵר לְגוֹי וְעוֹשֶׂה, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵינוֹ עוֹשֶׂה — אֵינוֹ אוֹמֵר לְגוֹי וְעוֹשֶׂה. תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: מְקַבְּלִין קִיבּוֹלֶת בַּמּוֹעֵד לַעֲשׂוֹתָהּ לְאַחַר הַמּוֹעֵד, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יִמְדּוֹד וְשֶׁלֹּא יִשְׁקוֹל וְשֶׁלֹּא יִמְנֶה כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁהוּא עוֹשֶׂה בַּחוֹל.
human_translation: The Sages taught may receive contract work on Festival to execute it after the Festival, but it is prohibited during the Festival The principle of the matter Any that may perform he may tell a gentile to perform, and any that he may not perform he may not tell a gentile to perform. It is taught another may receive contract work on a Festival to execute it after the Festival, provided that he does not measure, weigh, or count, in the manner as he does on an weekday.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One may accept a vow during the festival to fulfill it after the festival, but during the festival it is prohibited. The general principle is: anything one is doing - he may tell a non-Jew to do, but anything he is not doing - he may not tell a non-Jew to do. Another teaching: One may accept a vow during the festival to fulfill it after the festival, provided that he does not measure, weigh, or count it as he would on a weekday.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מַרְבִּיעִין בְּהֵמָה בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד. כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ: אֵין מַרְבִּיעִין בִּבְכוֹר וְלֹא בִּפְסוּלֵי הַמּוּקְדָּשִׁין.
human_translation: The Sages taught One may not breed an animal, on the intermediate days of a Festival, Similarly, one may not breed a firstborn nor an unfit consecrated animal.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One does not mate an animal on the festival eve. For example: One does not mate a firstborn animal, nor disqualified consecrated animals.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: אֵין מַרְבִּיעִין בְּהֵמָה בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: חֲמוֹרָה שֶׁתָּבְעָה — מַרְבִּיעִין עָלֶיהָ זָכָר בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁלֹּא תִּצְטַנֵּן, וּשְׁאָר כׇּל הַבְּהֵמוֹת — מַכְנִיסִין אוֹתָן לְבַקְרוּת.
human_translation: It is taught another One may not breed an animal on the intermediate days of a Festival. Rabbi Yehuda says: a she-donkey yearns one may breed her with a male, lest she cool off, all other animals they are brought into corrals
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Another Sage teaches: One does not mate an animal on the festival day. Rabbi Yehuda says: If a she-donkey is in heat, one may mate a male with her so that she does not suffer, and with all other animals, they are brought into the pen.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מְדַיְּירִין לֹא בְּשַׁבָּתוֹת וְלֹא בְּיָמִים טוֹבִים וְלֹא בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד. וְאִם בָּאוּ מֵאֲלֵיהֶן — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: The Sages taught One may not enclose on Shabbatot , or on Festivals, or on the intermediate days of a Festival. But if came on their own it is permitted,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One may not establish residence, neither on Shabbatot, nor on festivals, nor on the intermediate days of a festival. But if they came on their own accord — it is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין מְסַיְּיעִין אוֹתָן, וְאֵין מוֹסְרִין לָהֶם שׁוֹמֵר לְנַעֵר אֶת צֹאנָם. הָיָה שְׂכִיר שַׁבָּת, שְׂכִיר חֹדֶשׁ, שְׂכִיר שָׁנָה, שְׂכִיר שָׁבוּעַ — מְסַיְּיעִין אוֹתָן, וּמוֹסְרִין לָהֶם שׁוֹמֵר לְנַעֵר אֶת צֹאנָם. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: בַּשַּׁבָּת — בְּטוֹבָה, בְּיוֹם טוֹב — בִּמְזוֹנוֹת, בַּמּוֹעֵד — בְּשָׂכָר. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הִלְכְתָא כְּרַבִּי.
human_translation: And one may not assist nor may one provide them with a shepherd to herd their sheep were hired by the week, by the month, by the year, by the septennial one may assist them and provide them with a shepherd to herd their sheep. Rabbi says: On Shabbat as a favor, on a Festival, for food; on the the Festival, for pay. Rav Yosef said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi
llm_translation: "And they do not assist them, and they do not appoint for them a guardian to watch over their flock. If one was hired for the Sabbath, hired for the month, hired for the year, hired for the week - they assist him, and appoint for him a guardian to watch over his flock. Rabbi says: On the Sabbath - with a gift, on a festival day - with provisions, on a holiday - with payment. Rav Yosef said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְכֵן מִי שֶׁהָיָה יֵינוֹ בְּתוֹךְ הַבּוֹר וְאֵירְעוֹ אֵבֶל אוֹ אוֹנֶס אוֹ שֶׁהִטְעוּהוּ — זוֹלֵף וְגוֹמֵר וְגָף כְּדַרְכּוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עוֹשֶׂה לוֹ לִימּוּדִים בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁלֹּא יַחְמִיץ.
human_translation: And similarly, one whose wine was in the pit and mourning or unavoidable accident befell him, or misled him, he may draw off and complete and plug in its manner; the statement of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yehuda says: He should construct a wooden panel so that will not sour.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And similarly, one whose wine was in the pit and it turned sour due to mourning, or rape, or if they misled him — he may wring it out, finish it, and pour it in the normal manner, the words of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yehuda says: He should make it into vinegar so that it does not become leavened.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּצְרִיכָא. דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן קַמַּיְיתָא, בְּהַהִיא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי — מִשּׁוּם דְּמִישְׁחָא נְפִישׁ פְּסֵידֵיהּ, אֲבָל חַמְרָא דְּלָא נְפִישׁ פְּסֵידֵיהּ — אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן בָּתְרָיְיתָא, בְּהַהִיא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אֲבָל בְּהָךְ אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And necessary, as, if teaches us the first in that does Rabbi Yosei say because oil, the loss is considerable. However, wine, where the loss is not considerable, that he concedes to Rabbi Yehuda And if he teaches us the last in that did Rabbi Yehuda say but in the other say that he concedes to Rabbi Yosei necessary
llm_translation: Gemara and it is necessary. For if we were to hear the first statement, in that Rabbi Yosei said - because the wine is more significant, its loss is considered a loss, but the vinegar, whose loss is not significant - one might say that Rabbi Yehuda agrees with him. And if we were to hear the latter statement, in that Rabbi Yehuda said, but in this case one might say he agrees with Rabbi Yosei. It is necessary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר אַבָּא: מַאן תַּנָּא שִׁינּוּי בַּמּוֹעֵד בְּדָבָר הָאָבֵד — דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Abba said: Who is the tanna during the intermediate days of the Festival an altered fashion with regard to a matter that, loss? not Rabbi Yosei’s Rav Yosef said: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak bar Abba said: Who is the Tanna that disputes regarding Shinuy (changing) on a festival in a matter of loss? It is not like Rabbi Yosei. Rav Yosef said: The halacha is like Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מַהוּ לְמֵישַׁע חָבִיתָא דְשִׁיכְרָא בְּחוּלָּא דְמוֹעֲדָא? אֲמַר לְהוּ: סִינַי אָמַר הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. אֵימוֹר דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּחַמְרָא, בְּשִׁיכְרָא מִי אָמַר!
human_translation: asked of Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak: What is to sealing a barrel of beer during the intermediate days of the Festival? He said to them: Sinai, said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. Say that Rabbi Yosei said about wine, about beer does he say
llm_translation: He inquired of him, Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak: What about pouring a barrel of beer in the public domain on a festival? He said to them: Sinai said the halacha is like Rabbi Yosei. But in the case where Rabbi Yosei spoke about wine, who said anything about beer!

hebrew_text: חַמְרָא טַעְמָא מַאי — מִשּׁוּם דִּנְפִישׁ פְּסֵידֵיהּ, שִׁיכְרָא נָמֵי אִית בֵּהּ פְּסֵידָא. דְּאָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אֲמַרָה לִי אֵם: בַּר שֵׁית סָאוֵי וּשְׁיִיעַ, מִבַּר תַּמְנֵי וְלָא שְׁיִיעַ.
human_translation: wine, what is the reason because the loss is considerable; beer as well, there is a loss as Abaye said: mother told me: of six se’a that is sealed than of eight that is not sealed,
llm_translation: Wine, what is the reason? Because its loss is significant, beer has a benefit in it. For Abaye said, his mother told him: "Bar Sheit measured and poured, from Bar Tamnei and did not pour."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָמָא בַּר גּוּרְיָא אָמַר רַב: הִלְכוֹת מוֹעֵד כְּהִלְכוֹת כּוּתִים בַּהֲלָכָה. לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? אָמַר רַב דָּנִיאֵל בַּר קַטִּינָא אָמַר רַב: לוֹמַר שֶׁהֵן עֲקוּרוֹת וְאֵין לְמֵידוֹת זוֹ מִזּוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥama bar Gurya said Rav said: The halakhot relating to a Festival resemble the halakhot relating to the Samaritans in the halakha . With regard to what the halakha Rav Daniel bar Ketina said Rav said: to convey that they are sterile, and one may not learn one from one another
llm_translation: Rav Ḥama son of Guria said in the name of Rav: The laws of the festival are like the laws of the Kutim in halakha. What is the comparison to the Kutim? Rav Daniyel son of Katina said in the name of Rav: To say that they are twisted and not straight teachings from one another.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: זוֹפְתִין כּוּזְתָּא וְאֵין זוֹפְתִין חָבִיתָא. רַב דִּימִי מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא אָמַר: זוֹפְתִין חָבִיתָא וְאֵין זוֹפְתִין כּוּזְתָּא. מָר חָיֵישׁ לִפְסֵידָא, וּמָר חָיֵישׁ לְטִירְחָא.
human_translation: For Shmuel said: One may seal a jug with pitch, but one may not seal a barrel with pitch Rav Dimi from Neharde’a said: One may seal a barrel with pitch, but one may not seal jug with pitch. This Sage, was concerned about loss, And this Sage, was concerned about exertion
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "As Samuel said: 'Zuftin kuzta, ve'ein zuftin chavita.' Rav Dimi from Nehardea said: 'Zuftin chavita, ve'ein zuftin kuzta.' Mar chayash lifseida, u'mar chayash letircha."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: נָקְטִינַן הִלְכוֹת מוֹעֵד כְּהִלְכוֹת שַׁבָּת;
human_translation: Abaye stated We have a tradition the halakhot of a Festival are like the halakhot of Shabbat:
llm_translation: Abbaye said: We establish the laws of the festival like the laws of Shabbat.

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ מֵהֶן פָּטוּר אֲבָל אָסוּר, וְיֵשׁ מֵהֶן מוּתָּר לְכַתְּחִלָּה.
human_translation: Some of exempt are prohibited, and some of them permitted ab initio .
llm_translation: There are some of them exempt but forbidden, and there are some of them permitted initially.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא חֲצַדוּ לֵיהּ חֲצָדָא בְּמוֹעֲדָא. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא לְרַב הוּנָא טוֹחֲנִין קֶמַח בַּמּוֹעֵד לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד, וְשֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד — אָסוּר. דָּבָר שֶׁאָבוּד בַּמּוֹעֵד — מוּתָּר לַעֲשׂוֹתוֹ בַּמּוֹעֵד, דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ אָבוּד בַּמּוֹעֵד — אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rav Huna had his crop harvested for him on a Festival. Rabba bar Rav Huna raised an objection to Rav Huna One may grind flour on a Festival for the sake of the Festival, but not for the sake of the Festival, prohibited. a matter that, loss on the Festival, it is permitted to perform on the Festival. a matter that in loss the Festival, it is prohibited
llm_translation: Rav Huna divided for him a portion in the festival. Rabba bar Rav Huna raised an objection to Rav Huna: Grinding wheat on the festival for the needs of the festival is permitted, but if not for the needs of the festival, it is prohibited. Something that is lost on the festival may be done on the festival, but something that is not lost on the festival is prohibited.

hebrew_text: בַּמָּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בִּתְלוּשִׁין מִן הַקַּרְקַע, אֲבָל מְחוּבָּר לַקַּרְקַע — אֲפִילּוּ כּוּלּוֹ אָבוּד אָסוּר. וְאִם אֵין לוֹ מַה יֹּאכַל, קוֹצֵר וּמְעַמֵּר וְדָשׁ וְזוֹרֶה וּבוֹרֵר וְטוֹחֵן, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יָדוּשׁ בְּפָרוֹת!
human_translation: In what is this statement said? In detached from the ground, but attached to the ground, even if it all will be lost, is prohibited And if one does not have anything to eat, he may reap and bind sheaves, and thresh, and winnow and separate and grind provided that he does not thresh with cows,
llm_translation: In what case are these matters stated? — When they are detached from the ground, but if they are attached to the ground, even if the entire thing is lost, it is prohibited. And if one has nothing to eat, he may harvest, gather, thresh, winnow, select, and grind, provided he does not separate the grains from the husks!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יְחִידָאָה הִיא, וְלָא סְבִירָא לַן כְּווֹתֵיהּ. דְּתַנְיָא, כְּלָל אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: דָּבָר הַתָּלוּשׁ מִן הַקַּרְקַע, אֲפִילּוּ מִקְצָתוֹ אָבוּד — מוּתָּר, וְהַמְחוּבָּר לַקַּרְקַע — אֲפִילּוּ כּוּלּוֹ אָבוּד אָסוּר.
human_translation: said to is an individual and we do not hold in accordance with it; as it is taught Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel stated a principle in the name of Rabbi Yosei: an item that is detached from the ground, even if a portion of it will be lost it is permitted whereas that are attached to the ground, even if all of them will be lost, it is prohibited
llm_translation: He said to him: It is a private domain, and we do not hold like his opinion. As it was taught: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said in the name of Rabbi Yosei: A detached object from the ground, even if part of it is lost - it is permitted, but something attached to the ground - even if all of it is lost, it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: וְאִי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, יָדוּשׁ נָמֵי בְּפָרוֹת?! הָא אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר אַבָּא: מַאן תַּנָּא שִׁינּוּי בַּמּוֹעֵד בְּדָבָר הָאָבֵד — דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי!
human_translation: But if Rabbi Yosei, let him thresh even with cows. Rav Yitzḥak bar Abba say: Who taught on a Festival an altered manner with regard to a matter that a loss not in accordance with Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: And if it is Rabbi Yosei, would he be stringent with regards to produce?! For Rav Yitzchak bar Abba said: Who is the Tanna that made a distinction regarding a lost item on a festival – it is not like Rabbi Yosei!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ: הָכָא נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן דְּכׇל יוֹמָא לָאו בְּפָרוֹת דָּיְישִׁי, הָאִידָּנָא נָמֵי לָאו שִׁינּוּי הוּא.
human_translation: said to you: Here, too, since one does not always thresh with cows, now is also not an altered manner.
llm_translation: He said to you: Here it is stated, since every day is not with the bulls of Dan, now it is not a change.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: טוֹחֲנִין בַּמּוֹעֵד לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד, וְשֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד — אָסוּר. וְאִם טָחַן וְהוֹתִיר — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּתָּר. קוֹצְצִין עֵצִים בַּמּוֹעֵד לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד, וְשֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד — אָסוּר, וְאִם קָצַץ וְהוֹתִיר — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּתָּר.
human_translation: The Sages taught One may grind on a Festival for the sake of the Festival, but not for the sake of the Festival, prohibited.
