And if he ground and left over, it is permitted one may cut down trees on a Festival for the sake of the Festival, but not for the sake of the Festival prohibited. And if he cut down and left over, it is permitted
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Grinding is permitted on a Festival for the sake of the Festival, but if not for the sake of the Festival, it is prohibited. And if one ground and left over, this is permitted. Cutting wood is permitted on a Festival for the sake of the Festival, but if not for the sake of the Festival, it is prohibited. And if one cut and left over, this is permitted.

hebrew_text: מְטִילִין שֵׁכָר בַּמּוֹעֵד לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד, וְשֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד — אָסוּר, וְאִם הֵטִיל וְהוֹתִיר — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּתָּר, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יַעֲרִים.
human_translation: One may brew beer on a Festival for the sake of the Festival, but not for the sake of the Festival, prohibited. And if he brewed and left over, it is permitted provided that he does not employ an artifice,
llm_translation: We place beer on the festival for the sake of the festival, and if not for the sake of the festival - it is forbidden. And if one placed it and left it - it is permitted, as long as he does not mix it.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: מְטִילִין שֵׁכָר בַּמּוֹעֵד לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד, וְשֶׁלֹּא לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד — אָסוּר, אֶחָד שֵׁכַר תְּמָרִים, וְאֶחָד שֵׁכַר שְׂעוֹרִים. וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ יָשָׁן, מַעֲרִים וְשׁוֹתֶה מִן הֶחָדָשׁ. תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין מַעֲרִימִין בְּכָךְ, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מַעֲרִימִין.
human_translation: raises a contradiction One may brew beer on a Festival for the sake of the Festival, but not for the sake of the Festival, prohibited. both date beer and barley beer. And even though he has old he may employ an artifice and drink from the new This is tanna’im , as it is taught One may not employ an artifice in this regard, Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: One may employ an artifice.
llm_translation: And they asked: We may pour wine on a festival for the purpose of the festival, but if not for the purpose of the festival — it is forbidden, whether it is date wine or barley wine. And even though it has aged, one may mix and drink from the new. This is a dispute of the Tannaim. As it was taught: One does not mix in this manner, Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: One may mix.

hebrew_text: רַב חֲצַדוּ לֵיהּ חֲצָדָא בְּחוּלָּא דְמוֹעֲדָא. שְׁמַע שְׁמוּאֵל, אִיקְּפַד. לֵימָא שְׁמוּאֵל כִּיחִידָאָה סְבִירָא לֵיהּ? לָא, חֲצָדָא דְחִיטֵּי הֲוָה, דְּלָא הֲוָה פָּסֵיד.
human_translation: Rav had his crop harvested on the intermediate days of a Festival. Shmuel heard was dismayed. Shall we say Shmuel holds in accordance with the individual No, it was a crop of wheat, which would not have been ruined
llm_translation: Rav Chatzadu gave him a field as a gift on a weekday of a festival. Shmuel heard, he was upset. Shall we say that Shmuel considers it as if it were a private gift? No, the field was of barley, so there was no loss.

hebrew_text: וְרַב מַאי טַעְמָא עָבֵיד הָכִי? אֵין לוֹ מַה יֹּאכַל הֲוָה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל — לָא סַיְּימוּהָ קַמֵּיהּ. אִי נָמֵי, אָדָם חָשׁוּב שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: What is the reason Rav acted in this manner? one who does not have anything to eat, And Shmuel did not complete for him. Alternatively, an important person is different,
llm_translation: And Rav, what is the reason he does so? He had nothing to eat. And Shmuel - they did not finish it before him. Alternatively, a person of importance is different.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה נְשִׂיאָה נְפַק בְּחוּמַרְתָּא דִמְדוּשָׁא, וְאִשְׁתִּי מַיָּא דְּאַחֵים קַפִּילָא אֲרַמָּאָה. שְׁמַע רַבִּי אַמֵּי, אִיקְּפַד. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מַאי טַעְמָא אִיקְּפַד? אִי מִשּׁוּם חוּמַרְתָּא דִמְדוּשָׁא, הָא תַּנְיָא: הַשִּׁירִין, הַנְּזָמִים וְהַטַּבָּעוֹת — הֲרֵי הֵן כְּכׇל הַכֵּלִים הַנִּיטָּלִין בֶּחָצֵר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda Nesia went out with a coral seal [ ḥumreta ] and drank water heated by a gentile cook. Rabbi Ami heard was dismayed Rav Yosef said: What is the reason he was dismayed? If because of the coral seal, isn’t taught Bracelets, nose rings, and rings are like all utensils that may be carried in a courtyard?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah the Nasi went out with a needle of a handloom, and his wife with a pitcher of water of the brothers of Kapila the Aramean. Rabbi Ammi heard, he was upset. Rav Yosef said: What is the reason he was upset? If it is because of the needle of a handloom, it is taught: The needles, the rings, and the buttons - they are like all utensils that are taken out into the courtyard.

hebrew_text: אִי מִשּׁוּם דְּאִישְׁתִּי מַיָּא דְּאַחֵים קַפִּילָא אֲרַמָּאָה, הָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר רַב: כֹּל שֶׁנֶּאֱכָל כְּמוֹת שֶׁהוּא חַי, אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם בִּישּׁוּלֵי גוֹיִם! אָדָם חָשׁוּב שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: if because drank water heated by a gentile cook [ kapeila ], didn’t Shmuel bar Yitzḥak say Rav said: anything that is eaten raw, it is not subject to food cooked by gentiles? An important person is different,
llm_translation: If because my wife is from the village of Kafila in Aram Naharaim, behold, Shmuel the son of Yitzchak said in the name of Rav: "Anything that is eaten while still alive, there is no issue of the cooking of non-Jews in it!" A person is considered different.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חֲנַנְאֵל אָמַר רַב: קוֹצֵץ אָדָם דֶּקֶל בַּמּוֹעֵד, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ אֶלָּא לַנְּסוֹרֶת שֶׁלּוֹ. לָיֵיט עֲלַהּ אַבָּיֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ḥananel said Rav said: A person may chop down a palm tree on a Festival, although he needs only its sawdust. Abaye cursed it,
llm_translation: Rav Hananel said in the name of Rav: One may cut a palm branch on a festival, even though he only needs it for his lulav. Abaye objected to this.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי הֲוָה לֵיהּ אִבָּא בִּשְׁלַנְיָיא. אֲזַל לְמִיקְצְיֵיהּ בְּחוּלָּא דְמוֹעֲדָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שֵׁילָא מִשְּׁלַנְיָיא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: מַאי דַּעְתָּיךְ, דְּקָאָמַר רַב חֲנַנְאֵל אָמַר רַב: קוֹצֵץ אָדָם דֶּקֶל בַּמּוֹעֵד אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ אֶלָּא לַנְּסוֹרֶת שֶׁלּוֹ — הָא לָיֵיט עֲלַהּ אַבָּיֵי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא שְׁמִיעַ לִי, כְּלוֹמַר, לָא סְבִירָא לִי. אִישְׁתְּמִיט נַרְגָּא, בָּעֵי לְמִיפְסְקֵיהּ לְשָׁקֵיהּ. שַׁבְקֵיהּ וַהֲדַר אֲתָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi had a forest [ ava ] in Shelaniya. He went to cut it down on the intermediate days of the Festival. Rav Sheila from Shelaniya said to Rav Ashi: What is your opinion that Rav Ḥananel said Rav said: A person may chop down a palm tree on a Festival even though he needs only its sawdust? Didn’t Abaye curse said to him: I did not hear that is to say, I do not hold The ax slipped was about to cut off his leg. He left it, and came back again
llm_translation: Rav Ashi had a father-in-law in Shalnaya. He went to meet him on Chol Hamoed, and Rav Sheilah from Shalnaya said to Rav Ashi: What is your opinion, that Rav Hananel said in the name of Rav: One may cut a palm branch on Chol Hamoed, even though he only needs it for his basket - here, take this myrtle branch! He said to him: I do not accept, meaning, I do not agree. He threw it away, and then he came back.

hebrew_text: רַב יְהוּדָה שְׁרָא לְמִיעְקַר כִּיתָּנָא וּלְמִיקְטַל כְּשׁוּתָא, וּלְמִיעְקַר שׁוּמְשְׁמֵי. אָמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: בִּשְׁלָמָא כִּיתָּנָא — חֲזֵי לַחֲפִיפָה, כְּשׁוּתָא — חֲזֵי לְשִׁיכְרָא, אֶלָּא שׁוּמְשְׁמֵי לְמַאי חֲזֵי? חֲזֵי לְנַזְיֵי דְּאִית בְּהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda permitted uprooting flax, cutting hops, and uprooting sesame plants Abaye said to Rav Yosef: Granted, flax, suitable for a cover [ ḥafifa ] hops, suitable for beer, but for what are sesame plants suitable, They are suitable for the seeds [ nazyei ] on them,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah would lend out a linen garment to be worn and a woolen garment to be killed, and he would lend out a lamp to be used. Abaye said to Rav Yosef: With regard to a linen garment - see for a patch, with regard to a woolen garment - see for a tear, but with regard to a lamp, what should one see? See for the wick that is in it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יַנַּאי הֲוָה לֵיהּ הָהוּא פַּרְדֵּיסָא דִּמְטָא זִמְנֵיהּ בְּחוּלָּא דְמוֹעֲדָא, קַטְפֵיהּ. לְשָׁנָה שַׁהִיּוּה כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לְפַרְדֵּיסַיְיהוּ לְחוּלָּא דְמוֹעֲדָא. אַפְקְרֵיהּ רַבִּי יַנַּאי לְפַרְדֵּיסֵיהּ הָהִוא שַׁתָּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai had an orchard whose time arrived during the intermediate days of the Festival. He harvested it The following year, everyone delayed their orchards until the intermediate days of the Festival. Rabbi Yannai declared his orchard ownerless that year,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai had a certain orchard that would come into season during the secular festival. He would harvest it. In a year when everyone was going to their orchards during the secular festival, Rabbi Yannai entrusted his orchard to that year.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מַכְנִיס אָדָם פֵּירוֹתָיו מִפְּנֵי הַגַּנָּבִים, וְשׁוֹלֶה פִּשְׁתָּנוֹ מִן הַמִּשְׁרָה בִּשְׁבִיל שֶׁלֹּא תֹּאבַד, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְכַוֵּין אֶת מְלַאכְתּוֹ בַּמּוֹעֵד. וְכוּלָּן אִם כִּוְּונוּ מְלַאכְתָּן בַּמּוֹעֵד — יֹאבֵדוּ.
human_translation: A person may bring his fruit in because about thieves, and he may draw his flax out of the soaking pool so that it is not ruined provided that he does not plan his work on the Festival. And all if one planned his labor on the Festival, must be lost
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A person may bring in his fruits because of thieves, and may pull his flax from the bleach in order that it not be lost, provided that he does not intend to complete his work at the appointed time. And all of them, if they intended to complete their work at the appointed time — they will be lost.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיַּכְנִיסֵם בְּצִנְעָא לְתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ.
human_translation: taught provided that he brings them into his house discreetly.
llm_translation: Gemara: A Tanna taught: "And only if he brings them in discreetly into his house."

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף הֲוָה לֵיהּ כְּשׁוּרֵי, עַיְּילִינְהוּ בִּימָמָא.
human_translation: Rav Yosef had beams, he brought into during the day
llm_translation: Rav Yosef had a headache, they brought him wine.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי, וְהָתַנְיָא: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיַּכְנִיסֵם בְּצִנְעָא בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: צִנְעָא דְּהָנֵי — יְמָמָא הוּא, כֵּיוָן דִּבְלֵילְיָא בָּעוּ גַּבְרֵי יַתִּירֵי, וּבָעוּ מַדְבּוּרֵי דְנוּרָא, אָוְושָׁא מִילְּתָא.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: But isn’t it taught provided that he brings them into his house discreetly? said to him: Discretion to these is the day, since at night more people are required, and torchbearers [ medokhrei denura ] are needed, the matter noticeable.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye, and it was taught: And only if he brings them in modestly into his house! He said to him: The modesty of these — it is a matter of days, since the nights are long, and they need the light of a candle, then the matter will be clarified.

hebrew_text: וְשׁוֹלֶה פִּשְׁתָּנוֹ מִן הַמִּשְׁרָה כּוּ׳. בָּעֵי מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה מֵרַבִּי זֵירָא: כִּוֵּון מְלַאכְתּוֹ בַּמּוֹעֵד וָמֵת, מַהוּ שֶׁיִּקְנְסוּ בָּנָיו אַחֲרָיו?
human_translation: And he may draw his flax out of the soaking pool Rabbi Yirmeya asked Rabbi Zeira: one planned his labor on a Festival, and he died what is Should his children be penalized after him
llm_translation: "And one who removes his linen garment from the washing tub." Rabbi Yirmeya inquired of Rabbi Zeira: Since he completed his work on the festival and died, what should his sons inherit from him?"

hebrew_text: אִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר
human_translation: if you might say
llm_translation: If you will say

hebrew_text: צָרַם אֹזֶן בְּכוֹר קָנְסוּ בְּנוֹ אַחֲרָיו — מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיסּוּרָא דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא,
human_translation: one who slit the ear of a firstborn penalized his son after him, because the prohibition is by Torah law.
llm_translation: They caused distress to the firstborn's ear, his sons after him - because of the prohibition of the Torah,

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר מָכַר עַבְדּוֹ לְגוֹי וָמֵת קָנְסוּ בְּנוֹ אַחֲרָיו — מִשּׁוּם דְּכֹל יוֹמָא מַפְקַע לֵיהּ מִמִּצְוֹת,
human_translation: And if you might say one who sold his slave to a gentile and died penalized his son after him, because every day is in the gentile’s possession precludes him from
llm_translation: And if you might say, "He sold his slave to a non-Jew and he died, his sons are liable after him" - because every day he exempts him from commandments.

hebrew_text: הָכָא מַאי: גַּבְרָא קָנֵיס רַבָּנַן — וְהָא לֵיתֵיהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא: מָמוֹנָא קָנֵיס רַבָּנַן — וְהָא אִיתֵיהּ!
human_translation: What, here, the Sages penalized the man and he is no longer or perhaps the Sages imposed a penalty on the money, and it exists
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text: Talmudic text: Here, what is it: a man acquired scholars — and he does not have them, or perhaps: he acquired money and scholars — and he has them!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: שָׂדֶה שֶׁנִּתְקַוְּוצָה בַּשְּׁבִיעִית — תִּזָּרַע לְמוֹצָאֵי שְׁבִיעִית, נִטַּיְּיבָה אוֹ נִדַּיְּירָה — לֹא תִּזָּרַע לְמוֹצָאֵי שְׁבִיעִית. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: נָקְטִינַן, הֱטִיבָהּ וָמֵת — בְּנוֹ זוֹרְעָהּ, אַלְמָא: לְדִידֵיהּ קְנַסוּ רַבָּנַן, לִבְרֵיהּ לָא קְנַסוּ רַבָּנַן. הָכָא נָמֵי: לְדִידֵיהּ קְנַסוּ רַבָּנַן, לִבְרֵיהּ לָא קְנַסוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: said to You learned A field whose thorns were removed during the Sabbatical Year may be sown in the eighth year, if it had been improved or if it had been enclosed it may not be sown in the eighth year. And Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: We have a tradition improved and died, his son may sow it. Apparently, the Sages penalized him, the Sages did not penalize his son. Here, too, the Sages penalized him, the Sages did not penalize his son.
llm_translation: He said to him, "You taught it: a field that was uprooted in the seventh year - should be sown for the produce of the seventh year, if it was fertilized or irrigated - do not sow for the produce of the seventh year." And Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina said: We have learned, if one improved it and died - his son sows it, implying: the Rabbis penalized him, but did not penalize his son. Here too: the Rabbis penalized him, but did not penalize his son.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: נָקְטִינַן: טִימֵּא טַהֲרוֹתָיו וָמֵת — לֹא קָנְסוּ בְּנוֹ אַחֲרָיו. מַאי טַעְמָא — הֶיזֵּק שֶׁאֵינוֹ נִיכָּר לָא שְׁמֵיהּ הֶיזֵּק. לְדִידֵיהּ קְנַסוּ רַבָּנַן, לִבְרֵיהּ לָא קְנַסוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Abaye said: We have a tradition rendered impure another’s ritually pure items and died did not penalize his son after him What is the reason damage that is not evident, is not considered damage the Sages penalized the Sages did not penalize his son.
llm_translation: Abaye said: We have learned: If his pure ones became impure and he died - his sons are not penalized. What is the reason? - The damage that is not recognizable, its name is not damage. According to his own opinion, the Rabbis penalized, according to his son's opinion, the Rabbis did not penalize.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין לוֹקְחִין בָּתִּים עֲבָדִים וּבְהֵמָה אֶלָּא לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד, אוֹ לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹכֵר שֶׁאֵין לוֹ מַה יֹּאכַל.
human_translation: One may not purchase houses, slaves, and cattle unless for the sake of the Festival, or for the needs of the seller who does not have anything to eat.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may only purchase houses, slaves, and animals for the purpose of the festival, or for the purpose of a seller who has nothing to eat.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵרַב נַחְמָן: שְׂכַר פְּעוּלָּה שֶׁאֵין לוֹ מַה יֹּאכַל, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵינָא: אוֹ לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹכֵר שֶׁאֵין לוֹ מַה יֹּאכַל. לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? לָאו לְאֵתוֹיֵי שְׂכַר פְּעוּלָּה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא, פָּרוֹשֵׁי קָא מְפָרֵשׁ.
human_translation: Rava asked Rav Naḥman: What is wages who does not have anything to eat? said to him: We learned Or for the needs of the seller, if he has nothing to eat. What is added by add wages said to him: No, is explaining
llm_translation: Gemara: Rava asked a question from Rav Nachman: "Regarding wages for work that one has nothing to eat, what is the law?" He said to him, "We learned: Or for the need of the seller who has nothing to eat." To include what? Not to include wages for work! He said to him: No, it is explaining the details.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֵין כּוֹתְבִין שְׁטָרֵי חוֹב בַּמּוֹעֵד, וְאִם אֵינוֹ מַאֲמִינוֹ, אוֹ שֶׁאֵין לוֹ מַה יֹּאכַל — הֲרֵי זֶה יִכְתּוֹב. שֶׁאֵין לוֹ מַה יֹּאכַל — לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? לָאו לְאֵתוֹיֵי שְׂכַר פְּעוּלָּה! שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection Promissory notes may not be written on a Festival, but if does not trust or if he has nothing to eat, he may write What is added If he has nothing to eat? the wages Conclude from it
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Abaye: One does not write promissory notes during a festival, and if he does not trust him, or if he has nothing to eat - behold, this one shall be written. "If he has nothing to eat" - to include what? Is it not to include wages for labor! Learn from it.

hebrew_text: מוֹתֵיב רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים, שָׁלֹשׁ אוּמָּנִיּוֹת עוֹשִׂין מְלָאכָה בְּעַרְבֵי פְסָחִים עַד חֲצוֹת: הַחַיָּיטִין וְהַסַּפָּרִין וְהַכּוֹבְסִין. הַחַיָּיטִין — שֶׁכֵּן הֶדְיוֹט תּוֹפֵר כְּדַרְכּוֹ בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד, הַסַּפָּרִין וְהַכּוֹבְסִין — שֶׁכֵּן הַבָּאִין מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם וְהַיּוֹצֵא מִבֵּית הָאֲסוּרִין מוּתָּרִין לְסַפֵּר וּלְכַבֵּס בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet raised an objection And the Rabbis say: three crafts perform labor until midday on Passover eve, the tailors, the barbers, and the launderers, The tailors as a layperson sew in his manner during the intermediate days of the Festival. The barbers and the launderers as those who arrive from overseas one who leaves prison cut hair and wash on the intermediate days of the Festival
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet raises an objection: And the sages say, three crafts are permitted to work on the eve of Passover until midnight: tailors, scribes, and launderers. Tailors - because the common people sew in their usual manner on the eve of a festival, scribes and launderers - because those who come from a coastal town and those who come out of prison are permitted to write and launder on the eve of a festival.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ שְׂכַר פְּעוּלָּה שֶׁאֵין לוֹ מַה יֹּאכַל שְׁרֵי — כׇּל מְלָאכוֹת נָמֵי לִישְׁתְּרוֹ, דְּהָא אִיכָּא שְׂכַר פְּעוּלָּה שֶׁאֵין לוֹ מַה יֹּאכַל!
human_translation: And if it enters your mind wages who does not have anything to eat is permitted all labor should also be permitted as there is the wages who does not have anything to eat.
llm_translation: And if it comes to your mind, the reward of a laborer who has nothing to eat is permitted - all types of work are essentially permitted, for there is the reward of a laborer who has nothing to eat!

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה בִּנְיָן לִישְׁתְּרֵי, שֶׁכֵּן כּוֹתֶל הַגּוֹהֶה לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — סוֹתֵר וּבוֹנֶה כְּדַרְכּוֹ מִפְּנֵי הַסַּכָּנָה!
human_translation: Rav Pappa strongly objects to this: If that is so, building should be permitted as a wall that tilts toward the public domain may be demolished and rebuilt in the usual manner due to the danger
llm_translation: Challenges her Rav Papa: Rather from now on, a structure will be left, for so the wall that leans towards the public domain - demolishing and building according to its way because of danger!

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבִינָא: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה לַבְלָר לִישְׁתְּרֵי, שֶׁכֵּן כּוֹתְבִין קִידּוּשֵׁי נָשִׁים גִּיטִּין וְשׁוֹבָרִין!
human_translation: Ravina strongly objects to this: If that is so, a scribe [ lavlar ] should be permitted as one may write betrothal deeds, bills of divorce, and receipts
llm_translation: Ravina objects to her: Rather, from now on, let him be more careful, for this is how they write the sanctifications of women, divorces, and bills of release!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מוֹעֵד אַאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר קָא רָמֵית? מוֹעֵד — מִשּׁוּם טִירְחָא הוּא, וּבִמְקוֹם פְּסֵידָא שָׁרוּ רַבָּנַן. אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר — מִשּׁוּם צוֹרֶךְ יוֹם טוֹב הוּא. מִידֵּי דְּצוֹרֶךְ יוֹם טוֹב שָׁרוּ רַבָּנַן, מִידֵּי דְּלָאו צוֹרֶךְ יוֹם טוֹב לָא שָׁרוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said Are you raising a contradiction a Festival and the fourteenth a Festival because it involves exertion, and in a situation of loss the Sages permitted the fourteenth is due to the need for the Festival, Whatever is needed for the Festival, the Sages permitted, whatever is not needed for the Festival, the Sages did not permit.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashe said: "Why did you raise the issue of the festival? 'Moed' - it is due to exertion, and in a place of loss, the Rabbis permitted it. 'Fourteen' - it is due to the need for a festival day. When there is a need for a festival day, the Rabbis permitted it; when there is no need for a festival day, the Rabbis did not permit it."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין מְפַנִּין מִבַּיִת לְבַיִת, אֲבָל מְפַנֶּה הוּא לַחֲצֵרוֹ. אֵין מְבִיאִין כֵּלִים מִבֵּית הָאוּמָּן, אִם חוֹשֵׁשׁ לָהֶם — מְפַנָּן לְחָצֵר אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: One may not move from house to house but he may move to his courtyard One may not bring utensils from the house of a craftsman if one is concerned about them he may move them to another courtyard.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may not carry objects from house to house, but one may carry objects into his courtyard. One may not bring utensils from the craftsman's house, if one is concerned for them - one may carry them to another courtyard.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְהָאָמְרַתְּ רֵישָׁא אֵין מְפַנִּין כְּלָל? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: סֵיפָא אֲתָאן לְבַיִת שֶׁבֶּחָצֵר.
human_translation: But didn’t you say in the first clause one may not move at all, Abaye said In the latter clause we come to the house in his courtyard
llm_translation: Gemara: And the statement you made at the beginning, "we do not turn away altogether"? Abaye said: The conclusion comes to the house in the courtyard.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין מְבִיאִין כֵּלִים מִבֵּית הָאוּמָּן. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בָּדֵיק לַן רָבָא, תְּנַן: אֵין מְבִיאִין כֵּלִים מִבֵּית הָאוּמָּן, וּרְמִינְהוּ: מוֹלִיכִין וּמְבִיאִין כֵּלִים מִבֵּית הָאוּמָּן, וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינָן לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד!
human_translation: And one may not bring utensils from the house of a craftsman. Rav Pappa said: Rava tested us We learned one may not bring utensils from the house of a craftsman. And this raises a contradiction to One may take utensils to and bring them from the house of a craftsman, even if they are not for the sake of the Festival.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And one does not bring utensils from the craftsman's house." Rav Papa said: Rava examined us, we learned: One does not bring utensils from the craftsman's house. And they raised a dilemma: One may bring and bring utensils from the craftsman's house, even though they are not needed for the festival!

hebrew_text: וְשַׁנֵּינַן לֵיהּ: כָּאן בְּאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, כָּאן בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד. אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא וְהָא בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד. כָּאן בְּמַאֲמִינוֹ, כָּאן בְּשֶׁאֵינוֹ מַאֲמִינוֹ.
human_translation: And we answered him: Here, to the fourteenth here, to the intermediate days of a Festival. if you wish, say this and that to the intermediate days of a Festival, here, where he trusts here, where he does not trust
llm_translation: And we learned it: here in fourteen, here in the weekday of the festival. If you wish, say: here and here in the weekday of the festival. Here in one who believes, here in one who does not believe.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: מְבִיאִין כֵּלִים מִבֵּית הָאוּמָּן, כְּגוֹן כַּד מִבֵּית הַכַּדָּר, וְכוֹס מִבֵּית הַזַּגָּג. אֲבָל לֹא צֶמֶר מִבֵּית הַצַּבָּע, וְלֹא כֵּלִים מִבֵּית הָאוּמָּן. וְאִם אֵין לוֹ מַה יֹּאכַל — נוֹתֵן לוֹ שְׂכָרוֹ וּמַנִּיחוֹ אֶצְלוֹ. וְאִם אֵינוֹ מַאֲמִינוֹ — מַנִּיחוֹ בְּבַיִת הַסָּמוּךְ לוֹ. וְאִם חוֹשֵׁשׁ לָהֶם שֶׁמָּא יִגָּנְבוּ — מְפַנָּן לְחָצֵר אַחֶרֶת, וְאִם אֵינוֹ מַאֲמִינוֹ — מְבִיאָן בְּצִנְעָה בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ.
human_translation: And it is taught One may bring utensils from the house of a craftsman; for example, a jug from the jug-maker's house and a cup from the glass-blower’s house, But not wool from the dyer’s house or utensils from the craftsman’s house, But if has nothing to eat, he may give him his wages and leave with him. And if he does not trust he may leave it in a house near him. And if he is concerned about lest they be stolen, he may move them to another courtyard. And if he does not trust he may bring them into his house discreetly.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: One may bring utensils from the craftsman's house, such as a pitcher from the potter's house, and a cup from the glassmaker's house. But not wool from the dyer's house, nor utensils from the craftsman's house. And if one has nothing to eat — one gives him his wage and leaves it with him. And if he does not trust him — he leaves it in a neighboring house. And if he is concerned that they might steal it — he should bring them into a hidden courtyard within his house.

hebrew_text: תָּרֵצְתְּ מְבִיאִין, מוֹלִיכִין קַשְׁיָא, דְּקָתָנֵי: אֵין מְבִיאִין, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן שֶׁאֵין מוֹלִיכִין! אֶלָּא: מְחַוַּורְתָּא כִּדְשַׁנַּיִין מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: You have explained one may bring one may take difficult, as teaches: One may not bring And all the more so, one may not take Rather, it is clear as we answered initially
llm_translation: If you want to bring the animal to be slaughtered, you bring a rope, as it is taught: "One does not bring the animal, and all the more so, one does not lead it!" Rather, you bring a hole like a tooth from the very beginning.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מְחַפִּין אֶת הַקְּצִיעוֹת בְּקַשׁ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף מְעַבִּין. מוֹכְרֵי פֵירוֹת, כְּסוּת וְכֵלִים — מוֹכְרִים בְּצִנְעָה לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד. הַצַּיָּידִין וְהַדָּשׁוֹשׁוֹת וְהַגָּרוֹסוֹת — עוֹשִׂין בְּצִנְעָה לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: הֵם הֶחֱמִירוּ עַל עַצְמָן.
human_translation: figs may be covered with straw Rabbi Yehuda says: One may even condense Those who sell produce, clothing, and utensils may sell in private, for the sake of the Festival. Fishermen, and groats makers [ dashoshot ], and pounders, may ply in private for the sake of the Festival. Rabbi Yosei says: They were stringent with themselves
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may wrap bundles of stalks in straw. Rabbi Yehuda says: One may even tie them. Sellers of fruits, clothing, and utensils - sell them discreetly for the needs of the festival. Hunters, fowlers, and fishermen - may prepare discreetly for the needs of the festival. Rabbi Yosei says: They have been stringent upon themselves.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא וְרַבִּי אַסִּי, וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּחִזְקִיָּה וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. חַד אָמַר: ״מְחַפִּין״ אַקְלוֹשֵׁי, ״מְעַבִּין״ אַסְמוֹכֵי. וְחַד אָמַר: ״מְחַפִּין״ בֵּין אַקְלוֹשֵׁי בֵּין אַסְמוֹכֵי, ״מְעַבִּין״ — עוֹשֶׂה אוֹתוֹ כְּמִין כְּרִי. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: ״מְעַבִּין״ עוֹשֶׂה אוֹתוֹ כְּמִין כְּרִי, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba and Rabbi Asi disagree about and both of them in the name of Ḥizkiyya and Rabbi Yoḥanan. One said: Cover lightly condense densely. And one said: Cover whether lightly or densely, condense making it as if a pile This is also taught One may condense, making it as if a pile the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: The dispute is in it: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba and Rabbi Assi, and both of them from the name of Chizkiyah and Rabbi Yochanan. One said: "Mechaṣhin" are the Akloshay, "Me'abin" are the Asmokhay. And one said: "Mechaṣhin" whether Akloshay or Asmokhay, "Me'abin" - he makes it like a Kri. It was also taught likewise: "Me'abin" - he makes it like a Kri, the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: מוֹכְרֵי פֵירוֹת כְּסוּת וְכֵלִים מוֹכְרִין בְּצִנְעָה וְכוּ׳. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הֵן הֶחֱמִירוּ עַל עַצְמָן — דְּלָא הֲווֹ עָבְדִי כְּלָל, אוֹ דִלְמָא דַּהֲווֹ עָבְדִי בְּצִנְעָה?
human_translation: those who sell produce, clothing, and utensils may sell in private, asked: they were stringent with themselves, that they did not work at all or perhaps that they did in private,
llm_translation: Sellers of fruits, clothing, and utensils sell discreetly, etc. They asked: Did they act stringently upon themselves, that they did not transgress at all, or perhaps they transgressed discreetly?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מוֹכְרֵי פֵירוֹת כְּסוּת וְכֵלִים — מוֹכְרִין בְּצִנְעָה לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: תַּגָּרֵי טְבֶרְיָא הֵן הֶחֱמִירוּ עַל עַצְמָן שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ מוֹכְרִין כׇּל עִיקָּר. צָדֵי חַיּוֹת וְעוֹפוֹת וְדָגִים — צָדִין בְּצִנְעָה לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: צָדֵי עַכּוֹ הֵן הֶחֱמִירוּ עַל עַצְמָן שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ צָדִין כׇּל עִיקָּר. דָּשׁוֹשֵׁי חִילְקָא טַרְגִּיס וְטִיסְנִי — דּוֹשְׁשִׁין בְּצִנְעָה לְצוֹרֶךְ הַמּוֹעֵד, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: דָּשׁוֹשֵׁי צִיפּוֹרִי הֵן הֶחְמִירוּ עַל עַצְמָן שֶׁלֹּא יְהוּ דּוֹשְׁשִׁין כׇּל עִיקָּר.
human_translation: Come hear: Those who sell produce, clothing, and utensils may sell in private, for the sake of the Festival. Rabbi Yosei says: The merchants of Tiberias were stringent with themselves not to sell at all, Hunters of animals, fowlers, and fishermen may hunt discreetly for the sake of the Festival. Rabbi Yosei says: The hunters of Akko were stringent with themselves not to hunt at all. Groats makers ḥilka , targis , and tisanei , crack in private for the sake of the Festival. Rabbi Yosei says: The groats makers of Tzippori were stringent with themselves not to crack at all.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Those who sell fruits, clothing, and utensils - they may sell discreetly for the needs of the festival. Rabbi Yosei says: The merchants of Teverya were stringent upon themselves not to sell anything at all. Hunters of wild animals, birds, and fish - they may hunt discreetly for the needs of the festival. Rabbi Yosei says: The hunters of Akko were stringent upon themselves not to hunt at all. Trappers of weasels, badgers, and lizards - they may trap discreetly for the needs of the festival. Rabbi Yosei says: The trappers of birds were stringent upon themselves not to trap at all.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: חִילְקָא — חֲדָא לְתַרְתֵּי, טַרְגִּיס — חֲדָא לִתְלָת, טִיסְנִי — חֲדָא לְאַרְבְּעָה. כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: כּוּנָּתָא.
human_translation: Abaye said: ḥilka one into two; targis one into three; tisanei one into four. When Rav Dimi came he said: emmer wheat.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Chilka - one for two, Targis - one for three, Tisni - one for four. When Rav Dimi came, he said: The intention.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: חִילְקָא טַרְגִּיס וְטִיסְנִי טְמֵאִין בְּכׇל מָקוֹם. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר חֲדָא לְתַרְתֵּי לִתְלָת וּלְאַרְבְּעָה, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי טְמֵאִין בְּכׇל מָקוֹם — דְּאִתַּכְשׁוּר, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כּוּנָּתָא, אַמַּאי טְמֵאִין בְּכׇל מָקוֹם, הָא לָא אִיתַּכְשׁוּר?
human_translation: raises an objection Ḥilka , targis , and tisanei are ritual impurity everywhere. Granted, according to the one who said one into two, into three, and into four, due to that they are impurity everywhere, as they become fit But according to the one who says that is emmer wheat why is it susceptible to impurity everywhere, it has not become fit
llm_translation: Challenging it: Chilka Targis and Tisni are impure in every place. Granted according to the one who says one is impure for two, three, and four, for this reason they are impure in every place - because of the connection. But according to the one who says intention, why are they impure in every place, isn't there no connection?

hebrew_text: כְּגוֹן דְּמִיקַּלְּפָן, דְּאִי לָאו דִּשְׁרָא לְהוּ בְּמַיָּא לָא הֲוָה מִיקַּלְפָא. וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״חִילְקָא״ — דְּשָׁקֵל חִלְקַיְהוּ.
human_translation: where, for example, was husked, since if it had not been soaked in water, it would not have been possible to husk it. And why, is it called ḥilka ? because their husks [ ḥelkayhu ] were removed.
llm_translation: As an expert Talmud scholar, I will now provide the English word-for-word translation of the given Talmudic text while maintaining the original style and format of Talmudic discourse: Talmudic text: For example, that if not would have been thrown into the water, would not have been saved. And why is it called "Chilka" - because he took their portions. English translation: Like the case of Mikalpan, that if it would not have been thrown into the water, it would not have been saved. And why is it called "Chilka" - because he took their portions.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַדָּגָן — אָסוּר אַף בְּפוֹל הַמִּצְרִי יָבֵשׁ, וּמוּתָּר בְּלַח, וּמוּתָּר בְּאוֹרֶז בְּחִילְקָא וְטַרְגִּיס וְטִיסְנִי. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר חֲדָא לְתַרְתֵּי חֲדָא לִתְלָת וַחֲדָא לְאַרְבְּעָה — שַׁפִּיר, דִּנְפַקוּ לְהוּ מִתּוֹרַת דָּגָן, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כּוּנָּתָא, דָּגָן מְעַלְּיָא הוּא! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: raises an objection One who vows to from grain [ dagan ] prohibited to of even dry Egyptian beans, and is permitted of fresh And permitted of rice, of ḥilka , and targeis , and tisnei . Granted, according to the one who said one into two, one into three, and one into four, it is fine, as it leaves the category of grain. But according to the one who says emmer wheat, it is a proper grain. difficult.
llm_translation: Challenger: One who vows from grain - forbidden even with Egyptian dry flax, and permitted with moist flax, and permitted with rice, millet, and panicum miliaceum. It is well according to the one who says one species for two species, one for three, and one for four - it is fine, as they have emerged from the category of grain. But according to the one who says intention, grain is superior! This is difficult.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא שְׁרָא לְהוּ לְהָנְהוּ כְּרוּפְיָיתָא לְמֵיזַל לְזַבּוֹנֵי כִּי אוֹרְחַיְיהוּ בְּשׁוּקָא. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא: חֲנוּת פְּתוּחָה לִסְטָיו — פּוֹתֵחַ וְנוֹעֵל כְּדַרְכּוֹ,
human_translation: Rav Huna permitted the spice merchants [ kerufayata ] to go sell in their usual manner in the marketplace Rav Kahana raised an objection to a store opens into a row of pillars may open and close it in his usual manner
llm_translation: Rav Huna permitted them to go out with a kerufyata to go to the market, for they are accustomed to walk in the market. Rav Kahana objected to him: An open store for a thief - he opens and closes as is his way.

hebrew_text: פְּתוּחָה לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים — פּוֹתֵחַ אַחַת וְנוֹעֵל אַחַת, וְעֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁל חַג מוֹצִיא וּמְעַטֵּר אֶת שׁוּקֵי הָעִיר בְּפֵירוֹת בִּשְׁבִיל כְּבוֹד יוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן. מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד יוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן אִין, שֶׁלֹּא מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד יוֹם טוֹב לָא!
human_translation: open to the public domain, he may open one and close the other. And on the eve of the last day of the festival he may take out and adorn the markets of the city with fruit in honor of the last day of the Festival. For the honor of the last day of the Festival, yes, not for the honor of the Festival, not
llm_translation: Open to the public domain - one opens and one closes, and on the eve of the last day of the festival, he brings out and adorns the marketplaces of the city with fruits for the honor of the last day of the festival. It is not for the honor of the last day of the festival, but rather for the honor of the last day of the festival!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּפֵירֵי, הָא בְּתַבְלִין.
human_translation: not difficult: This to fruit, this to spices,
llm_translation: Not difficult: this in fruits, this in spices.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ מִי שֶׁהָפַךְ
llm_translation: We will return to you, O one who has overturned.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ מְגַלְּחִין בַּמּוֹעֵד: הַבָּא מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם וּמִבֵּית הַשִּׁבְיָה, וְהַיּוֹצֵא מִבֵּית הָאֲסוּרִין, וְהַמְנוּדֶּה שֶׁהִתִּירוּ לוֹ חֲכָמִים, וְכֵן מִי שֶׁנִּשְׁאַל לְחָכָם וְהוּתַּר, וְהַנָּזִיר וְהַמְּצוֹרָע מִטּוּמְאָתוֹ לְטׇהֳרָתוֹ.
human_translation: And these may shave on a Festival: One who comes from a country overseas; and from a house of captivity; and one who comes out of prison and one who had been ostracized and the Sages released him and similarly, one who requested of a Sage and was released and the nazirite and the leper his impurity his purity.
llm_translation: And these are the ones who may shave during the festival: one who comes from a maritime city, and from a prisoner's house, and one who comes out from a place of confinement, and a rebellious individual whom the sages permitted, and likewise one who was asked by a sage and was permitted, and the Nazirite and the leper from his impurity to his purification.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ מְכַבְּסִין בַּמּוֹעֵד: הַבָּא מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם וּמִבֵּית הַשִּׁבְיָה, וְהַיּוֹצֵא מִבֵּית הָאֲסוּרִין,
human_translation: And these may launder on a Festival: One who comes from a country overseas; and one who from a house of captivity; and one who comes out of prison
llm_translation: And these are the ones who launder on the festival: one who comes from the sea province and from the house of captivity, and one who goes out from the house of the imprisoned,

hebrew_text: וּמְנוּדֶּה שֶׁהִתִּירוּ לוֹ חֲכָמִים, וְכֵן מִי שֶׁנִּשְׁאַל לְחָכָם וְהוּתַּר.
human_translation: and one who had been ostracized and the Sages released and similarly, one who requested from a Sage and was released
llm_translation: And a vow that the sages permitted him, and likewise one who asked a sage and was permitted.

hebrew_text: מִטְפְּחוֹת הַיָּדַיִם וּמִטְפְּחוֹת הַסְּפָרִים וּמִטְפְּחוֹת הַסְּפָג, הַזָּבִין וְהַזָּבוֹת וְהַנִּדּוֹת וְהַיּוֹלְדוֹת, וְכׇל הָעוֹלִין מִטּוּמְאָה לְטׇהֳרָה — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מוּתָּרִין. וּשְׁאָר כׇּל אָדָם אֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: Hand towels; and barbers’ towels, and body-drying towels, Zavim , zavot , menstruating women; women who have given birth; and all others who leave ritual impurity for ritual purity these are permitted But all other people are prohibited
llm_translation: The hand-washing basins, the book-scroll basins, and the sponge basins, those with abnormal genital discharges, menstruating women, women who have given birth, and all those ascending from impurity to purity—these are permitted. And all other people are prohibited.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּשְׁאָר כׇּל אָדָם מַאי טַעְמָא אֲסוּרִין?
human_translation: What is the reason all other people are prohibited
llm_translation: "Gema' and the rest of all people, what is the reason that they are forbidden?"

hebrew_text: כְּדִתְנַן: אַנְשֵׁי מִשְׁמָר וְאַנְשֵׁי מַעֲמָד אֲסוּרִין לְסַפֵּר וּלְכַבֵּס, וּבַחֲמִישִׁי מוּתָּרִין מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: As we learned the members of the priestly watch and the members of the non-priestly watch are prohibited from cutting hair or laundering But on the Thursday they are permitted in deference to Shabbat.
llm_translation: As we have learned: The men of the watch and the men of the standing guard are prohibited from counting and washing, but on the fifth day they are permitted due to the honor of the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מַאי טַעְמָא — כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִכָּנְסוּ לְמִשְׁמַרְתָּן כְּשֶׁהֵן מְנֻוּוֹלִין, הָכָא נָמֵי: כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִכָּנְסוּ לָרֶגֶל כְּשֶׁהֵן מְנֻוּוֹלִין.
human_translation: And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: What is the reason in order that they not enter their watch when they are untidy. Here, too, in order that they not enter the Festival when they are untidy.
llm_translation: And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: What is the reason? — So that they should not enter their watch when they are unclean. Here too: So that they should not enter by foot when they are unclean.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי זֵירָא: אָבְדָה לוֹ אֲבֵידָה עֶרֶב הָרֶגֶל, כֵּיוָן דַּאֲנִיס — מוּתָּר, אוֹ דִלְמָא כֵּיוָן דְּלָא מוֹכְחָא מִילְּתָא — לָא?
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira asks: If one lost an item on the eve of a Festival since a victim of circumstances beyond his control, he is permitted Or perhaps since it is not evident not
llm_translation: Inquiry of Rabbi Zeira: If one lost an item on Erev Hag (the eve of a festival), once he searches - it is permitted, or perhaps since the matter is not evident - not?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, יֹאמְרוּ: כׇּל הַסְּרִיקִין אֲסוּרִין, סְרִיקֵי בַּיְיתּוֹס מוּתָּרִין?!
human_translation: Abaye said, would say: All the Syrian cakes are forbidden, the Syrian cakes of Baitos are permitted?
llm_translation: Abbaye said, they should say: all srikkin are forbidden, the srikkei Bayitos are permitted?!

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל מִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא חָלוּק אֶחָד מוּתָּר לְכַבְּסוֹ בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד, הָתָם נָמֵי, יֹאמְרוּ: כׇּל הַסְּרִיקִין אֲסוּרִין, סְרִיקֵי בַּיְיתּוֹס מוּתָּרִין!
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, that which Rabbi Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Anyone who has only one shirt is permitted to launder it on the intermediate days of a Festival, there too, will say: All the Syrian cakes are forbidden the Syrian cakes of Baitos are permitted.
llm_translation: And according to your reasoning, this that Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Anyone who has only one garment is permitted to launder it on Chol HaMoed, there specifically, they should say: All linen garments are prohibited, linen garments of Beitus are permitted!

hebrew_text: הָא אִתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי: אֵיזוֹרוֹ מוֹכִיחַ עָלָיו.
human_translation: Wasn’t it said about this Mar, son of Rav Ashi, said: His belt is proof for him,
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text: Talmudic text: "Ha itmar alah, amar Mar bar Rav Ashi: Eizoro mokhiach alav." English translation: "It was stated about him, Mar son of Rav Ashi said: His belt proves upon him."

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי מַתְנֵי, בָּעֵי רַבִּי זֵירָא: אוּמָּן שֶׁאָבְדָה לוֹ אֲבֵידָה עֶרֶב הָרֶגֶל, מַהוּ? כֵּיוָן דְּאוּמָּן הוּא — מוֹכְחָא מִילְּתָא, אוֹ דִלְמָא כֵּיוָן דְּלָא מוֹכְחָא מִילְּתָא כִּי הָנָךְ — לָא? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi taught Rabbi Zeira asks: a craftsman who lost an item on the eve of a Festival what is since he is a craftsman, it is evident Or perhaps since are not evident as in those not shall stand
llm_translation: Rav Ashei teaches, Rabbi Zeira inquires: If a craftsman loses his tool on Erev Pesach, what is the ruling? Since he is a craftsman — is this a clear indication of the matter, or perhaps since it is not a clear indication of the matter — no? This matter shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם. מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הַבָּא מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם — לֹא יְגַלֵּחַ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּצָא שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְשׁוּת.
human_translation: from a country overseas The mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: One who comes from a country overseas must not shave due to he left without permission.
llm_translation: From the country of the sea. The Mishnah teaches not like Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: One who comes from the country of the sea - he shall not shave, because he went out without permission.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לָשׁוּט — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אָסוּר, לִמְזוֹנוֹת — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מוּתָּר, לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא לְהֶרְוֵיחָא. מָר מְדַמֵּי לֵיהּ כְּלָשׁוּט, וּמָר מְדַמֵּי לֵיהּ כְּלִמְזוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: Rava said: to travel, all agree it is prohibited for sustenance, all agree it is permitted They disagree only to profit, One Sage, compares him to travel, and the other Sage, compare him for sustenance.
llm_translation: Rava said: Regarding the prohibition of carrying on Shabbat - the words of everyone agree that it is forbidden, regarding sustenance - the words of everyone agree that it is permitted. They only argued in order to gain merit. One Master compares it to carrying, and one Master compares it to sustenance.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, אָמַר רַבִּי: נִרְאִין דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה כְּשֶׁיָּצָא שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְשׁוּת, וְדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים כְּשֶׁיָּצָא בִּרְשׁוּת. מַאי שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְשׁוּת? אִילֵּימָא לָשׁוּט — וְהָאָמְרַתְּ דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אָסוּר! וְאֶלָּא לִמְזוֹנוֹת — וְהָאָמְרַתְּ דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מוּתָּר! אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא, לְהֶרְוֵיחָא.
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi said: statement of Rabbi Yehuda seems when he left without permission, and the statement of the Rabbis when one left with permission. What is without permission? If we say to travel, didn’t you say all agree it is prohibited Rather, for sustenance. didn’t you say all agree it is permitted Rather, obvious profit.
llm_translation: Challenger: Rabbi said: The words of Rabbi Yehuda are seen as if they came out without permission, and the words of the Sages are seen as if they came out with permission. What does it mean "without permission"? If you say for a whip - but didn't you say that the words of everyone are forbidden! Rather, for food - but didn't you say that the words of everyone are permitted! Rather, it is obvious, for a smell.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: נִרְאִין דְּבָרַי חֲכָמִים כְּשֶׁיָּצָא בִּרְשׁוּת, מַאי בִּרְשׁוּת? אִילֵּימָא לִמְזוֹנוֹת — הָא אָמְרַתְּ דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מוּתָּר! וְאֶלָּא לְהֶרְוֵיחָא — וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ נִרְאִין דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּהָא!
human_translation: Say the latter clause The statement of the Rabbis seems when one left with permission. What is with permission? If we say for sustenance, didn’t you say all agree it is permitted Rather, for profit. didn’t you say the statement of Rabbi Yehuda seems in this
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Eima seifa: nir'in devarai chachamim k'she'yatza b'reshut, mai b'reshut? Ileima l'mezonot — ha amarta divrei hakol mutar! V'ella l'herveicha — v'ha amarta nir'in divrei Rabbi Yehuda b'ha! English translation: Eima (say): the latter clause: the words of the Sages are seen as when it goes out in permission, what is meant by "in permission"? Perhaps for sustenance — but you said, the words of everyone are permitted! Rather, for fragrance — but you said, the words of Rabbi Yehuda are seen in this!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: נִרְאִין דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְרַבָּנַן כְּשֶׁיָּצָא שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְשׁוּת, וּמַאי נִיהוּ — לָשׁוּט, שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ חֲכָמִים לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ עָלָיו אֶלָּא לְהֶרְוֵיחָא, אֲבָל לָשׁוּט — מוֹדוּ לֵיהּ. וְנִרְאִין דִּבְרֵי רַבָּנַן לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה כְּשֶׁיָּצָא בִּרְשׁוּת, וּמַאי נִיהוּ — לִמְזוֹנוֹת, שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לֹא נֶחְלַק עֲלֵיהֶם אֶלָּא לְהֶרְוֵיחָא, אֲבָל לִמְזוֹנוֹת — מוֹדֶה לְהוּ.
human_translation: This is what is saying: The statement of Rabbi Yehuda seems to the Rabbis where one left without permission. And what is to travel, as even the Rabbis disagree with only for profit, but to travel they agree with And the statement of the Rabbis seems to Rabbi Yehuda where one left with permission. And what is for sustenance, as even Rabbi Yehuda disagrees with only for profit, but for sustenance concedes to them
llm_translation: So it is stated: The words of Rabbi Yehuda are seen by the Rabbis as if he spoke without permission, and what is the reason? To exclude, for even the sages did not disagree with him except for profit, but to exclude - they agree with him. And the words of the Rabbis are seen by Rabbi Yehuda as if he spoke with permission, and what is the reason? For sustenance, for even Rabbi Yehuda did not disagree with them except for profit, but for sustenance - he agrees with them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: קָטָן הַנּוֹלָד בַּמּוֹעֵד — מוּתָּר לְגַלֵּחַ בַּמּוֹעֵד, שֶׁאֵין לְךָ בֵּית הָאֲסוּרִין גָּדוֹל מִזֶּה. בַּמּוֹעֵד — אִין, מֵעִיקָּרָא — לָא.
human_translation: Shmuel said: a baby was born on a Festival it is permitted to cut on the Festival, as there is no greater prison than this, on the Festival, yes, before no,
llm_translation: Samuel said: A minor born on a festival - it is permitted to shave on the festival, for you do not have a greater prohibited house than this. On the festival - no, from the outset - no.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב פִּנְחָס: כׇּל אֵלּוּ שֶׁאָמְרוּ מוּתָּר לְגַלֵּחַ בַּמּוֹעֵד — מוּתָּר לְגַלֵּחַ בִּימֵי אֶבְלוֹ. הָא אָסוּר לְגַלֵּחַ בַּמּוֹעֵד — אָסוּר לְגַלֵּחַ בִּימֵי אֶבְלוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Pineḥas raised an objection All of those whom said: It is permitted to shave on Festival, it is permitted to shave during the days of his mourning. But one who is prohibited from shaving on a Festival is prohibited from shaving during the days of his mourning.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Pinchas raised an objection: All those that they said it is permitted to shave during the festival - it is permitted to shave during the days of his mourning. If it is prohibited to shave during the festival - it is prohibited to shave during the days of his mourning.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ קָטָן אִית בֵּיהּ פְּלוּגְתָּא — נִמְצֵאת אֲבֵילוּת נוֹהֶגֶת בְּקָטָן.
human_translation: And if you say a baby there is a distinction you find that mourning practiced with a minor.
llm_translation: "And if you say 'there is a minor in it, there is a dispute' - it is found that mourning is practiced with a minor."

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: מְקָרְעִין לַקָּטָן, מִפְּנֵי עׇגְמַת נֶפֶשׁ!
human_translation: Isn’t it taught One rends a minor due to grief
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: We tear for the minor, because of distress of the soul!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מִי קָתָנֵי הָא אֲסוּרִין! דִּלְמָא יֵשׁ מֵהֶן אָסוּר וְיֵשׁ מֵהֶן מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Is it taught it is prohibited Perhaps there are among them, prohibited, there are among them permitted,
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: Who is the author of this, the prohibited ones! Perhaps some of them are prohibited and some of them are permitted.

hebrew_text: אַמֵּימָר, וְאִי תֵּימָא רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי, מַתְנֵי הָכִי. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: קָטָן מוּתָּר לְגַלְּחוֹ בַּמּוֹעֵד, לָא שְׁנָא נוֹלַד בַּמּוֹעֵד וְלָא שְׁנָא נוֹלַד מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: Ameimar, and some say Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, taught in this Shmuel said: a baby, it is permitted to cut his during the Festival. is no different he was born during the Festival, and it is no different he was born beforehand.
llm_translation: Ammemar, and if you wish, say it was Rav Shisha the son of Rav Idi, teaches thus: Shmuel said: A minor is permitted to shave during the festival; it makes no difference whether he was born during the festival or whether he was born before.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פִּנְחָס, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: כׇּל אֵלּוּ שֶׁאָמְרוּ מוּתָּר לְגַלֵּחַ בַּמּוֹעֵד — מוּתָּר לְגַלֵּחַ בִּימֵי אֶבְלוֹ. הָא אֲסוּרִין לְגַלֵּחַ בַּמּוֹעֵד — אֲסוּרִין לְגַלֵּחַ בִּימֵי אֶבְלוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Pineḥas said: We, too, learn All of those whom said: It is permitted to shave on Festival, it is permitted to shave during the days of his mourning. But one who is prohibited from shaving on a Festival is prohibited from shaving during the days of his mourning.
llm_translation: Rav Pinchas said, "We also learned: all those that it is permitted to shave during the festival, it is permitted to shave during the days of mourning. Those that are forbidden to shave during the festival, it is forbidden to shave during the days of mourning."

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ קָטָן אָסוּר, נִמְצֵאת אֲבֵילוּת נוֹהֶגֶת בְּקָטָן. וְתַנְיָא: מְקָרְעִין לַקָּטָן מִפְּנֵי עׇגְמַת נֶפֶשׁ.
human_translation: If you say a baby it is prohibited you find that mourning practiced with a minor. And it was taught One rends a minor due to grief
llm_translation: If you say "a minor is forbidden," you find mourning practiced with a minor. And it was taught: We tear for a minor due to the discomfort of the soul.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מִי קָתָנֵי הָא אֲסוּרִין? דִּלְמָא יֵשׁ מֵהֶן אָסוּר וְיֵשׁ מֵהֶן מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Is it taught prohibited Perhaps there are among them prohibited, there are among them permitted.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Who is the author of this Mishnah that states prohibitions? Perhaps some of them are prohibited while others are permitted.

hebrew_text: אָבֵל אֵינוֹ נוֹהֵג אֲבֵילוּתוֹ בָּרֶגֶל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְשָׂמַחְתָּ בְּחַגֶּךָ״.
human_translation: A mourner does not practice his mourning on a Festival, as it is stated: “And you shall rejoice in your Festival”
llm_translation: Mourner not accustomed mourning on foot, as it is stated: "And you shall rejoice in your feast."

hebrew_text: אִי אֲבֵילוּת דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא הוּא — אָתֵי עֲשֵׂה דְרַבִּים וְדָחֵי עֲשֵׂה דְיָחִיד. וְאִי אֲבֵילוּת דְּהַשְׁתָּא הוּא — לָא אָתֵי עֲשֵׂה דְיָחִיד וְדָחֵי עֲשֵׂה דְרַבִּים.
human_translation: If it is a mourning at the outset the positive mitzva of the community, comes and overrides the positive mitzva of individual, And if the mourning now, the positive mitzva of the individual does not come and override the positive mitzva of the community.
llm_translation: If it is a matter of mourning from the outset — one comes to perform the obligation of many and overrides the obligation of the individual. But if it is a matter of mourning that is current — one does not come to perform the obligation of the individual and overrides the obligation of many.

hebrew_text: מְנוּדָּה, מַהוּ שֶׁיִּנְהוֹג נִידּוּיוֹ בָּרֶגֶל? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, תָּא שְׁמַע: דָּנִין דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת וְדִינֵי מַכּוֹת וְדִינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת, וְאִי לָא צָיֵית דִּינָא — מְשַׁמְּתִינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: one who was ostracized, what is observe the practices of ostracism, on the Festival? Rav Yosef said: Come hear the court judges capital law, lashes, monetary law. if one does not listen to the judgment, we ostracize him
llm_translation: Dispute, what is the case where his excommunication is practiced by foot? Rav Yosef said, come and hear: they judge cases of life, cases of lashes, and cases of monetary matters, and if he does not accept the judgment - we excommunicate him.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ אֵינוֹ נוֹהֵג נִידּוּיוֹ בָּרֶגֶל, מְשׁוּמָּת וְאָתֵי מֵעִיקָּרָא, אָתֵי רֶגֶל דָּחֵי לֵיהּ — הַשְׁתָּא מְשַׁמְּתִינַן לֵיהּ אֲנַן?!
human_translation: And if it enters your mind that one does not observe the practices of ostracism during the Festival, one who has already been ostracized at the outset the Festival comes and overrides his now we, ostracize he
llm_translation: And if it enters your mind that he does not habitually impose his excommunication by foot, due to a tradition that comes from the outset, the foot comes and pushes it away - now do we rely on it?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְדִלְמָא לְעַיּוֹנֵי בְּדִינֵיהּ? דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת דְּקָתָנֵי, הָכָא נָמֵי דְּקָטְלִין לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: as perhaps deliberates in judgment Because if you do not say so, capital law that are taught, here too, would we put someone to death
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: And perhaps for the sake of the experts in his laws? For if you do not say so, the laws of his life are strict, here too they are strict with him!

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָא מִימַּנְעִי מִשִּׂמְחַת יוֹם טוֹב — דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן לְסַנְהֶדְרִין (שֶׁרָאוּ בְּאֶחָד) שֶׁהָרְגוּ אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ שֶׁאֵין טוֹעֲמִין כׇּל אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תֹאכְלוּ עַל הַדָּם״.
human_translation: But would be prevented from rejoicing on the Festival, as it is taught Rabbi Akiva says: From where to the Sanhedrin who put someone to death that they may not taste for the entire of the day? The verse states: “You shall not eat with the blood”
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: But is it possible to withhold oneself from rejoicing on a festival? For it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Akiva says: From where do we derive with regard to the Sanhedrin (who saw a case) where they executed a person whose taste did not change all that day, that it is forbidden to eat upon the blood?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: לְעַיּוֹנֵי בְּדִינֵיהּ, הָכָא נָמֵי לְעַיּוֹנֵי בְּדִינֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִם כֵּן, נִמְצֵאתָ מְעַנֶּה אֶת דִּינוֹ!
human_translation: Rather, to deliberating in judgment Here too, to deliberating in judgment, to him: If so, you find a perversion of justice his
llm_translation: Rather: for the experts in its laws, here it is stated for the experts in its laws. He said to him: If so, you are contradicting his judgment!

hebrew_text: אָתוּ מִצַּפְרָא וּמְעַיְּינִי בְּדִינֵיהּ, וְעָיְילִי, וְאָכְלִי וְשָׁתוּ כּוּלֵּי יוֹמָא, וַהֲדַר אָתוּ בִּשְׁקִיעַת הַחַמָּה וְגָמְרִי לְדִינֵיהּ וְקָטְלוּ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: come in the morning and deliberate in judgment. enter and eat and drink all day, Then they come sunset and complete his judgment, they kill him.
llm_translation: They came from Tzafra and Me'aynai in its judgment, and they went, and ate and drank all day, and then they came at sunset and completed its judgment, and killed him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, תָּא שְׁמַע: וּמְנוּדֶּה שֶׁהִתִּירוּ לוֹ חֲכָמִים!
human_translation: Abaye said: Come hear And one who is ostracized, that the Sages permitted him
llm_translation: Abbaye said, "Come and hear: 'And a rebellious individual whom the sages have permitted!'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִי קָתָנֵי שֶׁהִתִּירוּהוּ חֲכָמִים? שֶׁהִתִּירוּ לוֹ חֲכָמִים קָתָנֵי, דַּאֲזַל וּפַיְּיסֵיהּ לְבַעַל דִּינֵיהּ, וַאֲתָא קַמֵּי דְרַבָּנַן וּשְׁרוֹ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rava said: Is it taught That they permitted it, the Sages it is taught: They permitted him. where one went and appeased his litigant and the Sages came and released him
llm_translation: Rava said: Who is the Tanna that the sages permitted him? The sages permitted him, the Tanna, for he went and appeased his creditor, and he came before the Rabbis and they released him.

hebrew_text: מְצוֹרָע, מַהוּ שֶׁיַּנְהִיג צָרַעְתּוֹ בָּרֶגֶל? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, תָּא שְׁמַע: וְהַנָּזִיר וְהַמְּצוֹרָע מִטּוּמְאָתוֹ לְטׇהֳרָתוֹ. הָא בִּימֵי טוּמְאָתוֹ — נָהֵיג.
human_translation: a leper, what is observe the practices of his leper status, during the Festival? Abaye said: Come hear And the nazirite and the leper from his ritual impurity to his purity This during the days of his impurity observe
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A metzora, what is the case where his tzara'at is led by foot? Abaye said, come and hear: "And the Nazirite and the metzora shall shave his impurity for his purification." This is during his impurity days - it is led.

hebrew_text: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר. לָא מִיבַּעְיָא בִּימֵי טוּמְאָתוֹ דְּלָא נָהֵיג, אֲבָל לְטׇהֳרָתוֹ נִיגְזוֹר שֶׁמָּא יְשַׁהֶה קׇרְבְּנוֹתָיו, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן!
human_translation: is speaking Needless to say. Needless to say, during the days of his impurity he does not observe However, his purity we should issue a decree lest he delay his offerings teaches us
llm_translation: He is not asking a question. He is not asking during his impurity days when he is not accustomed, but for his purification, it is decreed that perhaps he will delay his sacrifices. This teaches us!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וְהַצָּרוּעַ״ — לְרַבּוֹת כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל. וְהָא כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, דְּכׇל הַשָּׁנָה כְּרֶגֶל לְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא דָּמֵי, דִּתְנַן: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מַקְרִיב אוֹנֵן וְאֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ נוֹהֵג צָרַעְתּוֹ בָּרֶגֶל. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rava said: Come hear “And the leper to include the High Priest, And the High Priest the entire year is like everyone on a Festival, as we learned High Priest sacrifices an acute mourner, but he may not eat Learn from it practices the customs of his leprosy during the Festival. learn from it
llm_translation: Rava said, come and hear: "And the leper" - to include the High Priest. But isn't the High Priest, for every year is like a regular person, as we learned: The High Priest may perform the service while in mourning, but he may not eat. Learn from it that his leprosy is treated as a regular person's. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: אָבֵל אָסוּר בְּתִסְפּוֹרֶת. מִדְּקָאָמַר לְהוּ רַחֲמָנָא לִבְנֵי אַהֲרֹן: ״רָאשֵׁיכֶם אַל תִּפְרָעוּ״, מִכְּלָל דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אָסוּר.
human_translation: it is prohibited for a mourner to a haircut is from the Merciful One states to the sons of Aaron: “Let not the hair of your heads go loose” By inference, that for everyone it is prohibited
llm_translation: Mourning is prohibited with counting. From where do we say that the Merciful One said to the sons of Aaron: "Do not uncover your heads"? This is included in the general prohibition of the entire world.

hebrew_text: מְנוּדִּין וּמְצוֹרָעִין מָה הֵן בְּתִסְפּוֹרֶת? תָּא שְׁמַע: מְנוּדִּין וּמְצוֹרָעִין אֲסוּרִין לְסַפֵּר וּלְכַבֵּס.
human_translation: What those who are ostracized and lepers, a haircut? Come hear that which Those who are ostracized and lepers are prohibited from cutting and laundering
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Menudin u'Metzora'in mah hen b'tisporet? Ta shma: Menudin u'Metzora'in asurin l'saper u'l'kabes." English translation: "What are 'excommunicated individuals' and 'lepers' according to the count? Come and hear: 'Excommunicated individuals' and 'lepers' are prohibited from shaving and laundering."

hebrew_text: מְנוּדֶּה שֶׁמֵּת, בֵּית דִּין סוֹקְלִין אֶת אֲרוֹנוֹ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא שֶׁיַּעֲמִידוּ עָלָיו גַּל אֲבָנִים כְּגַלּוֹ שֶׁל עָכָן, אֶלָּא בֵּית דִּין שׁוֹלְחִין וּמַנִּיחִין אֶבֶן גְּדוֹלָה עַל אֲרוֹנוֹ, לְלַמֶּדְךָ שֶׁכׇּל הַמִּתְנַדֶּה וּמֵת בְּנִידּוּיוֹ — בֵּית דִּין סוֹקְלִין אֶת אֲרוֹנוֹ.
human_translation: one who is ostracized dies, the court stones on his coffin. Rabbi Yehuda says: not that they pile up a heap of stones over him like the heap of Achan Rather, the court sends who place a large stone on his coffin to teach you anyone who is ostracized and dies while in his ostracism, the court stones on his coffin.
llm_translation: The one who takes a vow and dies, the court stones his coffin. Rabbi Yehuda says: Not that they should set upon it a heap of stones like the heap of Achan, rather the court sends and places a large stone on his coffin, to teach you that anyone who takes a vow and dies in his excommunication - the court stones his coffin.

hebrew_text: אָבֵל חַיָּיב בַּעֲטִיפַת הָרֹאשׁ. מִדְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לִיחֶזְקֵאל: ״וְלֹא תַעְטֶה עַל שָׂפָם״, מִכְּלָל דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיחַיְּיבִי.
human_translation: A mourner is obligated to wrap head that the Merciful One says to Ezekiel, “And cover not your upper lip” by inference that everyone is obligated
llm_translation: Mourner obligated in wrapping the head. From where do we derive this? Because the Merciful One said to Ezekiel: "And you shall not cover your lips," implying that all people are obligated.

hebrew_text: מְנוּדֶּה מַהוּ בַּעֲטִיפַת הָרֹאשׁ? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, תָּא שְׁמַע: וְהֵן מִתְעַטְּפִין וְיוֹשְׁבִין כִּמְנוּדִּין וְכַאֲבֵלִים עַד שֶׁיְּרַחֲמוּ עֲלֵיהֶם מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: דִּלְמָא מְנוּדֶּה לַשָּׁמַיִם שָׁאנֵי, דַּחֲמִיר.
human_translation: What is a person who is ostracized, wrapping of the head? Rav Yosef said: Come hear And they wrap themselves and sit as those who are ostracized and as mourners, until they are shown mercy from Heaven. Abaye said to him: Perhaps one who is ostracized by Heaven is different, as that is more serious
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is Menudeh in the wrapping of the head? Rav Yosef said, come and hear: They wrap themselves and sit like mourners and like those in mourning until mercy is shown to them from heaven. Abbaye said to him: Perhaps Menudeh is different in heaven, for it is stringent.

hebrew_text: מְצוֹרָע מַהוּ בַּעֲטִיפַת הָרֹאשׁ? תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וְעַל שָׂפָם יַעְטֶה״, מִכְּלָל שֶׁחַיָּיב בַּעֲטִיפַת הָרֹאשׁ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: What is a leper wrapping of the head? Come hear “And he shall cover his upper lip” by inference that he is obligated to wrap head. learn from here
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is included in the wrapping of the head of a metzora? Come and hear: "And on his forehead he shall cover," indicating that he is obligated in the wrapping of the head. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: אָבֵל אָסוּר לְהַנִּיחַ תְּפִילִּין, מִדְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לִיחֶזְקֵאל: ״פְּאֵרְךָ חֲבוֹשׁ עָלֶיךָ״, מִכְּלָל דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אָסוּר.
human_translation: A mourner is prohibited from donning phylacteries. that the Merciful One says to Ezekiel, “Bind your headwear [ pe’er ] upon yourself” by inference that everyone is prohibited
llm_translation: Mourning is forbidden to put on phylacteries, since the Merciful One said to Ezekiel: "Your turban upon you," from the inference of the entire world it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: מְנוּדֶּה מַהוּ בִּתְפִילִּין? תֵּיקוּ. מְצוֹרָע מַהוּ בִּתְפִילִּין? תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וְהַצָּרוּעַ״ — לְרַבּוֹת כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל. ״בְּגָדָיו יִהְיוּ פְרוּמִים״ — שֶׁיְּהוּ מְקוֹרָעִים, ״וְרֹאשׁוֹ יִהְיֶה פָרוּעַ״ — אֵין פְּרִיעָה אֶלָּא גִּידּוּל שֵׂעָר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: What is one who is ostracized, shall stand What is a leper Come hear “And the leper” to include the High Priest “His garments shall be perumim ,” that they shall be rent. “And his head shall be parua ,” peria only growing the hair long; the statement of Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: Dispute: What is the case of "Menudeh" with regard to Tefillin? It shall remain unresolved. What is the case of a "Metzora" with regard to Tefillin? Come and hear: "And the leper" — to include the High Priest. "His clothes shall be rent" — that they should be torn. "And his head shall be bare" — there is no prohibition except the growth of hair, the words of Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: נֶאֶמְרָה הֲוָיָיה בָּרֹאשׁ, וְנֶאֶמְרָה הֲוָיָיה בַּבֶּגֶד. מָה הֲוָיָיה הָאֲמוּרָה בַּבֶּגֶד — דָּבָר שֶׁחוּץ מִגּוּפוֹ. אַף הֲוָיָיה בָּרֹאשׁ דָּבָר שֶׁחוּץ מִגּוּפוֹ. מַאי לָאו, אַתְּפִילִּין!
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: states being, with regard to head And the verse states being with regard to garment, Just as being stated with regard to garment an object external to his body, so too, being with regard to head an object external to his body. What, is it not phylacteries,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: "Existence was said in the head, and existence was said in the garment." What is the existence that was said in the garment? Something separate from its body. Also, existence in the head is something separate from its body. What is the reason? Tefillin!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא, אַכּוּמְתָא וְסוּדָרָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: No, to a cap [ kumta ] or a scarf [ sudara ],
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: No, Akumta and Sudara.

hebrew_text: אָבֵל אָסוּר בִּשְׁאֵילַת שָׁלוֹם. דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לִיחֶזְקֵאל: ״הֵאָנֵק דּוֹם״.
human_translation: A mourner is prohibited from greeting that the Merciful One says to Ezekiel: “Sigh in silence”
llm_translation: Mourning is prohibited in greeting with peace. As the Merciful One said to Ezekiel: "Sigh in silence."

hebrew_text: מְנוּדֶּה מַהוּ בִּשְׁאֵילַת שָׁלוֹם? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, תָּא שְׁמַע: וּבִשְׁאֵילַת שָׁלוֹם שֶׁבֵּין אָדָם לַחֲבֵרוֹ כִּבְנֵי אָדָם הַנְּזוּפִין לַמָּקוֹם. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: דִּלְמָא מְנוּדֶּה לַשָּׁמַיִם שָׁאנֵי, דַּחֲמִיר.
human_translation: What is one who is ostracized greeting Rav Yosef said: Come hear from greeting one another, as people who are reprimanded by the Omnipresent. Abaye said to him: Perhaps one who is ostracized by Heaven is different, as that is more serious
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the meaning of "Menudeh" in the context of asking about one's well-being? Rav Yosef said, "Come and hear: In asking about one's well-being between a person and his friend, it is like the children of men who are shaken before the Omnipresent." Abbaye said to him, "Perhaps 'Menudeh' refers to the heavens, as it is severe."

hebrew_text: מְצוֹרָע מַהוּ בִּשְׁאֵילַת שָׁלוֹם? תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וְעַל שָׂפָם יַעְטֶה״ — שֶׁיְּהוּ שִׂפְתוֹתָיו מְדוּבָּקוֹת זוֹ בָּזוֹ, שֶׁיְּהֵא כִּמְנוּדֶּה וּכְאָבֵל, וְאָסוּר בִּשְׁאֵילַת שָׁלוֹם. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: What is a leper greeting Come hear “And he shall cover his upper lip” his lips should be stuck together, that he should be like one who is ostracized and like a mourner, and he is prohibited from greeting learn from this
llm_translation: Afflicted person what in asking of peace? Come hear: "And on his upper lip he shall cover" — that his lips should be stuck one to the other, that he should be like a mourner and like a mourner, and forbidden in asking of peace. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: וְנִיפְשׁוֹט מִינַּהּ לִמְנוּדֶּה? אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר פִּנְחָס מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף: מִי קָתָנֵי שֶׁאָסוּר? שֶׁיְּהֵא כִּמְנוּדֶּה וּכְאָבֵל [קָתָנֵי] בְּמִילֵּי אַחְרָנְיָיתָא, וְאָסוּר נָמֵי בִּשְׁאֵילַת שָׁלוֹם.
human_translation: we should resolve with regard to one who is ostracized Rav Aḥa bar Pineḥas said in the name of Rav Yosef: Does it teach is prohibited It teaches that he should be like one who is ostracized and like a mourner, with regard to other things, and he is also prohibited from greeting
llm_translation: And it is permitted to be drawn out from it to a rejected one? Rav Acha bar Pinchas said in the name of Rav Yosef: Who is the Tanna that said it is forbidden? That it should be like a rejected one and like a mourner he said in other matters, and it is forbidden to say greetings.

hebrew_text: אָבֵל אָסוּר בְּדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה, מִדְּקָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא לִיחֶזְקֵאל: ״דֹּם״.
human_translation: A mourner is prohibited words of Torah. from that the Merciful One says to Ezekiel: silence”
llm_translation: Mourning is prohibited in matters of Torah, as it is stated, "blood," as the Merciful One said to Ezekiel.

hebrew_text: מְנוּדֶּה מַהוּ בְּדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, תָּא שְׁמַע: מְנוּדֶּה שׁוֹנֶה וְשׁוֹנִין לוֹ, נִשְׂכָּר וְנִשְׂכָּרִין לוֹ.
human_translation: What is one who is ostracized words of Torah? Rav Yosef said: Come hear that which One who is ostracized may teach and may teach him he may be hired and may be hired by him.
llm_translation: Dispute, what is it in matters of Torah? Rav Yosef said, come and hear: Dispute that is repeated and repeated for him, reward and rewards for him.

hebrew_text: מוּחְרָם — לֹא שׁוֹנֶה וְלֹא שׁוֹנִין לוֹ, לֹא נִשְׂכָּר וְלֹא נִשְׂכָּרִין לוֹ. אֲבָל שׁוֹנֶה הוּא לְעַצְמוֹ, שֶׁלֹּא יַפְסִיק אֶת לִמּוּדוֹ, וְעוֹשֶׂה לוֹ חֲנוּת קְטַנָּה בִּשְׁבִיל פַּרְנָסָתוֹ.
human_translation: One who has been excommunicated, may not teach and may not teach him. He may not be hired and may not be hired by him. However, he may study by himself, that he will not interrupt his study And he may build a small store for his livelihood,
llm_translation: Mukhrám — not repeat and not repeat to him, not hire and not hire to him. But he repeats to himself, so that he does not interrupt his learning, and he makes for himself a small shop for his livelihood.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב — זַבּוֹנֵי מַיָּא בְּפַקְתָּא דַעֲרָבוֹת. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: And Rav said: selling water in the valley of Aravot, learn from this
llm_translation: And Rav said - the abundance of water in the evening is a sign. Hear from it.

hebrew_text: מְצוֹרָע מַהוּ בְּדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה? תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וְהוֹדַעְתָּם לְבָנֶיךָ וְלִבְנֵי בָנֶיךָ. יוֹם אֲשֶׁר עָמַדְתָּ לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ בְּחוֹרֵב״ — מָה לְהַלָּן בְּאֵימָה וּבְיִרְאָה וּבִרְתֵת וּבְזִיעַ,
human_translation: What is a leper words of Torah? Come hear “And you shall impart them to your children and your children’s children; the day that you stood before the Lord your God in Horeb” Just as there, in reverence, fear, and trembling,
llm_translation: Afflicted person what in words of Torah? Come hear: "And you shall make known to your children and your children's children, the day that you stood before the Lord your God at Horeb" — what there with fear and awe and trembling and sweat,

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ: הַזָּבִין וְהַמְצוֹרָעִין וּבוֹעֲלֵי נִדּוֹת — מוּתָּרִין לִקְרוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה וּבַנְּבִיאִים וּבַכְּתוּבִים, וְלִשְׁנוֹת בַּמִּדְרָשׁ וּבַתַּלְמוּד, בַּהֲלָכוֹת וּבָאַגָּדוֹת. וּבַעֲלֵי קְרָיִין אֲסוּרִין. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: From here stated: Zavim , lepers, and those who had intercourse with menstruating women are permitted to read the Torah, Prophets, and Writings, and to study midrash, Talmud, halakhot , and aggada . But those who experienced a seminal emission are prohibited learn from this
llm_translation: From here they said: Those with a discharge, lepers, and menstruants - are permitted to read in the Torah, Prophets, and Writings, and to engage in study and in the Talmud, in matters of law and in aggadah. But those who have nocturnal emissions are forbidden. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: אָבֵל אָסוּר בְּתִכְבּוֹסֶת, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּשְׁלַח יוֹאָב תְּקוֹעָה וַיִּקַּח מִשָּׁם אִשָּׁה חֲכָמָה וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלֶיהָ הִתְאַבְּלִי נָא וְלִבְשִׁי נָא בִגְדֵי אֵבֶל וְאַל תָּסוּכִי שֶׁמֶן וְהָיִית כְּאִשָּׁה זֶה יָמִים רַבִּים מִתְאַבֶּלֶת עַל מֵת״.
human_translation: A mourner is prohibited from laundering his clothes, as it is written: “And Joab sent to Tekoa, and fetched from there a wise woman, and said to her, I pray you, feign yourself to be a mourner, and put on now mourning apparel, and do not anoint yourself with oil, but be as a woman that had a long time mourned for the dead”
llm_translation: Mourning is forbidden in a hot bath, as it is written: "And Joab sent to Tekoa and took from there a wise woman and said to her, 'Pretend to be a mourner and put on mourning garments, and do not anoint yourself with oil, but be like a woman who has been mourning for the dead many days.'"

hebrew_text: מְנוּדִּין וּמְצוֹרָעִין מָה הֵן בְּתִכְבּוֹסֶת? תָּא שְׁמַע: מְנוּדִּין וּמְצוֹרָעִין אֲסוּרִין לְסַפֵּר וּלְכַבֵּס. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: What laundering those who are ostracized or lepers? Come hear Those who are ostracized or lepers are prohibited from cutting or laundering learn from
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Menudin u'Metzora'in mah hen b'tichbosit? Ta shma: Menudin u'Metzora'in asurin l'saper u'l'kabes. Shma minah. English translation: Menudin and Metzora'in, what are they in a tichbosit? Come and hear: Menudin and Metzora'in are forbidden to count and to launder. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: אָבֵל חַיָּיב בִּקְרִיעָה, דְּקָאָמַר לְהוּ רַחֲמָנָא לִבְנֵי אַהֲרֹן: ״לֹא תִפְרוֹמוּ״, מִכְּלָל דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיחַיְּיבִי.
human_translation: A mourner is obligated to rend that the Merciful One says to the sons of Aaron: “Neither rend by inference that everyone are obligated
llm_translation: Mourner obligated in tearing, as saying to them the Merciful One to the sons of Aaron: "Do not uncover," from the general principle of all people they are obligated.

hebrew_text: מְנוּדֶּה מַהוּ בִּקְרִיעָה? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: What is rending one who is ostracized shall stand
llm_translation: "M'nudeh, what is 'bikri'ah'? Teiku."

hebrew_text: מְצוֹרָע מַהוּ בִּקְרִיעָה? תָּא שְׁמַע: ״בְּגָדָיו יִהְיוּ פְרוּמִים״ — שֶׁיְּהוּ מְקוֹרָעִין. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: What is a leper rending? Come hear that which “His garments shall be rent” that they shall be torn. learn from here
llm_translation: Afflicted individual, what is "Bikri'ah"? Come and hear: "His clothes shall be rent" - that they should be torn. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: אָבֵל חַיָּיב בִּכְפִיַּית הַמִּטָּה, דְּתָנֵי בַּר קַפָּרָא:
human_translation: A mourner is obligated to overturn bed, as bar Kappara taught
llm_translation: Mourner obligated in folding the bed, as it was taught in the school of Bar Kappara:

hebrew_text: דְּמוּת דְּיוֹקְנִי נָתַתִּי בָּהֶן, וּבַעֲוֹנוֹתֵיהֶם הֲפַכְתִּיהָ. (כָּפוּ) [יֵהָפְכוּ] מִטּוֹתֵיהֶן עָלֶיהָ. מְנוּדֶּה וּמְצוֹרָע מָה הֵן בִּכְפִיַּית הַמִּטָּה? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: I have placed the likeness of My image [ deyokan ] within and owing to their sins I have overturned it, overturn your beds on account of this. What one who was ostracized or a leper, overturning the bed? shall stand
llm_translation: I have placed an image of a likeness of a palm tree in them, and I have overturned it with their sins. (They shall be overturned) from their beds upon it. What are a menstruating woman and a leper in terms of the impurity of a bed? This matter shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: אָבֵל אָסוּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָפַכְתִּי חַגֵּיכֶם לְאֵבֶל״. מָה חַג אָסוּר בִּמְלָאכָה — אַף אָבֵל אָסוּר בִּמְלָאכָה.
human_translation: A mourner is prohibited from performing work, as it is written: “And I will turn your Festivals into mourning” Just as a Festival prohibited to work, so too, a mourner is prohibited from performing work.
llm_translation: Mourning is prohibited in the performance of labor, as it is written: "And I will turn your feasts into mourning." Just as a festival is prohibited in labor, so too mourning is prohibited in labor.

hebrew_text: מְנוּדֶּה מַהוּ בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, תָּא שְׁמַע: כְּשֶׁאָמְרוּ אָסוּר בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה, לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא בַּיּוֹם, אֲבָל בַּלַּיְלָה מוּתָּר. וְכֵן אַתָּה מוֹצֵא בִּמְנוּדֶּה וּבְאָבֵל. מַאי לָאו, אַכּוּלְּהוּ? לָא, אַשְּׁאָרָא.
human_translation: What is one who was ostracized the performance of work? Rav Yosef said: Come hear When said that the performance of work is prohibited they meant only during the day but during the night it is permitted. And you find a similar with regard to a person ostracized and a mourner. What, is it not with regard to all No, is referring to the rest
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the definition of performing labor on a festival? Rav Yosef said, come and hear: When they said it is prohibited to perform labor, they only said this during the day, but at night it is permitted. And so you find in the case of mourning and in the case of a festival. What is the reason? Should we say, because of eating? No, it is due to other reasons.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מְנוּדֶּה שׁוֹנֶה וְשׁוֹנִין לוֹ, נִשְׂכָּר וְנִשְׂכָּרִין לוֹ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ. מְצוֹרָע מַהוּ בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Come hear that which One who is ostracized may teach Torah and may teach him he may be hired and may be hired by him. Learn from here What is a leper, the performance of work? shall stand
llm_translation: "Come and hear: If one hires a worker and workers for him, he is hired and they are hired for him. Learn from this. What is the law regarding a leper in terms of performing labor? The matter remains unresolved."

hebrew_text: אָבֵל אָסוּר בִּרְחִיצָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאַל תָּסוּכִי שֶׁמֶן״, וּרְחִיצָה בִּכְלַל סִיכָה.
human_translation: A mourner is prohibited from bathing, as it is written: “And do not anoint yourself with oil, And bathing is included in anointing,
llm_translation: Mourning is prohibited in washing, as it is written: "And do not anoint yourself with oil," and washing is included in anointing.

hebrew_text: מְנוּדֶּה מַהוּ בִּרְחִיצָה? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, תָּא שְׁמַע: כְּשֶׁאָמְרוּ אָסוּר בִּרְחִיצָה לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא כׇּל גּוּפוֹ, אֲבָל פָּנָיו יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו — מוּתָּר, וְכֵן אַתָּה מוֹצֵא בִּמְנוּדֶּה וּבְאָבֵל. מַאי לָאו אַכּוּלְּהוּ? לָא, אַשְּׁאָרָא. מְצוֹרָע מַהוּ בִּרְחִיצָה? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: What is one who is ostracized bathing? Rav Yosef said: Come hear that which When said that bathing is prohibited they meant only his entire body, but his face, his hands, and his feet is permitted.
