And you find a similar with regard to a person who was ostracized and a mourner. What, is it not with regard to all No, is referring to the rest What is a leper bathing? shall stand
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the case of Menudeh in regard to immersion? Rav Yosef said, come and hear: When they said it is prohibited to immerse, they only said this regarding his entire body, but his face, hands, and feet - are permitted. And so you find regarding Menudeh and mourning. What is the reason they did not eat them? No, I will remain silent. What is the case of a leper in regard to immersion? This matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: אָבֵל אָסוּר בִּנְעִילַת הַסַּנְדָּל, מִדְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לִיחֶזְקֵאל ״וּנְעָלֶיךָ תָּשִׂים בְּרַגְלֶיךָ״, מִכְּלָל דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אָסוּר.
human_translation: A mourner is prohibited from wearing shoes. Since the Merciful One says to “And put your shoes upon your feet” by inference that everyone is prohibited
llm_translation: Mourning is prohibited with sandal wearing, as it says to Ezekiel "And your sandals you shall put on your feet," from the general principle of all worlds it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: מְנוּדֶּה מַהוּ בִּנְעִילַת הַסַּנְדָּל? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, תָּא שְׁמַע: כְּשֶׁאָמְרוּ אָסוּר בִּנְעִילַת הַסַּנְדָּל — לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא בָּעִיר, אֲבָל בַּדֶּרֶךְ — מוּתָּר. הָא כֵּיצַד? יָצָא לַדֶּרֶךְ — נוֹעֵל, נִכְנַס לָעִיר — חוֹלֵץ, וְכֵן אַתָּה מוֹצֵא בִּמְנוּדֶּה וּבְאָבֵל. מַאי לָאו אַכּוּלְּהוּ? לָא, אַשְּׁאָרָא.
human_translation: What is one who is ostracized wearing shoes? Rav Yosef said: Come hear that which When said wearing shoes is prohibited they meant only in the city, but on the road, is permitted. How so? he sets out on the road, he may put on he enters the city he must take off And you find a similar with regard to a person ostracized and a mourner. What, is it not with regard to all No, is referring to the rest
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the case of "Menudeh" in the matter of sandal fastening? Rav Yosef said, come and hear: When they said it is forbidden to fasten the sandal - they only said this in the city, but on the road - it is permitted. How so? If one goes out on the road - he fastens, when he enters the city - he unties. And so you find in the case of "Menudeh" and in mourning. What, should we say they are similar? No, I will say.

hebrew_text: מְצוֹרָע מַהוּ בִּנְעִילַת הַסַּנְדָּל? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: What is a leper wearing shoes? shall stand
llm_translation: Afflicted one, what is the case with regard to the locking of the sandal? This matter shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: אָבֵל אָסוּר בְּתַשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְנַחֵם דָּוִד אֵת בַּת שֶׁבַע אִשְׁתּוֹ וַיָּבֹא אֵלֶיהָ״, מִכְּלָל דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא אָסוּר.
human_translation: A mourner is prohibited from engaging in sexual relations, as it is written: “And David comforted Bath-Sheba his wife, and went into her, by inference that initially, were forbidden.
llm_translation: Mourning is prohibited in marital relations, as it is written: "And David comforted Bathsheba his wife, and he went to her," indicating that initially it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: מְנוּדֶּה מַהוּ בְּתַשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, תָּא שְׁמַע: כׇּל אוֹתָן שָׁנִים שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר מְנוּדִּין הָיוּ, וְשִׁימְּשׁוּ מִטּוֹתֵיהֶן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְדִלְמָא מְנוּדֶּה לַשָּׁמַיִם שָׁאנֵי, דְּקִיל.
human_translation: What is one who is ostracized sexual relations? Rav Yosef said: Come hear that which All those years that the Jewish people were in the wilderness they were ostracized, and they engaged in sexual relations, Abaye said to him: Perhaps one who is ostracized by Heaven is different, that is less serious
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the definition of "menudeh" in relation to the use of a bed? Rav Yosef said, "Come and hear: All those years that the Israelites were in the wilderness, they had beds that they used." Abbaye said to him, "But perhaps 'menudeh' refers to the heavens, as it is written, 'Heaven is My throne.'"

hebrew_text: קִיל?! וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ חֲמִיר! סַפּוֹקֵי מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ: זִיל הָכָא קָמְדַחֵי לֵיהּ, וְזִיל הָכָא קָמְדַחֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: less serious? But didn’t you, say more serious is uncertain he goes in this he rejects and he goes in that he rejects
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Kil?! Ve'ha amrati chamir! Sapukei mesapka lei: Zil hacha kamdachei lei, ve'zil hacha kamdachei lei. English translation: Kil?! But didn't you say chamir! Doubts are doubting it: Go here, it will be clarified for him, and go here, it will be clarified for him.

hebrew_text: מְצוֹרָע מַהוּ בְּתַשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְיָשַׁב מִחוּץ לְאׇהֳלוֹ״, שֶׁיְּהֵא כִּמְנוּדֶּה וּכְאָבֵל, וְאָסוּר בְּתַשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה. וְאֵין ״אׇהֳלוֹ״ אֶלָּא אִשְׁתּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֵךְ אֱמוֹר לָהֶם שׁוּבוּ לָכֶם לְאׇהֳלֵיכֶם״. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: What is a leper sexual relations? Come hear as it is taught “But he shall remain outside his tent that should be like one who is ostracized and like a mourner, and he is prohibited in sexual relations. only “his tent” his wife, as is stated “Go say to them, return again to your tents” learn from this
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Metzora, what is the case with regard to marital relations on the bed? Come and hear, as it was taught: 'And he shall dwell outside his tent,' that he should be like a mourner and like a nidui, and prohibited in marital relations on the bed. And 'his tent' refers only to his wife, as it is stated: 'Go, say to them, return to your tents.' Learn from it."

hebrew_text: וְנִיפְשׁוֹט נָמֵי לִמְנוּדֶּה? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב פִּנְחָס מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף: מִי קָתָנֵי שֶׁאָסוּר? שֶׁיְּהֵא כִּמְנוּדֶּה וּכְאָבֵל בְּמִילֵּי אַחְרָנְיָיתָא, וְאָסוּר נָמֵי בְּתַשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה.
human_translation: can we resolve one who is ostracized, Rav Huna, son of Rav Pineḥas, said in the name of Rav Yosef: Is it taught is prohibited It states he should be like one who is ostracized and like a mourner, with regard to other things, and in addition he is prohibited sexual relations.
llm_translation: And will he be permitted to engage in marital relations? Rav Huna, son of Rav Pinchas, in the name of Rav Yosef, said: Who taught that it is prohibited? That he should be like one who is under a ban and like a mourner in matters of intimacy, and it is prohibited to engage in marital relations.

hebrew_text: אָבֵל אֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּחַ קׇרְבְּנוֹתָיו, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: ״שְׁלָמִים״ — בִּזְמַן שֶׁהוּא שָׁלֵם, וְלֹא בִּזְמַן שֶׁהוּא אוֹנֵן.
human_translation: A mourner may not send his offerings as it is taught Rabbi Shimon says: A peace [ shelamim ] at a time when he is whole [ shalem ] but not at a time when he is an acute mourner,
llm_translation: Mourner not sends his sacrifices, as it was taught, Rabbi Shimon says: "Peace offerings" - when it is complete, and not when he is mourning.

hebrew_text: מְנוּדֶּה מַהוּ שֶׁיְּשַׁלַּח קׇרְבְּנוֹתָיו? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, תָּא שְׁמַע: כׇּל אוֹתָן שָׁנִים שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר מְנוּדִּין הָיוּ, וְשִׁלְּחוּ קׇרְבְּנוֹתֵיהֶן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְדִלְמָא מְנוּדֶּה לַשָּׁמַיִם שָׁאנֵי, דְּקִיל?
human_translation: What is one who is ostracized sending his offerings Rav Yosef said: Come hear All those years that the Jewish people were in the wilderness they were ostracized, and they sent their offerings. Abaye said to him: Perhaps one who is ostracized by Heaven is different, as that is less serious
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the meaning of "that he shall send his offerings"? Rav Yosef said, come and hear: All those years that the Israelites were in the wilderness, they were rebellious, yet they sent their offerings. Abbaye said to him: Perhaps rebellion towards heaven is different, for it is light?

hebrew_text: קִיל?! וְהָאָמְרַתְּ חֲמִיר? סַפּוֹקֵי מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ וּמְדַחֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: less serious? But certainly you, said more serious is uncertain he rejects
llm_translation: "Kil?! And you said 'chamir'? Doubts are doubtful to him and he pushes it away."

hebrew_text: מְצוֹרָע מַהוּ שֶׁיְּשַׁלַּח קׇרְבְּנוֹתָיו? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְאַחֲרֵי טׇהֳרָתוֹ״ — אַחַר פְּרִישָׁתוֹ מִן הַמֵּת, ״שִׁבְעַת יָמִים יִסְפְּרוּ לוֹ״ — אֵלּוּ שִׁבְעַת יְמֵי סְפִירוֹ, ״וּבְיוֹם בֹּאוֹ אֶל הַקּוֹדֶשׁ אֶל הֶחָצֵר הַפְּנִימִית לְשָׁרֵת בַּקּוֹדֶשׁ יַקְרִיב חַטָּאתוֹ״ —
human_translation: What is a leper sending his offerings Come hear as it is taught “And after he is purified”; after he has separated from deceased “They shall count for him seven days”; these are the seven days of his counting “And on the day that he goes into the Sanctuary, into the inner court, to minister in the Sanctuary, he shall sacrifice his sin
llm_translation: Afflicted individual, what is the procedure for sending his sacrifices? Come and hear, as it was taught: "And after his cleansing" - after his separation from the dead, "seven days they shall count for him" - these are the seven days of his counting, "and on the day that he comes to the sanctuary, to the inner courtyard, to serve in the sanctuary, he shall bring his sin offering."

hebrew_text: זוֹ עֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה שֶׁלּוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: this is a tenth of an ephah the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: This is one-tenth of his ephah, the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: ״בְּבֹאוֹ יַקְרִיב״, בִּזְמַן שֶׁרָאוּי לְבִיאָה — רָאוּי לְהַקְרָבָה, בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵינוֹ רָאוּי לְבִיאָה — אֵינוֹ רָאוּי לְהַקְרָבָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: he goes into he shall sacrifice when he is fit to enter he is fit to sacrifice when he is not fit to go into he is not fit to sacrifice
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "When he comes to offer," at a time when it is fitting for bringing - it is fitting for offering; at a time when it is not fitting for bringing - it is not fitting for offering.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מְנָלַן דִּמְשַׁדְּרִין שְׁלִיחָא דְּבֵי דִינָא וּמַזְמְנִינַן לֵיהּ לְדִינָא — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּשְׁלַח מֹשֶׁה לִקְרֹא לְדָתָן וְלַאֲבִירָם בְּנֵי אֱלִיאָב״. וּמְנָלַן דְּמַזְמְנִינַן לְדִינָא — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר מֹשֶׁה אֶל קֹרַח אַתָּה וְכׇל עֲדָתְךָ״.
human_translation: Rava said: From where do we that a court agent is sent to summon to court As it is written: “And Moses sent to call Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab” And from where do we that we summon court? As it is written: “And Moses said to Korah: Be you and all your congregation
llm_translation: Rava said: From where do we know that we appoint a messenger of the court and summon him to court? As it is written: "And Moses sent to call Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab." And from where do we know that we summon to court? As it is written: "And Moses said to Korah, 'You and all your congregation.'"

hebrew_text: לְקַמֵּי גַּבְרָא רַבָּה — דִּכְתִיב: ״לִפְנֵי ה׳״. אַתְּ וּפְלָנְיָא — דִּכְתִיב: ״אַתָּה וָהֵם וְאַהֲרֹן״. דְּקָבְעִינַן זִימְנָא — דִּכְתִיב: ״מָחָר״. זִימְנָא בָּתַר זִימְנָא — דִּכְתִיב: ״קָרְאוּ שָׁם פַּרְעֹה מֶלֶךְ מִצְרַיִם שָׁאוֹן הֶעֱבִיר הַמּוֹעֵד״.
human_translation: before a great man? As it is written: before the Lord” You and so-and-so, As it is written: “You, and they, and Aaron” that we set a date As it is written: “Tomorrow” date after date, As it is written: “They did cry there, Pharaoh, king of Egypt is but a noise; he has passed the time appointed…
llm_translation: Before a man great — as it is written: "before the Lord." You and so-and-so — as it is written: "you and they and Aaron." When we establish a time — as it is written: "tomorrow." One time after another time — as it is written: "Pharaoh king of Egypt called out the noise; he has let the appointed time pass."

hebrew_text: וּמְנָלַן דְּאִי מִתְפַּקַּר בִּשְׁלִיחָא דְּבֵי דִינָא, וְאָתֵי וְאָמַר, לָא מִיתְחֲזֵי כְּלִישָּׁנָא בִּישָׁא — דִּכְתִיב: ״הַעֵינֵי הָאֲנָשִׁים הָהֵם תְּנַקֵּר״.
human_translation: And from where do we that if behaves disrespectfully toward the agent of the court, and comes and reports this is not considered slander? As it is written: “Will you put out the eyes of these men?”
llm_translation: And from where do we know that if one is summoned by the court's messenger and he comes and says, "It does not appear like a vessel in a vessel" - as it is written: "The eyes of those men were blinded"?

hebrew_text: וּמְנָלַן דִּמְשַׁמְּתִינַן — דִּכְתִיב: ״אוֹרוּ מֵרוֹז״. דְּהָכִי סְבָרָא דְּגַבְרָא רַבָּה — דִּכְתִיב: ״אָמַר מַלְאַךְ ה׳״. וּמְנָלַן דְּמַחְרְמִינַן — דִּכְתִיב: ״אוֹרוּ אָרוֹר״.
human_translation: And from where do we that we ostracize As it is written: “Curse Meroz” that it the decision of a great man As it is written: said the messenger of the Lord” And from where do we that, we excommunicate As it is written: curse bitterly
llm_translation: And from where do we derive that we compare the punishment of a thief to the punishment of a rose? For it is written: "His light shall be put out" (Job 18:5). This is the opinion of Rabba, for it is written: "The angel of the Lord said" (Numbers 22:35). And from where do we derive that we excommunicate a thief? For it is written: "Cursed be his light" (Job 18:18).

hebrew_text: דְּאָכֵיל וְשָׁתֵי בַּהֲדֵיהּ וְקָאֵי בְּאַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת דִּידֵיהּ — דִּכְתִיב: ״יוֹשְׁבֶיהָ״. וּמְנָלַן דְּפָרְטִינַן חִטְאֵיהּ בְּצִיבּוּרָא — דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי לֹא בָאוּ לְעֶזְרַת ה׳״.
human_translation: that eats or drinks with, or stands within, four cubits of As it is written: its inhabitants” And from where do we that we detail his sin in public? As it is written: because they did not come to the help of the Lord”
llm_translation: He eats and drinks simultaneously and stands within his four cubits— as it is written: "its inhabitants." And how do we know that one can specify his sins in public? — as it is written: "for they did not come to the aid of the Lord."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר עוּלָּא: בְּאַרְבַּע מְאָה שִׁיפּוּרֵי שַׁמְּתֵיהּ בָּרָק לְמֵרוֹז. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי גַּבְרָא רַבָּה הֲוָה, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי כּוֹכְבָא הֲוָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִן שָׁמַיִם נִלְחָמוּ הַכּוֹכָבִים״.
human_translation: And Ulla said: Barak ostracized Meroz with four hundred shofarot some say he was a great man And others say a star as it is stated: “The stars fought from heaven;
llm_translation: And Ula said: With four hundred ships he placed it in the sky. Some say it was a great man, and some say it was a star, as it is said: "The stars fought from heaven."

hebrew_text: וּמְנָלַן דְּמַפְקְרִינַן נִכְסֵיהּ — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכׇל אֲשֶׁר לֹא יָבֹא לִשְׁלֹשֶׁת הַיָּמִים בַּעֲצַת הַשָּׂרִים וְהַזְּקֵנִים יׇחֳרַם כׇּל רְכוּשׁוֹ וְהוּא יִבָּדֵל מִקְּהַל הַגּוֹלָה״.
human_translation: And from where do we that may declare the property of as ownerless? As it is written: “And that whoever would not come within three days, according to the counsel of the princes and the Elders, all his substance shall be forfeited [ yaḥoram ] and himself separated from the congregation of the exiles”
llm_translation: And from where do we derive that we confiscate his property? As it is written: "And whoever would not come within three days, by the counsel of the princes and the elders, all his substance should be forfeited, and he himself separated from the congregation of the captivity."

hebrew_text: וּמְנָלַן דְּנָצֵינַן וְלָיְיטִינַן וּמָחֵינַן וְתָלְשִׁינַן שֵׂיעָר וּמַשְׁבְּעִינַן — דִּכְתִיב: ״וָאָרִיב עִמָּם וָאֲקַלְלֵם וָאַכֶּה מֵהֶם אֲנָשִׁים וָאֶמְרְטֵם וָאַשְׁבִּיעֵם״.
human_translation: And from where do we that we may contend with and curse and beat and pull out hair, and make take an oath As it is written: “And I contended with them, and cursed them, and beat some of them, and pulled out their hair, and made them take oath
llm_translation: And from where do we derive that we warn, and admonish, and scourge, and excommunicate a member of the community? For it is written: "And I contended with them, and cursed them, and smote certain of them, and plucked off their hair, and made them swear" (Nehemiah 13:25).

hebrew_text: וּמְנָלַן דְּכָפְתִינַן וְאָסְרִינַן וְעָבְדִינַן הַרְדָּפָה — דִּכְתִיב: ״הֵן לְמוֹת הֵן לִשְׁרוֹשִׁי הֵן לַעֲנָשׁ נִכְסִין וְלַאֲסוּרִין״. מַאי לִשְׁרוֹשִׁי? אָמַר אַדָּא מָרִי אָמַר נְחֶמְיָה בַּר בָּרוּךְ אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הַרְדָּפָה. מַאי הַרְדָּפָה? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר שִׁילַת מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: מְנַדִּין לְאַלְתַּר, וְשׁוֹנִין לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים, וּמַחְרִימִין לְאַחַר שִׁשִּׁים.
human_translation: And from where do we that we may shackle chain and apply pressure? As it is written: “Whether it be for death, or for banishment [ lishroshi ], or for confiscation of goods, or for imprisonment” What “ lishroshi ,” Adda Mari said Neḥemya bar Baruch said Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin said Rav Yehuda said: pressure. What pressure? Rav Yehuda, son of Rav Shmuel bar Sheilat, said in the name of Rav They ostracize immediately, and again after thirty they excommunicate him after sixty
llm_translation: And from where do we derive that we fine, prohibit, and pursue? As it is written: "If it be for death, or for some other matter, no matter whether it be for oxen or for sheep, or for clothing, or for any manner of lost thing, which another challengeth to be his." What is meant by "for some other matter"? Adai Mari said in the name of Nechemyah bar Baruch, who said in the name of Rav Chiya bar Avin, who said in the name of Rav Yehudah: Pursuit. What is meant by pursuit? Rav Yehudah, son of Rav Shmuel bar Shilat, said in the name of Rav: We fine immediately, we warn after thirty days, and we excommunicate after sixty days.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִינָּנָא, הָכִי אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מַתְרִין בֵּיהּ שֵׁנִי וַחֲמִישִׁי וְשֵׁנִי. הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְמָמוֹנָא, אֲבָל לְאַפְקֵירוּתָא — לְאַלְתַּר.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Ḥinnana said to him: Rav Ḥisda said as follows: warns him Monday, Thursday, and Monday. This applies a monetary judgment But behaves disrespectfully immediately
llm_translation: He said to him Rav Huna son of Chinena, thus said Rav Chisda: "Permitting the second and the fifth, and the second." These words are regarding money matters, but for charity - immediately.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא טַבָּחָא דְּאִיתְפַּקַּר בְּרַב טוֹבִי בַּר מַתְנָה, אִימְּנוֹ עֲלֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא וְשַׁמְּתוּהוּ, לְסוֹף אֲזַל פַּיְּיסֵיהּ לְבַעַל דִּינֵיהּ. אֲמַר אַבָּיֵי: הֵיכִי לֶיעְבֵּיד? לִישְׁרֵי לֵיהּ — לָא חַל שַׁמְתָּא עֲלֵיהּ תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין. לָא לִישְׁרֵי לֵיהּ — קָא בָּעוּ רַבָּנַן לְמֵיעַל.
human_translation: a certain butcher behaved disrespectfully toward Rav Tuvi bar Mattana. Abaye and Rava were appointed and ostracized him. In the end went and appeased his disputant, Abaye said: What should we do he be released His ostracism has not been in effect for thirty days. shall he not be released the Sages wish to enter
llm_translation: The butcher who was appointed in the city of Tovi bar Matna, they trusted him to Abaye and Rava, and they appointed him. In the end, he went to reconcile with his creditor. Abaye said: How should we act? If we straighten it out for him - it will not take more than thirty days. If we do not straighten it out for him - the Rabbis are seeking to harm him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְרַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין: מִידֵּי שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ בְּהָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַב תַּחְלִיפָא בַּר אֲבִימִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: טוּט אָסַר וְטוּט שָׁרֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְמָמוֹנָא, אֲבָל לְאַפְקֵירוּתָא — עַד דְּחָיְילָא שַׁמְתָּא עֲלֵיהּ תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין.
human_translation: He said to Rav Idi bar Avin: you heard anything with regard to such said to Rav Taḥlifa bar Avimi said Shmuel said as follows: blast makes binding, and blast releases said to him: This applies a monetary judgment but behaves disrespectfully, until the ostracism has been in effect for thirty days.
llm_translation: He said to Rav Idi bar Avin: Have you heard this? He said to him: Thus said Rav Tahalifa bar Avimi said in the name of Shmuel: A tot that is forbidden and a tot that is permitted. He said to him: Those matters are regarding money, but regarding property — until you place a guard over it for thirty days.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא קָסָבַר אַבָּיֵי: הָנֵי בֵּי תְלָתָא דְּשַׁמִּיתוּ — לָא אָתוּ תְּלָתָא אַחֲרִינֵי וְשָׁרוּ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Apparently, Abaye maintains three ostracized three others may not come and release him.
llm_translation: The text reads: "Alma kasavra Abbayei: hanei bei t'lata d'shammitu - la atu t'lata acharinei v'sharu lei." Translation: "The Gemara suggests: those three students who were executed did not come to three others and teach them."

hebrew_text: דְּאִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הָנֵי בֵּי תְלָתָא דְּשַׁמִּיתוּ, מַהוּ לְמֵיתֵי תְּלָתָא אַחֲרִינֵי וְשָׁרוּ לֵיהּ? תָּא שְׁמַע: מְנוּדֶּה לָרַב — מְנוּדֶּה לַתַּלְמִיד, מְנוּדֶּה לַתַּלְמִיד — אֵינוֹ מְנוּדֶּה לָרַב.
human_translation: As a dilemma was raised before three ostracized what is three others coming and releasing him Come hear One who was ostracized by the teacher is ostracized with regard to the student, one who was ostracized by the student is not ostracized with regard to the teacher.
llm_translation: He wanted to say to them: Those three students who were excommunicated, what is the law regarding bringing in three others and permitting him? Come and hear: "A reviler to a judge - a reviler to a student, a reviler to a student - he is not a reviler to a judge."

hebrew_text: מְנוּדֶּה לְעִירוֹ — מְנוּדֶּה לְעִיר אַחֶרֶת, מְנוּדֶּה לְעִיר אַחֶרֶת — אֵינוֹ מְנוּדֶּה לְעִירוֹ. מְנוּדֶּה לַנָּשִׂיא — מְנוּדֶּה לְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל, מְנוּדֶּה לְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל — אֵינוֹ מְנוּדֶּה לַנָּשִׂיא. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד מִן הַתַּלְמִידִים שֶׁנִּידָּה וָמֵת — חֶלְקוֹ אֵינוֹ מוּפָר.
human_translation: One who was ostracized by his city is ostracized with regard to another city. one who was ostracized by another city is not ostracized with regard to his city. One who was ostracized by the Nasi is ostracized with regard to all the Jewish people; one who was ostracized by all the Jewish people is not ostracized with regard to the Nasi Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: one of the students had ostracized and he died his portion is not nullified.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Menudeh le'iro — menudeh le'ir acheret, menudeh le'ir acheret — einu menudeh le'iro. Menudeh lanasi — menudeh le'kol Yisrael, menudeh le'kol Yisrael — einu menudeh lanasi. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel omer: echad min hatalmidim she'nidah vamet — chelko einu mufar. English translation: A banishment for his city — a banishment for another city, a banishment for another city — is not a banishment for his city. A banishment for the leader — a banishment for all of Israel, a banishment for all of Israel — is not a banishment for the leader. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: One of the disciples who was excommunicated and died — his portion is not nullified.

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תְּלָת: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תַּלְמִיד שֶׁנִּידָּה לִכְבוֹדוֹ — נִידּוּיוֹ נִידּוּי, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד מֵיפֵר חֶלְקוֹ, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ הָנֵי בֵּי תְלָתָא דְּשַׁמִּיתוּ, לָא אָתוּ תְּלָתָא אַחֲרִינֵי וְשָׁרוּ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Learn three from this Learn from this a student who ostracizes due to his dignity his ostracism is valid. And learn from this each and every one nullifies his portion And learn from this three ostracized three other may not come and nullify
llm_translation: Listen to this conclusion: If a student who was excommunicated for his honor - his excommunication is valid. And listen to this conclusion: Each and every one nullifies his portion. And listen to this conclusion: Those three of the house of Shammitu did not come, three others came and permitted him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: הִלְכְתָא, הָנֵי בֵּי תְלָתָא דְּשַׁמִּיתוּ — אָתוּ בֵּי תְּלָתָא אַחֲרִינֵי וְשָׁרוּ לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְאַמֵּימָר: וְהָא תַּנְיָא, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד מִן הַתַּלְמִידִים שֶׁנִּידָּה וָמֵת — חֶלְקוֹ אֵינוֹ מוּפָר. מַאי לָאו, אֵינוֹ מוּפָר כְּלָל! לָא, עַד דְּאָתוּ בֵּי תְּלָתָא אַחֲרִינֵי וְשָׁרוּ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Ameimar said: The halakha is three ostracize three others may come and nullify Rav Ashi said to Ameimar: But isn’t it taught Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: one of the students had ostracized and he died his portion is not nullified? What, is it not it is not nullified at all, No, until three other people come and nullify
llm_translation: Amemar said: The halakha is that those three individuals who were excommunicated, another three individuals came and removed the excommunication from him. Rav Ashe said to Amemar: But isn't it taught in a baraita, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: If one of the disciples was excommunicated and died, his portion is not annulled. What is the reason that his portion is not annulled at all? No, until another three individuals came and removed the excommunication from him.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין נִידּוּי פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, וְאֵין נְזִיפָה פָּחוֹת מִשִּׁבְעָה יָמִים. וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין רְאָיָה לַדָּבָר, זֵכֶר לַדָּבָר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאָבִיהָ יָרֹק יָרַק בְּפָנֶיהָ הֲלֹא תִכָּלֵם שִׁבְעַת יָמִים״.
human_translation: The Sages taught Ostracism does not for less than thirty days, and admonition, does not for less than seven days. And although there is no proof with regard to the matter, an allusion to the matter, as it is stated: “If her father had but spit in her face, should she not be ashamed for seven days?”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A period of excommunication is not less than thirty days, and a period of flogging is not less than seven days. And even though there is no direct proof for this matter, it is a tradition, as it is stated: "And her father shall spit in her face; should she not be shamed seven days?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: נִידּוּי שֶׁלָּנוּ כִּנְזִיפָה שֶׁלָּהֶן, וּנְזִיפָה דִּידְהוּ שִׁבְעָה וְתוּ לָא. וְהָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּר רַבִּי וּבַר קַפָּרָא הֲווֹ יָתְבִי וְקָא גָרְסִי, קַשְׁיָא לְהוּ שְׁמַעְתָּא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לְבַר קַפָּרָא: דָּבָר זֶה צָרִיךְ רַבִּי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ בַּר קַפָּרָא לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: וּמָה רַבִּי אוֹמֵר בְּדָבָר זֶה?
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: Our ostracism of their admonition their admonition seven and no more? But isn’t Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi and bar Kappara were sitting and studying, a difficulty with halakha . Rabbi Shimon said to bar Kappara: This issue requires Rabbi Bar Kappara said to Rabbi Shimon, And what can Rabbi say about this
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisdah said: Our excommunication is like their excommunication, and their excommunication is sevenfold, and even more. Now, Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi and son of Kapara, were sitting and expounding. They heard a certain matter, Rabbi Shimon said to Bar Kapara: This matter requires investigation, Rabbi. Bar Kapara said to Rabbi Shimon: And what does Rabbi say about this matter?

hebrew_text: אֲזַל אֲמַר לֵיהּ לַאֲבוּהּ, אִיקְּפַד. אֲתָא בַּר קַפָּרָא לְאִיתְחֲזוֹיֵי לֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בַּר קַפָּרָא, אֵינִי מַכִּירְךָ מֵעוֹלָם! יְדַע דִּנְקַט מִילְּתָא בְּדַעְתֵּיהּ, נְהַג נְזִיפוּתָא בְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין.
human_translation: went and told his father, became angry bar Kappara came to visit, said to him: Bar Kappara, I do not know you at all. understood that had taken statement to heart, behaved admonished, for thirty days.
llm_translation: He went, said to his father, became angry. Came Bar Kappara to see him, said to him: Bar Kappara, I do not recognize you ever! Know that he took the matter to heart, he suffered anguish for thirty days.

hebrew_text: שׁוּב פַּעַם אֶחָד גָּזַר רַבִּי שֶׁלֹּא יִשְׁנוּ לַתַּלְמִידִים בַּשּׁוּק, מַאי דְּרַשׁ — ״חַמּוּקֵי יְרֵכַיִךְ כְּמוֹ חֲלָאִים״. מָה יָרֵךְ בַּסֵּתֶר,
human_translation: Once again, on another occasion, Rabbi decreed that students not be taught in the marketplace What expound “Your rounded thighs are like jewels, Just a thigh is hidden
llm_translation: Return. Once Rabbi decreed that students should not sleep in the market. What did he interpret? "The curves of your thighs are like jewels." What is a thigh in secret,

hebrew_text: אַף דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה בַּסֵּתֶר.
human_translation: so too, the words of Torah, hidden
llm_translation: Even the words of Torah in secret.

hebrew_text: יָצָא רַבִּי חִיָּיא וְשָׁנָה לִשְׁנֵי בְּנֵי אֶחָיו בַּשּׁוּק, לְרַב וּלְרַבָּה בַּר (בַּר) חָנָה. שְׁמַע רַבִּי, אִיקְּפַד. אֲתָא רַבִּי חִיָּיא לְאִיתְחֲזוֹיֵי לֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עִיָּיא, מִי קוֹרֵא לְךָ בַּחוּץ! יְדַע דִּנְקַט מִילְּתָא בְּדַעְתֵּיהּ, נְהַג נְזִיפוּתָא בְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya went out and taught his two nephews, Rav and Rabba bar bar Ḥana, in the marketplace. Rabbi heard became angry Rabbi Ḥiyya came to visit him, said to him: Iyya, who is calling you outside? understood that had taken the matter to heart he conducted admonished, for thirty days.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya went out and taught his two nephews in the marketplace, to Rav and to Rabbah bar (bar) Chana. "Listen, Rabbi," he rebuked. Rabbi Chiya came to see him, and said to him: "Iyya, who reads to you outside! Know that he has taken the matter to heart, and has been troubled for thirty days."

hebrew_text: בְּיוֹם תְּלָתִין שְׁלַח לֵיהּ: תָּא. הֲדַר שְׁלַח לֵיהּ דְּלָא לֵיתֵי.
human_translation: On the thirtieth day, sent him Come he later sent him not to come.
llm_translation: On the thirtieth day he sent to him: Come. He sent to him again because he did not come.

hebrew_text: מֵעִיקָּרָא מַאי סְבַר וּלְבַסּוֹף מַאי סְבַר? מֵעִיקָּרָא סָבַר: מִקְצָת הַיּוֹם כְּכוּלּוֹ. וּלְבַסּוֹף סָבַר: לָא אָמְרִינַן מִקְצָת הַיּוֹם כְּכוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: At the outset what did he hold, and ultimately what did he hold? Initially, held that part of the day is like of an entire But ultimately he held we do not say part of the day is like of an entire
llm_translation: From the outset, what does he hold, and in the end, what does he hold? From the outset, he holds: a part of the day is like the whole. And in the end, he holds: we do not say a part of the day is like the whole.

hebrew_text: לְסוֹף אֲתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי אֲתֵית? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּשָׁלַח לִי מָר דְּלֵיתֵי. וְהָא שְׁלַחִי לָךְ דְּלָא תֵּיתֵי! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זֶה רָאִיתִי, וְזֶה לֹא רָאִיתִי. קָרֵי עֲלֵיהּ: ״בִּרְצוֹת ה׳ דַּרְכֵי אִישׁ גַּם אוֹיְבָיו יַשְׁלִים אִתּוֹ״.
human_translation: In the end came asked him: Why have you come? responded: Because Master, sent I should come. But I sent that you should not come. He responded: This I saw but that I did not see. read about “When a man’s ways please the Lord, He makes even his enemies to be at peace with him”
llm_translation: At the end he came. He said to him: Why did you come? He said to him: Because my master sent me. But did he not send you so that you would not come? He said to him: This I saw, and this I did not see. He recited regarding him: "With the favor of the Lord, a man's ways are made pleasing even to his enemies."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא עֲבַד מָר הָכִי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״חׇכְמוֹת בַּחוּץ תָּרוֹנָּה״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִם קָרִיתָ — לֹא שָׁנִיתָ, וְאִם שָׁנִיתָ — לֹא שִׁילַּשְׁתָּ, וְאִם שִׁילַּשְׁתָּ — לֹא פֵּירְשׁוּ לְךָ.
human_translation: What is the reason that the Master, acted as said to him: As it is written: “Wisdom cries aloud in the streets” said to him: If you read you did not read a second time and if you read a second time, you did not read a third time; if you read a third time, it was not explained to you,
llm_translation: What is the reason that Master did so? He said to him, as it is written: "Wisdom calls aloud in the street." He said to him: If you have read it - you have not repeated it, and if you have repeated it - you have not explained it, and if you have explained it - they have not made it clear to you.

hebrew_text: ״חׇכְמוֹת בַּחוּץ תָּרוֹנָּה״, כִּדְרָבָא. דְּאָמַר רָבָא: כׇּל הָעוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה מִבִּפְנִים, תּוֹרָתוֹ מַכְרֶזֶת עָלָיו מִבַּחוּץ.
human_translation: “Wisdom cries aloud in the streets,” in accordance with of Rava. As Rava said: everyone who occupies himself with Torah inside his Torah will proclaim his outside,
llm_translation: "The wisdom in the street is despised," as Rava said: Rava said: Anyone who engages in Torah study internally, his Torah proclaims him externally.

hebrew_text: וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״לֹא מֵרֹאשׁ בַּסֵּתֶר דִּבַּרְתִּי״! הָהוּא בְּיוֹמֵי דְכַלָּה.
human_translation: But isn’t it written: “From the beginning I have not spoken in secret” That the days of the kalla ,
llm_translation: And is it not written: "Not from the beginning in secret I spoke"! That was in the days of Kalah.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא, הַאי ״חַמּוּקֵי יְרֵכַיִךְ״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵהּ? מוֹקֵי לֵהּ בִּצְדָקָה וּבִגְמִילוּת חֲסָדִים.
human_translation: And what did Rabbi Ḥiyya do with this “Your rounded thighs are like jewels”? He interprets it to charity and loving-kindness,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya said: What does the phrase "the folds of your thighs are like jewels" (Song of Songs 7:2) do for her? It adorns her with righteousness and acts of loving-kindness.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא נְזִיפָה דִּידְהוּ תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין! נְזִיפַת נָשִׂיא שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: that, apparently, admonition of those thirty days The admonition of the Nasi is different
llm_translation: The reprimand of ours thirty days! The reprimand of a prince is different.

hebrew_text: וּנְזִיפָה דִּידַן כַּמָּה הָוֵי? חַד יוֹמָא. כִּי הָא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל וּמָר עוּקְבָא, כִּי הֲווֹ יָתְבִי גָּרְסִי שְׁמַעְתָּא, הֲוָה יָתֵיב מָר עוּקְבָא קַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל בְּרָחוֹק אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת. וְכִי הֲווֹ יָתְבִי בְּדִינָא, הֲוָה יָתֵיב שְׁמוּאֵל קַמֵּיהּ דְּמָר עוּקְבָא בְּרָחוֹק אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת. וַהֲווֹ חָיְיקִי לֵיהּ דּוּכְתָּא לְמָר עוּקְבָא בְּצִיפְּתָא, וְיָתֵיב עִילָּוֵיהּ כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלִישְׁתַּמְעָן מִילֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And how is our admonition one day, as in Shmuel and Mar Ukva. When they would sit and study halakha , Mar Ukva would sit before Shmuel at a distance of four cubits And when they would sit in judgment, Shmuel would sit before Mar Ukva at a distance of four cubits But they would lower a place for Mar Ukva in the matting and he would sit on it so that he could hear words
llm_translation: Our sprinkling, how much should it be? One day. For this is like that which Shmuel and Mar Ukva, when they were sitting and learning, Mar Ukva was sitting four cubits away from Shmuel. And when they were sitting in judgment, Shmuel was sitting four cubits away from Mar Ukva. And they would stretch out a measuring line for Mar Ukva in the courtyard, and he would sit at its end so that he could hear his words.

hebrew_text: כׇּל יוֹמָא הֲוָה מְלַוִי לֵיהּ מָר עוּקְבָא לִשְׁמוּאֵל עַד אוּשְׁפִּיזֵיהּ. יוֹמָא חַד אִיטְּרִיד בְּדִינֵיהּ הֲוָה אָזֵיל שְׁמוּאֵל בָּתְרֵיהּ. כִּי מְטָא לְבֵיתֵיהּ, אָמַר לֵיהּ: לָא נְגַהּ לָךְ? לִישְׁרֵי לִי מָר בְּתִיגְרֵיהּ! יְדַע דִּנְקַט מִילְּתָא בְּדַעְתֵּיהּ, נְהַג נְזִיפוּתָא בְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ חַד יוֹמָא.
human_translation: Every day, Mar Ukva would accompany Shmuel to his lodgings, One day, was preoccupied with a case Shmuel was walking behind him When reached his home, said to him: Is it not enough for you Release me, Master, from my obligation, understood that had taken the matter to heart he conducted admonished, for one day
llm_translation: Every day, Mar Ukva would accompany Shmuel until his doorstep. One day, when he was delayed in his judgments, Shmuel went ahead of him. When he arrived home, he said to him: "Have you not escorted me? Accompany me, Mar, to your home!" He knew that a matter had been decided in his mind, so he expressed anger within himself one day.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא דַּהֲווֹת יָתְבָה בִּשְׁבִילָא, הֲווֹת פָּשְׁטָה כַּרְעַהּ וְקָא מְנִיפָה חוּשְׁלָאֵי, וַהֲוָה חָלֵיף וְאָזֵיל צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן וְלָא אִיכַּנְעָה מִקַּמֵּיהּ. אֲמַר: כַּמָּה חַצִּיפָא הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא! אֲתַאי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן. אֲמַר לַהּ: מִי שְׁמַעְתְּ שַׁמְתָּא מִפּוּמֵּיהּ? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: לָא. אֲמַר לַהּ: זִילִי נְהוּגִי נְזִיפוּתָא חַד יוֹמָא בְּנַפְשִׁיךְ.
human_translation: a certain woman was sitting alongside a path her leg extended she was sifting barley. A Torah scholar passed but she did not yield to him He said: How rude is that woman! came before Rav Naḥman He said to her: Did you hear excommunication from his mouth? She said to him: No. He said to her: go and observe an admonition for one day,
llm_translation: That woman who used to sit in Shevilah, she would spread out her leg and wave her menstrual blood. And she would walk around and go to the study hall of the Rabbis, and she would not be embarrassed before them. They said: How brazen is that woman! She came before Rav Nachman. He said to her: Have you heard that you are causing harm with your actions? She said to him: No. He said to her: Go and practice modesty for one day on your own.

hebrew_text: זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה הֲוָה קָפָסֵיק סִידְרָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה, כִּי מְטָא לְהַאי פְּסוּקָא ״וְאֵלֶּה דִּבְרֵי דָוִד הָאַחֲרוֹנִים״, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״אַחֲרוֹנִים״ — מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא רִאשׁוֹנִים, רִאשׁוֹנִים מַאי נִינְהוּ?
human_translation: Zutra bar Toviyya was reading the portion before Rav Yehuda. When he reached the verse: “Now these are the last words of David” said to last by inference there are first what are these first
llm_translation: Zutra bar Tobiah was sitting in front of Rav Yehudah, when he came to this verse "And these are the last words of David," he said to him: "Last words" — from the fact that there are first words, what are the first words?

hebrew_text: שְׁתֵיק וְלָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי, הֲדַר אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״אַחֲרוֹנִים״, מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא רִאשׁוֹנִים, רִאשׁוֹנִים מַאי הִיא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי דַּעְתָּךְ, דְּלָא יָדַע פֵּירוּשָׁא דְּהַאי קְרָא לָאו גַּבְרָא רַבָּה הוּא? יְדַע דִּנְקַט מִילְּתָא בְּדַעְתֵּיהּ, נְהַג נְזִיפוּתָא בְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ חַד יוֹמָא.
human_translation: remained silent and said nothing to him. then said to him last by inference there are first what are these first He said to him: What do you think? who does not know the meaning of this verse is not a great man? understood that had taken the matter to heart he conducted admonished for one day
llm_translation: He was silent and did not say to him, and not immediately, he then said to him: "Later ones," from the inference that there are earlier ones, what are the earlier ones? He said to him: What is your opinion, that he did not know the explanation of this verse, is he not a great man? He knew that the matter was taken to heart, he conducted self-reproach within himself for one day.

hebrew_text: וְדַאֲתָן עֲלַהּ, מִיהָא ״אַחֲרוֹנִים״ — מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא רִאשׁוֹנִים, רִאשׁוֹנִים מַאי הִיא? ״וַיְדַבֵּר דָּוִד לַה׳ אֶת דִּבְרֵי הַשִּׁירָה הַזֹּאת בְּיוֹם הִצִּיל ה׳ אוֹתוֹ מִכַּף כׇּל אוֹיְבָיו וּמִכַּף שָׁאוּל״.
human_translation: But that we have come last by inference there are first What are these first “And David spoke to the Lord the words of this song in the day that the Lord delivered him out of the hand of his enemies, and out of the hand of Saul”
llm_translation: And the opinion is raised, from where "later ones" — from the inclusive category of "earlier ones," what is "earlier ones"? "And David spoke to the Lord the words of this song on the day that the Lord delivered him from the hand of all his enemies and from the hand of Saul."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְדָוִד: דָּוִד, שִׁירָה אַתָּה אוֹמֵר עַל מַפַּלְתּוֹ שֶׁל שָׁאוּל? אִלְמָלֵי אַתָּה שָׁאוּל וְהוּא דָּוִד — אִיבַּדְתִּי כַּמָּה דָּוִד מִפָּנָיו.
human_translation: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to David: David, do you recite a song over the fall of Saul? Had you been Saul and he were David, I would have destroyed many Davids before him.
llm_translation: The Holy One, blessed be He, said to David: David, are you singing about the downfall of Saul? If you were Saul and he was David, how much more would I have protected David from him.

hebrew_text: הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״שִׁגָּיוֹן לְדָוִד אֲשֶׁר שָׁר לַה׳ עַל דִּבְרֵי כוּשׁ בֶּן יְמִינִי״, וְכִי כּוּשׁ שְׁמוֹ? וַהֲלֹא שָׁאוּל שְׁמוֹ! אֶלָּא: מָה כּוּשִׁי מְשׁוּנֶּה בְּעוֹרוֹ — אַף שָׁאוּל מְשׁוּנֶּה בְּמַעֲשָׂיו.
human_translation: is as it is written: “Shiggaion of David, which he sang to the Lord, concerning the words of Cush the Benjaminite” Is Cush his name? Saul is his name. Rather, Just as a Cushite, is distinguished by his skin, so too, Saul was distinguished by his actions,
llm_translation: That is as it is written: "A prayer of David. Hear my cry, O God; attend unto my prayer. From the end of the earth will I call unto Thee, when my heart fainteth; lead me to a rock that is too high for me." (Psalms 61:2-3) And is Kush his name? Is not Shaul his name? Rather, just as a Kushite is distinguished by his skin, so too Shaul is distinguished by his deeds.

hebrew_text: כַּיּוֹצֵא בַּדָּבָר אַתָּה אוֹמֵר: ״עַל אוֹדוֹת הָאִשָּׁה הַכּוּשִׁית אֲשֶׁר לָקָח״, וְכִי כּוּשִׁית שְׁמָהּ? וַהֲלֹא צִיפּוֹרָה שְׁמָהּ! אֶלָּא: מָה כּוּשִׁית מְשׁוּנָּה בְּעוֹרָהּ — אַף צִיפּוֹרָה מְשׁוּנָּה בְּמַעֲשֶׂיהָ. כַּיּוֹצֵא בַּדָּבָר אַתָּה אוֹמֵר: ״וַיִּשְׁמַע עֶבֶד מֶלֶךְ הַכּוּשִׁי״, וְכִי כּוּשִׁי שְׁמוֹ? וַהֲלֹא צִדְקִיָּה שְׁמוֹ! אֶלָּא: מָה כּוּשִׁי מְשׁוּנֶּה בְּעוֹרוֹ — אַף צִדְקִיָּה מְשׁוּנֶּה בְּמַעֲשָׂיו.
human_translation: Similarly, you can explain due to the Cushite woman whom he had married, But is her name Cushite? Zipporah is her name. Rather, just as a Cushite is distinguished by his skin, so too, Zipporah was distinguished by her actions. Similarly, you can explain “Now when Ebed-Melech the Cushite heard” Is his name Cushite? Zedekiah is his name. Rather, just as a Cushite is distinguished by his skin, so too, Zedekiah was distinguished by his actions.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "As an example in this matter, you say: 'concerning the ornaments of the Cushite woman he took,' but is her name Cushite? Is it not Zipporah her name! Rather, just as the Cushite woman is distinguished by her skin — so too Zipporah is distinguished by her actions. As an example in this matter, you say: 'and the servant of the king of Cush heard,' but is his name Cushite? Is it not Zedekiah his name! Rather, just as the Cushite is distinguished by his skin — so too Zedekiah is distinguished by his actions."

hebrew_text: כַּיּוֹצֵא בַּדָּבָר אַתָּה אוֹמֵר: ״הֲלֹא כִבְנֵי כוּשִׁיִּים אַתֶּם לִי בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל״, וְכִי כּוּשִׁיִּים שְׁמָן? וַהֲלֹא יִשְׂרָאֵל שְׁמָן! אֶלָּא: מָה כּוּשִׁי מְשׁוּנֶּה בְּעוֹרוֹ — אַף יִשְׂרָאֵל מְשׁוּנִּין בְּמַעֲשֵׂיהֶן מִכׇּל הָאוּמּוֹת.
human_translation: Similarly, you can explain “Are you not as much Mine as the children of the Cushites, O children of Israel?” Is their name Cushite? Israel is their name. Rather, just as a Cushite is distinguished by his skin, so too, the Jewish people are distinguished by their actions, from all the nations.
llm_translation: In a similar vein, you say: "Are you not like the Cushites to Me, O children of Israel," but are the Cushites named? Are not the Israelites named! Rather, just as the Cushite is distinguished by his skin, so too are the Israelites distinguished by their deeds from all the nations.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״נְאֻם דָּוִד בֶּן יִשַׁי וּנְאֻם הַגֶּבֶר הוּקַם עָל״ — נְאֻם דָּוִד בֶּן יִשַׁי שֶׁהֵקִים עוּלָּהּ שֶׁל תְּשׁוּבָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: What is which is written: “The saying of David, son of Yishai, and the saying of the man who was raised up on high [ al ]” The saying of David, son of Yishai, who raised the yoke of [ ulla ] repentance,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan, what is the meaning of what is written: "The saying of David, the son of Jesse, and the saying of the man who was raised on high" - the saying of David, the son of Jesse, who established the yoke of repentance.

hebrew_text: ״אָמַר אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לִי דִבֶּר צוּר יִשְׂרָאֵל מוֹשֵׁל בָּאָדָם צַדִּיק מוֹשֵׁל יִרְאַת אֱלֹהִים״. מַאי קָאָמַר? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אָמַר אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, לִי דִבֶּר צוּר יִשְׂרָאֵל, אֲנִי מוֹשֵׁל בָּאָדָם, מִי מוֹשֵׁל בִּי — צַדִּיק, שֶׁאֲנִי גּוֹזֵר גְּזֵרָה וּמְבַטְּלָהּ.
human_translation: “The God of Israel said, the Rock of Israel spoke to me, He that rules over men must be righteous, ruling in the fear of God” What is saying? Rabbi Abbahu said: This is what is saying: The God of Israel said, the Rock of Israel spoke to me: I rule over man, who rules over Me? a righteous person. As I, issue a decree nullifies it.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text states: "God of Israel said, 'The Rock of Israel spoke to me: A ruler over mankind, a righteous ruler who rules in the fear of God.'" What is it saying? Rabbi Avahu said: This is what it means: God of Israel said, 'The Rock of Israel spoke to me: I rule over mankind, who rules over me? The righteous one, for I decree a decree and nullify it.'

hebrew_text: ״אֵלֶּה שְׁמוֹת הַגִּבּוֹרִים אֲשֶׁר לְדָוִד יוֹשֵׁב בַּשֶּׁבֶת וְגוֹ׳״. מַאי קָאָמַר? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, הָכִי קָאָמַר: וְאֵלֶּה שְׁמוֹת גְּבוּרוֹתָיו שֶׁל דָּוִד.
human_translation: “These are the names of David’s warriors; Josheb-Basshebeth What is saying? Rabbi Abbahu said: This is what is saying: These are the names of the mighty actions of David.
llm_translation: "These are the names of the mighty men who were with David, who sat with him." What is it saying? Rabbi Abbahu said, thus it is saying: "And these are the names of his mighty men of David."

hebrew_text: ״יוֹשֵׁב בַּשֶּׁבֶת״ — בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהָיָה יוֹשֵׁב בִּישִׁיבָה, לֹא הָיָה יוֹשֵׁב עַל גַּבֵּי כָּרִים וּכְסָתוֹת אֶלָּא עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע. דְּכֹל כַּמָּה דַּהֲוָה רַבֵּיהּ עִירָא הַיָּאִירִי קַיָּים, הֲוָה מַתְנֵי לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן עַל גַּבֵּי כָּרִים וּכְסָתוֹת. כִּי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ, הֲוָה מַתְנִי דָּוִד לְרַבָּנַן וַהֲוָה יָתֵיב עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לִיתֵּיב מָר אַכָּרִים וּכְסָתוֹת! לָא קַבֵּיל עֲלֵיהּ.
human_translation: Josheb-Basshebeth [ yoshev bashevet ] when would sit [ yoshev ] in the study hall, he would not sit upon pillows and cushions, Rather, on the ground For as long as teacher, Ira the Jairite, was alive, would teach the Sages on pillows and cushions. When passed away, David would teach the Sages, and he sitting on the ground. They said to him: Master, should sit upon pillows and blankets. He did not accept
llm_translation: "Yoshev bashevet" - at the time when he was sitting in session, he was not sitting on cushions and pillows, but rather on the ground. Whenever his teacher, Rabbi Hiyya the Great, was present, he would spread cushions and pillows for the Rabbis to sit on. When he felt comfortable, he would spread a mat for himself and sit on the ground. They said to him: "Master, should you not sit on cushions and pillows?" He did not accept their suggestion.

hebrew_text: ״תַּחְכְּמוֹנִי״, אָמַר רַב: אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, הוֹאִיל וְהִשְׁפַּלְתָּ עַצְמְךָ תְּהֵא כָּמוֹנִי. שֶׁאֲנִי גּוֹזֵר גְּזֵרָה, וְאַתָּה מְבַטְּלָהּ.
human_translation: “a Tahchemonite [ taḥkemoni ].” Rav said: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to him: Since you have humbled yourself, be you like Me [ tehe kamoni ]. As I issue a decree, and you, may nullify it.
llm_translation: "Tachkemoni," said Rav: The Holy One, blessed be He, said to him, "Since you have humbled yourself, you shall be like Me. For I decree a decree, and you nullify it."

hebrew_text: ״רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁלִישִׁים״ — תְּהֵא רֹאשׁ לִשְׁלֹשֶׁת אָבוֹת. ״הוּא עֲדִינוֹ הָעֶצְנִי״, כְּשֶׁהָיָה יוֹשֵׁב וְעוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה — הָיָה מְעַדֵּן עַצְמוֹ כְּתוֹלַעַת, וּבְשָׁעָה שֶׁיּוֹצֵא לַמִּלְחָמָה — הָיָה מַקְשֶׁה עַצְמוֹ כְּעֵץ.
human_translation: “chief of the captains [ rosh hashalishim ]” You will be the head [ rosh ] of the three [ sheloshet ] Patriarchs. “The same was Adino the Eznite”; when would sit and occupy himself with Torah, he would make himself soft [ me’aden ] as a worm, and when he would go out to war, he would make himself hard as a tree [ etz ].
llm_translation: "The head of the third division should be the head of the three fathers. 'He was delicate and sinewy,' when he would sit and engage in Torah study - he would make himself delicate as a worm, and when he would go out to battle - he would make himself hard as wood."

hebrew_text: ״עַל שְׁמוֹנֶה מֵאוֹת חָלָל בְּפַעַם אֶחָת״. שֶׁהָיָה זוֹרֵק חֵץ, וּמַפִּיל שְׁמוֹנֶה מֵאוֹת חָלָל בְּפַעַם אֶחָת, וְהָיָה מִתְאַנֵּחַ עַל מָאתַיִם, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֵיכָה יִרְדֹּף אֶחָד אֶלֶף״.
human_translation: “Against eight hundred people, which he slew at one time,” that he would throw an arrow and kill eight hundred people at one time. And would sigh over the two hundred as it is written: “How should one man chase a thousand”
llm_translation: "On eight hundred slain in one time." He would shoot an arrow, and cause eight hundred slain in one time, and he would rejoice over two hundred, as it is written: "How could one chase a thousand."

hebrew_text: יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: ״רַק בִּדְבַר אוּרִיָּה הַחִתִּי״.
human_translation: A Divine Voice issued forth and said save only the matter of Uriah the Hittite”
llm_translation: A voice came forth and said: "Only with the word of Uriah the Hittite."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא אִישׁ כְּפַר עַכּוֹ, אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אַחָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׂמְלַאי. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ, אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם אָמַר רַב הוּנָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא לְחוֹדֵיהּ:
human_translation: Rabbi Tanḥum, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, of the village of Akko, said Rabbi Ya’akov bar Aḥa said Rabbi Simlai said, and say Rabbi Tanḥum said Rav Huna said, and say Rav Huna himself
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Tanhum son of Rabbi Hiyya, a man of Kefar Akko, said Rabbi Yaakov son of Acha said Rabbi Simlai. And some say, Rabbi Tanhum said Rabbi Huna said, and some say Rabbi Huna said in his name:

hebrew_text: תַּלְמִיד שֶׁנִּידָּה לִכְבוֹדוֹ — נִדּוּיוֹ נִידּוּי, דְּתַנְיָא: מְנוּדֶּה לָרַב — מְנוּדֶּה לַתַּלְמִיד, מְנוּדֶּה לַתַּלְמִיד — אֵינוֹ מְנוּדֶּה לָרַב. לָרַב הוּא דְּאֵינוֹ מְנוּדֶּה, הָא לְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא — מְנוּדֶּה.
human_translation: a student ostracized due to his dignity, his ostracism is valid, as it is taught One who is ostracized by the teacher is ostracized with regard to the student. one who is ostracized by the student is not ostracized with regard to the teacher. He is not ostracized with regard to the teacher, that he is ostracized with regard to everyone
llm_translation: A student who is shamed for his honor - his shaming is a shaming, as it was taught: One who shames the teacher - shames the student, one who shames the student - is not shaming the teacher. It is the teacher who is not shamed, but in the eyes of everyone else - it is a shaming.

hebrew_text: לְמַאי? אִי בְּמִילֵּי דִשְׁמַיָּא — ״אֵין חׇכְמָה וְאֵין תְּבוּנָה וְאֵין עֵצָה לְנֶגֶד ה׳״! אֶלָּא לָאו, לִכְבוֹד עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: For what If for a matter relating to Heaven, “There is no wisdom or understanding or counsel against the Lord” Rather, is it not to his dignity?
llm_translation: For what? If in matters of Heaven - "There is no wisdom, no understanding, no counsel against the Lord!" But rather, not for His own honor.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן עָבֵיד דִּינָא לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ בְּמִילְּתָא דִּפְסִיקָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: A Torah scholar may execute judgment for himself with regard to a matter about which he is certain,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: A student who is sharp makes a legal decision for himself in a matter that is clear to him.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן דַּהֲווֹ סְנוּ שׁוּמְעָנֵיהּ, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הֵיכִי לֶיעְבֵּיד? לְשַׁמְּתֵיהּ — צְרִיכִי לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן, לָא לְשַׁמְּתֵיהּ — קָא מִיתְּחִיל שְׁמָא דִשְׁמַיָּא.
human_translation: There was a certain Torah scholar who gained a bad reputation Rav Yehuda said: What should be done? To excommunicate him The Sages need him, Not to excommunicate him the name of Heaven would be desecrated.
llm_translation: That certain elder student of the Sages who were strict in guarding his reputation, Rav Yehudah said: How should he act? If for the sake of his reputation — he needs the Sages, if not for the sake of his reputation — he is beginning to desecrate the Name of Heaven.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְרַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: מִידֵּי שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ בְּהָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי שִׂפְתֵי כֹהֵן יִשְׁמְרוּ דַעַת וְתוֹרָה יְבַקְשׁוּ מִפִּיהוּ כִּי מַלְאַךְ ה׳ צְבָאוֹת הוּא״. אִם דּוֹמֶה הָרַב לְמַלְאַךְ ה׳ — יְבַקְּשׁוּ תּוֹרָה מִפִּיו, וְאִם לָאו — אַל יְבַקְּשׁוּ תּוֹרָה מִפִּיו.
human_translation: said to Rabba bar bar Ḥana: you heard anything with regard to this He said to him: Rabbi Yoḥanan said as follows: What is which is written: “For the priest’s lips should keep knowledge, and they should seek Torah at his mouth; for he is a messenger [ malakh ] of the Lord of hosts” If the teacher is similar to an angel [ malakh ] of the Lord, seek Torah from his mouth, not do not seek Torah from his mouth;
llm_translation: He said to him, to Rabba bar bar Ḥana: From where do you hear this? He said to him, thus said Rabbi Yoḥanan: What is the meaning of what is written: "For the lips of a kohen should safeguard knowledge, and Torah they should seek from his mouth, for he is an angel of the Lord of Hosts"? If the rabbi is similar to an angel of the Lord, they should seek Torah from his mouth, but if not, they should not seek Torah from his mouth.

hebrew_text: שַׁמְּתֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה. לְסוֹף אִיחֲלַשׁ רַב יְהוּדָה. אֲתוֹ רַבָּנַן לְשַׁיּוֹלֵי בֵּיהּ וַאֲתָא אִיהוּ נָמֵי בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ, כַּד חַזְיֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה, חַיֵּיךְ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda ostracized In the end, Rav Yehuda took ill The Sages came to inquire about his well-being, and came with them as well. When Rav Yehuda saw him, he laughed.
llm_translation: The name of Rav Yehudah. At the end, Rav Yehudah became weak. The Rabbis came to inquire about him, and he came to himself in their presence, as Rav Yehudah saw, "By your life."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא מִסָּתְיֵיהּ דְּשַׁמְּתֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא, אֶלָּא אַחוֹכֵי נָמֵי חַיֵּיךְ בִּי?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו בְּדִידָךְ מְחַיֵּיכְנָא, אֶלָּא דְּכִי אָזֵילְנָא לְהָהוּא עָלְמָא בְּדִיחָא דַּעְתַּאי, דַּאֲפִילּוּ לְגַבְרָא כְּווֹתָךְ לָא חַנֵּיפִי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to him: Was it not enough that you excommunicated that man, but you even laugh at me? said to him: I was not laughing at you; rather, I am happy as I go to that world that I did not flatter even man like you,
llm_translation: He said to him: "I did not intend to deceive that man, but rather I was waiting for you, my life upon me?!" He said to him: "I did not deceive you, but when I went to that place in jest, for my own amusement, even to a man like you, I did not flatter him."

hebrew_text: נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה. אֲתָא לְבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא, אֲמַר לְהוּ: שְׁרוֹ לִי! אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן: גַּבְרָא דַּחֲשִׁיב כְּרַב יְהוּדָה לֵיכָּא הָכָא דְּלִישְׁרֵי לָךְ, אֶלָּא זִיל לְגַבֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה נְשִׂיאָה דְּלִישְׁרֵי לָךְ. אֲזַל לְקַמֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אַמֵּי: פּוֹק עַיֵּין בְּדִינֵיהּ, אִי מִיבְּעֵי לְמִישְׁרֵא לֵיהּ — שְׁרִי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda died. came to the study hall and said Release me The Sages said to him: There is no man here as eminent as Rav Yehuda who can release you Rather, go to Rabbi Yehuda Nesia as he can release you. came before said to Rabbi Ami: Go and examine his case. If it is necessary to release him release him
llm_translation: The soul of Rav Yehudah rested. He came to the study hall, he said to them: Sing for me! The sages said to him: A man as esteemed as Rav Yehudah is not here to sing for you, rather go to his wife, the wife of Rabbi Yehudah, who can sing for you. He went before her, he said to her: Go and look into his judgments, if he wants to be reconciled with you - allow him.

hebrew_text: עַיֵּין רַבִּי אַמֵּי בְּדִינֵיהּ, סְבַר לְמִישְׁרֵא לֵיהּ. עָמַד רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי עַל רַגְלָיו וְאָמַר: וּמָה שִׁפְחָה שֶׁל בֵּית רַבִּי לֹא נָהֲגוּ חֲכָמִים קַלּוּת רֹאשׁ בְּנִידּוּיָהּ שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים, יְהוּדָה חֲבֵירֵינוּ עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami examined his case thought to release him Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani rose up on his feet and said: If the maidservant in the house of Rabbi the Sages did not relate frivolously to her ostracism three years all the more so, with regard to Yehuda our colleague,
llm_translation: The translation of the Talmudic text is as follows: Rabbi Ammi investigated his case, he thought to acquit him. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani stood on his feet and said: "And how much more so the maidservant of the house of Rabbi, the Sages did not treat lightly her excommunication for three years, our colleague Judah even more so."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: מַאי דְּקַמַּן דַּאֲתָא הָאִידָּנָא הַאי סָבָא בְּבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא, דְּהָא כַּמָּה שְׁנֵי לָא אֲתָא, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לָא מִיבְּעֵי לְמִישְׁרֵא לֵיהּ. לָא שְׁרָא לֵיהּ, נְפַק כִּי קָא בָכֵי וְאָזֵיל,
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: What this Elder, to come before us in the study hall though for many years he did not come, Learn from this it is not necessary to release him did not release him left in tears.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: What is the reason that this elder came to the study hall, for he did not come for many years, learn from it that he does not want to go straight to it. He did not see him, he went out when he was crying and left.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא זִיבּוּרָא וְטַרְקֵיהּ אַאַמְּתֵיהּ וּשְׁכֵיב. עַיְּילוּהּ לִמְעָרְתָּא דַּחֲסִידֵי וְלָא קַיבְּלוּהּ, עַיְּילוּהּ לִמְעָרְתָּא דְּדַיָּינֵי וְקַיבְּלוּהּ.
human_translation: A wasp came and stung on his penis and he died. they took him into the caves in which the pious but did not accept him. They took him into the caves of the judges, and they accepted him.
llm_translation: The scholar Zibura came and his students with him and they lodged. They went to the cave of the pious ones but they did not accept them, they went to the cave of the judges and they accepted them.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? דַּעֲבַד כְּרַבִּי אִילְעַאי. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אִילְעַאי אוֹמֵר: אִם רוֹאֶה אָדָם שֶׁיִּצְרוֹ מִתְגַּבֵּר עָלָיו — יֵלֵךְ לְמָקוֹם שֶׁאֵין מַכִּירִין אוֹתוֹ, וְיִלְבַּשׁ שְׁחוֹרִים וְיִתְעַטֵּף שְׁחוֹרִים, וְיַעֲשֶׂה מַה שֶּׁלִּבּוֹ חָפֵץ, וְאַל יְחַלֵּל שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא.
human_translation: What is the reason he acted in accordance with Rabbi Ilai, as it is taught Rabbi Ilai says: If a person sees that his inclination is gaining control over him he should go to a place where he is not known. He should wear black, and he should wrap his in black, he should do as his heart desires and not desecrate the name of Heaven in public.
llm_translation: What is the reason? Because he acted like Rabbi Ilai. As it was taught: Rabbi Ilai says: If a person sees that his inclination is overpowering him, he should go to a place where he is not recognized, and wear black garments and wrap himself in black, and do what his heart desires, and not desecrate the name of Heaven openly.

hebrew_text: שִׁפְחָה שֶׁל בֵּית רַבִּי מַאי הִיא? דְּאַמְּתָא דְבֵי רַבִּי חֲזֵיתֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּהֲוָה מָחֵי לִבְנוֹ גָּדוֹל, אֲמַרָה: לֶיהֱוֵי הָהוּא גַּבְרָא בְּשַׁמְתָּא, דְּקָעָבֵר מִשּׁוּם ״וְלִפְנֵי עִוֵּר לֹא תִתֵּן מִכְשׁוֹל״. דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְלִפְנֵי עִוֵּר לֹא תִתֵּן מִכְשׁוֹל״ — בְּמַכֶּה לִבְנוֹ גָּדוֹל הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: What is the maidservant in the house of Rabbi that the maidservant in Rabbi house saw a certain man who was striking his adult son. She said: Let that man be excommunicated, due to he has transgressed “You shall not place a stumbling block before the blind” as it is taught “You shall not place a stumbling block before the blind,” the verse speaks of one who strikes his adult son,
llm_translation: Maid of the house of Rabbi, what is she? As the maidservant of the house of Rabbi saw that a certain man who was raising his large son, she said: Let that man be in the name, for he transgresses the verse "And before the blind do not put a stumbling block." As it was taught: "And before the blind do not put a stumbling block" - this verse speaks of one who strikes his large son.

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ הֲוָה מְנַטַּר פַּרְדֵּיסָא. אֲתָא הָהוּא גַּבְרָא וְקָאָכֵיל תְּאֵינֵי, רְמָא בֵּיהּ קָלָא וְלָא אַשְׁגַּח בֵּיהּ. אֲמַר: לֶיהֱוֵי הָהוּא גַּבְרָא בְּשַׁמְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַדְּרַבָּה, לֶיהֱוֵי הָהוּא גַּבְרָא בְּשַׁמְתָּא, אִם מָמוֹן נִתְחַיַּיבְתִּי לְךָ, נִידּוּי מִי נִתְחַיַּיבְתִּי לָךְ?
human_translation: Reish Lakish was guarding an orchard a certain man came and ate figs raised his voice but paid no attention to him said: Let that man be excommunication. said to him: On the contrary, let that man, be excommunication, if I have become liable to you for payment, have I become liable to you for excommunication?
llm_translation: Reish Lakish was guarding the orchard. A certain man came and ate figs, he threw a stone at him but did not pay attention to him. He said: Let that man be in the name. He said to him: On the contrary, let that man be in the name, if I owe you money, who owes you excommunication?

hebrew_text: אֲתָא לְבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: שֶׁלּוֹ — נִידּוּי, שֶׁלְּךָ — אֵינוֹ נִידּוּי.
human_translation: went to the study hall said to him: His ostracism is your ostracism is not.
llm_translation: He came to the study hall, they said to him: "Yours - excommunicated, his - not excommunicated."

hebrew_text: וּמַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ? זִיל לְגַבֵּיהּ דְּלִישְׁרֵי לָךְ. לָא יָדַעְנָא לֵיהּ. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: זִיל לְגַבֵּי נְשִׂיאָה דְּלִישְׁרֵי לָךְ, דְּתַנְיָא: נִידּוּהוּ וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ מִי נִידָּהוּ, יֵלֵךְ אֵצֶל נָשִׂיא וְיַתִּיר לוֹ נִדּוּיוֹ.
human_translation: what is the remedy Go to him so that he may release you I do not know him. They said to him: Go to the Nasi , so that he may release you as it is taught was ostracized, but he does not know who ostracized him, he should go to the Nasi , and may release his ostracism.
llm_translation: "What is its remedy? Go to his superior to rectify for you. I do not know him. They said to him: Go to the prince who can rectify for you, as it was taught: If one excommunicated him and he does not know who excommunicated him, he should go to a prince and he will annul his excommunication."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא, בְּאוּשָׁא הִתְקִינוּ: אַב בֵּית דִּין שֶׁסָּרַח — אֵין מְנַדִּין אוֹתוֹ, אֶלָּא אוֹמֵר לוֹ: ״הִכָּבֵד וְשֵׁב בְּבֵיתֶךָ״. חָזַר וְסָרַח — מְנַדִּין אוֹתוֹ, מִפְּנֵי חִילּוּל הַשֵּׁם.
human_translation: Rav Huna said in Usha it was enacted: the president of the court sinned, he is not ostracized. Rather, say to him “Keep your honor and stay at home” he sins again, he is ostracized, due to the desecration of God’s name
llm_translation: Rav Huna said, in Usha they instituted: If a member of the court rebels - they do not excommunicate him, but rather say to him: "Be respectful and stay in your home." If he rebels again - they excommunicate him, because of desecration of the Name.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ. דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁסָּרַח — אֵין מְנַדִּין אוֹתוֹ בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכָשַׁלְתָּ הַיּוֹם וְכָשַׁל גַּם נָבִיא עִמְּךָ לָיְלָה״ — כַּסֵּהוּ כַּלַּיְלָה.
human_translation: disagrees with Reish Lakish, Reish Lakish said: a Torah scholar sins, he is not ostracized in public, as it is stated: “Therefore, shall you fall in the day, and the prophet also shall fall with you in the night” should be concealed like the night
llm_translation: Disagreement of Reish Lakish. For Reish Lakish said: A Torah scholar who stumbles — they do not judge him in public, as it is stated: "And you shall stumble by day, and even a prophet will stumble with you by night" — cover him up at night.

hebrew_text: מָר זוּטְרָא חֲסִידָא, כִּי מִיחַיַּיב צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן שַׁמְתָּא, בְּרֵישָׁא מְשַׁמֵּית נַפְשֵׁיהּ, וַהֲדַר מְשַׁמֵּית לְדִידֵיהּ. כִּי הֲוָה עָיֵיל בְּאוּשְׁפִּיזֵיהּ שָׁרֵי לֵיהּ לְנַפְשֵׁיהּ, וַהֲדַר שָׁרֵי לֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ.
human_translation: when a Torah scholar would become liable excommunication before Mar Zutra the Pious, would first excommunicate himself and afterward he would ostracize when would enter his house he would release his and afterward he would release
llm_translation: Mar Zutra the pious, for when he would be obligated to pay a fine to the sages of the city, he would first endanger himself, and then endanger them. For when he would go into the alleys, he would allow danger to come upon himself, and then allow danger to come upon them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: תַּלְמִיד חָכָם מְנַדֶּה לְעַצְמוֹ, וּמֵיפֵר לְעַצְמוֹ. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: תֵּיתֵי לִי, דְּלָא שַׁמֵּיתִי צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן מֵעוֹלָם. אֶלָּא כִּי קָא מִיחַיַּיב צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן שַׁמְתָּא, הֵיכִי עָבֵיד? כִּי הָא דִּבְמַעְרְבָא מִימְּנוּ אַנְּגָדָא דְּצוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן וְלָא מִימְּנוּ אַשַּׁמְתָּא.
human_translation: Rav Giddel said Rav said: A Torah scholar may ostracize himself, and he may release himself Rav Pappa said: I have coming to me, as I have never ostracized a Torah scholar. If so, when a Torah scholar was liable to be ostracized, what would he do? as they do in the West, they appoint to give a Torah scholar lashes, but they do not appoint to ostracize him.
llm_translation: Rav Gidel said in the name of Rav: A Torah scholar may excommunicate himself, and may absolve himself. Rav Papa said: Give me, for I have never excommunicated a Torah scholar. Rather, when a Torah scholar is obligated to excommunicate himself, how should he act? Like one who mixes his wine with water from the side opposite the Torah scholar, and not from the side of the Torah scholar.

hebrew_text: מַאי שַׁמְתָּא? אָמַר רַב: שָׁם מִיתָה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: שְׁמָמָה יִהְיֶה, וּמַהְנְיָא בֵּיהּ כִּי טִיחְיָא בְּתַנּוּרָא.
human_translation: What excommunication [ shamta ]? Rav said: there is death [ sham mita ], And Shmuel said: he will be a desolation [ shemama yiheyeh ], and it is effective upon him like fat on an oven.
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "Shamta"? Rav said: There is death. And Shmuel said: It will be desolate. And what is the practical difference between them? When plaster is in the oven.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ. דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁנִּכְנֶסֶת בְּמָאתַיִם וְאַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁמוֹנָה אֵיבָרִים, כָּךְ כְּשֶׁהִיא יוֹצְאָה — יוֹצְאָה מִמָּאתַיִם וְאַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁמוֹנָה אֵיבָרִים.
human_translation: And disagrees with Reish Lakish, Reish Lakish said: Just as enters the two hundred and forty-eight organs so too when it leaves, it leaves from two hundred and forty-eight organs.
llm_translation: Disagreement of Reish Lakish. For Reish Lakish said: Just as it enters with 248 limbs, so too when it exits, it exits with 248 limbs.

hebrew_text: כְּשֶׁהִיא נִכְנֶסֶת, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיְתָה הָעִיר חֵרֶם״ — ״חֵרֶם״ בְּגִימַטְרִיָּא מָאתַיִם וְאַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁמוֹנָה הָווּ. כְּשֶׁהִיא יוֹצְאָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּרוֹגֶז רַחֵם תִּזְכּוֹר״, ״רַחֵם״ בְּגִימַטְרִיָּא הָכִי הָווּ.
human_translation: When it enters, as it is written: “And the city shall be a curse [ ḥerem ]” and the numerical value [ gimatriyya ] ḥerem , is two hundred and forty-eight. When it leaves, as it is written: “In wrath remember mercy [ raḥem ]” and the numerical value raḥem is also
llm_translation: When she enters, as it is written: "And the city shall be devoted to destruction" — "devoted to destruction" in gematria is two hundred and forty-eight. When she exits, as it is written: "In wrath remember mercy," "mercy" in gematria is thus.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: שְׁדִי שַׁמְתָּא אַגְּנוּבְתָּא דְכַלְבָּא וְאִיהִי דִּידַהּ עָבְדָה. דְּהָהוּא כַּלְבָּא דַּהֲוָה אָכֵיל מְסָאנֵי דְרַבָּנַן וְלָא הֲווֹ קָא יָדְעִי מַנּוּ, וְשַׁמִּתוּ לֵיהּ. אִיתְּלַי בֵּיהּ נוּרָא בִּגְנוּבְתֵּיהּ וַאֲכַלְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Cast an excommunication on the tail of a dog and it, will do its work a certain dog that would eat the shoes of the Sages, and they did not know who it was and they excommunicated tail caught fire and got burnt.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "Shedi, you have placed the stolen purse of the dog, and she herself did it. For that dog used to eat the delicacies of the Rabbis and they did not know from where, and they placed it for her. A fire was found in her purse, and she ate it."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא אַלָּמָא דַּהֲוָה קָא מְצַעַר לֵיהּ לְהָהוּא צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל שַׁמְתֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִסְתְּפֵינָא מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: a violent person who suffering to a certain Torah scholar. came before Rav Yosef said to him: Go and ostracize him. said to him: I am afraid of him,
llm_translation: That certain individual who was causing distress to that particular student of the sages, came before Rav Yosef. He said to him: "Go place him." He said to him: "I am afraid of him."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁקֵיל פְּתִיחָא עֲלֵיהּ. כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן דְּמִסְתְּפֵינָא מִינֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שִׁקְלֵיהּ, אַחֲתֵיהּ בְּכַדָּא,
human_translation: said to him: Take a written against him. All the more so I am fearful of him, said to him Take and place it in a jug,
llm_translation: He said to him: Take a knife and slaughter it. All the more so since I am suffering from it. He said to him: Slaughter it, its blood in a vessel.

hebrew_text: וְאַחֲתֵיהּ בֵּי קִבְרֵי, וּקְרִי בֵּיהּ אַלְפָּא שִׁפּוּרֵי בְּאַרְבְּעִין יוֹמִין. אָזֵיל עָבֵיד הָכִי, פְּקַע כַּדָּא וּמִית אַלָּמָא. מַאי שִׁפּוּרֵי — שֶׁנִּפְרָעִין מִמֶּנּוּ.
human_translation: and set it down in a cemetery, and sound a thousand, shofar blasts over the course of forty days. went and did this. The jug burst and the violent man died. What shofarot that they extract punishment [ shenifra’in ] from
llm_translation: And one of them is Beit Kivrei, and it is called Alpa Shipurei in forty days. He went and did so, he split the tree and died on it. What is Shipurei - that they are paid from it.

hebrew_text: מַאי תְּבָרָא? אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה: תָּבְרִי בָּתֵּי רָמֵי. דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁ״נָּתְנוּ חֲכָמִים עֵינֵיהֶם״, אוֹ מִיתָה אוֹ עוֹנִי.
human_translation: What broken Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rav Yehuda, said: It breaks tall buildings, as it is taught Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: Wherever the Sages set their eyes either death or poverty.
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "tevara"? Rav Yitzchak, son of Rav Yehuda, said: "Tabri, daughter of Ramei." As it was taught: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: "In any place where 'the sages have set their eyes,' either death or poverty."

hebrew_text: וְהַנָּזִיר וְהַמְּצוֹרָע מִטּוּמְאָתוֹ לְטׇהֳרָתוֹ. בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה מֵרַבִּי זֵירָא: בְּשֶׁלֹּא הָיָה לָהֶם פְּנַאי, אוֹ דִלְמָא אַף בְּשֶׁהָיָה לָהֶם פְּנַאי?
human_translation: And the nazirite and the leper his impurity his purity, Rabbi Yirmeya raised a question before Rabbi Zeira: where they did not have the time Or perhaps even where they had the time
llm_translation: The Nazirite and the Metzora from his impurity to his purification. Rabbi Yirmiyah asked Rabbi Zeira: If they did not have free time, or perhaps even if they did have free time?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵינָא: כׇּל אֵלּוּ שֶׁאָמְרוּ מוּתָּרִין לְגַלֵּחַ בַּמּוֹעֵד — בְּשֶׁלֹּא הָיָה לָהֶם פְּנַאי, אֲבָל הָיָה לָהֶם פְּנַאי — אֲסוּרִים.
human_translation: He said to him: We learned all those the said are permitted to cut their hair on a Festival, if they did not have time But they had time they are prohibited
llm_translation: He said to him, "We have learned: all those who said it is permissible to shave during the festival - it is when they did not have free time, but if they had free time - it is prohibited."

hebrew_text: נָזִיר וּמְצוֹרָע, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהָיָה לָהֶם פְּנַאי — מוּתָּרִים, שֶׁלֹּא יְשַׁהוּ קׇרְבְּנוֹתֵיהֶן.
human_translation: a nazirite and a leper, even if they had the time they are permitted that they will not delay their offerings.
llm_translation: "Nazir and metzora, even though they had leisure time - are permitted, so that they do not delay their sacrifices."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: הַכֹּהֵן וְהָאָבֵל מוּתָּרִין בְּגִילּוּחַ. הַאי אָבֵל הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא שֶׁחָל שְׁמִינִי שֶׁלּוֹ בְּעֶרֶב הָרֶגֶל — אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְגַלּוֹחֵי בָּעֶרֶב הָרֶגֶל! אֶלָּא, שֶׁחָל שְׁמִינִי שֶׁלּוֹ לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת עֶרֶב הָרֶגֶל.
human_translation: taught A priest and a mourner are permitted to cut their hair What are the circumstances mourner If we say that the eighth his occurred on the eve of the Festival, he should have cut his hair on the eve of the Festival, Rather, where the eighth his occurred on a Shabbat that was the eve of the Festival,
llm_translation: Mishnah: The kohen and the mourner are permitted to shave. What is the case of this mourner? If you say that his eighth day of mourning falls on Erev Pesach, let him ask to shave on Erev Pesach! Rather, his eighth day of mourning falls on Erev Shabbat of Pesach.

hebrew_text: אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְגַלּוֹחֵי עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת, דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רָבִינָא בַּר שֵׁילָא: הֲלָכָה כְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל, וּמוֹדִים חֲכָמִים לְאַבָּא שָׁאוּל בְּשֶׁחָל שְׁמִינִי שֶׁלּוֹ לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת עֶרֶב הָרֶגֶל שֶׁמּוּתָּר לְגַלֵּחַ בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת!
human_translation: he should have cut his hair on Friday, for Rav Ḥisda said Ravina bar Sheila said: The halakha is in accordance with Abba Shaul. And the Rabbis concede Abba Shaul when the eighth his occurs on a Shabbat that is the eve of the Festival, that he is permitted to cut his hair on Friday.
llm_translation: He asked the hairdressers of Erev Shabbat, as Rav Chisda said in the name of Ravina bar Sheila: The halacha is like Abba Shaul, and the sages agree with Abba Shaul that on the eighth day of his circumcision, which falls on Erev Hag, it is permitted to shave on Erev Shabbat!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, שֶׁחָל שְׁבִיעִי שֶׁלּוֹ לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת עֶרֶב הָרֶגֶל.
human_translation: No, necessary where the seventh his occurs on a Shabbat that is the eve of the Festival.
llm_translation: Not necessary, for the seventh of it to be on Shabbat eve of the festival.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא בָּרָא סָבַר לַהּ כְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל, דְּאָמַר: מִקְצָת הַיּוֹם כְּכוּלּוֹ, וְיוֹם שְׁבִיעִי עוֹלֶה לוֹ לְכָאן וּלְכָאן. וְכֵיוָן דְּשַׁבָּת הָוֵי — אָנוּס הוּא.
human_translation: The tanna of the baraita , holds in accordance with Abba Shaul, who said: part of the day is like an entire and the seventh counts as both since is Shabbat, he is unavoidably prevented
llm_translation: The text states: "It was taught: Bara thought like Abba Shaul, who said: Part of the day is like the whole day, and the seventh day ascends for him from here to there. And once Shabbat arrives - it is compulsory."

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא דִידַן סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבָּנַן, דְּאָמְרִי: לָא אָמְרִינַן מִקְצָת הַיּוֹם כְּכוּלּוֹ, וְאַכַּתִּי לָא שְׁלִים אֲבֵילוּת דְּשִׁבְעָה.
human_translation: The tanna our holds in accordance with Rabbis, who say: We do not say part of the day is like an entire he has not yet completed seven- mourning,
llm_translation: We have learned in our Mishnah in accordance with the opinion of the Rabbis, who say: We do not say that part of the day is like the whole day, and therefore the mourning of seven days is not completed.

hebrew_text: הַאי כֹּהֵן הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דִּשְׁלִים מִשְׁמַרְתּוֹ עֶרֶב הָרֶגֶל — אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְגַלּוֹחֵי עֶרֶב הָרֶגֶל!
human_translation: this priest, what are the circumstances? If we say that he completed his watch on the eve of the Festival, he should have cut his hair on the eve of the Festival.
llm_translation: This priest, how is his status? If you say that he completed his watch before the festival eve - it is necessary to ask him to shave before the festival eve!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דִּשְׁלִים מִשְׁמַרְתּוֹ בָּרֶגֶל. תַּנָּא דִידַן סָבַר, כֵּיוָן דִּתְנַן: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה פְּרָקִים בַּשָּׁנָה הָיוּ כׇּל הַמִּשְׁמָרוֹת שָׁווֹת, בְּאֵימוּרֵי הָרְגָלִים, וּבְחִילּוּק לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים — כְּמַאן דְּלָא שְׁלִים מִשְׁמַרְתּוֹ בָּרֶגֶל דָּמֵי. וְתַנָּא בָּרָא סָבַר: אַף עַל גַּב דְּשָׁיֵיךְ בְּהָנָךְ מִשְׁמָרוֹת, מִשְׁמַרְתֵּיהּ מִיהָא שְׁלִימָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: No, necessary where one completed his watch during the Festival The tanna our holds since we learned At the year, all of the priestly watches share equally in the Festival offerings and in the division of the shewbread he is like one whose watch was not completed during the Festival, And the tanna of the baraita holds that although belongs to those watches nevertheless, his own watch was completed
llm_translation: Not necessary, that he completes his watch by foot. Our Mishnaic sage holds, since we learned: In three chapters a year, all the watches were equal, in the words of the feet, and in the division of the showbread - it is as if one did not complete his watch by foot. And the son of Rava holds: Even though his watches are lacking in enjoyment, his watch is considered complete for him.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כׇּל אֵלּוּ שֶׁאָמְרוּ מוּתָּרִין לְגַלֵּחַ בַּמּוֹעֵד — מוּתָּרִין לְגַלֵּחַ בִּימֵי אֶבְלָן.
human_translation: The Sages taught All those about whom it was said are permitted to cut their hair on a Festival they may cut their hair during the period of their mourning
llm_translation: They taught: All these that they said are permitted to shave during the festival - are permitted to shave during their mourning days.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: אֲסוּרִים! אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רַב שֵׁילָא: כִּי תַּנְיָא הָכָא מוּתָּרִין — בְּשֶׁתְּכָפוּהוּ אֲבָלָיו.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught They are prohibited Rav Ḥisda said Rav Sheila said: When it is taught they are permitted for whom mourning applied in succession.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: They are forbidden! Rav Ḥisda said in the name of Rav Sheila: When it was taught here that they are permitted — when it is pressed, but not otherwise.

hebrew_text: אִי בְּשֶׁתְּכָפוּהוּ אֲבָלָיו, מַאי אִירְיָא כׇּל אֵלּוּ שֶׁאָמְרוּ, אֲפִילּוּ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא נָמֵי? דְּתַנְיָא: תְּכָפוּהוּ אֲבָלָיו זֶה אַחַר זֶה, הִכְבִּיד שְׂעָרוֹ — מֵיקֵל בְּתַעַר, וּמְכַבֵּס כְּסוּתוֹ בְּמַיִם.
human_translation: If where his mourning applied in succession, why specifically all those about whom it was said even to everyone, as it is taught one’s mourning applied in succession, one after the other, his hair became heavy, he may lighten with a razor, and he may wash his garment in water,
llm_translation: If they overlapped him but not his father, what is the ruling? What is the reason that all these they said, even all the generations? For it was taught: "Overlapping him but not his father" means one after the other, he should lighten his hair - with a razor, and wash his garment in water.

hebrew_text: הָא אִתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: בְּתַעַר וְלֹא בְּמִסְפָּרַיִם, בְּמַיִם וְלֹא בְּנֶתֶר וְלֹא בְּאָהָל. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת אָבֵל אָסוּר בְּתִכְבּוֹסֶת.
human_translation: But wasn’t it said with regard to that Rav Ḥisda said: with a razor, but not with scissors? with water, but not with neter or soap. Rav Ḥisda said: That is to say a mourner is prohibited from laundering
llm_translation: The Gemara raises a contradiction: Rav Ḥisda said: With a razor and not with scissors, with water and not with lye, and not in a tent. Rav Ḥisda said: This teaches that mourning is prohibited with laundering.
