hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאָמְרוּ אָסוּר לְגַלֵּחַ בַּמּוֹעֵד, כָּךְ אָסוּר לִיטּוֹל צִפּוֹרְנַיִם בַּמּוֹעֵד, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַתִּיר.
human_translation: The Sages taught Just as said it is prohibited to cut one’s hair during the a Festival, so too it is prohibited to cut one’s nails during the a Festival; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda, whereas Rabbi Yosei permits
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Just as they said it is forbidden to shave during the festival, so too it is forbidden to trim one's nails during the festival, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. But Rabbi Yosei permits it.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֵׁם שֶׁאָמְרוּ אָבֵל אָסוּר לְגַלֵּחַ בִּימֵי אֶבְלוֹ — כָּךְ אָסוּר לִיטּוֹל צִפּוֹרְנַיִם בִּימֵי אֶבְלוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַתִּיר.
human_translation: And just as said a mourner is prohibited from cutting his hair during the period of his mourning, so too he is prohibited from cutting his nails during the period of his mourning; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda, whereas Rabbi Yosei permits
llm_translation: "And as they said, 'It is forbidden to shave during the days of mourning,' so too it is forbidden to trim one's nails during the days of mourning, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. And Rabbi Yosei permits."

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּאֵבֶל, וַהֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּמּוֹעֵד. שְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר:
human_translation: Ulla said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda with regard to mourning, but the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei with regard to the Festival. Shmuel said:
llm_translation: Ula said: The halakha is like Rabbi Yehuda in matters of mourning, and the halakha is like Rabbi Yosei in matters of festivals. Shmuel said:

hebrew_text: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּמּוֹעֵד וּבְאֵבֶל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי הַמֵּיקֵל בְּאֵבֶל.
human_translation: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei with regard to the Festival and with regard to mourning, as Shmuel said The halakha is in accordance with the statement of the lenient in mourning.
llm_translation: Halakha like Rabbi Yosei in Moed and in mourning, as Shmuel said: Halakha follows the lenient opinion in mourning.

hebrew_text: פִּנְחָס אֲחוּהּ דְּמָר שְׁמוּאֵל אִיתְּרַע בֵּיהּ מִילְּתָא, עָל שְׁמוּאֵל לְמִישְׁאַל טַעְמָא מִינֵּיהּ. חֲזַנְהוּ לְטוּפְרֵי[הּ] דַּהֲווֹ נְפִישָׁן, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי לָא שָׁקְלַתְּ לְהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי בְּדִידֵיהּ הֲוָה, מִי מְזַלְזְלַתְּ בֵּיהּ כּוּלֵּי הַאי?
human_translation: something happened to Pineḥas, brother of Mar Shmuel, Shmuel entered to ask him the reason, He saw that nails were long, said to him: Why do you not cut them? replied: If it were your would you treat so lightly
llm_translation: Pinchas, the brother of Mar Samuel, had a matter against him, concerning Samuel to inquire about his reasoning. He saw his disciples who were numerous, he said to him: "Why did you not take them?" He said to him: "If it had been my own, would I have belittled all these?"

hebrew_text: הֲוַאי ״כִּשְׁגָגָה שֶׁיֹּצָא מִלִּפְנֵי הַשַּׁלִּיט״, וְאִיתְּרַע בֵּיהּ מִילְּתָא בִּשְׁמוּאֵל. עָל פִּנְחָס אֲחוּהּ לְמִישְׁאַל טַעְמָא מִינֵּיהּ. שַׁקְלִינְהוּ לְטוּפְרֵיהּ חַבְטִינְהוּ לְאַפֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לֵית לָךָ בְּרִית כְּרוּתָה לַשְּׂפָתַיִם?
human_translation: were: “Like an error that proceeds from a ruler” something happened to Shmuel, Pineḥas, his brother, entered to ask him the reason, took his nails and cast them in said to him: you not a covenant is made with the lips?
llm_translation: The matter of "unintentional sin that departs from before the ruler," and a matter was found in the name of Shmuel. Concerning Pinchas, his brother Mishael disagreed with him. He took them to his chambers, slapped them on their faces. He said to him: Do you not have a covenant sealed on your lips?

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִנַּיִן שֶׁבְּרִית כְּרוּתָה לַשְּׂפָתַיִם — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אַבְרָהָם אֶל נְעָרָיו שְׁבוּ לָכֶם פֹּה עִם הַחֲמוֹר וַאֲנִי וְהַנַּעַר נֵלְכָה עַד כֹּה וְנִשְׁתַּחֲוֶה וְנָשׁוּבָה אֲלֵיכֶם״, וְאִיסְתַּיְּיעָא מִלְּתָא דַּהֲדוּר תַּרְוַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: as Rabbi Yoḥanan said: From where that a covenant is made with the lips, For it is stated: “And Abraham said to his young men: Stay here with the donkey, and I and the lad will go onward; and we will worship, and we will come back to you” yet this had an influence and they both came back.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Yochanan said: From where do we derive that a covenant was made with the lips? As it is stated: "And Abraham said to his young men, 'Stay here with the donkey, while I and the boy will go up there; we will worship and we will return to you'" (Genesis 22:5), and the matter is established. English translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: From where do we derive that a covenant was made with the lips? As it is stated: "And Abraham said to his young men, 'Stay here with the donkey, while I and the boy will go up there; we will worship and we will return to you'" (Genesis 22:5), and the matter is established.

hebrew_text: סְבוּר מִינֵּיהּ דְּיָד — אִין, דְּרֶגֶל — לָא. אָמַר רַב עָנָן בַּר תַּחְלִיפָא: לְדִידִי מִפָּרְשָׁא לִי מִינֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: לָא שְׁנָא דְּיָד וְלָא שְׁנָא דְּרֶגֶל.
human_translation: concluded from this: hand, yes, foot, no, Rav Anan bar Taḥlifa said: It was explained to me by Shmuel It is not different hand and it is not different foot,
llm_translation: He thought regarding the matter of the hand - no, regarding the matter of the foot - yes. Rav Anan son of Tahalifa said: According to my understanding, the opinion of Shmuel is explained to me: It is no different whether it is the hand or the foot.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: וּבִגְנוּסְטְרָא — אָסוּר. אָמַר רַב שֶׁמֶן בַּר אַבָּא: הֲוָה קָאֵימְנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד, וְשַׁקְלִינְהוּ לְטוּפְרֵיהּ בְּשִׁינֵּיהּ וְזַרְקִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi said Rav said: But with scissors [ genustera ] it is prohibited, Rav Shemen bar Abba said: I stood before Rabbi Yoḥanan in the study hall during the intermediate days of a Festival, and he cut his nails with his teeth and threw them
llm_translation: Rav Chiya bar Ashe said in the name of Rav: And in Ginusṭra — it is prohibited. Rav Shemen bar Abba said: I was standing before Rabbi Yochanan in the study hall on a weekday of a festival, and I took figs in my teeth and threw them.

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תְּלָת. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מוּתָּר לִיטּוֹל צִפׇּרְנַיִם בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: אֵין בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם מִיאוּס, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מוּתָּר לְזוֹרְקָן.
human_translation: Learn from this three Learn from this it is permitted to cut one’s nails on the intermediate days of a Festival. And learn from this have no due to repulsive, And learn from this it is permitted nails
llm_translation: Listen, derive from it three. Listen, derive from it: permissible to take out the ashes from the altar on the Sabbath, and listen, derive from it: they are not considered disgusting, and listen, derive from it: it is permissible to sprinkle them.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָתַנְיָא, שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים נֶאֶמְרוּ בַּצִּפׇּרְנַיִם: הַקּוֹבְרָן — צַדִּיק, שׂוֹרְפָן — חָסִיד, זוֹרְקָן — רָשָׁע. טַעְמָא מַאי — שֶׁמָּא תַּעֲבוֹר עֲלֵיהֶן אִשָּׁה עוּבָּרָהּ וְתַפִּיל.
human_translation: Is that so? But isn’t it taught Three things were said about nails: One who buries them is righteous. One who burns them is pious. One who throws them is wicked. What is the reason lest a pregnant women pass over them and miscarry,
llm_translation: I am not? But it was taught: Three things were said about the Tzippornayim: One who buries them is righteous, one who burns them is pious, one who throws them away is wicked. What is the reason? Lest a pregnant woman pass by them and miscarry.

hebrew_text: אִשָּׁה בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא לָא שְׁכִיחָא. וְכִי תֵּימָא: זִימְנִין דִּמְיכַנְּשִׁי לְהוּ וְשָׁדֵי לְהוּ אַבָּרַאי — כֵּיוָן דְּאִשְׁתַּנִּי אִשְׁתַּנִּי.
human_translation: A woman is not usually in the study hall, If you say sometimes are gathered and thrown outside Once has changed change
llm_translation: A woman in the study hall is not common. And if you will say: Sometimes they would marry them and divorce them immediately — once they have married, they have married.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: זוּג בָּא מֵחַמָּתָן לִפְנֵי רַבִּי, וּמָר זוּטְרָא מַתְנֵי: זוּג בָּא מֵחַמָּתָן לִפְנֵי רַבִּי, וּבִקְּשׁוּ מִמֶּנּוּ צִפׇּרְנַיִם — וְהִתִּיר לָהֶם. וְאִם בִּקְּשׁוּ מִמֶּנּוּ שָׂפָה — הִתִּיר לָהֶם, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אַף בִּקְּשׁוּ מִמֶּנּוּ שָׂפָה, וְהִתִּיר לָהֶם.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: A pair Ḥamatan came before Rabbi And Mar Zutra taught A pair Ḥamatan came before Rabbi And they asked him nails, and he permitted to them. And had they asked him mustache, he would have permitted to them. And Shmuel said: They also asked him a mustache, he permitted to them.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: A pair came from their in-laws before Rabbi, and Mar Zutra taught: A pair came from their in-laws before Rabbi, and they requested of him cymbals - and he permitted them. And if they requested of him a flute - he permitted them. And Shmuel said: Even if they requested of him a flute, and he permitted them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אֲבִיטוּל סָפְרָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא: שָׂפָה מִזָּוִית לְזָוִית. אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: וּבְשָׂפָה הַמְעַכֶּבֶת. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: לְדִידִי כְּשָׂפָה הַמְעַכֶּבֶת דָּמֵי לִי.
human_translation: Avitul the scribe said in the name of Rav Pappa: A mustache from corner to corner Rabbi Ami said: mustache that interferes Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: For me, is like a mustache that interferes
llm_translation: Said Avitul Safra in the name of Rav Papa: "A lip from corner to corner." Rabbi Ammi said: "And with a lip that obstructs." Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "According to me, a lip that obstructs is equivalent."

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר אֲבִיטוּל סָפְרָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא: פַּרְעֹה שֶׁהָיָה בִּימֵי מֹשֶׁה, הוּא אַמָּה, וּזְקָנוֹ אַמָּה, וּפַרְמַשְׁתְּקוֹ אַמָּה וָזֶרֶת, לְקַיֵּים מַה שֶּׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּשְׁפַל אֲנָשִׁים יָקִים עָלֶיהָ״.
human_translation: And Avitul the scribe said in the name of Rav Pappa: Pharaoh who lived in the days of Moses was a cubit beard was a cubit and his penis parmashtako a cubit and a span, in order to fulfill what is stated: “And He sets up over it the lowest of men”
llm_translation: And Abitul Sofra said in the name of Rav Papa: Pharaoh who was in the days of Moses, his height was a cubit, and his beard a cubit, and his stride a cubit and a half, to fulfill what is said: "And lowly men will rise upon it."

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר אֲבִיטוּל סָפְרָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא: פַּרְעֹה שֶׁהָיָה בִּימֵי מֹשֶׁה אַמְגּוּשִׁי הָיָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הִנֵּה יוֹצֵא הַמָּיְמָה וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Avitul the scribe said in the name of Rav Pappa: Pharaoh who lived in the days of Moses was a sorcerer amgushi as it is stated: “Behold, he goes out to the water”
llm_translation: And said Avitul the scribe from the name of Rav Papa: Pharaoh who was in the days of Moses was a convert, as it is said: "Behold, he goes out to the water..."

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ מְכַבְּסִין בַּמּוֹעֵד, הַבָּא מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם. אָמַר רַב אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא חָלוּק אֶחָד — מוּתָּר לְכַבְּסוֹ בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד.
human_translation: And these may launder on a Festival: One who comes from a country overseas. Rav Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Anyone who has only one shirt is permitted to launder it on the intermediate days of a Festival.
llm_translation: And these are the ones who may do laundry on the festival, one who comes from the sea region. Rav Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: One who only has one garment - he is permitted to launder it in the weekday of the festival.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: אֵלּוּ מְכַבְּסִין בַּמּוֹעֵד, הַבָּא מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם כּוּ׳. הָנֵי אִין, מִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא חָלוּק אֶחָד — לָא!
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raised an objection And these may launder on the a Festival: One who comes from a country overseas, etc. Those yes, one who has only one shirt not
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rabbi Yirmeya raised a contradiction: These are the ones who do laundry on the festival: one who comes from a sea-faring city. Those ones, no, one who only has one garment - no!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב לְרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: אַסְבְּרַהּ לָךְ, מַתְנִיתִין אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִית לֵיהּ תְּרֵי וּמִטַּנְּפִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov said to Rabbi Yirmeya: I will explain it to you. The mishna he has two and dirty.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yaakov to Rabbi Yirmeya: "I will explain it to you, Mishnah, even though you have two and a half."

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח רַב יִצְחָק בַּר יַעֲקֹב בַּר גִּיּוֹרֵי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּלֵי פִשְׁתָּן — מוּתָּר לְכַבְּסָן בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד. מֵתִיב רָבָא: מִטְפְּחוֹת הַיָּדַיִם, מִטְפְּחוֹת
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Ya’akov bar Giyorei sent in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: linen garments, it is permitted to launder them during the intermediate days of the Festival Rava raised an objection Hand towels, the towels
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak son of Yaakov son of Giyorei sent in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Linen garments — it is permitted to launder them on Chol HaMoed. Rava objects: From hand towels, from hand towels...

hebrew_text: הַסְּפָרִים. הָנֵי — אִין, כְּלֵי פִשְׁתָּן — לָא.
human_translation: of barbers these yes, linen garments, no,
llm_translation: The books. These - no, linen garments - no.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מַתְנִיתִין אֲפִילּוּ דִּשְׁאָר מִינֵי. אָמַר בַּר הִידְיָא: לְדִידִי חֲזֵי לִי יַמָּהּ שֶׁל טְבֶרְיָה, דְּמַפְּקִי לַהּ מְשִׁיכְלֵי דְּמָנֵי כִּיתָּנָא בְּחוּלָּא דְמוֹעֲדָא.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: The mishna even of other types Bar Hedya said: I myself saw the Sea of Tiberias, to which basins of linen garments were brought out during the intermediate days of a Festival.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Mishnaic teachings even of other kinds. Bar Hei Hai said: According to my opinion, I see the sea of Tiberias, from which fish come out with fins like a radish in the secular year.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ אַבָּיֵי: מַאן לֵימָא לַן דִּבְרָצוֹן חֲכָמִים עָבְדִי, דִּלְמָא שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְצוֹן חֲכָמִים עָבְדִי.
human_translation: Abaye strongly objects to this: who says to us they did in accordance with the will of the Sages? Perhaps they did without the will of the Sages.
llm_translation: Abbaye objects to him: Who can say to us that the will of the sages was done, perhaps it was not done with the will of the sages.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְאֵלּוּ כּוֹתְבִין בַּמּוֹעֵד: קִדּוּשֵׁי נָשִׁים וְגִיטִּין וְשׁוֹבָרִין. דְּיָיתֵיקֵי, מַתָּנָה וּפְרוֹזְבּוּלִין. אִיגְּרוֹת שׁוּם וְאִיגְּרוֹת מָזוֹן.
human_translation: And these may be written on a Festival: betrothal of wives, bills of divorce; receipts wills [ deyateiki ]; gift; perozbolin , letters of valuation, letters of sustenance,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And these are written on festivals: marriage contracts for women, bills of divorce, and receipts. The Gemara explains: marriage gifts and promissory notes. Letters of assessment and letters of sustenance.

hebrew_text: שְׁטָרֵי חֲלִיצָה וּמֵיאוּנִים וּשְׁטָרֵי בֵירוּרִין. גְּזֵרוֹת בֵּית דִּין וְאִיגְּרוֹת שֶׁל רְשׁוּת.
human_translation: Documents of the ritual through which the brother-in-law frees the yevama of her levirate bonds [ ḥalitza ], refusal documents of arbitration, court rulings; and correspondence of the authorities.
llm_translation: Documents of redemption and appraisals, and documents of clarification. Decrees of the court and letters of authority.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מוּתָּר לְאָרֵס אִשָּׁה בְּחוּלּוֹ שֶׁל מוֹעֵד, שֶׁמָּא יִקְדְּמֶנּוּ אַחֵר. לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: וְאֵלּוּ כּוֹתְבִין בַּמּוֹעֵד — קִדּוּשֵׁי נָשִׁים,
human_translation: Shmuel said: It is permitted to betroth on the intermediate days of a Festival, lest another first. Let us say that supports And these may be drawn up on the a Festival: Documents of betrothal.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Shmuel: Permitted to betroth a woman on a weekday of the festival, lest another precede him. Let him say: And these are written on the festival - the sanctifications of women.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו שְׁטָרֵי קִדּוּשִׁין מַמָּשׁ? לָא, שְׁטָרֵי פְסִיקָתָא, וְכִדְרַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב.
human_translation: What, is not actual documents of betrothal, No, documents of stipulation in accordance with Rav Giddel said Rav said.
llm_translation: What is the reason that marriage documents are not actual documents? No, they are documents of separation, as Rav Gidel said in the name of Rav.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: כַּמָּה אַתָּה נוֹתֵן לְבִנְךָ? כָּךְ וְכָךְ. כַּמָּה אַתָּה נוֹתֵן לְבִתְּךָ? כָּךְ וְכָךְ. עָמְדוּ וְקִדְּשׁוּ קָנוּ, הֵן הֵן הַדְּבָרִים הַנִּקְנִין בַּאֲמִירָה.
human_translation: For Rav Giddel said Rav said: How much do you give to your son such and such how much do you give to your daughter? Such and such arose and the betrothal acquired These are the things that are acquired through words
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Rav Giddel said in the name of Rav: "How much do you give to your son?" "Such and such." "How much do you give to your daughter?" "Such and such." They stood up and consecrated, they are indeed the things acquired through speech.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: אֵין נוֹשְׂאִין נָשִׁים בַּמּוֹעֵד, לֹא בְּתוּלוֹת וְלֹא אַלְמָנוֹת. וְלֹא מְיַבְּמִין, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁשִּׂמְחָה הִיא לוֹ. הָא לְאָרֵס — שָׁרֵי.
human_translation: Let us say supports One may not marry a woman on the a Festival, neither a virgin nor a widow; nor may one perform levirate marriage because that a joyous for him. but betrothing is permitted.
llm_translation: Let us say, it supports him: Women are not carried on the festival, neither virgins nor widows. And they do not perform levirate marriage, because it is a joy for him. But for betrothal - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר. לָא מִיבַּעְיָא לְאָרֵס — דְּלָא קָעָבֵיד מִצְוָה, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ לִישָּׂא נָמֵי, דְּקָא עָבֵיד מִצְוָה, אָסוּר.
human_translation: it is speaking in the style of: Needless to say. needless to say betrothal because does not perform a mitzva Rather, even of marriage, through which one performs a mitzva, not permitted.
llm_translation: He is not asking about betrothal. He is not asking about betrothal to a widow - because he is not fulfilling a commandment, but even to marry a widow, who is fulfilling a commandment, is prohibited.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי שְׁמוּאֵל: מְאָרְסִין, אֲבָל לֹא כּוֹנְסִין. וְאֵין עוֹשִׂין סְעוּדַת אֵירוּסִין, וְלֹא מְיַבְּמִין, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁשִּׂמְחָה הִיא לוֹ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Come hear that which the school of Shmuel taught One may betroth but he may not marry nor may he make a betrothal feast, nor may he perform levirate marriage, because that a joyous for him, Learn from this
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught in the school of Shmuel: They may betroth, but not gather. And they do not make a betrothal feast, and they do not perform levirate marriage, because it is a joy for him. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל שֶׁמָּא יִקְדְּמֶנּוּ אַחֵר? וְהָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּכׇל יוֹם וְיוֹם בַּת קוֹל יוֹצֵאת וְאוֹמֶרֶת: בַּת פְּלוֹנִי לִפְלוֹנִי, שְׂדֵה פְלוֹנִי לִפְלוֹנִי.
human_translation: And did Shmuel say perhaps another first? But didn’t Rav Yehuda say that Shmuel said: Every day a Divine Voice issues forth and says: The daughter of so-and-so so-and-so; the field of so-and-so to so-and-so?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who said that Shmuel perhaps another precedes him? And Rav Yehudah said that Shmuel said: Every day a heavenly voice goes out and says, 'The daughter of so-and-so to so-and-so, the field of so-and-so to so-and-so.'"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: שֶׁמָּא יִקְדְּמֶנּוּ אַחֵר בְּרַחֲמִים.
human_translation: Rather, Perhaps another first by means of mercy.
llm_translation: Rather: perhaps another will precede him with mercy.

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּרָבָא שַׁמְעֵיהּ לְהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּבָעֵי רַחֲמֵי וְאָמַר: תִּזְדְּמֵן לִי פְּלָנִיתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא תִּיבְעֵי רַחֲמֵי הָכִי. אִי חַזְיָא לָךְ — לָא אָזְלָא מִינָּךְ, וְאִי לָא — כָּפְרַתְּ בַּה׳. בָּתַר הָכִי, שַׁמְעֵיהּ דְּקָאָמַר: אוֹ אִיהוּ לֵימוּת מִקַּמַּהּ, אוֹ אִיהִי תְּמוּת מִקַּמֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו אָמֵינָא לָךְ לָא תִּיבְעֵי עֲלַהּ דְּמִילְּתָא?
human_translation: like this which Rava heard a certain man asking for mercy, who said: Grant me so-and-so said to him: Do not ask for mercy this If is fit for you, she will not go away from you. And if not you will deny the Lord After heard him say either let him die before her or let her die before him. said to him: Did I not say to you not to pray for this matter?
llm_translation: The matter of Rava, whose name was heard by that man who sought mercy, and he said: "May such and such happen to me." He said to him: "Do not seek mercy in this way. If you see it - it will not depart from you, and if not - you will have atoned with God." After this, he heard him saying: "Either he will die before her, or she will die before him." He said to him: "Do you not believe that you should not seek mercy for such a matter?"

hebrew_text: הָכִי אָמַר רַב מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי רְאוּבֵן בֶּן אִצְטְרוֹבִילִי: מִן הַתּוֹרָה וּמִן הַנְּבִיאִים וּמִן הַכְּתוּבִים — מֵה׳ אִשָּׁה לְאִישׁ. מִן הַתּוֹרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַן לָבָן וּבְתוּאֵל וַיֹּאמְרוּ מֵה׳ יָצָא הַדָּבָר״. מִן הַנְּבִיאִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ לֹא יָדְעוּ כִּי מֵה׳ הִיא״. מִן הַכְּתוּבִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״בַּיִת וָהוֹן נַחֲלַת אָבוֹת וּמֵה׳ אִשָּׁה מַשְׂכָּלֶת״.
human_translation: Rav said in the name of Rabbi Reuven ben Itzterobili as follows: From the Torah, and from the Prophets, and from the Writings; woman to man from God. from the Torah, as it is written: “Then Laban and Bethuel answered and said: The thing comes from the Lord, From the Prophets, as it is written: “But his father and his mother knew not that it was of the Lord” From the Writings, as it is written: “House and riches are the inheritance of fathers; but a prudent woman is from the Lord”
llm_translation: So said Rav in the name of Rabbi Reuven ben Itztrovil: "From the Torah, and from the Prophets, and from the Writings - 'From the Lord a woman to a man.' From the Torah, as it is written: 'And Laban and Bethuel answered and said, "From the Lord has this thing come about."' From the Prophets, as it is written: 'And his father and mother did not know that it was from the Lord.' From the Writings, as it is written: 'House and wealth are an inheritance from fathers, but from the Lord comes an understanding wife.'"

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי רְאוּבֵן בֶּן אִצְטְרוֹבִילִי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא, אָמַר רַבִּי רְאוּבֵן בֶּן אִצְטְרוֹבִילִי: אֵין אָדָם נֶחְשָׁד בְּדָבָר אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן עֲשָׂאוֹ, וְאִם לֹא עָשָׂה כּוּלּוֹ — עָשָׂה מִקְצָתוֹ, וְאִם לֹא עָשָׂה מִקְצָתוֹ — הִרְהֵר בְּלִבּוֹ לַעֲשׂוֹתוֹ, וְאִם לֹא הִרְהֵר בְּלִבּוֹ לַעֲשׂוֹתוֹ — רָאָה אֲחֵרִים שֶׁעָשׂוּ וְשָׂמַח.
human_translation: Rav said in the name of Rabbi Reuven ben Itzterobili, and some say it was taught in a baraita Rabbi Reuven ben Itzterobili said: A man is suspected of something only if he has done so. And if he did not do it wholly, he did it partly. And if he did not do it partly, he thought in his heart to do it. And if he did not think to himself to do it, he saw others doing it and was happy.
llm_translation: And Rav said in the name of Rabbi Reuven ben Itztrovilai, and some say it was taught in a baraita, Rabbi Reuven ben Itztrovilai said: A person is not suspected of a matter unless he did it, and if he did not do it entirely — he did part of it, and if he did not do part of it — he contemplated in his heart to do it, and if he did not contemplate in his heart to do it — he saw others who did and rejoiced.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב: ״וַיְחַפְּאוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל דְּבָרִים אֲשֶׁר לֹא כֵן עַל ה׳ אֱלֹהֵיהֶם״! הָתָם לְהַכְעִיס הוּא דַּעֲבוּד.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov raised an objection: “And the children of Israel fabricated matters that were not right against the Lord their God” There they did it in order to anger
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: "Rabbi Yaakov asks: 'And the children of Israel provoked with things that were not so upon the Lord their God'!" There, it was to anger Him with idolatry.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וַיְקַנְאוּ לְמֹשֶׁה בַּמַּחֲנֶה לְאַהֲרֹן קְדוֹשׁ ה׳״, רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכׇּל אֶחָד קִינֵּא לְאִשְׁתּוֹ מִמֹּשֶׁה! הָתָם מִשּׁוּם שִׂנְאָה הוּא דַּעֲבוּד.
human_translation: Come hear “And they were jealous of Moses in the camp, of Aaron the Lord’s holy one” Rav Shmuel bar Yitzḥak said: teaches that every man warned his wife with Moses There they did it out of hatred
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: 'And they envied Moses in the camp, and Aaron the holy one of the Lord.'" Rav Shmuel bar Yitzchak said: This teaches that each one envied his wife from Moses! There, it is because of hatred that it is considered idolatry.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: יְהֵא חֶלְקִי עִם מִי שֶׁחוֹשְׁדִין אוֹתוֹ בְּדָבָר וְאֵין בּוֹ. וְאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לְדִידִי חַשְׁדוּן וְלָא הֲוָה בִּי!
human_translation: Come hear that which Rabbi Yosei said: May my portion be with one who is suspected but is innocent, And Rav Pappa said: They suspected me but I was not
llm_translation: Come and hear, Rabbi Yosei said: "Let my portion be with those who suspect me of something I am not guilty of." And Rav Papa said: "For me, suspicion is enough, even if there is no basis for it!"

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּקָלָא דְּפָסֵיק, הָא בְּקָלָא דְלָא פָּסֵיק. וְקָלָא דְלָא פָּסֵיק עַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אֲמַרָה לִי אֵם: דּוֹמֵי דְמָתָא יוֹמָא וּפַלְגָא.
human_translation: It not difficult. This to a rumor that stops, that to a rumor that does not stop, a rumor that does not stop, for how long Abaye said: My nurse told me: Local gossip lasts for a day and a half,
llm_translation: Not difficult: this in a case of a clear interruption, that in a case of a non-interruption. And how long is a non-interruption? Abaye said, his mother told him: "It is like the length of a day and a half."

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי דְּלָא פְּסַק בֵּינֵי בֵּינֵי, אֲבָל פְּסַק בֵּינֵי בֵּינֵי — לֵית לַן בַּהּ. וְכִי פְּסַק בֵּינֵי בֵּינֵי, לָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא פְּסַק מֵחֲמַת יִרְאָה, אֲבָל פְּסַק מֵחֲמַת יִרְאָה — לָא.
human_translation: This applies only did not stop in between, but it stopped in between we have no with it, And if stopped in between, we said only stopped not out of fear, stopped out of fear, not
llm_translation: These are the matters in which he did not separate between them, but if he separated between them - we do not have it. And when he separated between them, we only said that he did not separate due to fear, but if he separated due to fear - no.

hebrew_text: וְלָא אֲמַרַן, אֶלָּא דְּלָא הָדַר נָבֵט, אֲבָל הָדַר נָבֵט — לָא. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ אוֹיְבִים, אֲבָל אִית לֵיהּ אוֹיְבִים — אוֹיְבִים הוּא דְּאַפְּקוּהּ לְקָלָא.
human_translation: And we said only if it did not arise again. But it arose again, not And we said only if has no enemies. But he has enemies, it was the enemies who disseminated the rumor.
llm_translation: And we did not say, except that he did not look back, but if he did look back - no. And we did not say except that he has no enemies, but if he has enemies - it is the enemies that have caused him harm.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין כּוֹתְבִין שְׁטָרֵי חוֹב בַּמּוֹעֵד. וְאִם אֵינוֹ מַאֲמִינוֹ, אוֹ שֶׁאֵין לוֹ מַה יֹּאכַל — הֲרֵי זֶה יִכְתּוֹב.
human_translation: One may not write bills of debt on a Festival. But if does not trust or has nothing to eat, he may write
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may not write promissory notes during a festival. And if one does not trust him, or if he has nothing to eat - he should be written off.

hebrew_text: אֵין כּוֹתְבִין סְפָרִים תְּפִילִּין וּמְזוּזוֹת בַּמּוֹעֵד, וְאֵין מַגִּיהִין אוֹת אַחַת אֲפִילּוּ בְּסֵפֶר עֶזְרָא. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כּוֹתֵב אָדָם תְּפִילִּין וּמְזוּזוֹת לְעַצְמוֹ,
human_translation: One may not write scrolls, phylacteries, or mezuzot on the a Festival, nor may one correct a single letter, even in the scroll of Ezra, Rabbi Yehuda says: One may write phylacteries and mezuzot for himself
llm_translation: One does not write scrolls, phylacteries, and mezuzot on a festival, and one does not recite even a single letter from them, not even from the Book of Ezra. Rabbi Yehuda says: A person may write phylacteries and mezuzot for himself.

hebrew_text: וְטוֹוֶה עַל יְרֵיכוֹ תְּכֵלֶת לְצִיצִיתוֹ.
human_translation: And one may spin sky-blue for ritual fringes on his thigh,
llm_translation: "And a cord of blue on the fringe of his garment."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כּוֹתֵב אָדָם תְּפִילִּין וּמְזוּזוֹת לְעַצְמוֹ, וְטוֹוֶה עַל יְרֵיכוֹ תְּכֵלֶת לְצִיצִיתוֹ, וְלַאֲחֵרִים בְּטוֹבָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מַעֲרִים, וּמוֹכֵר אֶת שֶׁלּוֹ, וְחוֹזֵר וְכוֹתֵב לְעַצְמוֹ. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כּוֹתֵב וּמוֹכֵר כְּדַרְכּוֹ כְּדֵי פַרְנָסָתוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught A person may write phylacteries and mezuzot for himself and spin sky-blue for his fringes on his thigh. And for others as a favor, the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: he may employ artifice, sell his own and go back and write for himself. Rabbi Yosei says: He may write and sell in his manner, enough for his livelihood.
llm_translation: The sages taught: A person may write tefillin and mezuzot for himself, and dye a thread of tekhelet for his tzitzit, and for others with good intent, these are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: He may hide them, sell his own, and then write for himself. Rabbi Yosei says: He may write and sell in his usual manner for his livelihood.

hebrew_text: אוֹרִי לֵיהּ רַב לְרַב חֲנַנְאֵל, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה לְרַב חֲנַנְאֵל: הֲלָכָה, כּוֹתֵב וּמוֹכֵר כְּדַרְכּוֹ כְּדֵי פַרְנָסָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rav ruled for Rav Ḥananel, and some say Rabba bar bar Ḥana for Rav Ḥananel: The halakha is one may write and sell in his manner, enough for his livelihood.
llm_translation: Illuminate it to Rav for Rav Chananel, and some say to him Rabba bar bar Chanah to Rav Chananel: Halacha, one writes and sells in his usual manner for his livelihood.

hebrew_text: וְטוֹוֶה עַל יְרֵיכוֹ תְּכֵלֶת. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: טוֹוֶה אָדָם עַל יְרֵיכוֹ תְּכֵלֶת לְצִיצִיתוֹ, אֲבָל לֹא בְּאֶבֶן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אַף בְּאֶבֶן. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשְּׁמוֹ: בְּאֶבֶן אֲבָל לֹא בְּפֶלֶךְ, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בֵּין בְּאֶבֶן בֵּין בְּפֶלֶךְ.
human_translation: And one may spin sky-blue for ritual fringes on his thigh. The Sages taught A person may spin sky-blue for his ritual fringes on his thigh, but not with a stone, the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. But the Rabbis say: even with a stone. Rabbi Yehuda said in with a stone, but not with a spindle. And the Rabbis say: with either a stone or a spindle.
llm_translation: "And a thread of blue on the corner. The Rabbis taught: A person ties a thread of blue on the corner of his garment for his tzitzit, but not with a stone, according to the words of Rabbi Eliezer. And the Sages say: Even with a stone. Rabbi Yehuda says in his own name: With a stone but not with a shell, and the Sages say: Whether with a stone or with a shell."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה בֵּין בְּאֶבֶן בֵּין בְּפֶלֶךְ. וַהֲלָכָה: כּוֹתֵב כְּדַרְכּוֹ וּמוֹכֵר כְּדֵי פַרְנָסָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said, and similarly Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: both with a stone and with a spindle, And the halakha is: One may write in his manner and sell enough for his livelihood.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel, and so said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The halakha is the same whether with regard to a stone or with regard to a clod. And the halakha is: One may write in his usual manner and sell in order to sustain himself.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַקּוֹבֵר אֶת מֵתוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים קוֹדֶם לָרֶגֶל — בָּטְלָה הֵימֶנּוּ גְּזֵרַת שִׁבְעָה. שְׁמוֹנָה — בָּטְלוּ הֵימֶנּוּ גְּזֵרַת שְׁלֹשִׁים.
human_translation: One who buries his deceased three days before a pilgrimage Festival the decree of seven- nullified for him eight the decree of thirty is nullified for him.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who buries his deceased three days before a festival — his seven-day mourning period is annulled. If it is eight days before the festival — his thirty-day mourning period is annulled.

hebrew_text: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאָמְרוּ: שַׁבָּת עוֹלָה, וְאֵינָהּ מַפְסֶקֶת. רְגָלִים מַפְסִיקִין, וְאֵינָן עוֹלִין.
human_translation: because said Shabbat counts and it does not interrupt pilgrimage Festivals, interrupt They do not, count.
llm_translation: Because they said: Shabbat ascends, yet it does not interrupt. Festivals interrupt, yet they do not ascend.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מִשֶּׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, עֲצֶרֶת כַּשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: From the time that the Temple was destroyed, Shavuot is like Shabbat,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: From when the Temple was destroyed, the gathering is like Shabbat.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים כָּרְגָלִים. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: לֹא כְּדִבְרֵי זֶה וְלֹא כְּדִבְרֵי זֶה, אֶלָּא: עֲצֶרֶת כָּרְגָלִים, רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים כַּשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: Rosh HaShana and Yom Kippur like pilgrimage Festivals, And the Rabbis say: is neither in accordance with the statement of nor in accordance with the statement of  Rather, Shavuot like the pilgrimage Festivals, Rosh HaShana and Yom Kippur like Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur are like festivals. And the sages say: Not like the words of this one and not like the words of that one, rather: a festival-like assembly, Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur are like Shabbat.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב: גְּזֵרוֹת — בָּטְלוּ, יָמִים — לֹא בָּטְלוּ, וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי הוּנָא: גְּזֵרוֹת — בָּטְלוּ, יָמִים — לֹא בָּטְלוּ. וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ יָמִים נָמֵי בָּטְלוּ.
human_translation: Rav said: decree, was nullified, the days were not nullified. And so said Rav Huna: The decree was nullified, the days were not nullified. And Rav Sheshet said: Even the days were also nullified.
llm_translation: Gemara said Rav: Decrees - nullified, days - not nullified, and so said Rabbi Huna: Decrees - nullified, days - not nullified. And Rav Sheshet said: Even days indeed nullified.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא יָמִים לֹא בָּטְלוּ? שֶׁאִם לֹא גִּילַּח עֶרֶב הָרֶגֶל — אָסוּר לְגַלֵּחַ אַחַר הָרֶגֶל.
human_translation: What is the reason that the days were not nullified? that if he did not cut his hair on the eve of the Festival, he is prohibited from cutting his hair after the Festival
llm_translation: What is the reason that days were not nullified? Because if one did not shave on the eve of the festival, it is forbidden to shave after the festival.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: הַקּוֹבֵר אֶת מֵתוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים קוֹדֶם לָרֶגֶל — בָּטְלָה הֵימֶנּוּ גְּזֵרַת שִׁבְעָה, שְׁמוֹנָה יָמִים קוֹדֶם לָרֶגֶל — בָּטְלָה הֵימֶנּוּ גְּזֵרַת שְׁלֹשִׁים, וּמְגַלֵּחַ עֶרֶב הָרֶגֶל. אִם לֹא גִּילַּח עֶרֶב הָרֶגֶל — אָסוּר לְגַלֵּחַ אַחַר הָרֶגֶל.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught one who buries his dead three days before a pilgrimage Festival, the decree of seven- nullified for him. eight the decree of thirty is nullified for him, cut his hair on the eve of the Festival. If, he did not cut his hair on the eve of the Festival, he is prohibited from cutting his hair after the Festival
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: One who buries his deceased three days before the festival — the decree of seven days of mourning is annulled for him. Eight days before the festival — the decree of thirty days of mourning is annulled for him, and he shaves on the eve of the festival. If he did not shave on the eve of the festival — it is forbidden to shave after the festival.

hebrew_text: אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: מוּתָּר לְגַלֵּחַ אַחַר הָרֶגֶל, שֶׁכְּשֵׁם שֶׁמִּצְוַת שְׁלֹשָׁה מְבַטֶּלֶת גְּזֵרַת שִׁבְעָה, כָּךְ מִצְוַת שִׁבְעָה מְבַטֶּלֶת גְּזֵרַת שְׁלֹשִׁים.
human_translation: Abba Shaul says: he is permitted to cut his hair after the Festival, for just as the mitzva of three cancels the decree of seven- so too, the mitzva of seven cancels the decree of thirty-
llm_translation: Abba Shaul says: It is permitted to shave after the festival, for just as the obligation of three nullifies the decree of seven, so too the obligation of seven nullifies the decree of thirty.

hebrew_text: שִׁבְעָה? וְהָאֲנַן שְׁמוֹנָה תְּנַן! קָסָבַר אַבָּא שָׁאוּל: מִקְצָת הַיּוֹם כְּכוּלּוֹ, וְיוֹם שְׁבִיעִי עוֹלֶה לוֹ לְכָאן וּלְכָאן. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רָבִינָא בַּר שֵׁילָא: הֲלָכָה כְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל.
human_translation: seven But didn’t we learn eight Abba Shaul maintains part of the day is like an entire day, the seventh day counts as both Rav Ḥisda said Ravina bar Sheila said: The halakha is in accordance with Abba Shaul.
llm_translation: Seven? But we learned eight! Abba Saul holds: Part of the day is like the whole day, and the seventh day is incumbent upon him from here and from there. Rav Hisda said, Ravina bar Sheila said: The halakha is in accordance with Abba Saul.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדִים חֲכָמִים לְאַבָּא שָׁאוּל כְּשֶׁחָל שְׁמִינִי שֶׁלּוֹ לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת עֶרֶב הָרֶגֶל, שֶׁמּוּתָּר לְגַלֵּחַ בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: And the Rabbis concede to Abba Shaul that when one’s eighth occurs on a Shabbat, the eve of a Festival, he is permitted to cut his hair on Friday,
llm_translation: The sages agree with Abba Shaul that when the eighth day of his circumcision falls on the eve of a festival, it is permitted to shave on Erev Shabbat.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב עַמְרָם אָמַר רַב: אָבֵל, כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָמְדוּ מְנַחֲמִין מֵאֶצְלוֹ, מוּתָּר בִּרְחִיצָה? כְּמַאן — כְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which Rav Amram said Rav said: a mourner, once the comforters have stood up his he is immediately permitted to bathe? In accordance with whose In accordance Abba Shaul.
llm_translation: As to where did he go? This one that Rav Amram said in the name of Rav: "Aveil, once the comforters stood up from beside him, is he permitted to bathe? As to where? Like Abba Sha'ul.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הֲלָכָה כְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל בְּיוֹם שִׁבְעָה, וּמוֹדִים חֲכָמִים לְאַבָּא שָׁאוּל בְּיוֹם שְׁלֹשִׁים, דְּאָמְרִינַן מִקְצָת הַיּוֹם כְּכוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: Abaye said: The halakha is in accordance with Abba Shaul with regard to the seventh and the Rabbis concede to Abba Shaul with regard to the thirtieth day, we say part of the day is like an entire
llm_translation: Abaye said: The halacha follows Abba Shaul on the seventh day, and the sages concede to Abba Shaul on the thirtieth day, for we say: "Part of the day is like the whole day."

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל בְּיוֹם שְׁלֹשִׁים, וְאֵין הֲלָכָה כְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל בְּיוֹם שִׁבְעָה. וּנְהַרְדָּעֵי אָמְרִי: הֲלָכָה כְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל בָּזוֹ וּבָזוֹ, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי הַמֵּיקֵל בְּאֵבֶל.
human_translation: Rava said: The halakha is in accordance with Abba Shaul with regard to the thirtieth day but the halakha is not in accordance with Abba Shaul with regard to the seventh And Neharde’a say: The halakha is in accordance with Abba Shaul with regard to both Shmuel said: The halakha follows the statement of the lenient in mourning.
llm_translation: Rava said: The halakha is like Abba Saul on the thirtieth day, and the halakha is not like Abba Saul on the seventh day. And the Nehardeans say: The halakha is like Abba Saul in this and in this, for Samuel said: The halakha follows the lenient view in matters of mourning.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם מְנָלַן? יָלֵיף ״פֶּרַע״ ״פֶּרַע״ מִנָּזִיר. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״רָאשֵׁיכֶם אַל תִּפְרָעוּ״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״גַּדֵּל פֶּרַע שְׂעַר רֹאשׁוֹ״, מָה לְהַלָּן שְׁלֹשִׁים, אַף כָּאן שְׁלֹשִׁים.
human_translation: From where do we thirty-day It is learned between pera pera a nazirite. Here, it is written: “Let the hair of your heads not grow loose [ tifra’u ]” And there, it is written: “He shall let the hair of his head grow long [ pera ]” Just as there, thirty so too, here thirty
llm_translation: Thirty days - from where do we derive this? We derive it from "pera pera" of a Nazirite. It is written here: "Do not let your hair become unkempt," and it is written there: "He shall let the locks of hair on his head grow long." Just as there, it is thirty days, so too here it is thirty days.

hebrew_text: וְהָתָם מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה: סְתַם נְזִירוּת — שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר קְרָא: ״קָדוֹשׁ יִהְיֶה״, יִהְיֶה בְּגִימַטְרִיָּא תְּלָתִין הָווּ.
human_translation: And there, from where do we Rav Mattana said: An unspecified naziriteship, thirty days. What is the reason The verse states: “He shall be sacred, “He shall be [ yihye ],” has a numerical value [ gimatriyya ] of thirty,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And where do we derive this from? Rav Matna said: A regular Nazirite - thirty days. What is the reason? The verse says, "He shall be holy," which in gematria equals thirty.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: הַכֹּל מוֹדִין כְּשֶׁחָל שְׁלִישִׁי שֶׁלּוֹ לִהְיוֹת עֶרֶב הָרֶגֶל — שֶׁאָסוּר בִּרְחִיצָה עַד הָעֶרֶב.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Everyone, agrees when his third occurs on the eve of the Festival, is prohibited from bathing until the evening.
llm_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: Everyone agrees that when the third hour of the day arrives to be the eve of a festival, washing is prohibited until evening.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נְחֶמְיָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: אַשְׁכַּחְתִּינְהוּ לְרַב פַּפֵּי וּלְרַב פָּפָּא דְּיָתְבִי וְקָאָמְרִי: הֲלָכָה כְּרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב נְחֶמְיָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף: אַשְׁכַּחְתִּינְהוּ לְרַב פַּפֵּי וּלְרַב פָּפָּא וּלְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ דְּיָתְבִי וְקָאָמְרִי: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים שֶׁאִם חָל שְׁלִישִׁי שֶׁלּוֹ לִהְיוֹת עֶרֶב הָרֶגֶל — שֶׁאָסוּר בִּרְחִיצָה עַד הָעֶרֶב.
human_translation: Rav Neḥemya, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: I found Rav Pappi and Rav Pappa sitting and saying: The halakha is in accordance with Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua. There are who say Rav Neḥemya, son of Rav Yosef, said: I found Rav Pappi, Rav Pappa, and Rav Huna, son of Yehoshua, sitting and saying: Everyone concedes when the third occurs on the eve of a Festival, is prohibited from bathing until the evening.
llm_translation: Rav Nechemya, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: I found them sitting before Rav Pappai and Rav Papa, and they were saying: The halacha is according to Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua. Some say that Rav Nechemya, son of Rav Yosef, said: I found them sitting before Rav Pappai, Rav Papa, and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, and they were saying: Everyone agrees that if one's third meal is interrupted to be the eve of a festival, he is prohibited from washing until the evening.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ אַבָּיֵי מֵרָבָא: קְבָרוֹ בָּרֶגֶל, רֶגֶל עוֹלֶה לוֹ לְמִנְיַן שְׁלֹשִׁים, אוֹ אֵין רֶגֶל עוֹלֶה לוֹ לְמִנְיַן שְׁלֹשִׁים? לְמִנְיַן שִׁבְעָה לָא קָמִיבַּעְיָא לִי, דְּלָא נָהֲגָא מִצְוַת שִׁבְעָה בָּרֶגֶל. כִּי קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לִי לְמִנְיַן שְׁלֹשִׁים, דְּקָא נָהֲגָא מִצְוַת שְׁלֹשִׁים בָּרֶגֶל, מַאי?
human_translation: Abaye inquired of Rava: one buried on the Festival does the Festival count toward his thirty- or does the Festival not count toward his thirty- I do not ask seven- the obligation seven does not apply during the Festival, What I am asking is thirty- mitzva of thirty- do apply during the Festival, What,
llm_translation: Abaye asked Rava: If one's grave is at the foot of a mountain, does the foot count towards the tally of thirty cubits, or does the foot not count towards the tally of thirty? I do not need to ask about the tally of seven, for the mitzvah of seven is not practiced at the foot. When I ask about the tally of thirty, for the mitzvah of thirty is practiced at the foot, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵינוֹ עוֹלֶה. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: הַקּוֹבֵר אֶת מֵתוֹ שְׁנֵי יָמִים קוֹדֶם הָרֶגֶל — מוֹנֶה חֲמִשָּׁה יָמִים אַחַר הָרֶגֶל, וּמְלַאכְתּוֹ נַעֲשֵׂית עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים, וַעֲבָדָיו וְשִׁפְחוֹתָיו עוֹשִׂים בְּצִינְעָא בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ, וְאֵין רַבִּים מִתְעַסְּקִין עִמּוֹ,
human_translation: said to him: does not count raised an objection to one buries his dead two days before a Festival, he must count five days after the Festival, and his work is performed by others. And his menservants and maidservants do in private inside his house, and the public need not occupy themselves with him
llm_translation: He said to him: He does not go up. They raised an objection against him: One who buries his deceased two days before the festival - counts five days after the festival, and his work is done by others, and his male and female slaves do it secretly inside his house, and many do not engage with him.

hebrew_text: שֶׁכְּבָר נִתְעַסְּקוּ בּוֹ בָּרֶגֶל. כְּלָלוֹ שֶׁל דָּבָר: כׇּל שֶׁהוּא מִשּׁוּם אֵבֶל — רֶגֶל מַפְסִיקוֹ. וְכׇל שֶׁהוּא מִשּׁוּם עִסְקֵי רַבִּים — אֵין רֶגֶל מַפְסִיקוֹ.
human_translation: for they already occupied themselves with him during the Festival. The principle with regard to the matter Any that because it is mourning is interrupted by the Festival And anything that involves the public’s occupation is not interrupted by the Festival,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Shekvar nit'asku bo baregel. Kelalo shel davar: Kol shehu mishum evel — regel mafsiko. Ve'kol shehu mishum iskei rabim — ein regel mafsiko." English translation: "For they have already engaged in it on foot. The general principle: Anything that is due to mourning — the foot interrupts it. And anything that is due to communal matters — the foot does not interrupt it."

hebrew_text: קְבָרוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים בְּסוֹף הָרֶגֶל — מוֹנֶה שִׁבְעָה אַחַר הָרֶגֶל, אַרְבָּעָה יָמִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים — רַבִּים מִתְעַסְּקִין בּוֹ, שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים הָאַחֲרוֹנִים — אֵין רַבִּים מִתְעַסְּקִין בּוֹ, שֶׁכְּבָר נִתְעַסְּקוּ [בּוֹ] בָּרֶגֶל, וְרֶגֶל עוֹלֶה לוֹ.
human_translation: he three days the end of the Festival, must count seven after the Festival first four days the public must occupy themselves with him the three last days, the public need not occupy themselves with him, as they already occupied themselves with him during the Festival. And the Festival counts for him
llm_translation: His grave three days at the end of the festival — counts seven after the festival, four days the first — many are occupied with it, three days the last — not many are occupied with it, for they have already been occupied with it at the festival, and the festival is a merit for him.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו — אַסֵּיפָא! לָא, אַרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: What, is it not the latter clause No, the first clause,
llm_translation: What is "Lavo" - the latter part! No, the former part.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: רֶגֶל עוֹלֶה לוֹ לְמִנְיַן שְׁלֹשִׁים, כֵּיצַד? קְבָרוֹ בִּתְחִילַּת הָרֶגֶל — מוֹנֶה שִׁבְעָה אַחַר הָרֶגֶל, ומְלַאכְתּוֹ נַעֲשֵׂית עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים, וַעֲבָדָיו וְשִׁפְחוֹתָיו עוֹשִׂין בְּצִנְעָא בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ, וְאֵין רַבִּים מִתְעַסְּקִין בּוֹ, שֶׁכְּבָר נִתְעַסְּקוּ בּוֹ בָּרֶגֶל, וְרֶגֶל עוֹלֶה לוֹ. תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: raised an objection to A pilgrimage Festival counts toward the thirty- How so? buried at the beginning of a pilgrimage Festival, he must count seven after the Festival, and his work is performed by others. And his menservants and maidservants perform in private inside his house, and the public need not occupy themselves with him for they already occupied themselves with him during the Festival. And the Festival counts for him. a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: A foot ascends for him to the count of thirty, how so? His grave at the beginning of the foot - counts seven after the foot, and his work is done by others, and his male and female servants do it discreetly within his house, and many do not engage in it, for they have already engaged in it at the foot, and a foot ascends for him. This is a refutation.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֲפִילּוּ קְבָרוֹ בָּרֶגֶל, וְכֵן אוֹרִי לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לְרַבִּי פְּדָת בְּרֵיהּ: אֲפִילּוּ קְבָרוֹ בָּרֶגֶל.
human_translation: When Ravin came he said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even one buried during the Festival, And, similarly, Rabbi Elazar ruled for Rabbi Pedat, his son: Even if one buried during the Festival
llm_translation: When Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if his grave is at his feet. And so Rabbi Elazar said to Rabbi Pedat his son: Even if his grave is at his feet.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: קִיֵּים כְּפִיַּית הַמִּטָּה שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים קוֹדֶם הָרֶגֶל — אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לִכְפּוֹתָהּ אַחַר הָרֶגֶל, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֲפִילּוּ יוֹם אֶחָד, אֲפִילּוּ שָׁעָה אַחַת.
human_translation: The Sages taught one fulfilled the overturning the bed for three days before the pilgrimage Festival, he is no required to overturn it after the Festival; the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. But the Rabbis say: Even one day, or even for one hour,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If one fulfilled the obligation of reclining for three days before the festival, he is not required to recline after the festival - these are the words of Rabbi Eliezer. And the Sages say: Even one day, even one hour.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: הֵן הֵן דִּבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, הֵן הֵן דִּבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל. שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֲפִילּוּ יוֹם אֶחָד.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, said: This is the statement of Beit Shammai, that is the statement of Beit Hillel. for Beit Shammai say: Three days, and Beit Hillel say: Even one day.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, said: Yes, yes, the words of Beit Shammai, yes, yes, the words of Beit Hillel. For Beit Shammai say: three days, and Beit Hillel say: even one day.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא וּלְרַב הוּנָא: אֲפִילּוּ יוֹם אֶחָד, אֲפִילּוּ שָׁעָה אַחַת. רָבָא אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּתַנָּא דִּידַן דְּאָמַר שְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: Rav Huna said Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said, and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan said to Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba and to Rav Huna: Even one day, even one hour. Rava, said: The halakha is in accordance with the tanna our said three
llm_translation: Rav Huna said, Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said, Rabbi Yohanan said, and some say: Rabbi Yohanan said to Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba and to Rav Huna: Even one day, even one hour. Rava said: The halakha is in accordance with our Tanna who said three.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אִיקְּלַע לְסוּרָא דִפְרָת, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חֲבִיבָא לְרָבִינָא: הִלְכְתָא מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲפִילּוּ יוֹם אֶחָד, וַאֲפִילּוּ שָׁעָה אַחַת.
human_translation: Ravina happened Sura on the Euphrates Rav Ḥaviva said to Ravina: What is halakha He said to him: Even one day, and even one hour.
llm_translation: Ravinah arrived in the town of Pumbedita, Rav H̱aviva said to Ravina: What is the law? He said to him: Even for one day, and even for one hour.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא וְרַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא אַקִּילְעָא דְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר, נְפַק מִילְּתָא מִבֵּינַיְיהוּ: מִנַּיִן לַאֲבֵילוּת שִׁבְעָה — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָפַכְתִּי חַגֵּיכֶם לְאֵבֶל״, מָה חַג שִׁבְעָה — אַף אֲבֵילוּת שִׁבְעָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, Rabbi Ami, and Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa were sitting in the pavilion of Rabbi Yitzḥak ben Elazar A matter emerged from among them: From where mourning seven As it is written: “And I will turn your Festivals into mourning” Just as a Festival seven so too mourning seven
llm_translation: Sitting were Rabbi Chiya bar Abba, and Rabbi Ammi, and Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha, the colleague of Rabbi Yitzchak ben Elazar. A matter emerged from among them: From where do we derive the mourning of seven days? As it is written: "And I will turn your feasts into mourning." Just as a feast lasts seven days, so too mourning lasts seven days.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא עֲצֶרֶת, דְּחַד יוֹמָא! הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ. דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה נְשִׂיאָה: מִנַּיִן לִשְׁמוּעָה רְחוֹקָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ נוֹהֶגֶת אֶלָּא יוֹם אֶחָד — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָפַכְתִּי חַגֵּיכֶם לְאֵבֶל״, וְאַשְׁכְּחַן עֲצֶרֶת דְּאִיקְּרִי חַד יוֹמָא חַג.
human_translation: And say Shavuot , which is one day. That is required for Reish Lakish, as Reish Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda Nesia: From where that distant tidings, applies for only one day? As it is written: “And I will turn your Festivals into mourning,” and we find Shavuot that one day is called a Festival.
llm_translation: And why is the assembly called an "Atzeret," for it is one day! That one Rabbi Yochanan sought to teach it to Reish Lakish. For Reish Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda the Prince: From where do we learn that the distant report of which is not customary except for one day — as it is written: "And I will turn your feasts into mourning," and we find that the Atzeret which is called a festival is one day.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁמוּעָה קְרוֹבָה — נוֹהֶגֶת שִׁבְעָה וּשְׁלֹשִׁים, שְׁמוּעָה רְחוֹקָה — אֵינָהּ נוֹהֶגֶת אֶלָּא יוֹם אֶחָד. אֵיזוֹ הִיא קְרוֹבָה וְאֵיזוֹ הִיא רְחוֹקָה? קְרוֹבָה בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים, רְחוֹקָה לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אַחַת שְׁמוּעָה קְרוֹבָה וְאַחַת שְׁמוּעָה רְחוֹקָה — נוֹהֶגֶת שִׁבְעָה וּשְׁלֹשִׁים.
human_translation: The Sages taught recent tidings applies for seven- and thirty- distant tidings, it applies only for one day. What are recent tidings and what are distant tidings? Recent within thirty Distant after thirty the statement of Rabbi Akiva. And the Rabbis say: Both recent tidings and distant tidings, applies for seven- and thirty-
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A close report - is practiced for thirty-seven days, a distant report - is only practiced for one day. What is considered close and what is considered distant? Close is within thirty days, distant is after thirty days, the words of Rabbi Akiva. And the sages say: Whether it is a close report or a distant report - it is practiced for thirty-seven days.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאַתָּה מוֹצֵא יָחִיד מֵקֵיל וְרַבִּים מַחְמִירִין — הֲלָכָה כָּרַבִּים. חוּץ מִזּוֹ, שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מֵקֵיל וַחֲכָמִים מַחְמִירִין — הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי הַמֵּקֵיל בְּאֵבֶל.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Wherever you find an individual being lenient and the majority being stringent, the halakha is in accordance with the majority, except for this for even though Rabbi Akiva is lenient and the Rabbis are stringent, the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva. stated by Shmuel: The halakha follows the statement of the lenient in mourning.
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: In every place where you find an individual lenient and the majority stringent - the halakha follows the majority. Except for this case, where even though Rabbi Akiva is lenient and the Sages are stringent - the halakha follows Rabbi Akiva. As Shmuel said: The halakha follows the lenient opinion in matters of mourning.

hebrew_text: רַב חֲנִינָא אַתְיָא לֵיהּ שְׁמוּעָה דַאֲבוּהּ מִבֵּי חוֹזָאֵי, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁמוּעָה רְחוֹקָה אֵינָהּ נוֹהֶגֶת אֶלָּא יוֹם אֶחָד. רַב נָתָן בַּר אַמֵּי אֲתָא לֵיהּ שְׁמוּעָה דְּאִימֵּיהּ מִבֵּי חוֹזָאֵי, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֲרֵי אָמְרוּ, שְׁמוּעָה רְחוֹקָה אֵינָהּ נוֹהֶגֶת אֶלָּא יוֹם אֶחָד בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: Rav Ḥanina received tidings of his father’s from Bei Ḥozai. He came before Rav Ḥisda said to him: distant tidings, applies for only one day. Rav Natan bar Ami received a report about his mother’s from Bei Ḥozai. He came before Rava, said to him: They said distant tidings, applies for only one day.
llm_translation: Rav Chanina came to hear a report from the household of Chozai, he came before Rav Chisda, he said to him: A distant report is only practiced for one day. Rav Natan bar Ami came to hear a report from his mother's household of Chozai, he came before Rava, he said to him: Behold they said, a distant report is only practiced for one day alone.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: בַּמָּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בַּחֲמִשָּׁה מֵתֵי מִצְוָה, אֲבָל עַל אָבִיו וְעַל אִמּוֹ שִׁבְעָה וּשְׁלֹשִׁים!
human_translation: raised an objection to In what is this statement said? the five close relatives, death a mitzva But for one’s father or mother, seven and thirty
llm_translation: He raised an objection: In what case are these words said? — In the case of five who are liable to the death penalty for transgressing a commandment, but for cursing one's father or mother, thirty-nine are liable!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יְחִידָאָה הִיא, וְלָא סְבִירָא לַן כְּווֹתֵיהּ. דְּתַנְיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה וּמֵת אָבִיו שֶׁל רַבִּי צָדוֹק בְּגִינְזַק, וְהוֹדִיעוּהוּ לְאַחַר שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים, וּבָא וְשָׁאַל אֶת אֱלִישָׁע בֶּן אֲבוּיָה וּזְקֵנִים שֶׁעִמּוֹ, וְאָמְרוּ: נְהוֹג שִׁבְעָה וּשְׁלֹשִׁים. וּכְשֶׁמֵּת בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי אֲחִיָּיה בַּגּוֹלָה, יָשַׁב עָלָיו שִׁבְעָה וּשְׁלֹשִׁים.
human_translation: said to him: is an individual and we do not hold in accordance with his as it is taught an incident and the father of Rabbi Tzadok died in Ginzak, and they informed him after three years. He came and asked Elisha ben Avuya and the Elders with him And said Observe seven and thirty And when the son of Rabbi Aḥiyya died in the Diaspora, sat seven and thirty
llm_translation: He said to him: It is a unique case, and it does not seem to us like his usual practice. As it was taught: The incident of the death of the father of Rabbi Tzadok in Ginzaq, and they informed him after three years, and he came and asked Elisha ben Avuya and the elders who were with him, and they said: It is customary to observe thirty-seven days of mourning. And when the son of Rabbi Aḥiyya died in exile, he observed upon him thirty-seven days of mourning.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָא רַב, בַּר אֲחוּהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא דְּהוּא בַּר אֲחָתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא, כִּי סְלֵיק לְהָתָם אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַבָּא קַיָּים?
human_translation: Is that so, But Rav was the son of Rabbi Ḥiyya’s brother and the son of Rabbi Ḥiyya’s sister, When went there, said to him: Is father, alive?
llm_translation: I am not? But Rav, the son of the brother of Rabbi Chiya, who is the son of his sister, Rabbi Chiya, when he went up there, said to him: "Is Abba alive?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִימָּא קַיֶּימֶת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִימָּא קַיֶּימֶת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַבָּא קַיָּים? אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ: חֲלוֹץ לִי מִנְעָלַי, וְהוֹלֵךְ אַחֲרַי כֵּלַי לְבֵית הַמֶּרְחָץ.
human_translation: said to him: Is mother alive? said to him: Is mother alive? said to him: Is father alive? said to his servant: Remove my shoes carry my clothes behind me, to the bathhouse.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Are you standing?" He said to him: "Are you standing?" He said to him: "Is Abba standing?" He said to him in order to hear: "Take off my shoes, and follow me to the bathhouse."

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תְּלָת. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ — אָבֵל אָסוּר בִּנְעִילַת הַסַּנְדָּל, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ — שְׁמוּעָה רְחוֹקָה אֵינָהּ נוֹהֶגֶת אֶלָּא יוֹם אֶחָד, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ — מִקְצָת הַיּוֹם כְּכוּלּוֹ!
human_translation: Learn three from this Learn from this a mourner is prohibited from wearing shoes, And learn from this distant tidings apply for only one day And learn from this part of the day is like of an entire
llm_translation: Listen to its type three. Listen to its type - morning is prohibited in sandal wearing, and listen to its type - a distant rumor is only prevalent for one day, and listen to its type - part of the day is like the whole!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חִיָּיא לְחוּד, רַבִּי אֲחִיָּיה לְחוּד.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya is a discrete and Rabbi Aḥiyya is a discrete
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya to the one side, Rabbi Achiya to the one side.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר אָבִין: שָׁמַע שְׁמוּעָה קְרוֹבָה בָּרֶגֶל, וּלְמוֹצָאֵי הָרֶגֶל נַעֲשֵׂית רְחוֹקָה — עוֹלָה לוֹ, וְאֵינוֹ נוֹהֵג אֶלָּא יוֹם אֶחָד. תָּנֵי רַבִּי אַדָּא דְּמִן קֵסָרִי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שָׁמַע שְׁמוּעָה קְרוֹבָה בְּשַׁבָּת, וּלְמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת נַעֲשֵׂית רְחוֹקָה — אֵינוֹ נוֹהֵג אֶלָּא יוֹם אֶחָד.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Avin said: one received recent tidings during a Festival, and after the Festival they became distant counts for him And, he observes only one day Rabbi Adda of Caesarea taught before Rabbi Yoḥanan: one received recent tidings on Shabbat, and at the conclusion of Shabbat it became distant tidings, he observes only one day
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Avin said: A rumor heard nearby on foot, and for those who are far from the foot, it becomes distant - it ascends for him, and he only observes one day. Rabbi Adda from Kesari related before Rabbi Yochanan: A rumor heard nearby on Shabbat, and for those who are far from Shabbat, it becomes distant - he only observes one day.

hebrew_text: קוֹרֵעַ אוֹ אֵינוֹ קוֹרֵעַ? רַבִּי מָנִי אָמַר: אֵינוֹ קוֹרֵעַ, רַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר: קוֹרֵעַ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי מָנִי לְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְדִידִי דְּאָמֵינָא אֵינוֹ קוֹרֵעַ, הַיְינוּ דְּלָא אִיכָּא אֲבֵילוּת שִׁבְעָה. אֶלָּא לְדִידָךְ דְּאָמְרַתְּ קוֹרֵעַ — קְרִיעָה בְּלֹא שִׁבְעָה מִי אִיכָּא?
human_translation: does one rend or does he not rend Rabbi Mani said: He does not rend Rabbi Ḥanina said: rend Rabbi Mani said to Rabbi Ḥanina: Granted, that according to my as I say he does not rend this is because there is no seven- mourning. But according to you, who says he does rend is there rending without a seven- mourning
llm_translation: He tears or does not tear? Rabbi Mani said: He does not tear, Rabbi Chanina said: He tears. Rabbi Mani said to Rabbi Chanina: According to my opinion that he does not tear, that is because there is no mourning of seven days. But according to your opinion that you say he tears — is there tearing without seven days?

hebrew_text: וְלָא?! וְהָתַנְיָא אִיסִי אֲבוּהּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אֲחוּהּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא: מִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ חָלוּק לִקְרוֹעַ, וְנִזְדַּמֵּן לוֹ בְּתוֹךְ שִׁבְעָה — קוֹרֵעַ. לְאַחַר שִׁבְעָה — אֵינוֹ קוֹרֵעַ.
human_translation: not? But isn’t it taught Isi, father of Rabbi Zeira, and some say the brother of Rabbi Zeira before Rabbi Zeira: one did not have garment to rend, and he acquired during the seven- rend after the seven- he does not rend
llm_translation: And not?! And it was taught in a Baraita: Isi the father of Rabbi Zeira, and some say it was his brother, stood before Rabbi Zeira and said: One who does not have a portion to tear, and it becomes available to him within seven days, tears. After seven days, he does not tear.

hebrew_text: עָנִי רַבִּי זֵירָא בָּתְרֵיהּ: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בַּחֲמִשָּׁה מֵתֵי מִצְוָה, אֲבָל עַל אָבִיו וְעַל אִמּוֹ — קוֹרֵעַ וְהוֹלֵךְ!
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira explained after him, In what is this statement said? the five close relatives death a mitzva But for one’s father or mother, one continues to rend
llm_translation: The poor, Rabbi Zeira lamented: In what case are these words said? — In regards to five who are obligated in mitzvot, but regarding one's father and mother — one must tear and go!

hebrew_text: כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא, לִכְבוֹד אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ.
human_translation: When that is taught, to honor his father or mother.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "For the honor of his father and mother."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כׇּל הָאָמוּר בְּפָרָשַׁת כֹּהֲנִים שֶׁכֹּהֵן מִיטַּמֵּא לָהֶן — אָבֵל מִתְאַבֵּל עֲלֵיהֶן, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: אִשְׁתּוֹ, אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ, אָחִיו וַאֲחוֹתוֹ, בְּנוֹ וּבִתּוֹ. הוֹסִיפוּ עֲלֵיהֶן: אָחִיו וַאֲחוֹתוֹ הַבְּתוּלָה מֵאִמּוֹ, וַאֲחוֹתוֹ נְשׂוּאָה, בֵּין מֵאָבִיו בֵּין מֵאִמּוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: all mentioned in the passage priests, for which a priest becomes impure, a mourner must mourn for them. And they are: His wife, his father, and his mother, his brother and his sister his son, and his daughter. added to His brother and his unmarried sister from the same mother, and his married sister, whether from the same father or from the same mother. although
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: All that is said in the portion of the priests that renders a priest impure to them — but he mourns for them, and these are they: his wife, his father, his mother, his brother, his sister, his son, and his daughter. They added to them: his brother's virgin sister from his mother, and his sister who is married, whether from his father or from his mother.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֵׁם שֶׁמִּתְאַבֵּל עֲלֵיהֶם — כָּךְ מִתְאַבֵּל עַל שְׁנִיִּים שֶׁלָּהֶם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ מִתְאַבֵּל אֶלָּא עַל בֶּן בְּנוֹ וְעַל אֲבִי אָבִיו. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל שֶׁמִּתְאַבֵּל עָלָיו, מִתְאַבֵּל עִמּוֹ.
human_translation: Just as one mourns for them, so too he mourns for their second-degree relatives. the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: He mourns only over his son’s son and his father’s father, And the Rabbis say: Any over whom one would mourn one mourns with him
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And just as one mourns for them - so one mourns for their two, the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: One only mourns for his grandson and his great-grandfather. And the sages say: Whoever mourns for him, others mourn with him.

hebrew_text: חֲכָמִים הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ עִמּוֹ בַּבַּיִת. כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ רַב לְחִיָּיא בְּרֵיהּ, וְכֵן אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא לְרַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ: בְּאַפַּהּ — נְהוֹג אֲבִילוּתָא, בְּלָא אַפַּהּ — לָא תִּינְהוֹג אֲבִילוּתָא.
human_translation: the Rabbis is first tanna , between them with him in the house. like what Rav said to his son, Ḥiyya, and similarly Rav Huna said to his son Rabba, In her presence practice mourning, out of her presence do not practice mourning.
llm_translation: The sages, is that the first Tanna? There is a difference between them, he is with him in the house. For this is what Rav said to Chiya his son, and so Rav Huna said to Rabbah his son: With the oven - mourning is customary, without the oven - mourning is not customary.

hebrew_text: מָר עוּקְבָא שְׁכֵיב לֵיהּ בַּר חֲמוּהּ. סְבַר לְמֵיתַב עֲלֵיהּ שִׁבְעָה וּשְׁלֹשִׁים, עָל רַב הוּנָא לְגַבֵּיהּ, אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: צוּדָנְיָיתָא בָּעֵית לְמֵיכַל?! לֹא אָמְרוּ לִכְבוֹד אִשְׁתּוֹ — אֶלָּא חָמִיו וַחֲמוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: the son of Mar Ukva’s father-in-law, died, thought to sit over him for seven- and thirty- Rav Huna went into his found him said to him: Do you desire to eat mourners’ food [ tzudaniyyata ]? said in honor of his wife only his father-in-law or his mother-in-law.
llm_translation: Mar Ukva lay with Bar Chamuah. He thought to bring upon him thirty-seven lashes. Rav Huna found him, encountered him, and said to him: "You seek to eat a hunted animal?! They did not say this out of respect for his wife — rather, for his father-in-law and mother-in-law."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: מִי שֶׁמֵּת חָמִיו אוֹ חֲמוֹתוֹ — אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לָכוֹף אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ לִהְיוֹת כּוֹחֶלֶת וְלִהְיוֹת פּוֹקֶסֶת, אֶלָּא כּוֹפֶה מִטָּתוֹ, וְנוֹהֵג עִמָּהּ אֲבֵילוּת. וְכֵן הִיא שֶׁמֵּת חָמִיהָ אוֹ חֲמוֹתָהּ — אֵינָהּ רַשָּׁאָה לִהְיוֹת כּוֹחֶלֶת וְלִהְיוֹת פּוֹקֶסֶת, אֶלָּא כּוֹפָה מִטָּתָהּ וְנוֹהֶגֶת עִמּוֹ אֲבֵילוּת.
human_translation: As it is taught One whose father-in-law or mother-in-law died may not force his wife to paint [ koḥelet ] or put rouge [ pokeset Rather, he should overturn his bed, and observe mourning with her. And similarly, when her father-in-law or mother-in-law dies, she may not paint or put rouge Rather, she should overturn her bed and practice mourning with him.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One whose father-in-law or mother-in-law dies— he is not permitted to compel his wife to be a mourner and to be disdainful, rather he compels her from her bed, and he conducts himself with her in mourning. And similarly, if her father-in-law or mother-in-law dies— she is not permitted to be a mourner and to be disdainful, rather he compels her from her bed, and she conducts herself with him in mourning.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לָכוֹף אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ לִהְיוֹת כּוֹחֶלֶת וְלִהְיוֹת פּוֹקֶסֶת, בֶּאֱמֶת אָמְרוּ מוֹזֶגֶת לוֹ אֶת הַכּוֹס, וּמַצַּעַת לוֹ מִטָּה, ומַרְחֶצֶת לוֹ פָּנָיו יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו. קַשְׁיָין אַהֲדָדֵי!
human_translation: And it was taught in another Even though said that may not force his wife to paint or put rouge actually, they said she may pour his cup make his bed, and wash his face, hands, and feet, contradict each other:
llm_translation: And it was taught in another Baraita: Even though they said one is not permitted to compel his wife to be like a warrior and to be brazen, in truth they said: She should mix the cup for him, spread a bed for him, and wash his face, hands, and feet. They are affectionate towards each other!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: כָּאן בְּחָמִיו וַחֲמוֹתוֹ, כָּאן בִּשְׁאָר קְרוֹבִים. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: לֹא אָמְרוּ לִכְבוֹד אִשְׁתּוֹ אֶלָּא חָמִיו וַחֲמוֹתוֹ בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: Rather, not conclude from this Here, his father-in-law or mother-in-law. There, other relatives Conclude from this This is also taught said in honor of his wife only his father-in-law or his mother-in-law.
llm_translation: Rather, it is not a logical inference. Here, with his father-in-law and mother-in-law, here, with other close relatives. Logical inference. It was also taught similarly: They did not say for the honor of his wife, but only his father-in-law and mother-in-law.

hebrew_text: אַמֵּימָר שָׁכֵיב לֵיהּ בַּר בְּרֵיהּ, קְרַע עִילָּוֵיהּ. אֲתָא בְּרֵיהּ — קְרַע בְּאַפֵּיהּ. אִידְּכַר דִּמְיוּשָּׁב קְרַע, קָם קְרַע מְעוּמָּד.
human_translation: the son of Ameimar’s son died, rent over him. His son came he rent in the presence of his he remembered he rent sitting, he stood up rent standing.
llm_translation: Ammemar lay with his son's son, he tore his cloak. His son's son came - he tore his own cloak. It is remembered that when sitting one tears, when standing one tears.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְאַמֵּימָר: קְרִיעָה דִּמְעוּמָּד מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּקׇם אִיּוֹב וַיִּקְרַע אֶת מְעִילוֹ״.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Ameimar: From where do we rending standing? As it is written “Then Job arose, and rent his coat”
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ashi to Amemar: From where do we derive the tearing of standing? As it is written: "And Job arose and tore his mantle."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה: ״וְעָמַד וְאָמַר לֹא חָפַצְתִּי לְקַחְתָּהּ״, הָכָא נָמֵי? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: בֵּין יוֹשֵׁב בֵּין עוֹמֵד בֵּין מוּטֶּה!
human_translation: However, if so, “And if he stands and he says: I do not wish to take her” Here also But isn’t it taught whether sitting, or standing, or reclining?
llm_translation: Rather, from now on: "And he shall stand and say, 'I did not desire to take her.'" Is it here similar? But it was taught: Whether sitting, standing, or leaning!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם לָא כְּתִיב ״וְיַעֲמֹד וְיֹאמַר״, הָכָא כְּתִיב ״וַיָּקׇם וַיִּקְרַע״.
human_translation: He said to him: There, it is not written: And he will stand and he will say, here, it is written: “Then arose, and rent
llm_translation: He said to him: There it is not written "and he shall stand and say," here it is written "and he arose and tore."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: מִנַּיִן לִקְרִיעָה שֶׁהִיא מְעוּמָּד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיָּקׇם אִיּוֹב וַיִּקְרַע״. דִּלְמָא מִילְּתָא יַתִּירְתָּא הוּא דַּעֲבַד? דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי — ״וַיָּגׇז אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ״, הָכִי נָמֵי?
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama said: From where that rending must be standing? As it is stated: “Then Job arose, and rent Perhaps he did something extra as, if you do not say “And he shaved his head” this also
llm_translation: Ramai bar Ḥama said: From where do we derive that tearing clothing must be done while standing, as it is stated: "And Job arose and tore his clothes" (Job 1:20)? Perhaps it is an extra matter that he did? For if you do not say so, then the verse should have said: "And he shaved his head," should it have said so?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵהָכָא: ״וַיָּקָם הַמֶּלֶךְ וַיִּקְרַע אֶת בְּגָדָיו״. וְדִלְמָא מִילְּתָא יַתִּירְתָּא עָבֵיד? דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי — ״וַיִּשְׁכַּב אָרְצָה״, הָכִי נָמֵי?
human_translation: Rather, from here, “Then the king arose, and rent his garments” perhaps he did something extra as, if you do not say “And he lay on the earth” this also?
llm_translation: Rather, from here: "And the king arose and tore his garments." And perhaps he did an additional thing? For if you do not say this - "And he lay on the ground," is it also so?

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: יָשַׁב עַל גַּבֵּי מִטָּה, עַל גַּבֵּי כִּסֵּא, עַל גַּבֵּי אוּדְיָינִי גְּדוֹלָה, עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע — מִכּוּלָּן לֹא יָצָא יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שֶׁלֹּא קִיֵּים כְּפִיַּית הַמִּטָּה!
human_translation: But isn’t it taught sat on a bed, on a chair, on a large mortar [ udyanei ], or on the ground, he does not fulfill his obligation through any of them. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: because he did not fulfill overturn his bed,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: If one sat upon a bed, upon a chair, upon a large stool, upon the ground — from all of these he has not fulfilled his obligation. And Rabbi Yochanan said: He has not fulfilled according to the measure of the bed!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּעֵין אַרְצָה.
human_translation: said to as if on the ground,
llm_translation: He said to him: Like the eye of the land.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, וְאֵלּוּ דְּבָרִים שֶׁאָבֵל אָסוּר בָּהֶן: אָסוּר בִּמְלָאכָה וּבִרְחִיצָה וּבְסִיכָה וּבְתַשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה וּבִנְעִילַת הַסַּנְדָּל. וְאָסוּר לִקְרוֹת בְּתוֹרָה וּבַנְּבִיאִים וּבַכְּתוּבִים, וְלִשְׁנוֹת בַּמִּשְׁנָה, בַּמִּדְרָשׁ וּבָהֲלָכוֹת, וּבַתַּלְמוּד וּבָאַגָּדוֹת. וְאִם הָיוּ רַבִּים צְרִיכִין לוֹ — אֵינוֹ נִמְנָע. וּמַעֲשֶׂה וּמֵת בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּצִיפּוֹרִי, וְנִכְנַס לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ, וְדָרַשׁ כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: These are the activities that a mourner is prohibited from in: He is prohibited from working, and from bathing, and from anointing and from engaging in sexual relations, and from wearing shoes. And he is prohibited from reading in the Torah, and in the Prophets, and in the Writings, and from studying in the Mishna, in the midrash, and in the halakhot , and in the Talmud, and in the aggadot . But if the public needs him he need not refrain There was an incident that the son of Rabbi Yosei died in Tzippori, and entered the study hall and expounded for the entire day.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught, and these are the things that a mourner is prohibited from: prohibited from work, from bathing, from anointing oneself, from marital relations, and from wearing sandals. And it is prohibited to read from the Torah, from the Prophets, and from the Writings, and to engage in Mishnah, in Midrash, in Halakhot, in Talmud, and in Aggadot. And if many people need him, he is not exempt. And there was an incident with the son of Rabbi Yosei of Tzipori, and he entered the study hall and expounded the entire day.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אִיתְּרַעָא בֵּיהּ מִילְּתָא, סָבַר דְּלָא לְמִיפַּק לְפִירְקָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: אִם הָיוּ רַבִּים צְרִיכִין לוֹ — אֵינוֹ נִמְנָע. סְבַר לְאוֹקוֹמֵי אָמוֹרָא עֲלֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב: תַּנְיָא, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יַעֲמִיד תּוּרְגְּמָן.
human_translation: a calamity, befell Rabba bar bar Ḥana, he thought not to go out to his exposition. Rabbi Ḥanina said to him: if the public needs him one need not refrain He thought to place an interpreter alongside him, Rav said to him: It is taught Provided that he does not place the disseminator
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana encountered a matter, he thought it would not be resolved. Rabbi Ḥanina said to him: If many need him, he cannot refuse. He thought to stand before the Amora regarding it. Rav said to him: It was taught, but only if he does not appoint an interpreter.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הֵיכִי עָבֵיד? כִּי הָא דְּתַנְיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה וּמֵת בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּר אִילְעַאי, וְנִכְנַס לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ. וְנִכְנַס רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָה בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא וְיָשַׁב בְּצִדּוֹ, וְלָחַשׁ הוּא לְרַבִּי חֲנַנְיָה בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא, וְרַבִּי חֲנַנְיָה בֶּן עֲקַבְיָא לְתוּרְגְּמָן, וְתוּרְגְּמָן הִשְׁמִיעַ לָרַבִּים.
human_translation: But how, act like that which is taught an incident and the son of Rabbi Yehuda bar Ilai died, and entered the study hall. And Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akavya sat by his side. whispered to Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akavya, and Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akavya to the disseminator, and the disseminator sounded to the public
llm_translation: And rather how does he do it? For this that it was taught: The incident of the death of the son of Rabbi Yehuda bar Ilai, and he entered the study hall. And Rabbi Chananya ben Akavya entered and sat beside him, and he whispered to Rabbi Chananya ben Akavya, and Rabbi Chananya ben Akavya translated, and the translator made it heard to the public.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אָבֵל, שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים — אָסוּר לְהַנִּיחַ תְּפִילִּין, מִשְּׁלִישִׁי וְאֵילָךְ, וּשְׁלִישִׁי בַּכְּלָל — מוּתָּר לְהַנִּיחַ תְּפִילִּין. וְאִם בָּאוּ פָּנִים חֲדָשׁוֹת — אֵינוֹ חוֹלֵץ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: אָבֵל, שְׁנֵי יָמִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים אָסוּר לְהַנִּיחַ תְּפִילִּין. מִשֵּׁנִי, וְשֵׁנִי בַּכְּלָל — מוּתָּר לְהַנִּיחַ תְּפִילִּין, וְאִם בָּאוּ פָּנִים חֲדָשׁוֹת — חוֹלֵץ.
human_translation: The Sages taught the first three days, a mourner is prohibited from donning phylacteries. From the third and on, and including the third he is permitted to don phylacteries. And if new faces, come, he need not remove the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. Rabbi Yehoshua says: For the first two days, a mourner is prohibited from donning From the second and including the second he is permitted to wear But if new faces come in he must remove
llm_translation: The sages taught: Regarding a mourner, for the first three days - it is forbidden to wear tefillin.
