From the third day and onward, and the third day is included - it is permitted to wear tefillin. And if new visitors arrive - one does not remove them, the words of Rabbi Eliezer. Rabbi Yehoshua says: Regarding a mourner, for the first two days - it is forbidden to wear tefillin. From the second day, and the second day is included - it is permitted to wear tefillin, and if new visitors arrive - one removes them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מַתְנָה: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּתְּמוּ יְמֵי בְכִי אֵבֶל מֹשֶׁה״. אָמַר רַב עֵינָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאַחֲרִיתָהּ כְּיוֹם מָר״.
human_translation: Rav Mattana said: What is the reason of Rabbi Eliezer? As it is written: “And the days of weeping and mourning for Moses ended” Rav Eina said: What is the reason of Rabbi Yehoshua? As it is written: and its end as a bitter day”
llm_translation: Rav Matnah said: What is the reason for Rabbi Eliezer, as it is written: "And the days of weeping for Moses were completed." Rav Eina said: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehoshua, as it is written: "And her end is bitter as wormwood."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ נָמֵי, הָא כְּתִיב: ״וַיִּתְּמוּ יְמֵי וְגוֹ׳״! אָמַר לָךְ: שָׁאנֵי מֹשֶׁה, דְּתַקִּיף אֶבְלֵיהּ. וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר נָמֵי, הָא כְּתִיב: ״וְאַחֲרִיתָהּ כְּיוֹם מָר״! עִיקַּר מְרִירָא חַד יוֹמָא הוּא.
human_translation: But also Rabbi Yehoshua, isn’t it written “And the days ended,” said to you Moses was different, because the mourning for him was more intense, But also Rabbi Eliezer, isn’t it written “And its end as a bitter day”? the main bitterness is one day,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said: Is it not written, "And the days of..."! He said to you: Moses is different, for his strength was still intact. And Rabbi Eliezer said: Is it not written, "And her end is bitter as wormwood"! The main bitterness is just one day.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בַּחֲלִיצָה, וַהֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בְּהַנָּחָה.
human_translation: Ulla said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer with regard to removal And the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua with regard to the donning
llm_translation: Ula said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer regarding chalitza, and the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua regarding halitzah.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: בַּשֵּׁנִי לְעוּלָּא, חוֹלֵץ אוֹ אֵינוֹ חוֹלֵץ?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before According Ulla, on day remove or not remove
llm_translation: He asked them: In the second year of the leap year, does one perform halitzah or not perform halitzah?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, אָמַר עוּלָּא: חוֹלֵץ וּמַנִּיחַ אֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה פְּעָמִים. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, יְהוּדָה בֶּן תֵּימָא אוֹמֵר: חוֹלֵץ וּמַנִּיחַ אֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה פְּעָמִים.
human_translation: Come hear Ulla said One removes and he dons even a hundred times. This is also taught Yehuda ben Teima says: He removes and dons even a hundred times.
llm_translation: Come and hear, Ulah said: One may untie and tie even a hundred times. It was also taught similarly: Yehudah ben Tema says: One may untie and tie even a hundred times.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִנִּיחַ שׁוּב אֵינוֹ חוֹלֵץ. וְהָא רָבָא הוּא דְּאָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּתַנָּא דִּידַן דְּאָמַר שְׁלֹשָׁה!
human_translation: Rava said: Once he dons he does not remove again. But wasn’t it Rava said: The halakha is in accordance with the tanna our said three
llm_translation: Rava said: Once he left, he does not remove it. But Rava is the one who said: The halakha is according to our Mishna that says three!

hebrew_text: מִצְוָה שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: A mitzva is different,
llm_translation: Commandment that is two.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אָבֵל, שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים אָסוּר בִּמְלָאכָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ עָנִי הַמִּתְפַּרְנֵס מִן הַצְּדָקָה. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ — עוֹשֶׂה בְּצִינְעָא בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ. וְהָאִשָּׁה טוֹוָה בַּפֶּלֶךְ בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתָהּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught During the first three days a mourner is prohibited from working, even if he is a poor person who is supported by charity. From this forward, he may do privately in his home And a woman may spin on a spindle in her home
llm_translation: The sages taught: Regarding a mourner, for the first three days it is forbidden to work, even if a poor person is sustained by charity. From here onward — he may engage in private work within his home. And the woman sweeps the floor within her home.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אָבֵל, שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים אֵינוֹ הוֹלֵךְ לְבֵית הָאֵבֶל, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ הוֹלֵךְ, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹשֵׁב בִּמְקוֹם הַמְנַחֲמִין, אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹם הַמִּתְנַחֲמִין.
human_translation: The Sages taught A mourner during the first three days may not go to mourner’s house From this forward, he may go, but he may not sit among the consolers, but rather in the place of those being consoled,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A mourner, for the first three days does not go to the house of mourning, from here and onwards he goes, and he does not sit in the place of comforters, rather in the place of those being comforted.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אָבֵל, שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים אָסוּר בִּשְׁאֵילַת שָׁלוֹם. מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה וְעַד שִׁבְעָה — מֵשִׁיב וְאֵינוֹ שׁוֹאֵל. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, שׁוֹאֵל וּמֵשִׁיב כְּדַרְכּוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught A mourner, during the first three days is prohibited from extending greetings From the third to the seventh he may respond but he may not extend greetings From this forward, he may extend greetings and respond in his manner.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Regarding a mourner, for the first three days it is prohibited to greet him with the greeting of peace. From the third day until the seventh day - one may respond but not initiate the greeting. From then on, one may both initiate and respond in the usual manner.

hebrew_text: שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים אָסוּר בִּשְׁאֵילַת שָׁלוֹם? וְהָתַנְיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה וּמֵתוּ בָּנָיו שֶׁל רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, נִכְנְסוּ כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל וְהִסְפִּידוּם הֶסְפֵּד גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: prohibited greetings during the first three But isn’t it taught an incident and the sons of Rabbi Akiva died, and all the Jews entered to eulogize them with a great eulogy.
llm_translation: Three days the first forbidden in borrowing peace? And it was taught: The incident of the death of the sons of Rabbi Akiva, all Israel entered and eulogized them with a great eulogy.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁעַת פְּטִירָתָן, עָמַד רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא עַל סַפְסָל גָּדוֹל וְאָמַר: אַחֵינוּ בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל שִׁמְעוּ! אֲפִילּוּ שְׁנֵי בָנִים חֲתָנִים — מְנוּחָם הוּא בִּשְׁבִיל כָּבוֹד שֶׁעֲשִׂיתֶם. וְאִם בִּשְׁבִיל עֲקִיבָא בָּאתֶם, הֲרֵי כַּמָּה עֲקִיבָא בַּשּׁוּק. אֶלָּא כָּךְ אֲמַרְתֶּם: תּוֹרַת אֱלֹהָיו בְּלִבּוֹ. וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן שֶׁשְּׂכַרְכֶם כָּפוּל, לְכוּ לְבָתֵּיכֶם לְשָׁלוֹם!
human_translation: When they were about to take leave, Rabbi Akiva stood on a large bench and said: Our brothers, the house of Israel, listen! Even had my two sons been bridegrooms, I would have been consoled on account of the honor you have shown If you came for the sake of Akiva, there are many Akivas in the marketplace Rather, this is what you said “The Torah of his God is in his heart” All the more so is your reward doubled, Return to your homes in peace.
llm_translation: At the time of their passing, Rabbi Akiva stood on a large platform and said: "Listen, our brothers, the house of Israel! Even if two sons-in-law are Menucham, it is for the honor that you have shown. And if you have come for the sake of Akiva, how much more so is Akiva in the marketplace. Rather, this is what you should say: 'The Torah of his God is in his heart.' And certainly, since your reward is doubled, go to your homes in peace!"

hebrew_text: כְּבוֹד רַבִּים שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: respect for the public is different.
llm_translation: The honor of the many is different.

hebrew_text: מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה וְעַד שִׁבְעָה — מֵשִׁיב וְאֵינוֹ שׁוֹאֵל, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, שׁוֹאֵל וּמֵשִׁיב כְּדַרְכּוֹ.
human_translation: From the third to the seventh he may respond but he may not extend greetings From this forward, he may extend greetings and respond in his manner.
llm_translation: From three and up to seven - one who answers and does not ask, from here and onwards, asks and then answers in his usual manner.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: הַמּוֹצֵא אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ אָבֵל, בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם — מְדַבֵּר עִמּוֹ תַּנְחוּמִין וְאֵינוֹ שׁוֹאֵל בִּשְׁלוֹמוֹ, לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם — שׁוֹאֵל בִּשְׁלוֹמוֹ וְאֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר עִמּוֹ תַּנְחוּמִין.
human_translation: And raises a contradiction One who finds another in mourning during the thirty days may speak words of consolation to him, but he should not extend greetings toward him. after thirty days, he may extend greetings toward him, but he should not speak words of consolation to him,
llm_translation: And they raised a dilemma: One who encounters his fellow in mourning within thirty days - he speaks words of comfort to him and does not inquire about his well-being. After thirty days - he inquires about his well-being and does not speak words of comfort to him.

hebrew_text: מֵתָה אִשְׁתּוֹ וְנָשָׂא אִשָּׁה אַחֶרֶת, אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לִיכָּנֵס לְבֵיתוֹ לְדַבֵּר עִמּוֹ תַּנְחוּמִין. מְצָאוֹ בַּשּׁוּק — אוֹמֵר לוֹ בְּשָׂפָה רָפָה וּבְכוֹבֶד רֹאשׁ.
human_translation: wife died and he married another woman one may not enter his house to speak words of consolation with him, he finds him in the marketplace, he may speak to him with gentle words and in a serious manner.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "If his wife died and he married another woman, he is not permitted to enter his house to console him. If he meets him in the marketplace, he should say to him with a soft language and a heavy head."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין: הוּא שׁוֹאֵל בִּשְׁלוֹם אֲחֵרִים — שֶׁאֲחֵרִים שְׁרוּיִין בְּשָׁלוֹם, אֲחֵרִים אֵין שׁוֹאֲלִין בִּשְׁלוֹמוֹ, שֶׁהוּא אֵינוֹ שָׁרוּי בְּשָׁלוֹם.
human_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin said: himself, who may extend greetings [ shalom ] to others as the others are at peace [ shalom ]. other people, who may not extend greetings to him, as he, is not at peace.
llm_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin said: One who inquires about the well-being of others—since others are involved in his well-being, others do not inquire about his well-being, as he is not involved in their well-being.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי מֵשִׁיב, מִכְּלָל דְּשָׁיְילִינַן לֵיהּ? דְּלָא יָדְעִי.
human_translation: But from that it teaches respond by inference may extend greetings to him. did not know
llm_translation: And this is the case from the Mishnah of Meshiv, from the inference that we ask him? For he does not know.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הָתָם נָמֵי! הָתָם — מוֹדַע לְהוּ וְלָא מַהְדַּר לְהוּ, הָכָא — לָא צָרִיךְ לְאוֹדוֹעִינְהוּ.
human_translation: If so, there also, There, he must inform them and not respond Here, he need not inform them
llm_translation: If so, there it is clear! There — he is aware but does not honor, here — it is not necessary to make them aware.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: הַמּוֹצֵא אֶת חֲבֵרוֹ אָבֵל, בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ — מְדַבֵּר עִמּוֹ תַּנְחוּמִין, וְאֵינוֹ שׁוֹאֵל בִּשְׁלוֹמוֹ. לְאַחַר שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ — שׁוֹאֵל בִּשְׁלוֹמוֹ, וְאֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר עִמּוֹ תַּנְחוּמִין, אֲבָל מְדַבֵּר עִמּוֹ מִן הַצַּד.
human_translation: And raises a contradiction One who finds another in mourning during twelve months may speak words of consolation to him, but he should not extend greetings toward him. after twelve months, he may extend greetings toward him, and he should not speak words of consolation to him. He may, however, speak to him indirectly,
llm_translation: And they raised a dilemma: One who finds his friend in mourning, within twelve months - he speaks words of comfort to him, but does not inquire about his well-being. After twelve months - he inquires about his well-being, but does not speak words of comfort to him, rather he speaks to him from the side.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: הַמּוֹצֵא אֶת חֲבֵרוֹ אָבֵל לְאַחַר שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, וּמְדַבֵּר עִמּוֹ תַּנְחוּמִין, לְמָה הוּא דּוֹמֶה? לְאָדָם שֶׁנִּשְׁבְּרָה רַגְלוֹ וְחָיְתָה, מְצָאוֹ רוֹפֵא וְאָמַר לוֹ: כְּלָךְ אֶצְלִי שֶׁאֲנִי שׁוֹבְרָהּ וַאֲרַפְּאֶנָּה, כְּדֵי שֶׁתֵּדַע שֶׁסַּמְמָנִין שֶׁלִּי יָפִין!
human_translation: Rabbi Meir said: One who finds another in mourning after twelve months and speaks to him words of consolation, to what may be likened? To a person who broke his leg and it healed, found him and said to him: Come to me, for I will break it and I will heal it, so that you may know how good my medicines are
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir said: One who finds his friend mourning after twelve months, and speaks words of comfort to him, what is he comparable to? To a person whose leg was broken and healed, who found a doctor and said to him: "Splint this with me so that I may break it again and heal it, in order for you to know that my bandages are beautiful!"

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּאָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ, הָא בִּשְׁאָר קְרוֹבִים.
human_translation: This is not difficult. This his father or mother. That other relatives.
llm_translation: Not difficult: this in father and mother, this in other relatives.

hebrew_text: הָתָם נָמֵי, יְדַבֵּר עִמּוֹ תַּנְחוּמִין מִן הַצַּד? אִין הָכִי נָמֵי. וּמַאי אֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר עִמּוֹ תַּנְחוּמִין — כְּדַרְכּוֹ, אֲבָל מְדַבֵּר עִמּוֹ מִן הַצַּד.
human_translation: There too, let him speak words of consolation to him indirectly. Yes, it is indeed so. And what He should not speak words of consolation to him? in his manner, but he may speak to him indirectly.
llm_translation: There, is it possible that one should speak words of comfort to him from the side? It is not so. And why does he not speak words of comfort to him? According to his way, but he speaks to him from the side.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אָבֵל, שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים, בָּא מִמָּקוֹם קָרוֹב — מוֹנֶה עִמָּהֶן, בָּא מִמָּקוֹם רָחוֹק — מוֹנֶה לְעַצְמוֹ. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, אֲפִילּוּ בָּא מִמָּקוֹם קָרוֹב — מוֹנֶה לְעַצְמוֹ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ בָּא בְּיוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי מִמָּקוֹם קָרוֹב — מוֹנֶה עִמָּהֶן.
human_translation: The Sages taught a mourner comes from a nearby place during the first three days he counts with he came from a distant place, he counts on his own From this forward, even if he came from a nearby place, he counts on his own. Rabbi Shimon says: Even he came on the seventh day from a nearby place, he counts with
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Regarding a mourner, during the first three days, if he came from a nearby place - he counts with them; if he came from a distant place - he counts by himself. From here on, even if he came from a nearby place - he counts by himself. Rabbi Shimon says: Even if he came on the seventh day from a nearby place - he counts with them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים, בָּא מִמָּקוֹם קָרוֹב — מוֹנֶה עִמָּהֶן. אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְהוּא שֶׁיֵּשׁ גְּדוֹל הַבַּיִת בַּבַּיִת.
human_translation: The Master said, a mourner comes from a nearby place during the first three days he counts with Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: This is where the principal of the household is in the house,
llm_translation: Master said: Three days, the first, he comes from a nearby place - he counts with them. Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yohanan: And this is if there is a large room in the house.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ:
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before
llm_translation: He asked them:

hebrew_text: הָלַךְ גְּדוֹל הַבַּיִת לְבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת, מַהוּ?
human_translation: the principal of the household went to the cemetery what is
llm_translation: Went great the house to the cemetery, what?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֲפִילּוּ הָלַךְ גְּדוֹל הַבַּיִת לְבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת — מוֹנֶה עִמָּהֶן. מוֹנֶה עִמָּהֶן? וְהָתַנְיָא מוֹנֶה לְעַצְמוֹ!
human_translation: Come hear that which Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even principal of the household went to the cemetery, counts with them, he count with them? But isn’t it taught he counts on his own?
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Even if the head of the household goes to the cemetery, he counts with them. Counts with them? But it was taught: He counts for himself!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דַּאֲתָא בְּגוֹ תְּלָתָא, וְהָא דְּלָא אֲתָא בְּגוֹ תְּלָתָא. כִּי הָא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ רַב לִבְנֵי הַצַּלְבּוֹנִי: דְּאָתוּ בְּגוֹ תְּלָתָא — לִימְנוֹ בַּהֲדַיְיכוּ, דְּלָא אָתוּ בְּגוֹ תְּלָתָא — לִימְנוֹ לְנַפְשַׁיְהוּ.
human_translation: This is not difficult. This where came within three And the other where he did not come within three similar to Rav said to the sons of Hatzleponi Those who come within three should count with you; those who do not come within three should count on their own.
llm_translation: Not difficult: this one who came with three, and this one who did not come with three. For this one who said to the sons of the Tzalvonite: they came with three — count them together, for those who did not come with three — count them separately.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רָבָא לִבְנֵי מָחוֹזָא: אַתּוּן דְּלָא אָזְלִיתוּ בָּתַר עַרְסָא, מִכִּי מְהַדְּרִיתוּ אַפַּיְיכוּ מִבָּבָא דַאֲבוּלָּא — אַתְחִילוּ מְנוֹ.
human_translation: Rava said to the people of Meḥoza: you who do not follow the coffin should begin counting from when you turn your faces from the city gates
llm_translation: Rava said to the people of Mahoza: You who did not go after the pot of gold, when you honor your father and mother, begin with it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ בָּא בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי מִמָּקוֹם קָרוֹב — מוֹנֶה עִמָּהֶן. אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר גַּמָּדָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן שָׁאוּל אָמַר רַבִּי: וְהוּא שֶׁבָּא וּמָצָא מְנַחֲמִין אֶצְלוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Even came on the seventh day from a nearby place, he counts with Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Gamda said that Rabbi Yosei ben Shaul said that Rabbi said: And this is he came and found consolers in the house.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Even if he comes on the seventh day from a nearby place - he counts with them. Rabbi Hiyya bar Gamada said Rabbi Yosei ben Sha'ul said Rabbi: And he who comes and finds comforters with him.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב עָנָן: נִנְעֲרוּ לַעֲמוֹד וְלֹא עָמְדוּ, מַהוּ? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Anan asks: had stirred to stand up did not stand up what is stands
llm_translation: The question of Rav Anan: They tried to stand but did not stand, what is the ruling? The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: גְּמִירִי חַבְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר חִיָּיא מֵרַבִּי אַבָּא, וּמַנּוּ — רַבִּי זֵירָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: חַבְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא מֵרַבִּי זֵירָא, וּמַנּוּ — רַבִּי אַבָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בִּטְרֵיפוֹת, וַהֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּאֵבֶל.
human_translation: a colleague of Rabbi Abba bar Ḥiyya learned from Rabbi Abba. And who was Rabbi Zeira. And some say A colleague of Rabbi Zeira from Rabbi Zeira. And who is Rabbi Abba, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel with regard to a tereifa , and the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon with regard to mourning.
llm_translation: Gemiri, colleagues of Rabbi Abba bar Chiya from Rabbi Abba, and they counted - Rabbi Zeira, and some say: colleagues of Rabbi Zeira from Rabbi Zeira, and they counted - Rabbi Abba son of Rabbi Chiya bar Abba, Rabbi Yochanan said: The halacha is like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel in matters of treifot, and the halacha is like Rabbi Shimon in matters of mourning.

hebrew_text: כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּאֵבֶל — הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בִּטְרֵיפוֹת — דִּתְנַן: בְּנֵי מֵעַיִם שֶׁנִּיקְּבוּ וְלֵיחָה סוֹתַמְתָּן — כְּשֵׁרָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: in accordance with Rabbi Shimon with regard to mourning, concerning that which we said in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel with regard to tereifa that which we learned intestines became perforated, but was stopped up by mucus, fit. the statement of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: As Rabbi Shimon said in the mourning — this that we said. As Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel in Trifot — as we learned: The sons of Ma'ayim that were punctured and their blood congealed — it is valid, the words of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: מַאי לֵיחָה? אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: שִׁירְקָא דִמְעַיָּא דְּנָפֵיק אַגַּב דּוּחְקָא. אָמַר מַאן דְּהוּא: אִיזְכֵּי וְאֶיסַּק וְאֶגְמְרַהּ לִשְׁמַעְתָּא מִפּוּמֵּיהּ דְּמָרַיהּ,
human_translation: What mucus? Rav Kahana said: The fat [ shirka ] of the intestines that comes out under pressure. Someone said: May I merit to go up and learn this halakha from the mouth of its author.
llm_translation: What is "Leicha"? Rav Kahana said: The tube of water that comes out due to pressure. He said: Whoever is wise, let him understand and deduce and complete it for the sake of hearing from the mouth of his teacher.

hebrew_text: כִּי סְלֵיק, אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אַבָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲמַר מָר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בִּטְרֵיפוֹת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא ״אֵין הֲלָכָה״ אֲמַרִי.
human_translation: When he went up he found Rabbi Abba, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, said to him: Did the Master say the halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel with regard to a tereifa ? He said to him: I said the halakha is not
llm_translation: When he ascended, he found Rabbi Abba, son of Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba. He said to him: The Master said: Does the halakha follow Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel in cases of treifot? He said to him: I say, "There is no halakha," they said.

hebrew_text: כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּאֵבֶל, מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פְּלוּגְתָּא נִינְהוּ, דְּאִיתְּמַר, רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: הֲלָכָה, וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה. רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: אֵין הֲלָכָה.
human_translation: What is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon with regard to mourning? He said to him: subject to dispute, as it was stated: Rav Ḥisda said: The halakha and similarly Rabbi Yoḥanan said: halakha . Rav Naḥman said: It is not the halakha .
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon in Avlel said, what? He said to him: they are a dispute, as it was said, Rav Hisda said: it is a halakha, and so said Rabbi Yochanan: a halakha. Rav Nachman said: it is not a halakha.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בִּטְרֵיפוֹת, וַהֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּאֵבֶל. דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי הַמֵּיקֵל בְּאֵבֶל.
human_translation: The halakha is not in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel with regard to tereifa , and the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon with regard to mourning, as Shmuel stated The halakha follows the opinion of the lenient in mourning.
llm_translation: The halakha is not like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel in cases of treifot, and the halakha is like Rabbi Shimon in matters of mourning. For Shmuel said: The halakha follows the lenient opinion in matters of mourning.

hebrew_text: עַל כׇּל הַמֵּתִים כּוּלָּן מְדַחֶה מִטָּתוֹ — הֲרֵי זֶה מְשׁוּבָּח. עַל אָבִיו וְעַל אִמּוֹ — הֲרֵי זֶה מְגוּנֶּה, הָיָה עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת אוֹ עֶרֶב יוֹם טוֹב — הֲרֵי זֶה מְשׁוּבָּח, שֶׁאֵינוֹ עוֹשֶׂה אֶלָּא לִכְבוֹד אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ.
human_translation: With regard to all deceased is praiseworthy one quick the bier in one’s father or mother, is condemnable, it was Friday or the eve of a Festival, one is praiseworthy he does this only out of respect for his father or mother,
llm_translation: Regarding all the deceased, all of them are pushed from their bed — this one is praiseworthy. Regarding his father and his mother — this one is despicable. If it was Erev Shabbat or Erev Yom Tov — this one is praiseworthy, for he only acts for the honor of his father and his mother.

hebrew_text: עַל כׇּל הַמֵּתִים כּוּלָּן, רָצָה — מְמַעֵט בְּעִסְקוֹ, רָצָה — אֵינוֹ
human_translation: With regard to all dead, wishes reduce his business he wishes need not
llm_translation: Regarding all the deceased, all of them, He desired - if He wanted to diminish in His dealings, He desired - He does not.

hebrew_text: מְמַעֵט, עַל אָבִיו וְעַל אִמּוֹ — מְמַעֵט.
human_translation: reduce In his father or mother, reduce
llm_translation: From a little, regarding his father and his mother - from a little.

hebrew_text: עַל כׇּל הַמֵּתִים כּוּלָּן, רָצָה — חוֹלֵץ, רָצָה — אֵינוֹ חוֹלֵץ. עַל אָבִיו וְעַל אִמּוֹ — חוֹלֵץ.
human_translation: With regard to all deceased wishes, he may remove he wishes he need not remove in his father or mother, he remove
llm_translation: Regarding all the deceased, if he wishes - he may perform chalitzah, if he wishes - he does not perform chalitzah. Regarding his father and his mother - he performs chalitzah.

hebrew_text: וּמַעֲשֶׂה בִּגְדוֹל הַדּוֹר אֶחָד שֶׁמֵּת אָבִיו וּבִיקֵּשׁ לַחְלוֹץ, וּבִיקֵּשׁ גְּדוֹל הַדּוֹר אַחֵר שֶׁעִמּוֹ לַחְלוֹץ, וְנִמְנַע וְלֹא חָלַץ.
human_translation: an incident when the father of a leading authority of generation died, and wished to remove Another leading authority of the generation wished to remove with him, but refrained and did not remove
llm_translation: And the incident with the great man of that generation, whose father died and he sought to redeem him, and the other great man of the generation who was with him to redeem him, and he refused and did not redeem him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: גְּדוֹל הַדּוֹר — רַבִּי, גְּדוֹל הַדּוֹר שֶׁעִמּוֹ — רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אַחָא. וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: גְּדוֹל הַדּוֹר — רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אַחָא, גְּדוֹל הַדּוֹר שֶׁעִמּוֹ — רַבִּי.
human_translation: Abaye said: The leading authority of the generation Rabbi the leading authority of the generation with him Rabbi Ya’akov bar Aḥa. And some say: The leading authority of the generation Rabbi Ya’akov bar Aḥa, the leading authority of the generation with him Rabbi
llm_translation: Abaye said: "Great is the generation - Rabbi, great is the generation in which he is - Rabbi Yaakov bar Acha." And there are those who say: "Great is the generation - Rabbi Yaakov bar Acha, great is the generation in which he is - Rabbi."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר גְּדוֹל הַדּוֹר שֶׁעִמּוֹ — רַבִּי, הַיְינוּ דְּנִמְנַע וְלֹא חָלַץ,
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said the leading authority of the generation with him was Rabbi this is he refrained and did not remove
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says, "The generation that has him is great" - Rabbi, that is to say, he refrained and did not withdraw.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אַחָא, אַמַּאי נִמְנַע וְלֹא חָלַץ? רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל נָשִׂיא הֲוָה, וְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיחַיְּיבִי לְמִיחְלַץ! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: But according to the one who said Rabbi Ya’akov bar Aḥa why did refrain and not remove Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, the Nasi , and everyone is required to remove this difficult.
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says, Rabbi Yaakov bar Acha, why was he prevented and did not withdraw? Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel was the Nasi, and everyone in the world is obligated to withdraw! This is difficult.

hebrew_text: עַל כׇּל הַמֵּתִים כּוּלָּן מִסְתַּפֵּר לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, עַל אָבִיו וְעַל אִמּוֹ — עַד שֶׁיִּגְעֲרוּ בּוֹ חֲבֵרָיו. עַל כׇּל הַמֵּתִים כּוּלָּן נִכְנָס לְבֵית הַשִּׂמְחָה לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, עַל אָבִיו וְעַל אִמּוֹ — לְאַחַר שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: With regard to all deceased one may cut his hair after thirty days. In one’s father or mother, until his colleagues have rebuked him With regard to all deceased he may enter a place a joyous after thirty days; in his father or mother, after twelve months.
llm_translation: Upon all the deceased, all of them decompose after thirty days, upon his father and upon his mother — until his friends rebuke him. Upon all the deceased, all of them enter the house of joy after thirty days, upon his father and upon his mother — after twelve months.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: וּלְשִׂמְחַת מְרֵיעוּת. מֵיתִיבִי: וּלְשִׂמְחָה וְלִמְרֵיעוּת שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: to a joyous social gathering, raises an objection And for joyous social gatherings, thirty days. it difficult.
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: "And for the joy of a wedding feast." The question was raised: "And for joy and revelry thirty days." This is a difficulty.

hebrew_text: אַמֵּימָר מַתְנֵי הָכִי, אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: וּלְשִׂמְחַת מְרֵיעוּת מוּתָּר לִיכָּנֵס לְאַלְתַּר. וְהָא תַּנְיָא: לְשִׂמְחָה שְׁלֹשִׁים, וְלִמְרֵיעוּת שְׁלֹשִׁים!
human_translation: Ameimar taught as follows: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said For a joyous social gathering one is permitted to enter immediately. But isn’t it taught For joyous celebrations and for joyous social gatherings, thirty
llm_translation: Ammemar teaches thus, Rabba bar bar Hana said: And for the joy of a wedding feast, one may enter immediately. But isn't it taught: For joy, thirty days, and for a feast, thirty days!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בַּאֲרִיסוּתָא, הָא בְּפוּרְעֲנוּתָא.
human_translation: This is not difficult. This to an initial That to a reciprocal
llm_translation: Not difficult: here in the plowing, here in the sowing.

hebrew_text: עַל כׇּל הַמֵּתִים כּוּלָּן קוֹרֵעַ טֶפַח, עַל אָבִיו וְעַל אִמּוֹ עַד שֶׁיְּגַלֶּה אֶת לִבּוֹ. אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, מַאי קְרָא: ״וַיַּחֲזֵק דָּוִד בִּבְגָדָיו וַיִּקְרָעֵם״, וְאֵין אֲחִיזָה פָּחוֹת מִטֶּפַח.
human_translation: With regard to all deceased one rends of a handbreadth, In his father or mother, until he reveals his heart. Rabbi Abbahu said: What is the verse “And David took hold of his clothes and rent them” and taking hold cannot less than a handbreadth.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Upon all the deceased, everyone tears a handbreadth, upon his father and upon his mother until he reveals his heart." Rabbi Abbahu said, what is the verse: "And David grasped his garments and tore them," and there is no grasping less than a handbreadth.

hebrew_text: עַל כׇּל הַמֵּתִים כּוּלָּן אֲפִילּוּ לָבוּשׁ עֲשָׂרָה חֲלוּקִין — אֵינוֹ קוֹרֵעַ אֶלָּא עֶלְיוֹן, עַל אָבִיו וְעַל אִמּוֹ — קוֹרֵעַ אֶת כּוּלָּן. וְאַפִּיקָרְסוּתוֹ אֵינָהּ מְעַכֶּבֶת.
human_translation: With regard to all even if he is wearing ten garments, he rends only outer in his father or mother, he must rend them all. his undergarment, does not invalidate
llm_translation: Regarding all the deceased, all of them, even if dressed in ten garments - one only tears the upper garment; for one's father and mother - one tears all of them. And a sackcloth does not impede.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד הָאִישׁ וְאֶחָד אִשָּׁה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הָאִשָּׁה קוֹרַעַת אֶת הַתַּחְתּוֹן וּמַחְזִירָתוֹ לַאֲחוֹרֶיהָ, וְחוֹזֶרֶת וְקוֹרַעַת אֶת הָעֶלְיוֹן.
human_translation: Both a man and a woman Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: A woman rends inner and turns around, on her back. And afterward she rend outer
llm_translation: One man and one woman. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: The woman tears the lower one and returns it to her back, and she returns and tears the upper one.

hebrew_text: עַל כׇּל הַמֵּתִים כּוּלָּן, רָצָה — מַבְדִּיל קַמֵּי שָׂפָה שֶׁלּוֹ, רָצָה — אֵינוֹ מַבְדִּיל. עַל אָבִיו וְעַל אִמּוֹ — מַבְדִּיל.
human_translation: With regard to all deceased one wishes he may rip apart on the hem, wishes he does not rip apart In one’s father or mother, he must rip apart
llm_translation: Regarding all the deceased, all of them, if he wishes - he separates before his own lips, if he wishes - he does not separate. Regarding his father and his mother - he separates.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל קְרִיעָה שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַבְדִּיל קַמֵּי שָׂפָה שֶׁלּוֹ — אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא קֶרַע שֶׁל תִּיפְלוּת. אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּחֲזֵק בִּבְגָדָיו וַיִּקְרָעֵם לִשְׁנַיִם קְרָעִים״, מִמַּשְׁמַע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וַיִּקְרָעֵם״ אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁהֵן לִשְׁנַיִם? אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּרְאִין קְרוּעִים כִּשְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Any rending that does not rip apart on the hem is nothing other than a frivolous rent Rabbi Abbahu said: What is the reason Rabbi Yehuda’s As it is written: “And he took hold of his own clothes and he rent them in two pieces” From that which is stated: “And he rent,” do I not know that in two? Rather, that appear as if they were torn into two
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Any tearing that does not separate before his own lip - is nothing but a tear of prayer. Rabbi Avahu said: What is the reason of Rabbi Yehuda, as it is written: "And he took hold of his garments and tore them into two tears," from the fact that it says "and he tore them" I do not know that they are two? Rather, they appear torn as two.

hebrew_text: עַל כׇּל הַמֵּתִים כּוּלָּן שׁוֹלֵל לְאַחַר שִׁבְעָה, וּמְאַחֶה לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים. עַל אָבִיו וְעַל אִמּוֹ — שׁוֹלֵל לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים וְאֵינוֹ מְאַחֶה לְעוֹלָם. וְהָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹלַלְתּוֹ לְאַלְתַּר מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹדָהּ.
human_translation: With regard to all deceased one may tack after seven days, and one may join after thirty in one’s father or mother, he may tack after thirty days, and he may never join A woman, may tack immediately, due to her honor,
llm_translation: Regarding all the deceased, all of them are shrouded for after seven days, and mourning is prolonged for after thirty days. Concerning his father and his mother — mourning is shrouded for after thirty days and is never prolonged. And the wife shrouds him immediately due to her honor.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עַל כׇּל הַמֵּתִים, רָצָה — קוֹרֵעַ בַּיָּד, רָצָה — קוֹרֵעַ בִּכְלִי. עַל אָבִיו וְעַל אִמּוֹ — בַּיָּד.
human_translation: When Ravin came he said that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: With regard to all deceased if one wishes, he may rend with hand; he wishes, he may rend with a utensil in his father or mother, with his hand
llm_translation: When Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: Regarding all the deceased, if one wishes - he tears with his hand, if one wishes - he tears with a utensil. But regarding his father and his mother - with his hand.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עַל כׇּל הַמֵּתִים כּוּלָּן — מִבִּפְנִים, עַל אָבִיו וְעַל אִמּוֹ — קוֹרֵעַ מִבַּחוּץ. אֲמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: וְכֵן לַנָּשִׂיא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: With regard to all deceased on the inside, In one’s father or mother, he must rend on the outside, Rav Ḥisda said: And likewise, over a Nasi ,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: For all the deceased, all of them - from inside, for his father and for his mother - one tears from outside. Rav Chisda said: And so for a prince.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: לֹא הוּשְׁווּ לְאָבִיו וּלְאִמּוֹ אֶלָּא לְאִיחוּי בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: raises an objection were likened to one’s father or mother only with regard to rejoining
llm_translation: Challenger: They are not compared to his father and his mother, but only to his brother alone.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, אֲפִילּוּ לְנָשִׂיא? לָא, לְבַר מִנָּשִׂיא.
human_translation: What, is not even for the Nasi ? No, aside
llm_translation: What is the reason? Is it not even for a prince? No, for a son of a prince.

hebrew_text: נְשִׂיאָה שְׁכֵיב, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא לְרַב חָנָן בַּר רָבָא: כְּפִי אֲסִיתָא וְקוּם עֲלַהּ, וְאַחְוִי קְרִיעָה לְעָלְמָא.
human_translation: Nasi died, Rav Ḥisda said to Rav Ḥanan bar Rava: Turn the mortar over and stand on it, and show rent to everyone.
llm_translation: The prince is lying down, Rav Chisda said to Rav Hanan bar Rava: According to the custom, get up and go, and make a proclamation to the world.

hebrew_text: עַל חָכָם חוֹלֵץ מִיָּמִין, עַל אָב בֵּית דִּין מִשְּׂמֹאל, עַל נָשִׂיא מִכָּאן וּמִכָּאן.
human_translation: For a Sage, one removes from the right For president of the court from the left For Nasi from here and from here,
llm_translation: On a wise person, one removes from the right, on the head of the court from the left, on a prince from here and from there.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חָכָם שֶׁמֵּת — בֵּית מִדְרָשׁוֹ בָּטֵל, אַב בֵּית דִּין שֶׁמֵּת — כׇּל בָּתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת שֶׁבְּעִירוֹ בְּטֵילִין. וְנִכְנָסִין לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת וּמְשַׁנִּין אֶת מְקוֹמָן: הַיּוֹשְׁבִין בַּצָּפוֹן — יוֹשְׁבִין בַּדָּרוֹם, הַיּוֹשְׁבִין בַּדָּרוֹם — יוֹשְׁבִין בַּצָּפוֹן. נָשִׂיא שֶׁמֵּת — בָּתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת כּוּלָּן בְּטֵילִין, וּבְנֵי הַכְּנֶסֶת נִכְנָסִין לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת
human_translation: The Sages taught a Sage dies, his study hall ceases the president of the court dies, all of the study halls in his city cease enters the synagogue and changes their places Those who sit in the north sit in the south, and those who sit in the south sit in the north. a Nasi dies, all study halls cease the members of the synagogue enter the synagogue
llm_translation: The sages taught: If a scholar dies, his study hall is nullified; if a head of the court dies, all the study halls in his city are nullified. They then enter the synagogue and relocate their places: those who sat in the north now sit in the south, and those who sat in the south now sit in the north. If a leader dies, all the study halls are nullified, and the members of the synagogue enter the synagogue.

hebrew_text: וְקוֹרִין שִׁבְעָה, וְיוֹצְאִין. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא שֶׁיֵּלְכוּ וִיטַיְּילוּ בַּשּׁוּק, אֶלָּא יוֹשְׁבִין וְדָוִוין.
human_translation: and seven read And they leave Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa says: not that they stroll in the marketplace, rather they sit in silent
llm_translation: And they read seven, and they fulfill. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha says: Not that they should go and wander in the marketplace, but they should sit and be still.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין אוֹמְרִים שְׁמוּעָה וְאַגָּדָה בְּבֵית הָאֵבֶל. אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָה בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל שֶׁהָיָה אוֹמֵר שְׁמוּעָה וְאַגָּדָה בְּבֵית הָאֵבֶל.
human_translation: And one may not speak halakha or aggada in a house of mourning, It was said of Rabbi Ḥananya ben Gamliel that he would speak about halakha and aggada in a house of mourning.
llm_translation: "And they do not say reports and legends in the house of mourning. They said about Rabbi Hananiah ben Gamliel that he used to say reports and legends in the house of mourning."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אָבֵל, שַׁבָּת רִאשׁוֹנָה — אֵינוֹ יוֹצֵא מִפֶּתַח בֵּיתוֹ, שְׁנִיָּה — יוֹצֵא וְאֵינוֹ יוֹשֵׁב בִּמְקוֹמוֹ, שְׁלִישִׁית — יוֹשֵׁב בִּמְקוֹמוֹ וְאֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר, רְבִיעִית — הֲרֵי הוּא כְּכׇל אָדָם.
human_translation: The Sages taught first week the mourner may not go out of the opening of his house. second he may go out, but he may not sit in his place third he may sit in his place but he may not speak. fourth he is like any person.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: On the first day of mourning, one does not leave his house, on the second day, he may leave but does not sit in his usual place, on the third day, he sits in his usual place but does not speak, on the fourth day, he is like any other person.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא הוּצְרְכוּ לוֹמַר שַׁבָּת רִאשׁוֹנָה לֹא יֵצֵא מִפֶּתַח בֵּיתוֹ, שֶׁהֲרֵי הַכֹּל נִכְנָסִין לְבֵיתוֹ לְנַחֲמוֹ. אֶלָּא: שְׁנִיָּה — אֵינוֹ יוֹצֵא מִפֶּתַח בֵּיתוֹ, שְׁלִישִׁית — יוֹצֵא וְאֵינוֹ יוֹשֵׁב בִּמְקוֹמוֹ, רְבִיעִית — יוֹשֵׁב בִּמְקוֹמוֹ וְאֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר, חֲמִישִׁית — הֲרֵי הוּא כְּכׇל אָדָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: They did not need to say during the first week may not go out of the opening of his house. as everyone goes into his house to console him. Rather, second not go out of the opening of his house. third he may go out, but he may not sit in his place fourth he may sit in his place, but he may not speak. fifth he is like any person.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: It is not necessary to say that on the first Shabbat one does not leave his house, for everyone enters his house to console him. Rather: the second - he does not leave his house, the third - he leaves but does not sit in his place, the fourth - he sits in his place and does not speak, the fifth - he is like any other person.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כׇּל שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם לַנִּישּׂוּאִין. מֵתָה אִשְׁתּוֹ — אָסוּר לִישָּׂא אִשָּׁה אַחֶרֶת עַד שֶׁיַּעַבְרוּ עָלָיו שְׁלֹשָׁה רְגָלִים. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: רֶגֶל רִאשׁוֹן וְשֵׁנִי — אָסוּר, שְׁלִישִׁי — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: The Sages taught the entire thirty-day to marry. one’s wife died, it is prohibited to marry another wife until three Festivals pass Rabbi Yehuda says: first and second he is prohibited third permitted
llm_translation: The sages taught: All thirty days for betrothals. If his wife died, it is forbidden for him to marry another woman until three festivals pass over him. Rabbi Yehuda says: The first and second festival are forbidden, the third is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אֵין לוֹ בָּנִים — מוּתָּר לִישָּׂא לְאַלְתַּר מִשּׁוּם בִּיטּוּל פְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה. הִנִּיחָה לוֹ בָּנִים קְטַנִּים — מוּתָּר לִישָּׂא לְאַלְתַּר מִפְּנֵי פַרְנָסָתָן.
human_translation: And if he does not have children, he is permitted to marry immediately due to neglect be fruitful and multiply. left him young children, he is permitted to marry immediately, so that take care of them.
llm_translation: If he has no children - he is permitted to marry immediately because of the concern for the cessation of procreation. If he has young children - he is permitted to marry immediately because of their livelihood.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁמֵּתָה אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁל יוֹסֵף הַכֹּהֵן, וְאָמַר לַאֲחוֹתָהּ בְּבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת: לְכִי וּפַרְנְסִי אֶת בְּנֵי אֲחוֹתֵךְ, וְאַף עַל פִּי כֵן לֹא בָּא עָלֶיהָ אֶלָּא לִזְמַן מְרוּבֶּה. מַאי לִזְמַן מְרוּבֶּה? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: an incident when the wife of Yosef the Priest died, and he said to her sister at the cemetery Go and care for your sister’s children. But even though he did not engage in sexual relations with her for a long time What A long time? Rav Pappa said: After thirty days.
llm_translation: The incident of the death of the wife of Yosef the priest, and he said to her sister in the cemetery: "Go and support the children of your sister," yet he did not come upon her except to invite the majority. What is meant by 'to invite the majority'? Rav Papa said: After thirty days.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כׇּל שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם לְגִיהוּץ, אֶחָד כֵּלִים חֲדָשִׁים וְאֶחָד כֵּלִים יְשָׁנִים יוֹצְאִין מִתּוֹךְ הַמַּכְבֵּשׁ. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: לֹא אָסְרוּ אֶלָּא כֵּלִים חֲדָשִׁים בִּלְבָד. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: לֹא אָסְרוּ אֶלָּא כֵּלִים חֲדָשִׁים לְבָנִים בִּלְבָד.
human_translation: The Sages taught the entire thirty-day to ironed whether they are new garments or old garments taken out of the press, Rabbi says: prohibited only new garments. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: They prohibited only new white garments.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Any item that has been soaked for thirty days, whether new vessels or old vessels, may be removed from the lye. Rabbi says: They only prohibited new vessels. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: They only prohibited new white vessels.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי נָפֵיק בִּגְרָדָא דְסַרְבָּלָא כְּרַבִּי. רָבָא נָפֵיק בְּחִימּוּצְתָּא רוֹמִיתָא סוּמַּקְתָּא חַדְתִּי כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: Abaye went out in an old white garment, in accordance with Rabbi Rava, went out in a new, red Roman cloak, in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: Abbaye went out to the threshing floor of Sarbalah like Rabbi. Rava went out to the Roman bathhouse of Sumakta Chadta like Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאָמְרוּ: שַׁבָּת עוֹלָה וְאֵינָהּ מַפְסֶקֶת. בְּנֵי יְהוּדָה וּבְנֵי גָלִילָא. הָנֵי אָמְרִי:
human_translation: because said Shabbat counts but it does not interrupt the residents of Judea and the residents of the Galilee. These say:
llm_translation: Because they said: "Shabbat ascends and does not separate." The people of Judea and the people of Galilee. Those say:

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ אֲבֵילוּת בְּשַׁבָּת, וְהָנֵי אָמְרִי: אֵין אֲבֵילוּת בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: There is mourning on Shabbat, whereas those say: There is no mourning on Shabbat
llm_translation: There is mourning on Shabbat, and these say: There is no mourning on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר יֵשׁ אֲבֵילוּת בְּשַׁבָּת, דְּקָתָנֵי ״עוֹלָה״. מַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין אֲבֵילוּת בְּשַׁבָּת, דְּקָתָנֵי ״אֵינָהּ מַפְסֶקֶת״.
human_translation: The ones who said there is mourning on Shabbat that taught, counts The ones who said there is no mourning on Shabbat that taught does not interrupt
llm_translation: The one who says there is mourning on Shabbat, for it is taught "burnt offering." The one who says there is no mourning on Shabbat, for it is taught "it does not interrupt."

hebrew_text: אִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ יֵשׁ אֲבֵילוּת בְּשַׁבָּת, הַשְׁתָּא אֲבֵילוּת נָהֲגָא, אַפְסוֹקֵי מִיבַּעְיָא?
human_translation: If it should enter your mind there is mourning on Shabbat, now mourning applies is necessary interrupt
llm_translation: If your mind is inclined that there is mourning on Shabbat, now mourning is common, should we seek a resolution?

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא קָתָנֵי ״עוֹלָה״! אַיְּידֵי דְּקָבָעֵי לְמִיתְנֵא סֵיפָא ״אֵינָן עוֹלִים״, תְּנָא רֵישָׁא ״עוֹלָה״.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught counts Since wished to teach the latter clause do not count it taught in the first clause counts
llm_translation: And rather, this is what it teaches "Olah"! As evidence that they established to teach the latter part "they do not ascend," a Tanna teaches the first part "Olah."

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר יֵשׁ אֲבֵילוּת בְּשַׁבָּת, הָא קָתָנֵי אֵינָהּ מַפְסֶקֶת! מִשּׁוּם דְּקָבָעֵי לְמִיתְנֵא סֵיפָא ״מַפְסִיקִין״, תְּנָא רֵישָׁא ״אֵינָהּ מַפְסֶקֶת״.
human_translation: And according to the ones who said there is mourning on Shabbat, isn’t taught it does not interrupt due to wished to teach the latter clause interrupt it taught in the first clause does not interrupt
llm_translation: And for the one who says there is mourning on Shabbat, behold it teaches: it does not interrupt! Because they established to teach the latter part "we interrupt," the first part teaches "it does not interrupt."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: מִי שֶׁמֵּתוֹ מוּטָּל לְפָנָיו — אוֹכֵל בְּבַיִת אַחֵר. אֵין לוֹ בַּיִת אַחֵר — אוֹכֵל בְּבֵית חֲבֵרוֹ, אֵין לוֹ בַּיִת חֲבֵרוֹ — עוֹשֶׂה לוֹ מְחִיצָה עֲשָׂרָה טְפָחִים. אֵין לוֹ דָּבָר לַעֲשׂוֹת מְחִיצָה — מַחְזִיר פָּנָיו וְאוֹכֵל.
human_translation: Let us say parallel to tanna’im One whose deceased is laid out before him eats in another room. he does not have another room, he eats in the house of a friend. If he does not have a friend’s house he makes a partition ten handbreadths he does not have material with which to make a partition, he averts his face and eats.
llm_translation: Let us say like the Tannaim: If his deceased one is lying before him - he eats in another house. If he does not have another house - he eats in the house of his friend. If he does not have the house of his friend - he makes for himself a partition of ten handbreadths. If he has nothing to make a partition - he turns his face away and eats.

hebrew_text: וְאֵינוֹ מֵיסֵב וְאוֹכֵל, וְאֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל בָּשָׂר וְאֵינוֹ שׁוֹתֶה יַיִן, וְאֵין מְבָרֵךְ וְאֵין מְזַמֵּן, וְאֵין מְבָרְכִין עָלָיו וְאֵין מְזַמְּנִין עָלָיו, וּפָטוּר מִקְּרִיאַת שְׁמַע וּמִן הַתְּפִלָּה וּמִן הַתְּפִילִּין, וּמִכׇּל מִצְוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: And he does not recline while he eats, and he neither eats meat nor drinks wine; and he does not recite a blessing and he does not invite and they do not recite a blessing over him nor do others invite him And he is exempt from the recitation of Shema , and from prayer, and from phylacteries, and from all the mitzvot mentioned in the Torah.
llm_translation: He does not recline and eat, and he does not eat meat, and he does not drink wine, and he does not bless, and he does not invite others to eat with him, and they do not bless over him, and they do not invite others to eat with him, and he is exempt from reciting the Shema and from prayer and from wearing Tefillin, and from all the commandments stated in the Torah.

hebrew_text: וּבְשַׁבָּת — מֵיסֵב וְאוֹכֵל, וְאוֹכֵל בָּשָׂר וְשׁוֹתֶה יַיִן, וּמְבָרֵךְ וּמְזַמֵּן, וּמְבָרְכִין וּמְזַמְּנִין עָלָיו, וְחַיָּיב בִּקְרִיאַת שְׁמַע וּבִתְפִילָּה וּבִתְפִילִּין, וּבְכׇל מִצְוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה. רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁנִּתְחַיֵּיב בְּאֵלּוּ — נִתְחַיֵּיב בְּכוּלָּן.
human_translation: But on Shabbat he reclines and eats; and he eats meat and drinks wine; and he recites blessings and invite and others may recite blessings on his behalf and invite And he is obligated in the recitation of Shema , and in prayer, and in phylacteries, and in all the mitzvot mentioned in the Torah. Rabban Gamliel says: Since he is obligated these he is obligated all
llm_translation: On Shabbat — one may sit and eat, and eat meat and drink wine, and bless and invite others, and they bless and invite upon him, and is obligated in reciting the Shema, and in prayer, and in wearing tefillin, and in all the commandments stated in the Torah. Rabban Gamliel says: Since one is obligated in these mitzvot — one is obligated in all of them.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: תַּשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: between them, sexual relations.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: There is a difference between them in the matter of marital relations.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר: יֵשׁ אֲבֵילוּת בְּשַׁבָּת, וּמַר סָבַר: אֵין אֲבֵילוּת בְּשַׁבָּת!
human_translation: What, is it not with regard to this they disagree: that Sage, holds there is mourning on Shabbat and Sage, holds there is no mourning on Shabbat
llm_translation: What is the reason they do not argue about this? Because Mar holds: There is mourning on Shabbat, and Mar holds: There is no mourning on Shabbat!

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר תַּנָּא קַמָּא הָתָם, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּמֵתוֹ מוּטָּל לְפָנָיו. אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּאֵין מֵתוֹ מוּטָּל לְפָנָיו — לָא.
human_translation: From where Perhaps the first tanna saying only there, because his deceased is laid out before him But here, his dead is no laid out before him, not
llm_translation: From what? Perhaps until here did not say a Tanna earlier there, rather because his corpse is lying before him. But here, where his corpse is not lying before him - no.

hebrew_text: וְעַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הָתָם, דְּאַכַּתִּי לָא חָל אֲבֵילוּת עֲלֵיהּ. אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּחָל אֲבֵילוּת עֲלֵיהּ — הָכִי נָמֵי.
human_translation: And Rabban Gamliel is saying only there, where mourning have not taken effect, But here, where mourning taken effect, also
llm_translation: And until here not said Rabban Gamliel there, for it is not a disgrace upon it. But here, for it is a disgrace upon it - so it is said.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשְּׁמוּאֵל: יֵשׁ אֲבֵילוּת בְּשַׁבָּת אוֹ אֵין אֲבֵילוּת בְּשַׁבָּת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵין אֲבֵילוּת בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan asked of Shmuel: Is there mourning on Shabbat or is there no mourning on Shabbat He said to him: There is no mourning on Shabbat
llm_translation: Requested from him Rabbi Yochanan from Shmuel: Is there mourning on Shabbat or is there no mourning on Shabbat? He said to him: There is no mourning on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: יָתְבִי רַבָּנַן קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא וְקָאָמְרִי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: אָבֵל שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ מִטָּתוֹ בִּימֵי אֶבְלוֹ — חַיָּיב מִיתָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא: אָסוּר אִתְּמַר, וּמִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אִתְּמַר,
human_translation: The Sages sat before Rav Pappa and said in the name of Shmuel: A mourner who engaged in sexual relations during his days of mourning is liable the death penalty Rav Pappa said to them: It was said prohibited, And was said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan,
llm_translation: The sages sat before Rav Papa and were saying in the name of Shmuel: "One who derives pleasure from his bed during his mourning period - is liable to death." Rav Papa said to them: "It was stated as forbidden," and in the name of Rabbi Yochanan it was stated.

hebrew_text: וְאִי שְׁמִיעָא לְכוּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, הָכִי שְׁמִיעַ לְכוּ: אָמַר רַב תַּחְלִיפָא בַּר אֲבִימִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אָבֵל שֶׁלֹּא פֵּרַע וְשֶׁלֹּא פֵּירַם — חַיָּיב מִיתָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״רָאשֵׁיכֶם אַל תִּפְרָעוּ וּבִגְדֵיכֶם לֹא תִפְרוֹמוּ וְלֹא תָמוּתוּ וְגוֹ׳״, הָא אַחֵר שֶׁלֹּא פֵּרַע וְשֶׁלֹּא פֵּירַם — חַיָּיב מִיתָה.
human_translation: And if you heard in the name of Shmuel, you heard as follows: Rav Taḥlifa bar Avimi said Shmuel said: A mourner who did not let grow wild and did not rend is liable the death penalty as it is stated “Let not the hair of your heads go loose, neither rend your clothes, that you not die” that other who did not let grow wild or rend is liable the death penalty.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If you want to hear from the name of Shmuel, thus hear: Rav Tachlifa bar Avimi said in the name of Shmuel: One who neither loosened nor untied — liable to death, as it is stated: "Your heads do not loosen, and your garments shall not be torn, and you shall not die, etc." — this refers to one who neither loosened nor untied — liable to death.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַפְרָם בַּר פָּפָּא, תָּנָא בְּאֵבֶל רַבָּתִי: אָבֵל אָסוּר לְשַׁמֵּשׁ מִטָּתוֹ בִּימֵי אֶבְלוֹ, וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּאֶחָד שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ מִטָּתוֹ בִּימֵי אֶבְלוֹ, וְשָׁמְטוּ חֲזִירִים אֶת גְּוִיָּיתוֹ.
human_translation: Rafram bar Pappa said: taught in Evel Rabbati , A mourner is prohibited from engaging in sexual relations during his days of mourning. an incident with one who engaged in sexual relations during his days of mourning and pigs dragged away his corpse.
llm_translation: Rafhram son of Papa said, it was taught in the great mourning: One is forbidden to engage in marital relations during the days of his mourning. And there was an incident with one who engaged in marital relations during his mourning, and swine trampled his grave.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: פַּחַ״ז חוֹבָה, נֶתֶ״ר רְשׁוּת.
human_translation: Shmuel said: Peh , ḥet , zayin are obligatory. nun , tav , reish , are optional.
llm_translation: Shmuel said: "Pachaz chovah, neter reshut."

hebrew_text: פְּרִיעַת הָרֹאשׁ, חֲזָרַת קֶרַע לַאֲחוֹרָיו, זְקִיפַת הַמִּטָּה — חוֹבָה. נְעִילַת הַסַּנְדָּל, תַּשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה, רְחִיצַת יָדַיִם וְרַגְלַיִם בְּחַמִּין עַרְבִית — רְשׁוּת. וְרַב אָמַר: אַף פְּרִיעַת הָרֹאשׁ רְשׁוּת.
human_translation: Uncovering the head, reversing the tear to the back, standing the bed upright obligatory wearing shoes, engaging in sexual relations, washing one’s hands and feet in hot water in the evening are optional And Rav said: Uncovering the head is also an optional
llm_translation: Displacement of the head, tearing back his garment, propping up the bed — obligatory. Locking the sandal, bed usage, washing hands and feet in warm water — optional. And Rav said: Even displacement of the head is optional.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל, מַאי שְׁנָא נְעִילַת הַסַּנְדָּל דִּרְשׁוּת — דְּלָאו כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא עֲבִידִי דְּסָיְימִי מְסָאנַיְיהוּ. פְּרִיעַת הָרֹאשׁ נָמֵי, לָאו כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא עֲבִידִי דִּמְגַלּוּ רֵישַׁיְיהוּ!
human_translation: According to Shmuel, what is different about wearing shoes optional? not everyone wears shoes uncovering the head also, not everyone uncovers his head
llm_translation: Samuel, what is the difference between the locking of the sandal strap — that not everyone in the world can do, as they finish it off, and the tying of the head covering — that not everyone in the world can do, as they reveal their heads!

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כׇּל קֶרַע שֶׁאֵינוֹ בִּשְׁעַת חִימּוּם — אֵינוֹ קֶרַע. וְכׇל עֲטִיפָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ כַּעֲטִיפַת יִשְׁמְעֵאלִים — אֵינָהּ עֲטִיפָה. מַחְוֵי רַב נַחְמָן עַד גּוּבֵּי דְּדִיקְנָא.
human_translation: Shmuel to his reasoning, Shmuel said: Any rending that is not at the time of most intense is not rending And any wrapping that is not in the manner of the wrapping of the Ishmaelites, is not wrapping. Rav Naḥman demonstrated sides of the beard,
llm_translation: Samuel according to his reasoning, as Samuel said: Any tearing that is not at the time of heating - is not considered a tearing. And any wrapping that is not like the wrapping of the Ishmaelites - is not considered a wrapping. This is the statement of Rav Nachman until the innermost chambers of the furnace.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין לוֹ מִנְעָלִים בְּרַגְלָיו, אֲבָל יֵשׁ לוֹ מִנְעָלִים בְּרַגְלָיו — מִנְעָלָיו מוֹכִיחִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: They taught only when he has no shoes on his feet, But if he has shoes on his feet, his shoes prove he
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yaakov said Rabbi Yochanan: They only taught that if he does not have shoes on his feet, but if he has shoes on his feet - his shoes testify against him.

hebrew_text: כׇּל קֶרַע שֶׁאֵינוֹ בִּשְׁעַת חִימּוּם אֵינוֹ קֶרַע — וְהָא אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לִשְׁמוּאֵל: נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַב, קְרַע עֲלֵיהּ תְּרֵיסַר מָנֵי. אֲמַר: אֲזַל גַּבְרָא דַּהֲוָה מִסְתְּפֵינָא מִינֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא. קְרַע עֲלֵיהּ תְּלֵיסַר אִצְטְלֵי מֵלָתָא. אֲמַר: אֲזַל גַּבְרָא דַּהֲוָה מִסְתְּפֵינָא מִינֵּיהּ!
human_translation: any rending that is not at the time of most intense is not rending But they said to Shmuel Rav had passed away, he rent twelve garments on account of him, and said: The man of whom I was in fear, has gone they told Rabbi Yoḥanan Rabbi Ḥanina had passed away, he rent thirteen wool [ mileta ] garments [ itztelei ] on account of him, and said: The man of whom I was in fear has gone.
llm_translation: All torn garment that is not at the time of heating is not considered torn - and they said to Shmuel: "May the soul of Rav rest in peace, twelve threads were torn on it." He said: "A man who was suffering from it went." He said to Rabbi Yochanan: "May the soul of Rabbi Chanina rest in peace, thirteen threads were torn on it." He said: "A man who was suffering from it went."

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי רַבָּנַן, דְּכֵיוָן דְּכֹל שַׁעְתָּא מַדְכְּרִי שְׁמַעְתַּיְיהוּ — כִּשְׁעַת חִימּוּם דָּמֵי.
human_translation: The Sages are different. Since their teachings are mentioned all the time, is like the time of most intense
llm_translation: The sages differ, for as long as they mention His name at every moment - it is like the time of the heat of blood.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִין בַּר אַדָּא לְרָבָא: אָמַר תַּלְמִידְךָ רַב עַמְרָם, תַּנְיָא: אָבֵל, כׇּל שִׁבְעָה קוֹרְעוֹ לְפָנָיו, וְאִם בָּא לְהַחֲלִיף — מַחְלִיף וְקוֹרֵעַ. בְּשַׁבָּת, קוֹרְעוֹ לַאֲחוֹרָיו, וְאִם בָּא לְהַחֲלִיף — מַחְלִיף וְאֵינוֹ קוֹרֵעַ!
human_translation: Ravin bar Adda said to Rava: Your student, Rav Amram, said it is taught all seven days a mourner the tear before him And if he comes to change he changes and rends On Shabbat, the tear to his back, and if he comes to change he changes but does not tear
llm_translation: He said to him, Ravin bar Adda to Rava: A disciple said to you, Rav Amram, it was taught: A mourner, all seven days he rends his garments before him, and if he comes to change them — he changes and rends. On Shabbat, he rends his garments behind him, and if he comes to change them — he changes and does not rend!

hebrew_text: כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא, בִּכְבוֹד אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ.
human_translation: When that is taught, in honor of his father or mother.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "With respect to his father and mother."

hebrew_text: אוֹתָן קְרָעִין מִתְאַחִין, אוֹ אֵין מִתְאַחִין? פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ אֲבוּהּ דְּרַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא וּבַר קַפָּרָא. חַד אָמַר: אֵין מִתְאַחִין, וְחַד אָמַר: מִתְאַחִין.
human_translation: Those tears may they be mended or may they not be mended, They disagree about the father of Rav Oshaya and bar Kappara. One said: They may not be mended, and one said: They may be mended.
llm_translation: Those torn garments, do we darn them, or do we not darn them? They dispute it: the father of Rav Oshaya and Bar Kappara. One says: we do not darn them, and one says: we darn them.

hebrew_text: תִּסְתַּיֵּים דַּאֲבוּהּ דְּרַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא דְּאָמַר אֵין מִתְאַחִין. דְּאָמַר רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: אֵין מִתְאַחִין, מִמַּאן שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ — לָאו מֵאֲבוּהּ? לָא, מִבַּר קַפָּרָא רַבֵּיהּ שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Conclude that Rav Oshaya’s father said may not be mended, for Rav Oshaya said: may not be mended. From whom did he hear not from his father? No, he heard it from bar Kappara, his teacher.
llm_translation: The matter was concluded according to the opinion of Rav Oshaya who said: We do not mix. For Rav Oshaya said: We do not mix. From whom did he hear this? Was it not from his father? No, rather from his teacher, Bar Kapara, he heard this.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אָבֵל מְטַיֵּיל בְּאוּנְקְלִי בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ. אַבָּיֵי אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְרַב יוֹסֵף דִּפְרִיס לֵיהּ סוּדָרָא אַרֵישֵׁיהּ וְאָזֵיל וְאָתֵי בְּבֵיתֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו סָבַר לַהּ מָר אֵין אֲבֵילוּת בְּשַׁבָּת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: דְּבָרִים שֶׁבְּצִינְעָא — נוֹהֵג.
human_translation: Rava said: A mourner may walk about his house in robe [ unkali ] Abaye found Rav Yosef walking back and forth in his house with a scarf spread over his head He said to him: Master, do you not maintain there is no mourning on Shabbat? He said to him: This is what Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Matters that are in private apply,
llm_translation: Rava said: A mourner may walk around in his house wearing a shoe. Abaye found Rav Yosef spreading a scarf on his head and going out and coming back into his house. He said to him: Does the Master not hold that there is no mourning on Shabbat? He said to him: So said Rabbi Yochanan: Matters of private mourning are permitted.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מִשֶּׁחָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ עֲצֶרֶת כַּשַּׁבָּת וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל בַּר מְנַשְּׁיָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Since the Temple was destroyed, Shavuot is like Shabbat Rav Giddel bar Menashya said Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Gamliel.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: From when the Temple was destroyed, the festival is like the Sabbath, etc. Rav Giddel, son of Menashya, said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is according to Rabban Gamliel.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לְהָא דְּרַב גִּידֵּל בַּר מְנַשְּׁיָא אַהָא: כׇּל שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, תִּינוֹק יוֹצֵא בַּחֵיק, וְנִקְבָּר בְּאִשָּׁה אַחַת וּשְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים. אֲבָל לֹא בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד וּשְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים.
human_translation: And some teach this of Rav Giddel bar Menashya to the following thirty days an infant is taken out in bosom, And he is buried by one woman and two men, But not by one man and two women,
llm_translation: And there is one who teaches according to that which Rav Gidel, son of Menashya, said: "For thirty days, a baby is born in the lap, and is buried by one woman and two men. But not by one man and two women."

hebrew_text: אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: אַף בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד וּשְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים. וְאֵין עוֹמְדִין עָלָיו בְּשׁוּרָה. וְאֵין אוֹמְרִים עָלָיו בִּרְכַּת אֲבֵלִים וְתַנְחוּמֵי אֲבֵלִים.
human_translation: Abba Shaul says: even by one man and two women, And for do not stand in a line nor do recite over him the mourners’ blessing, nor consolation of mourners
llm_translation: Abba Shaul says: Even concerning one man and two women. And they do not stand over him in a row. And they do not say over him the blessings of mourners and the consolations of mourners.

hebrew_text: בֶּן שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹצֵא בִּדְלוֹסְקָמָא. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא דְּלוֹסְקָמָא הַנִּיטֶּלֶת בַּכָּתֵף, אֶלָּא הַנִּיטֶּלֶת בָּאֲגַפַּיִים. וְעוֹמְדִין עָלָיו בְּשׁוּרָה, וְאוֹמְרִים עָלָיו בִּרְכַּת אֲבֵלִים וְתַנְחוּמֵי אֲבֵלִים.
human_translation: A thirty-day-old is taken out in a coffin [ deluskema ]. Rabbi Yehuda says: Not in coffin that is carried on shoulder, but rather in the arms And for stand in a line And recite the mourners’ blessing And the consolation of mourners
llm_translation: A man of thirty goes out with his hair wrapped. Rabbi Yehuda says: Not with a wrapped turban on the shoulder, but with a wrapped turban on the temples. And they stand over him in a row and say over him the blessings of mourners and the consolations of mourners.

hebrew_text: בֶּן שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ יוֹצֵא בְּמִטָּה. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: הוּא בֶּן שָׁנָה וְאֵבָרָיו כְּבֶן שְׁתַּיִם, הוּא בֶּן שְׁתַּיִם וְאֵבָרָיו כְּבֶן שָׁנָה — יוֹצֵא בְּמִטָּה.
human_translation: A twelve-month-old is taken out on a bier, Rabbi Akiva says: is one year old and his limbs are like a two year old, he is two years old and his limbs are like a one-year-old. he is taken out on a bier.
llm_translation: Son twelve months goes out with bed. Rabbi Akiva says: He is one year and his limbs like two years, he is two years and his limbs like one year - goes out with bed.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הַיּוֹצֵא בְּמִטָּה — רַבִּים מַצְהִיבִין עָלָיו. אֵינוֹ יוֹצֵא בְּמִטָּה — אֵין רַבִּים מַצְהִיבִין עָלָיו. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה אוֹמֵר: נִיכָּר לָרַבִּים — רַבִּים מִתְעַסְּקִים עִמּוֹ, אֵינוֹ נִיכָּר לָרַבִּים — אֵין רַבִּים מִתְעַסְּקִים עִמּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: For one that is taken out on a bier, the public should grieve [ matzhivin ]. For one that is not taken out on a bier, the public need not grieve. Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya says: known to the public, the public must occupy themselves with him he was not known to the public, the public need not occupy themselves with him.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: One who goes out with a staff - many people accompany him. If he does not go out with a staff - many people do not accompany him. Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah says: If he is recognizable to the public - many people engage with him, if he is not recognizable to the public - many people do not engage with him.

hebrew_text: וּמָה הֵן בְּהֶסְפֵּד? רַבִּי מֵאִיר בְּשֵׁם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: עֲנִיִּים — בְּנֵי שָׁלֹשׁ, עֲשִׁירִים — בְּנֵי חָמֵשׁ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשְּׁמוֹ: עֲנִיִּים — בְּנֵי חָמֵשׁ, עֲשִׁירִים — בְּנֵי שֵׁשׁ, וּבְנֵי זְקֵנִים — כִּבְנֵי עֲנִיִּים.
human_translation: And what is the with regard to eulogy? Rabbi Meir said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: the poor the age of three, the wealthy the age of five. Rabbi Yehuda said in the name of the poor the age of five, the wealthy the age of six. And the children of the elderly are like the children of the poor,
llm_translation: "And what are the levels in mourning? Rabbi Meir in the name of Rabbi Yishmael says: The poor - for three days, the wealthy - for five days. Rabbi Yehuda says in his own name: The poor - for five days, the wealthy - for six days, and the elderly - like the poor."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל בַּר מְנַשְּׁיָא אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה שֶׁאָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל.
human_translation: Rav Giddel bar Menashya said Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, who stated it in the name of Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: Rav Giddel son of Menashya said in the name of Rav: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yehuda who said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַבִּי עֲנָנִי בַּר שָׂשׂוֹן אַפִּיתְחָא דְּבֵי נְשִׂיאָה: יוֹם אֶחָד לִפְנֵי עֲצֶרֶת וַעֲצֶרֶת — הֲרֵי כָּאן אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר. שְׁמַע רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְאִיקְּפַד, אֲמַר: אַטּוּ דִּידֵיהּ הִיא? דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא הִיא!
human_translation: Rabbi Anani bar Sason taught at the entrance to the house of the Nasi : one day before Shavuot and Shavuot fourteen Rabbi Ami heard and became angry He said: Is that to say his own It is that Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Oshaya
llm_translation: Rabbi Anani bar Sason expounded in the upper chamber of the house of the Nasi: One day before Shavuot and Shavuot itself — here we have fourteen. Rabbi Ammi heard and was upset, he said: Is it our concern? For Rabbi Elazar said it is Rabbi Oshaya!

hebrew_text: דְּרַשׁ רַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא אַקִּילְעָא דְּרֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא: יוֹם אֶחָד לִפְנֵי עֲצֶרֶת וַעֲצֶרֶת — הֲרֵי כָּאן אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר. שְׁמַע רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אִיקְּפַד, אָמַר: אַטּוּ דִּידֵיהּ הִיא? דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא הִיא!
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa taught in the pavilion [ kila ] of the Exilarch: one day before Shavuot and Shavuot fourteen Rav Sheshet heard and became angry. said: Is that to say his own It is that Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Oshaya
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak of Napachah expounded the verse of the exiles: "One day before Shavuot and Shavuot - here are fourteen." Rav Sheshet heard it and was astonished, saying: "Is it really his own idea?" Rabbi Elazar said, "It is Rabbi Oshaya's!"

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: מִנַּיִן לָעֲצֶרֶת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ תַּשְׁלוּמִין כׇּל שִׁבְעָה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּחַג הַמַּצּוֹת וּבְחַג הַשָּׁבוּעוֹת״, מָה חַג הַמַּצּוֹת יֵשׁ לָהּ תַּשְׁלוּמִין כׇּל שִׁבְעָה — אַף חַג הַשָּׁבוּעוֹת יֵשׁ לָהּ תַּשְׁלוּמִין כׇּל שִׁבְעָה.
human_translation: for Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Oshaya said: From where that the Shavuot have redress all seven days? As it is stated: on the festival of Passover, and on the festival of Shavuot , Just as the festival of Passover have redress all seven so too the festival of Shavuot have redress all seven
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Oshaya said: From where do we derive that Shavuot has accompanying offerings for seven days? As it is stated: "On the Festival of Matzot and on the Festival of Shavuot." Just as the Festival of Matzot has accompanying offerings for seven days, so too the Festival of Shavuot has accompanying offerings for seven days.

hebrew_text: אַדְבְּרֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְרַב אַוְיָא סָבָא וּדְרַשׁ: יוֹם אֶחָד לִפְנֵי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה וְרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה — הֲרֵי כָּאן אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר. אָמַר רָבִינָא, הִלְכָּךְ: יוֹם אֶחָד לִפְנֵי הֶחָג, וְחַג, וּשְׁמִינִי שֶׁלּוֹ — הֲרֵי כָּאן עֶשְׂרִים וְאֶחָד יוֹם.
human_translation: Rav Pappa granted permission to Rav Avya the Elder and he taught one day before Rosh HaShana and Rosh HaShana fourteen Ravina said: Therefore, one day before the Festival and the Festival and its Eighth twenty-one
llm_translation: The words of Rav Papa to Rav Avya the Elder, and he expounded: One day before Rosh Hashanah and Rosh Hashanah — here are fourteen. Ravina said, therefore: One day before the festival, the festival, and its eighth day — here are twenty-one days.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אִיקְּלַע לְסוּרָא דִפְרָת, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חֲבִיבָא מִסּוּרָא דִפְרָת לְרָבִינָא: אָמַר מָר, יוֹם אֶחָד לִפְנֵי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה וְרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה — הֲרֵי כָּאן אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא, מִסְתַּבְּרָא כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הוּא דְּאָמֵינָא.
human_translation: Ravina happened to Sura on the Euphrates Rav Ḥaviva from Sura on the Euphrates said to Ravina: Master say one day before Rosh HaShana and Rosh HaShana as fourteen He said to him: I said that it stands to reason according to Rabban Gamliel,
llm_translation: Rabinah arrived in Sura of Pumbedita, Rav H̱aviva said to Rabinah of Sura of Pumbedita: The Master said, one day before Rosh Hashanah and Rosh Hashanah - here are fourteen? He said to him: I, it seems like Rabban Gamliel who I believe.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין קוֹרְעִין וְלֹא חוֹלְצִין וְאֵין מַבְרִין אֶלָּא קְרוֹבָיו שֶׁל מֵת, וְאֵין מַבְרִין אֶלָּא עַל מִטָּה זְקוּפָה.
human_translation: do not rend and do not remove And do not provide them with a meal [ mavrin ] except for close relatives of the deceased. And provide the meal only on an upright bed,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One does not tear, nor remove their garments, and one does not cry out in mourning except for close relatives of the deceased. And one does not cry out except while standing.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וַאֲפִילּוּ חָכָם? וְהָתַנְיָא: חָכָם שֶׁמֵּת — הַכֹּל קְרוֹבָיו.
human_translation: And even Sage? But isn’t it taught scholar dies, everyone is his relative.
llm_translation: Gemara: And even if he is wise? And it was taught: A wise person who dies - all are his relatives.

hebrew_text: הַכֹּל קְרוֹבָיו סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא: הַכֹּל כִּקְרוֹבָיו: הַכֹּל קוֹרְעִין עָלָיו, וְהַכֹּל חוֹלְצִין עָלָיו, וְהַכֹּל מַבְרִין עָלָיו בָּרְחָבָה! לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּלָאו חָכָם הוּא.
human_translation: Does it enter your mind everyone is his relative? Rather, Everyone is like his relative everyone rends his over him, and everyone bares over him and everyone eats the mourner’s meal over him in the public square No, necessary where is not a scholar.
llm_translation: All his relatives, the removal of your mind?! Rather: all like his relatives: all tear on him, and all remove on him, and all explain on him broadly! Not necessary, for he is not wise.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָדָם כָּשֵׁר הוּא — חַיּוֹבֵי מִיחַיַּיב לְמִיקְרַע. דְּתַנְיָא: מִפְּנֵי מָה בָּנָיו וּבְנוֹתָיו שֶׁל אָדָם מֵתִים כְּשֶׁהֵן קְטַנִּים — כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּבְכֶּה וְיִתְאַבֵּל עַל אָדָם כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: And if was an upright person obligated to rend As it is taught For what do a person’s sons and daughters die when they are young? so that he will cry and mourn an upright person.
llm_translation: And if a person is fit - obligated from obligated to read. As it was taught: For what reason do the sons and daughters of a person who die while they are young - in order that he may weep and mourn for a righteous person.

hebrew_text: יִבְכֶּה וְיִתְאַבֵּל?! עֶרְבוֹנָא קָא שָׁקֵיל מִינֵּיהּ?! אֶלָּא: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלֹּא בָּכָה וְהִתְאַבֵּל עַל אָדָם כָּשֵׁר. שֶׁכׇּל הַבּוֹכֶה וּמִתְאַבֵּל עַל אָדָם כָּשֵׁר — מוֹחֲלִין לוֹ עַל כׇּל עֲוֹנוֹתָיו בִּשְׁבִיל כָּבוֹד שֶׁעָשָׂה לוֹ! דְּלָאו אָדָם כָּשֵׁר הוּא.
human_translation: he will cry and mourn? Is security, taken from him Rather because he did not cry or mourn over an upright person As anyone who cries and mourns over an upright person they forgive him all his transgressions because of the honor he accorded who not an upright person.
llm_translation: He cries and mourns?! Is it because he is taking a pledge from him?! Rather, because he did not cry and mourn for a righteous person. For anyone who cries and mourns for a righteous person - they forgive him for all his sins for the honor he showed him! For he is not a righteous person.

hebrew_text: אִי דְּקָאֵי הָתָם בִּשְׁעַת יְצִיאַת נְשָׁמָה חַיּוֹבֵי מִיחַיַּיב! דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הָעוֹמֵד עַל הַמֵּת בִּשְׁעַת יְצִיאַת נְשָׁמָה — חַיָּיב לִקְרוֹעַ. לְמָה זֶה דּוֹמֶה — לְסֵפֶר תּוֹרָה שֶׁנִּשְׂרַף, שֶׁחַיָּיב לִקְרוֹעַ!
human_translation: if one was standing there at the time of the soul’s departure, is obligated As it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: One who stands over the deceased at the time of the soul’s departure is obligated to rend To what may this be likened? To a Torah scroll that is burned, is obligated to rend
llm_translation: The text is as follows: "If he was standing there at the time of the departure of the soul, the relatives are obligated to rend. For it was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: One who stands over the deceased at the time of the departure of the soul — is obligated to rend. To what is this similar? To a Torah scroll that was burned, for which one is obligated to rend!"

hebrew_text: דְּלָא קָאֵי הָתָם בִּשְׁעַת יְצִיאַת נְשָׁמָה.
human_translation: who was not standing there at the time of the soul’s departure
llm_translation: The text stands there not at the time of the departure of the soul.

hebrew_text: כִּי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַב סָפְרָא, לָא קְרַעוּ רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ, אָמְרִי: לָא גָּמְרִינַן מִינֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ אַבָּיֵי: מִי תַּנְיָא ״הָרַב שֶׁמֵּת״? ״חָכָם שֶׁמֵּת״ תַּנְיָא. וְעוֹד: כֹּל יוֹמָא שְׁמַעְתָּתֵיהּ בְּפוּמִּין בְּבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא.
human_translation: when Rav Safra passed away the Sages did not rend over him. They said: We did not learn from him, Abaye said to them: Is it taught teacher died? It is taught: scholar died, And furthermore, every day his teachings are in our mouths in the study hall,
llm_translation: When Rav Safra passed away, the Rabbis did not rend their garments over him. They said: We have not yet finished learning from him. Abbaye said to them: Who taught the Mishnah "The Rabbi who dies"? It teaches "A wise man who dies." Furthermore, every day you would hear his voice in the corners of the study hall.

hebrew_text: סְבוּר: מָה דַּהֲוָה הֲוָה. אֲמַר לְהוּ אַבָּיֵי, תְּנֵינָא: חָכָם, כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁעוֹסְקִין בְּהֶסְפֵּד — חַיָּיבִין לִקְרוֹעַ. סְבוּר לְמִיקְרַע לְאַלְתַּר, אָמַר לְהוּ אַבָּיֵי, תַּנְיָא: חָכָם כְּבוֹדוֹ בְּהֶסְפֵּידוֹ.
human_translation: thought that what was was Abaye said to them: We learned: scholar, as long as they are engaged in eulogizing are obligated to rend They thought to rend immediately. Abaye said to them: It is taught A scholar’s honor is at his eulogy,
llm_translation: He thought: What will be, will be. Abaye said to them: We learned in a Mishnah: A wise person, as long as they are engaged in eulogizing, must tear. He thought to tear immediately, Abaye said to them: We learned in a Baraita: A wise person's honor is in their eulogizing.

hebrew_text: כִּי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא, סְבוּר לְאוֹתוֹבֵי סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה אַפּוּרְיֵיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב חִסְדָּא: מִילְּתָא דִּבְחַיֵּיהּ לָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, הַשְׁתָּא לֵיקוּם לֵיהּ לֶיעְבַּד לֵיהּ? דְּאָמַר רַב תַּחְלִיפָא: אֲנָא חֲזֵיתֵיהּ לְרַב הוּנָא דְּבָעֵי לְמֵיתַב אַפּוּרְיֵיהּ, וַהֲוָה מַנַּח סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה עֲלֵיהּ, וְכַף כַּדָּא אַאַרְעָא וְאוֹתֵיב סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה עִילָּוֵיהּ. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר: אָסוּר לֵישֵׁב עַל גַּבֵּי מִטָּה שֶׁסֵּפֶר תּוֹרָה מוּנָּח עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: When Rav Huna died they thought to place a Torah scroll on his bier, Rav Ḥisda said to them: a practice that he did not hold with during his lifetime; now should we stand up and do for him As Rav Taḥlifa said: I saw Rav Huna, who wished to sit on his bed, and there was a Torah scroll placed on it. And he turned a jug over and placed the Torah scroll on it Apparently he holds it is prohibited to sit on a bed upon which a Torah scroll lies.
llm_translation: When the soul of Rav Huna was at rest, he thought to bring out the Torah scroll and read from it. Rav Chisda said to them: The matter that he is alive does not seem to him, now that he has risen, should he not get up to serve it? For Rav Tachlifa said: I saw Rav Huna wanting to sit and read from the Torah scroll, and it was resting on him, and he would place a pillow under it and read from the Torah scroll above it. This implies that he holds: It is forbidden to sit on a bed on which a Torah scroll is placed.

hebrew_text: לָא הֲוָה נָפֵיק פּוּרְיָא מִבָּבָא, סְבוּר לְשַׁלְשׁוֹלֵי דֶּרֶךְ גַּגִּין. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב חִסְדָּא, הָא גְּמִירְנָא מִינֵּיהּ: חָכָם, כְּבוֹדוֹ דֶּרֶךְ פֶּתַח.
human_translation: the bier would not through the door. They thought to lower from the roof. Rav Ḥisda said to them: This I learned from him, A scholar’s honor through the opening,
