llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "He did not take out the Purya from the Bab, he thought to shake the path of the roofs. Rav Ḥisdah said to them: We have learned from him: A wise man, his honor is at the entrance."

hebrew_text: סְבוּר לְאַשְׁנוֹיֵי מִפּוּרְיָא לְפוּרְיָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב חִסְדָּא, הָכִי גְּמִירְנָא מִינֵּיהּ: חָכָם כְּבוֹדוֹ בְּמִטָּה רִאשׁוֹנָה. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מִנַּיִן לְחָכָם שֶׁכְּבוֹדוֹ בְּמִטָּה רִאשׁוֹנָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּרְכִּיבוּ אֶת אֲרוֹן הָאֱלֹהִים אֶל עֲגָלָה חֲדָשָׁה״. פְּרוּס בָּבָא וְאַפְּקוּהּ.
human_translation: They thought to move him from bier to bier Rav Ḥisda said to them: I learned from him, as follows: A scholar’s honor is on the first bier. As Rav Yehuda said Rav said: From where a scholar’s honor is on the first bier? As it is stated: “And they set the Ark of God upon a new cart” they broke the doorway and took him out
llm_translation: He thought to answer from Pur'ya to Pur'ya. Rav Ḥisdah said to them: So we have learned from him: "A wise man, his honor is in the first row." As Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: From where do we know that the honor of a wise man is in the first row? As it is stated: "And they placed the Ark of God on a new cart." Spread a cloth over it and cover it.

hebrew_text: פְּתַח עֲלֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא: רָאוּי הָיָה רַבֵּינוּ שֶׁתִּשְׁרֶה עָלָיו שְׁכִינָה, אֶלָּא שֶׁבָּבֶל גָּרְמָה לוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba opened him: Our Rabbi was worthy that the Divine Presence should rest upon him, except that Babylonia caused it
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba opened on it: Our Rabbi was worthy that the Divine Presence should rest upon him, but Babylon caused it to be withheld from him.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב נַחְמָן בַּר חִסְדָּא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב חָנָן בַּר חִסְדָּא: ״הָיֹה הָיָה דְבַר ה׳ אֶל יְחֶזְקֵאל בֶּן בּוּזִי הַכֹּהֵן בְּאֶרֶץ כַּשְׂדִּים״!
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Ḥisda raised an objection and some say Rav Ḥanan bar Ḥisda: “The word of the Lord came [ hayo haya ] to Ezekiel the priest, son of Buzi, in the land of the Chaldeans”
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Nachman bar Chisda asked, and some say it was Rav Chanin bar Chisda: "The word of the Lord came expressly to Ezekiel the son of Buzi the priest in the land of the Chaldeans!"

hebrew_text: טְפַח לֵיהּ אֲבוּהּ בְּסַנְדָּלֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו אָמֵינָא לָךְ לָא תִּיטְרוֹד עָלְמָא? מַאי ״הָיָה״ — שֶׁהָיָה כְּבָר.
human_translation: His father tapped him with his sandal He said to him: Have I not told you not to trouble everyone What “came [ hayo haya ]”? that it had already come
llm_translation: He measured it with his father's sandal, he said to him: I do not believe you, will you not wander in the world? What is "was" - that it was already.

hebrew_text: כִּי אַסְּקוּהּ לְהָתָם, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אַמֵּי וּלְרַבִּי אַסִּי: רַב הוּנָא אָתֵי. אֲמַרוּ: כִּי הֲוֵינַן הָתָם לָא הֲוָה לַן לְדַלּוֹיֵי רֵישִׁין מִינֵּיהּ. הַשְׁתָּא אָתֵינַן הָכָא — אֲתָא בָּתְרִין?
human_translation: when they took there, they said to Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi: Rav Huna has come, They said: When we were there, did not have strength to lift our heads before him. Now we have come here, has he come after us?
llm_translation: When they went there, they said to Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi: Rav Huna is coming. They said: When we were there, we did not have the opportunity to learn the beginning from him. Now that he has come here, will he come again?

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אֲרוֹנוֹ בָּא. רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי נְפוּק, רַבִּי אִילָא וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא לָא נְפוּק. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: רַבִּי אִילָא נְפַק, רַבִּי חֲנִינָא לָא נְפַק.
human_translation: They said to them: His coffin has come. Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi went out Rabbi Ila and Rabbi Ḥanina did not go out. Some say Rabbi Ila went out, Rabbi Ḥanina did not go out.
llm_translation: They said to him: His coffin is coming. Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi went out, Rabbi Ila and Rabbi Chanina did not go out. Some say: Rabbi Ila went out, Rabbi Chanina did not go out.

hebrew_text: דִּנְפַק, מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ? דְּתַנְיָא: אָרוֹן הָעוֹבֵר מִמָּקוֹם לְמָקוֹם — עוֹמְדִים עָלָיו בְּשׁוּרָה וְאוֹמְרִים עָלָיו בִּרְכַּת אֲבֵלִים וְתַנְחוּמֵי אֲבֵלִים. דְּלָא נְפַק, מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּתַנְיָא: אָרוֹן הָעוֹבֵר מִמָּקוֹם לְמָקוֹם — אֵין עוֹמְדִין עָלָיו בְּשׁוּרָה וְאֵין אוֹמְרִים עָלָיו בִּרְכַּת אֲבֵלִים וְתַנְחוּמֵי אֲבֵלִים.
human_translation: went out, what is reason As it is taught a coffin is passing from place to place, stand in a line for and they recite the mourners’ blessing and the consolation of the mourners over it. who did not go out, what is the reason As it is taught coffin is passing from place to place, they do not stand in a line for and they do not recite the mourners’ blessing or consolation of the mourners for him.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When it goes out, what is the reason? For it was taught: If an ark passes from place to place - they stand over it in a row and recite over it the blessings of mourners and the consolations of mourners. If it does not go out, what is the reason? For it was taught: If an ark passes from place to place - they do not stand over it in a row and do not recite over it the blessings of mourners and the consolations of mourners.

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָין אַהֲדָדֵי! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן — שֶׁשִּׁלְדּוֹ קַיֶּימֶת, כָּאן — בְּשֶׁאֵין שִׁלְדּוֹ קַיֶּימֶת. וְרַב הוּנָא שִׁלְדּוֹ קַיֶּימֶת הֲוָה? דְּלָא נְפַק, לָא סַיְּימוּהָ קַמֵּיהּ.
human_translation: these contradict each other. It is not difficult: Here, where the skeleton is intact, And there where the skeleton is no longer intact, And Rav Huna’s skeleton was intact. one did not go out they did not confirm for him
llm_translation: Difficulties of Hadadei! Not difficult: here - where its embryo is viable, here - where its embryo is not viable. And Rav Huna, was its embryo viable? Since it did not come out, they did not finish it before him.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: הֵיכָא נַינְּחֵיהּ? רַב הוּנָא רִיבֵּץ תּוֹרָה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל, וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא רִיבֵּץ תּוֹרָה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל הֲוָה.
human_translation: said: Where shall we bury him? Rav Huna disseminated Torah to Israel, and Rabbi Ḥiyya disseminated Torah to Israel;
llm_translation: They said: Where did he place it? Rav Huna rivets Torah in Israel, and Rabbi Hiyya rivets Torah in Israel was.

hebrew_text: מַאן מְעַיֵּיל לֵיהּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב חַגָּא: אֲנָא מְעַיֵּילְנָא לֵיהּ, דְּאוֹקֵמְתֵּיהּ לְתַלְמוּדַאי כִּי הֲוֵינָא בַּר תַּמְנֵי סְרֵי שְׁנִין וְלָא חֲזֵי לִי קֶרִי, וּמְשַׁמַּע לִי(ה) קַמֵּיהּ, וִידַעִי בְּעוֹבָדֵיהּ, דְּיוֹמָא חַד אִתְהֲפִיכָא לֵיהּ רְצוּעָה דִתְפִילִּין וִיתֵיב עֲלַהּ אַרְבְּעִין תַּעֲנִיָּתָא.
human_translation: Who will take him in Rav Ḥagga said to them: I will take him into for I presented my studies when I was eighteen, never having experienced a seminal emission. And I attended to him and knew his deeds. one day one of the straps of his phylacteries turned around, and he observed forty fasts for this,
llm_translation: Who brings it to him? He said to them, Rav Haga: I bring it to him, for I was established in the study hall when I was eighteen years old and did not see a seminal emission, and I heard his voice, and I know his actions, that one day he turned over a pouch of tefillin and sat on it for forty days of fasting.

hebrew_text: עַיְּילֵיהּ, הֲוָה גָּנֵי יְהוּדָה מִיַּמִּינֵיהּ דַּאֲבוּהּ וְחִזְקִיָּה מִשְּׂמָאלֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ יְהוּדָה לְחִזְקִיָּה: קוּם מִדּוּכְתִּיךְ, דְּלָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא דְּקָאֵים רַב הוּנָא. בַּהֲדֵי דְּקָאֵים — קָם בַּהֲדֵיהּ עַמּוּדָא דְנוּרָא. חַזְיֵיהּ רַב חַגָּא, אִיבְּעִית, זַקְפֵיהּ לַאֲרוֹנֵיהּ וּנְפַק אֲתָא. וְהַאי דְּלָא אִיעֲנַשׁ (ענש), מִשּׁוּם דְּזַקְפֵיהּ לַאֲרוֹנֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא.
human_translation: took him in. Yehuda lay to the right of his father, and Ḥizkiyya to his left. Yehuda said to Ḥizkiyya: Rise from your place, as not proper conduct Rav Huna is standing here. When up, a pillar of fire rose with him. Rabbi Ḥagga saw this, he was frightened he stood up coffin and went away. And he was not punished because he set up Rav Huna’s coffin
llm_translation: He (Yehudah) took him (Chizkiyah) to the right side of his father's bed, and Chizkiyah to his left. Yehudah said to Chizkiyah: Get up from your place, for Rav Huna is not accustomed to the way you are standing. While they were standing, he (Chizkiyah) got up and stood by the candlestick. Rav Haga saw him, and if you ask, he (Chizkiyah) stood up to his coffin and left. And the reason he was punished, because he stood up to the coffin of Rav Huna.

hebrew_text: כִּי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא, סְבוּר לְאוֹתוֹבֵי סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה אַפּוּרְיֵיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מִילְּתָא דִּלְרַבֵּיהּ לָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, אֲנַן נֵיקוּם נַעֲבֵיד לֵיהּ?
human_translation: When Rav Ḥisda died they thought to place a Torah scroll on his bier. Rabbi Yitzḥak said to them: a practice that this Rabbi did not hold with during his lifetime; should we stand up and do for him
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When the soul of Rav Ḥisda was about to depart, he thought to himself, "I am destined for the World to Come." Rabbi Yitzḥak said to him: "The matter of your Master does not seem clear to you, shall we take revenge on him?"

hebrew_text: סְבוּר דְּלָא לְמִישְׁלַל קִרְעַיְיהוּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אַמֵּי: חָכָם, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהֶחְזִירוּ פְּנֵיהֶם מֵאֲחוֹרֵי הַמִּטָּה — שׁוֹלְלִין.
human_translation: They thought not to tack, the tears Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Ami said to them: a Torah Sage, they may tack once they turn their faces from the bier.
llm_translation: He thought that they would not untie their belts. Rabbi Yitzchak bar Ammi said to them: Wise one, once they turn their faces away from the bed - they may strip.

hebrew_text: כִּי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבָּה בַּר הוּנָא וְרַב הַמְנוּנָא, אַסְּקוּנְהוּ לְהָתָם.
human_translation: when Rabba bar Huna and Rav Hamnuna died, they took them up there,
llm_translation: When the soul of Rabba bar Huna and Rav Hamnuna rested, they took him there.

hebrew_text: כִּי מְטוֹ אַגִּישְׁרָא, קָמוּ גַּמְלֵי. אֲמַר לְהוּ הַהוּא טַיָּיעָא: מַאי הַאי? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: רַבָּנַן דְּקָא עָבְדִי יְקָרָא אַהֲדָדֵי. מָר אָמַר: מָר נֵיעוּל בְּרֵישָׁא, וּמָר אָמַר: מָר נֵיעוּל בְּרֵישָׁא. אֲמַר: דִּינָא הוּא דְּרַבָּה בַּר הוּנָא לֵיעוּל בְּרֵישָׁא. חֲלֵיף גַּמְלֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה בַּר הוּנָא, נְתוּר כַּכֵּיהּ וְשִׁנֵּיהּ דְּהָהוּא טַיָּיעָא.
human_translation: When they reached a bridge the camels stood A certain Arab Tayya’a said to them: What is this They said to him: The Sages are showing honor to each other. Sage is saying: The Master should go first, Sage is saying: The Master should go first. said: By law Rabba bar Huna should go first, the camel Rabba bar Huna passed the molars and teeth of that Arab fell out
llm_translation: When Aggishra died, the camels stood up. That certain merchant said to them: What is this? They said to him: The Rabbis who were close friends. The master said: The master should be locked up first, and the master said: The master should be locked up first. He said: It is the judgment of Rabba bar Huna to lock up first. Rabba bar Huna's camel sneezed, and the liver and teeth of that merchant fell out.

hebrew_text: פְּתַח עֲלֵיהּ הַהוּא יָנוֹקָא: גֶּזַע יְשִׁישִׁים עָלָה מִבָּבֶל, וְעִמּוֹ סֵפֶר מִלְחָמוֹת, קָאַת וְקִפּוֹד הוּכְפְּלוּ, לִרְאוֹת בְּשׁוֹד וָשֶׁבֶר הַבָּא מִשִּׁנְעָר. קָצַף עַל עוֹלָמוֹ וְחָמַס מִמֶּנּוּ נְפָשׁוֹת, וְשָׂמַח בָּהֶם כְּכַלָּה חֲדָשָׁה. רוֹכֵב עֲרָבוֹת שָׂשׂ וְשָׂמַח, בְּבֹא אֵלָיו נֶפֶשׁ נָקִי וְצַדִּיק.
human_translation: a certain child opened The shoot of an ancient line, has ascended from Babylonia, and with him is the book of wars, The pelican and the bittern, have been doubled, to see the ruin and brokenness that has come from Shinar, became angry with His world and seized souls from it, and He rejoices over them like a new bride. who rides upon the clouds is joyous and happy when an innocent and righteous soul comes to Him.
llm_translation: The young man opened it and found: A scroll of genealogies had come up from Babylon, along with a book of wars, the cities of Kattah and Kippod were doubled, to see the desolation and ruin that came from youth. He was angry at his world, and violence from it took lives, yet he rejoiced in them like a new bride. Riding the plains, he was joyful and glad, when a pure and righteous soul came to him.

hebrew_text: כִּי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרָבִינָא, פְּתַח עֲלֵיהּ הַהוּא סַפְדָנָא: תְּמָרִים הָנִיעוּ רֹאשׁ עַל צַדִּיק כַּתָּמָר, נָשִׂים לֵילוֹת כְּיָמִים עַל מֵשִׂים לֵילוֹת כְּיָמִים.
human_translation: When Ravina passed away, a certain eulogizer opened for him Date-palms, hang your heads over the righteous man who may be likened to a date-palm. Let us make, nights like days over made nights like days
llm_translation: When the soul of Ravina rested, that certain elder opened with this lamentation: "Dates sway their heads like a palm tree over a righteous person, women mourn by night as by day over the dead."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְבַר קִיפּוֹק: הָהוּא יוֹמָא מַאי אָמְרַתְּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, אָמֵינָא: אִם בַּאֲרָזִים נָפְלָה שַׁלְהֶבֶת, מָה יַעֲשׂוּ אֵיזוֹבֵי קִיר. לִוְיָתָן בְּחַכָּה הוֹעֲלָה, מָה יַעֲשׂוּ דְּגֵי רְקָק. בְּנַחַל שׁוֹטֵף נָפְלָה חַכָּה, מָה יַעֲשׂוּ מֵי גֵבִים.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to bar Kippok, On that day what will you say? He said to him: I shall say If the cedars went up in flame, what shall the hyssop of the wall do? If the leviathan was lifted by a hook, what shall the fish of the marsh do? If dryness overtook a flowing river, what can the water of the puddles do?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ashi to Bar Kipok: On that day, what did you say? He said to him, I said: If a flame falls among cedars, what should hyssop branches do? If Leviathan is brought up with a hook, what should spitting fish do? If a stream overflows, what should waters from cisterns do.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ בַּר אָבִין: חַס וְשָׁלוֹם דְּחַכָּה וְשַׁלְהֶבֶת בְּצַדִּיקֵי אָמֵינָא. וּמַאי אָמְרַתְּ? אָמֵינָא: בְּכוּ לָאֲבֵלִים וְלֹא לָאֲבֵידָה, שֶׁהִיא לִמְנוּחָה וְאָנוּ לַאֲנָחָה.
human_translation: Bar Avin, said to him: God forbid hook and flame said with regard to the righteous, And what will you say? I shall say: Cry for the mourners and not for that which was lost, as to rest, while we, sighs.
llm_translation: He said to him, Bar Avin: "Mercy and peace, a spark and a flame, in the righteous I believe." And what do you say? I say: "Weep for the mourners, not for the lost, for it is for rest and we for sighing."

hebrew_text: חֲלַשׁ דַּעְתֵּיהּ עֲלַיְיהוּ, וְאִתְהֲפוּךְ כַּרְעַיְיהוּ. הַהוּא יוֹמָא לָא אֲתוֹ לְאַסְפּוֹדֵיהּ. וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: לָא בַּר קִיפּוֹק חָלֵיץ, וְלָא בַּר אָבִין חָלֵיץ.
human_translation: was offended by them, their feet turned On that day neither came to eulogize him. This is Rav Ashi said Neither bar Kippok can perform ḥalitza , nor can bar Avin perform ḥalitza ,
llm_translation: His mind weakened on them, and he turned over his legs. That day did not come for his gathering. That is what Rav Ashe said: Not with a bar kipok chalitz, and not with a bar avin chalitz.

hebrew_text: רָבָא, כִּי הֲוָה אֲתָא לְדִגְלַת, אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְבַר אָבִין: קוּם אֵימָא מִילְּתָא. קָאֵי וְאָמַר: בָּאוּ רוֹב שְׁלִישִׁית בְּמַיִם, זְכוֹר וְרַחֵם. תָּעִינוּ מֵאַחֲרֶיךָ כְּאִשָּׁה מִבַּעְלָהּ, אַל תַּזְנִיחֵנוּ כְּאוֹת מֵי מָרָה.
human_translation: When Rava came to the Tigris he said to bar Avin: Rise say He rose and said: Most of the third, has come in the water, Remember and have mercy we have strayed from you like an woman from her husband, do not forsake us like the sign of the bitter water,
llm_translation: Rava, when he would come to Diklat, said to Bar Avin: "Arise, let us say something." He stood and said: "The majority of a third of the water has come, 'Remember and have mercy.' You have forsaken us like a woman from her husband, do not abandon us like a sign of bitter waters."

hebrew_text: (חָנִין, יוֹחָנָן, זֵירָא, אַבָּא, יַעֲקֹב, יוֹסֵי, שְׁמוּאֵל, חִיָּיא, מְנַחֵם סִימָן).
human_translation: Ḥanin, Yoḥanan, Zeira, Abba, Ya’akov, Yosei, Shmuel, Ḥiyya, Menaḥem; mnemonic device
llm_translation: Hanin, Yochanan, Zeira, Abba, Yaakov, Yosei, Shmuel, Chiya, Menachem Siman.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חָנִין, חַתְנֵיהּ דְּבֵי נְשִׂיאָה הֲוָה. לָא (קָא) הֲווֹ לֵיהּ בְּנֵי, בְּעָא רַחֲמֵי וַהֲווֹ לֵיהּ. הָהוּא יוֹמָא דַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ, נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ, פְּתַח עֲלֵיהּ הַהוּא סַפְדָנָא: שִׂמְחָה לְתוּגָה נֶהְפָּכָה, שָׂשׂוֹן וְיָגוֹן נִדְבָּקוּ, בְּעֵת שִׂמְחָתוֹ נֶאֱנַח, בְּעֵת חֲנִינָתוֹ אָבַד חֲנִינוֹ. אַסִּיקוּ לֵיהּ חָנִן עַל שְׁמֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanin was a son-in-law in the house of the Nasi . he did not have children, he prayed mercy and had On the day that was to him, he passed away. A certain eulogizer opened for him Happiness has been turned into sorrow; joy and suffering have become joined together. At the moment of his happiness he sighed At the moment he was graced his grace was lost. And they named Ḥanan after
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanin, the son-in-law of the house of the leader, was. Not were to him sons, he prayed for mercy and they were to him. That day that was to him, he rested his soul, that eulogizer opened upon him: "Joy has turned to mourning, gladness and sorrow have become attached, at his time of joy he sighs, at his time of gracefulness his gracefulness is lost." They named him Chanin after his name.

hebrew_text: כִּי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, פְּתַח עֲלֵיהּ רַבִּי יִצְחָק בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: קָשֶׁה הַיּוֹם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל כְּיוֹם בֹּא הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ בַּצׇּהֳרַיִם, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיָה בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא וְהֵבֵאתִי הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ בַּצׇּהֳרַיִם״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זֶה יוֹמוֹ שֶׁל יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ.
human_translation: When Rabbi Yoḥanan passed away, Rabbi Yitzḥak ben Elazar opened for him Today is as difficult for the Jewish people as the day that the sun set at noon, as it is written: “And it shall come to pass on that day, that I will cause the sun to go down at noon, And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: This was the day Josiah
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When Rabbi Yochanan passed away, Rabbi Yitzchak ben Elazar opened with regard to him: "Difficult is the day for Israel as the day when the sun enters at noon," as it is written: "And it shall come to pass in that day, saith the Lord GOD, that I will cause the sun to go down at noon." And Rabbi Yochanan said: This is the day of Yoshiyahu.

hebrew_text: כִּי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, יָתֵיב רַבִּי אַמֵּי שִׁבְעָה וּשְׁלֹשִׁים. אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: רַבִּי אַמֵּי דַּעֲבַד — לְגַרְמֵיהּ הוּא דַּעֲבַד, דְּהָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֲפִילּוּ רַבּוֹ שֶׁלִּימְּדוֹ חׇכְמָה — אֵינוֹ יוֹשֵׁב עָלָיו אֶלָּא יוֹם אֶחָד.
human_translation: when Rabbi Yoḥanan passed away, Rabbi Ami sat seven and thirty Rabbi Abba, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba, said: Rabbi Ami did, he did on his own, For Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said as follows: Even his teacher who taught him wisdom, one sits over him for only one day
llm_translation: When the soul of Rabbi Yochanan departed, Rabbi Ammi sat for thirty-seven days. Rabbi Abba, son of Rabbi Chiya bar Abba, said: Rabbi Ammi, who did - it is for his own benefit that he did, for thus said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Even if one's teacher has taught him wisdom - he should not rely on him except for one day.

hebrew_text: כִּי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא, פְּתַח עֲלֵיהּ הַהוּא סַפְדָנָא: אֶרֶץ שִׁנְעָר הָרָה וְיָלְדָה, אֶרֶץ צְבִי גִּידְּלָה שַׁעֲשׁוּעֶיהָ. אוֹי נָא לָהּ אָמְרָה רַקַּת, כִּי אִבְּדָה כְּלִי חֶמְדָּתָהּ.
human_translation: When Rabbi Zeira died, a certain eulogizer opened for him The land of Shinar conceived and gave birth the land of beauty, raised the darling Woe to her, said Rakkath, for her dearest vessel has been lost.
llm_translation: When the soul of Rabbi Zeira was about to depart, that certain mourner opened with this lament: "The land of Shin'ar conceived and gave birth, the land of Tzvi raised her delights. Woe unto her, she said a vessel of desire has been lost."

hebrew_text: כִּי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, אַחִיתוּ עַמּוּדֵי דְקֵסָרִי מַיָּא. דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, שְׁפַעוּ מַרְזְבֵי דְצִיפּוֹרִי דְּמָא. דְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב, אִתְחֲמִיאוּ כּוֹכְבֵי בִּימָמָא. דְּרַבִּי אַסִּי, אִיעֲקַרוּ כׇּל אִילָנַיָּא. דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא, נְחִיתוּ כֵּיפֵי דְנוּרָא מֵרְקִיעָא. דְּרַבִּי מְנַחֵם בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, אִישְׁתַּעוֹ צַלְמָנַיָּיא וַהֲווֹ (לְמַחְלְצַיָּיא).
human_translation: When Rabbi Abbahu passed away, the pillars of Caesarea, ran with water Rabbi Yosei the gutters of Tzippori, flowed with blood. Rabbi Ya’akov the stars were visible during the day. Rabbi Asi all the trees were uprooted Rabbi Ḥiyya fiery stones fell from the sky. Rabbi Menaḥem, son of Rabbi Yosei, the statues became smooth as if they had been smoothed with trowel meḥlatzaya
llm_translation: When the soul of Rabbi Avahu would rest, the pillars of the Caesar's palace would be filled with water. Rabbi Yosei, the markets of the city of Tzipori would overflow with blood. Rabbi Yaakov, the stars would descend to the earth. Rabbi Assi, all the trees would be uprooted. Rabbi Chiya, the crowns of light from the firmament would descend. Rabbi Menachem, son of Rabbi Yosei, the images of the constellations would be removed and they would be saved.

hebrew_text: דְּרַבִּי תַּנְחוּם בַּר חִיָּיא, אִיתְקַצַּצוּ כֹּל אַנְדְּרָטַיָּא. דְּרַבִּי אֶלְיָשִׁיב, אִיחֲתַרוּ שִׁבְעִין מַחְתַּרְתָּא בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא. דְּרַב הַמְנוּנָא, נְחִיתוּ כֵּיפֵי דְבַרְדָּא מֵרְקִיעָא. דְּרַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף, נְשׁוּק כֵּיפֵי דִפְרָת אַהֲדָדֵי. דְּאַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא, נְשׁוּק כֵּיפֵי דְּדִגְלַת אַהֲדָדֵי. כִּי נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבִּי מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא, טְעוּן דִּיקְלֵי שִׁיצֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Tanḥum bar Ḥiyya every statue [ andartaya ] was mutilated. Rabbi Elyashiv seventy tunnels were dug in Neharde’a, Rav Hamnuna hail stones fell from the sky. Rabba and Rav Yosef the bridges of the Euphrates touched each other. Abaye and Rava the bridges of the Tigris touched each other. Rabbi Mesharshiyya the palm trees laden thorns [ shitzei ].
llm_translation: Rabbi Tanhum bar Hiyya, all the Andarta were cut off. Rabbi Elyashiv, seventy Machtarata were found in Nehardea. Rav Hamnuna, the walls of Devarda descended from the sky. Rabbah and Rav Yosef, the walls of Diprat Ahadadei were kissed. Abbaye and Rava, the walls of Diglata Ahadadei were kissed. When Rabbi Mesharshaya passed away, palm branches were required.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן:
human_translation: The Sages taught
llm_translation: The sages taught:

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ קְרָעִין שֶׁאֵין מִתְאַחִין: הַקּוֹרֵעַ עַל אָבִיו וְעַל אִמּוֹ, וְעַל רַבּוֹ שֶׁלִּימְּדוֹ תּוֹרָה, וְעַל נָשִׂיא וְעַל אָב בֵּית דִּין, וְעַל שְׁמוּעוֹת הָרָעוֹת, וְעַל בִּרְכַּת הַשֵּׁם, וְעַל סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה שֶׁנִּשְׂרַף, וְעַל עָרֵי יְהוּדָה וְעַל הַמִּקְדָּשׁ וְעַל יְרוּשָׁלַיִם. וְקוֹרֵעַ עַל מִקְדָּשׁ, וּמוֹסִיף עַל יְרוּשָׁלַיִם.
human_translation: And these are the rents that may never be mended: One who rends for his father, or for his mother, or for his teacher who taught him Torah, or for Nasi , or for president of the court; or upon evil tidings; or name being blessed, or when a Torah scroll has been burned; or upon the cities of Judea or the Temple or Jerusalem He rends for the Temple and extends for Jerusalem.
llm_translation: And these are the rendings that do not require compensation: one who rends for his father and for his mother, and for his teacher from whom he learned Torah, and for a prince and for the head of the court, and for evil reports, and for the blessing of the Name, and for a Torah scroll that was burned, and for the cities of Judah, and for the Temple, and for Jerusalem. And one who rends for the Temple, may add for Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ וְרַבּוֹ שֶׁלִּימְּדוֹ תּוֹרָה מְנָלַן — דִּכְתִיב: ״וֶאֱלִישָׁע רֹאֶה וְהוּא מְצַעֵק אָבִי אָבִי רֶכֶב יִשְׂרָאֵל וּפָרָשָׁיו״. ״אָבִי אָבִי״ — זֶה אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ, ״רֶכֶב יִשְׂרָאֵל וּפָרָשָׁיו״ — זֶה רַבּוֹ שֶׁלִּימְּדוֹ תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: From where do we his father, his mother, and his teacher who taught him Torah? As it is written “And Elisha saw it, and he cried, My father, my father, the chariots of Israel and their horsemen” “My father, my father”; this his father or mother. “The chariots of Israel and their horsemen”; this one’s teacher who taught him Torah.
llm_translation: His father and his mother and his teacher who taught him Torah, from where do we derive this? As it is written: "And Elisha saw it and he cried, 'My father, my father, the chariot of Israel and its horsemen.'" "My father, my father" - this refers to his father and his mother, "the chariot of Israel and its horsemen" - this refers to his teacher who taught him Torah.

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע? כְּדִמְתַרְגֵּם רַב יוֹסֵף: רַבִּי רַבִּי דְּטָב לְהוֹן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל בִּצְלוֹתֵיהּ מֵרְתִיכִּין וּפָרָשִׁין.
human_translation: From where be inferred As was translated by Rav Yosef: My teacher, my teacher, who was better for Jewish people with his prayers than chariots and horsemen.
llm_translation: What is implied? As Rav Yosef interpreted: "Rabbi, Rabbi, who was good to the people of Israel in their distress and in their need."

hebrew_text: וְלֹא מִתְאַחִין מְנָלַן — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּחֲזֵק בִּבְגָדָיו וַיִּקְרָעֵם לִשְׁנַיִם קְרָעִים״, מִמַּשְׁמַע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וַיִּקְרָעֵם״ אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁלִּשְׁנַיִם? אֶלָּא מְלַמֵּד שֶׁקְּרוּעִים וְעוֹמְדִים לִשְׁנַיִם לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: And from where do we are never mended? As it is written: “And he took hold of his own clothes, and rent them in two pieces” From the fact that is stated: “And he rent them,” do I not know that in two Rather, it teaches that they must remain torn in two forever.
llm_translation: "And not from where do we derive? — As it is written: 'And he seized his garments and tore them into two torn pieces.' From the fact that it says 'he tore them,' I do not know that it is into two? Rather, it teaches that torn garments are always standing in two."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵלִיָּהוּ חַי הוּא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, כֵּיוָן דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלֹא רָאָהוּ עוֹד״, לְגַבֵּי דִידֵיהּ כְּמֵת דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said to Rabbi Yoḥanan: Elijah alive? He said to him: Since it is written: “And he saw him no more” considered dead from
llm_translation: He said to him Resh Lakish to Rabbi Yochanan: "Elijah is alive?" He said to him, "Since it is written: 'And he was not seen anymore,' regarding himself as if dead."

hebrew_text: נָשִׂיא וְאַב בֵּית דִּין וּשְׁמוּעוֹת הָרָעוֹת מְנָלַן — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּחֲזֵק דָּוִד בִּבְגָדָיו וַיִּקְרָעֵם וְגַם כׇּל הָאֲנָשִׁים אֲשֶׁר אִתּוֹ. וַיִּסְפְּדוּ וַיִּבְכּוּ וַיָּצוּמוּ עַד הָעָרֶב עַל שָׁאוּל וְעַל יְהוֹנָתָן בְּנוֹ וְעַל עַם ה׳ וְעַל בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל כִּי נָפְלוּ בֶּחָרֶב״.
human_translation: From where do we Nasi or president of the court and evil tidings? As it is written, “Then David took hold of his clothes, and rent them; and likewise all the men that were with him: And they mourned, and wept, and fasted until evening, for Saul and for Jonathan his son, and for the people of the Lord, and for the house of Israel; because they were fallen by the sword”
llm_translation: The prince and the father of the court and the evil reports from where are they? — As it is written: "And David took hold of his clothes and tore them, and also all the men who were with him. And they mourned and wept and fasted until evening for Saul and for Jonathan his son and for the people of the Lord and for the house of Israel, because they had fallen by the sword."

hebrew_text: ״שָׁאוּל״ — זֶה נָשִׂיא, ״יְהוֹנָתָן״ — זֶה אַב בֵּית דִּין, ״עַל עַם ה׳ וְעַל בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל״ — אֵלּוּ שְׁמוּעוֹת הָרָעוֹת.
human_translation: “Saul”; this is Nasi , “Jonathan”; this is president of the court. “For the people of the Lord, and for the house of the Israel”; these are evil tidings.
llm_translation: "Shaul" - this is a leader, "Yehonatan" - this is the head of the court, "Al am Hashem ve'al beit Yisrael" - these are evil rumors.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב בַּר שַׁבָּא לְרַב כָּהֲנָא: וְאֵימָא עַד דְּהָווּ כּוּלְּהוּ! אָמַר לֵיהּ: ״עַל״ ״עַל״ הִפְסִיק הָעִנְיָן.
human_translation: Rav bar Shaba said to Rav Kahana: But say until all these He said to him: “For “for divides the matter
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav bar Shabba said to Rav Kahana: "And why not until they all were?" He said to him: "Upon, upon," the matter was interrupted.

hebrew_text: וּמִי קָרְעִינַן אַשְּׁמוּעוֹת הָרָעוֹת? וְהָא אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לִשְׁמוּאֵל: קְטַל שַׁבּוּר מַלְכָּא תְּרֵיסַר אַלְפֵי יְהוּדָאֵי בִּמְזִיגַת קֵסָרִי, וְלָא קְרַע! לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא בְּרוֹב צִבּוּר וּכְמַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה.
human_translation: But do we rend evil tidings? But didn’t they say to Shmuel: King Shapur killed twelve thousand Jews in Mezigat Caesarea, and did not rend They said only the majority of the community and resembles the incident that occurred
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who tore up the evil reports? And they said to Shmuel: Shabur, the king's officer, executed thirteen thousand Jews by drowning them in the mixing of Caesar, and did not tear! They only said this in the majority of the public and as an incident that occurred.

hebrew_text: וּמִי קְטַל שַׁבּוּר מַלְכָּא יְהוּדָאֵי? וְהָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ שַׁבּוּר מַלְכָּא לִשְׁמוּאֵל: תֵּיתֵי לִי דְּלָא קְטַלִי יְהוּדִי מֵעוֹלָם! הָתָם אִינְהוּ גָּרְמִי לְנַפְשַׁיְיהוּ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: לְקָל יְתֵירֵי דִּמְזִיגַת קֵסָרִי, פְּקַע שׁוּרָא דְלוּדְקִיָּא.
human_translation: Did King Shapur kill Jews? But didn’t King Shapur say to Shmuel: I have coming to me, for I have never killed a Jew? there, they brought it upon themselves, as Rabbi Ami said Due to the noise of the strings Mezigat Caesarea, the walls of Laodicea were breached,
llm_translation: And who killed Shabur the King of the Jews? And he said to him, Shabur the King said to Shmuel: "Give me that I have never killed a Jew in my life!" There they caused their own death, as Rabbi Ammi said: "For the lightest of Caesar's wine, they broke the horn of the lamp."

hebrew_text: עַל בִּרְכַּת הַשֵּׁם מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּבֹא אֶלְיָקִים בֶּן חִלְקִיָּה אֲשֶׁר עַל הַבַּיִת וְשֶׁבְנָא הַסּוֹפֵר וְיוֹאָח בֶּן אָסָף הַמַּזְכִּיר אֶל חִזְקִיָּהוּ קְרוּעֵי בְגָדִים״.
human_translation: From where do we upon name being blessed, As it is written “Then came Eliakim, son of Hilkiya, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah, son of Asaph, the recorder, to Hezekiah with their clothes rent”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: On the blessing of the Name, from where do we derive it? As it is written: "And Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph the recorder, came to Hezekiah with their clothes rent."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֶחָד הַשּׁוֹמֵעַ וְאֶחָד הַשּׁוֹמֵעַ מִפִּי הַשּׁוֹמֵעַ — חַיָּיב לִקְרוֹעַ. וְהָעֵדִים אֵינָן חַיָּיבִין לִקְרוֹעַ, שֶׁכְּבָר קָרְעוּ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁשָּׁמְעוּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught one who hears and one who hears from the mouth of who heard are obligated to rend But the witnesses are not obligated to rend because they already rent when they heard
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One who hears and one who hears from the mouth of the hearer - are obligated to read. But witnesses are not obligated to read, for they already read at the time they heard.

hebrew_text: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁשָּׁמְעוּ מַאי הָוֵי? הָא קָא שָׁמְעִי הַשְׁתָּא! לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי כִּשְׁמוֹעַ הַמֶּלֶךְ חִזְקִיָּהוּ וַיִּקְרַע אֶת בְּגָדָיו״, הַמֶּלֶךְ קָרַע וְהֵם לֹא קָרְעוּ.
human_translation: What does when they heard Didn’t they hear now? This will not enter your mind, as it is written: “And it came to pass, when King Hezekiah heard it, that he rent his clothes” the king rent but did not rend
llm_translation: At the moment they heard "What is happening?" - they heard it now! Your opinion did not arise, as it is written: "And when King Hezekiah heard, he tore his clothes," the king tore and they did not tear.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא מִתְאַחִין מְנָלַן — אָתְיָא ״קְרִיעָה״ ״קְרִיעָה״.
human_translation: And from where do we may not be mended? This is derived rending rending
llm_translation: "And not from where do we derive this? - It is taught: 'tearing,' 'tearing.'"

hebrew_text: סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה שֶׁנִּשְׂרַף מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי כִּקְרֹא יְהוּדִי שָׁלֹשׁ דְּלָתוֹת וְאַרְבָּעָה וְיִקְרָעֶהָ בְּתַעַר הַסּוֹפֵר וְהַשְׁלֵךְ אֶל הָאֵשׁ אֲשֶׁר אֶל הָאָח וְגוֹ׳״. מַאי שָׁלֹשׁ דְּלָתוֹת וְאַרְבָּעָה?
human_translation: From where do we a Torah scroll has been burned? As it is written: “And it came to pass, that when Jehudi had read three or four leaves, he would cut it with a penknife, and cast it into the fire that was in the brazier” What “three or four leaves,”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A Torah scroll that was burned, what is the law? As it is written: "And it came to pass, when the Jew read three columns and four, he cut it with a knife of the scribe and threw it into the fire that was in the brazier, etc." What is meant by "three columns and four"?

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לִיהוֹיָקִים: כָּתַב יִרְמְיָה סֵפֶר קִינוֹת. אֲמַר לְהוּ: מָה כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ? ״אֵיכָה יָשְׁבָה בָּדָד״. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אֲנָא מַלְכָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״בָּכֹה תִבְכֶּה בַּלַּיְלָה״. אֲנָא מַלְכָּא. ״גָּלְתָה יְהוּדָה מֵעוֹנִי״. אֲנָא מַלְכָּא. ״דַּרְכֵי צִיּוֹן אֲבֵלוֹת״. אֲנָא מַלְכָּא.
human_translation: They said to Jehoiakim: Jeremiah has written a book of Lamentations He said to them: What is written in it? “How does the city sit solitary” He said to them: I am king, They read him “She weeps sore in the night” I am king, “Judah is gone into exile due to affliction” I am king. “The ways of Zion do mourn” I am king.
llm_translation: They said to Yehoyakim: Jeremiah wrote the book of Lamentations. He said to them: What is written in it? "How does the city sit solitary." He said to them: I am the king. He said to him: "You shall weep in the night." I am the king. "Judah has gone into exile." I am the king. "Her ways to Zion mourn." I am the king.

hebrew_text: ״הָיוּ צָרֶיהָ לְרֹאשׁ״. אֲמַר לְהוּ: מַאן אַמְרַהּ? ״כִּי ה׳ הוֹגָהּ עַל רוֹב פְּשָׁעֶיהָ״. מִיָּד קָדַר כׇּל אַזְכָּרוֹת שֶׁבָּהּ, וּשְׂרָפָן בָּאֵשׁ. וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלֹא פָחֲדוּ וְלֹא קָרְעוּ אֶת בִּגְדֵיהֶם״, מִכְּלַל דִּבְעוֹ לְמִיקְרַע.
human_translation: “Her adversaries have become the chief” he said to them: Who said “For the Lord has afflicted her for the multitude of her transgressions” Immediately, he cut out all the names from and burned them in fire. This is as it is written: “Yet they were not afraid, nor rent their garments, By inference, that were required to rend
llm_translation: "They were her distress to her head." He said to them: Who said this? "For the Lord has afflicted her for the multitude of her transgressions." Immediately all her memories turned black, and they were consumed by fire. And this is what is written: "They did not fear, nor tear their garments," from which we learn that it is not appropriate to tear.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: אֵימַר מִשּׁוּם שְׁמוּעוֹת הָרָעוֹת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁמוּעוֹת רָעוֹת בְּהָהִיא שַׁעְתָּא מִי הֲווֹ?!
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: say due to the evil tidings said to him: Were they evil tidings at that time?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: Say it is due to evil rumors. He said to him: Evil rumors at that time, who were they from?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הָרוֹאֶה סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה שֶׁנִּקְרַע — חַיָּיב לִקְרוֹעַ שְׁתֵּי קְרִיעוֹת: אֶחָד עַל הַגְּוִיל וְאֶחָד עַל הַכְּתָב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַחֲרֵי שְׂרוֹף הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶת הַמְּגִלָּה וְאֶת הַדְּבָרִים״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥelbo said Rav Huna said: One who sees a Torah scroll that was torn is obligated to make two rents, one for the parchment and one for the writing, as it is stated: after the king had burned the scroll and the words”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Helbo said Rav Huna: One who sees a Torah scroll that has been torn - is obligated to tear two tears: one on the scroll and one on the writing, as it is stated: "After the king burned the scroll and the words."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַבָּא וְרַב הוּנָא בַּר חִיָּיא הָווּ יָתְבִי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַבָּא. בְּעָא לְאִפַּנּוֹיֵי, שַׁקְלֵיהּ לְטוֹטֶפְתֵּיהּ אַחֲתֵיהּ אַבֵּי סַדְיָא. אֲתַאי בַּת נַעָמִיתָא בְּעַא לְמִיבְלְעֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba and Rav Huna bar Ḥiyya were sitting before Rabbi Abba. needed to relieve himself. He removed his phylacteries placed them on the cushion An ostrich came and wanted to swallow
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba and Rav Huna son of Chiyya were sitting before Rabbi Abba. He wanted to show them hospitality, so he took one of his fingers and placed it in the mouth of his servant, Avi Sadya. The daughter of Naamita came and asked to swallow it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר: הַשְׁתָּא כִּי חַיְּיבַן לִי שְׁתֵּי קְרִיעוֹת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מְנָא לָךְ הָא? וְהָא בְּדִידִי הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא, וַאֲתַאי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב מַתְנָה וְלָא הֲוָה בִּידֵיהּ. אֲתַאי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה, וַאֲמַר לִי, הָכִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא בִּזְרוֹעַ, וּכְמַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה.
human_translation: He said: Now, I would have been obligated to make two rents. He said to him: From where do you this? There was an incident in which I and I came before Rav Mattana but he did not have I came before Rav Yehuda, and he said to me: Shmuel said as follows: They said only by force, and it resembles the incident that occurred
llm_translation: He said: "This year, I am obligated to have two rendings." He said to him: "From where do you know this?" And this was a personal matter for me, and it came before Rav Matnah, but it was not in his hands. It came before Rav Yehudah, and he said to me, "So said Shmuel: They only said this regarding the arm, and similar to the incident that occurred."

hebrew_text: עָרֵי יְהוּדָה מְנָלַן — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּבֹאוּ אֲנָשִׁים מִשְּׁכֶם מִשִּׁילוֹ וּמִשֹּׁמְרוֹן שְׁמוֹנִים אִישׁ מְגוּלְּחֵי זָקָן וּקְרוּעֵי בְגָדִים וּמִתְגּוֹדְדִים וּמִנְחָה וּלְבוֹנָה בְּיָדָם לְהָבִיא בֵּית ה׳ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: From where do we the cities of Judea As it is written: “There came certain men from Shechem, from Shiloh, and from Samaria, eighty people, their beards shaven, and their clothes rent, and having cut themselves, with offerings and incense in their hand, to bring to the house of the Lord”
llm_translation: Cities of Judah, from where? — As it is written: "And men came from Shechem, from Shiloh, and from Samaria, eighty men, with shaven faces and torn garments, and having cut themselves, with offerings and incense in their hands, to bring to the house of the Lord, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ אָמַר עוּלָּא בִּירָאָה אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הָרוֹאֶה עָרֵי יְהוּדָה בְּחוּרְבָּנָן, אוֹמֵר: ״עָרֵי קׇדְשְׁךָ הָיוּ מִדְבָּר״, וְקוֹרֵעַ. יְרוּשָׁלַיִם בְּחוּרְבָּנָהּ, אוֹמֵר: ״צִיּוֹן מִדְבָּר הָיָתָה יְרוּשָׁלִַם שְׁמָמָה״, וְקוֹרֵעַ. בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ בְּחוּרְבָּנוֹ, אוֹמֵר: ״בֵּית קׇדְשֵׁנוּ וְתִפְאַרְתֵּנוּ אֲשֶׁר הִלְלוּךָ אֲבוֹתֵינוּ הָיָה לִשְׂרֵיפַת אֵשׁ וְכׇל מַחֲמַדֵּינוּ הָיָה לְחׇרְבָּה״, וְקוֹרֵעַ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥelbo said Ulla Bira’a said Rabbi Elazar said: One who sees the cities of Judea in their desolation says: “Your sacred cities are become a wilderness” and rends Jerusalem in its desolation says: “Zion is a wilderness, Jerusalem a desolation” and rends the Temple in its desolation says: “Our sacred and our beautiful house, where our fathers praised You, is burned with fire; and all our pleasant things are laid waste” ( and rends
llm_translation: Rabbi Helbo said in the name of Ulah in fear, Rabbi Elazar said: One who sees the cities of Judah in their destruction says, "Your holy cities have become a wilderness," and tears. Jerusalem in its destruction, says, "Zion was a wilderness, Jerusalem a desolation," and tears. The Temple in its destruction, says, "Our holy Temple, the glory of our fathers, where our ancestors praised You, was given over to fire, and all our precious things were given over to the sword," and tears.

hebrew_text: קוֹרֵעַ עַל מִקְדָּשׁ, וּמוֹסִיף עַל יְרוּשָׁלַיִם. וּרְמִינְהוּ: אֶחָד הַשּׁוֹמֵעַ וְאֶחָד הָרוֹאֶה, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לְצוֹפִים — קוֹרֵעַ, וְקוֹרֵעַ עַל מִקְדָּשׁ בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ וְעַל יְרוּשָׁלַיִם בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ!
human_translation: He rends for the Temple and extends for Jerusalem. And they raise a contradiction one who hears and one who sees once he reaches Scopus [ Tzofim ], rends And he rends for the Temple separately and for Jerusalem separately.
llm_translation: He reads over the Temple, and adds on to Jerusalem. And they raised a dilemma: One who hears and one who sees, once he reaches Tzofim - he reads, and he reads over the Temple separately and over Jerusalem separately!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּפָגַע בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ בְּרֵישָׁא. הָא דְּפָגַע בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם בְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: This is not difficult. This one reached the Temple first, That one reached Jerusalem first,
llm_translation: Not difficult: this that he encountered in the Temple at first. This that he encountered in Jerusalem at first.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: וְכוּלָּן רַשָּׁאִין לְשׁוֹלְלָן וּלְמוֹלְלָן וּלְלוֹקְטָן וְלַעֲשׂוֹתָן כְּמִין סוּלָּמוֹת, אֲבָל לֹא לְאַחוֹתָן.
human_translation: The Sages taught And all of these one may tack them and hem them, and gather them, and fix them ladder-like But one may not mend them
llm_translation: The sages taught: And all of them are permitted to uproot, to circumcise, to gather, and to make them like ladders, but not to tie them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא:
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said:
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said:

hebrew_text: וּבְאִיחוּי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִי.
human_translation: And to Alexandrian mending,
llm_translation: And in the joining of Alexander.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַקּוֹרֵעַ מִתּוֹךְ הַשְּׁלָל מִתּוֹךְ הַמְּלָל מִתּוֹךְ הַלֶּקֶט, מִתּוֹךְ הַסּוּלָּמוֹת — לֹא יָצָא. מִתּוֹךְ הָאִיחוּי — יָצָא. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: וּבְאִיחוּי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִי.
human_translation: The Sages taught One who rends that had been tacked from the hem of the garment, on the gathering, on the ladder-like stiches has not fulfilled that had been mended, he has fulfilled Rav Ḥisda said: And to Alexandrian mending
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who reads from within the spoil, from within the garment, from within the bundle, from within the baskets - has not fulfilled his obligation. But from within the mixing - he has fulfilled his obligation. Rav Hisda said: And with mixing, I go according to the Alexandrians.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: רַשַּׁאי לְהוֹפְכוֹ לְמַטָּה וּלְאַחוֹתוֹ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹסֵר לְאַחוֹתוֹ, וּכְשֵׁם שֶׁהַמּוֹכֵר אָסוּר לְאַחוֹתוֹ — כָּךְ הַלּוֹקֵחַ אָסוּר לְאַחוֹתוֹ. וּלְפִיכָךְ מוֹכֵר צָרִיךְ לְהוֹדִיעוֹ לַלּוֹקֵחַ.
human_translation: The Sages taught permitted to turn upside down and mend Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar prohibits mending And just as the seller, is prohibited from mending so too the buyer, is prohibited from mending it. The seller must therefore inform the buyer
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: It is permissible to marry off his sister to her brother. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar prohibits marrying off his sister, and just as the seller is prohibited from marrying off his sister, so too the buyer is prohibited from marrying off his sister. Therefore, the seller must inform the buyer.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: תְּחִילַּת קְרִיעָה — טֶפַח, וְתוֹסֶפֶת — שָׁלֹשׁ אֶצְבָּעוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: תְּחִילַּת קְרִיעָה — שָׁלֹשׁ אֶצְבָּעוֹת, וְתוֹסֶפֶת — כׇּל שֶׁהוּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught The initial rending is a handbreadth  and extension, is three fingerbreadths; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: initial rending is three fingerbreadths and extension is any amount,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: The beginning of tearing - a handbreadth, and additional - three fingers, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: The beginning of tearing - three fingers, and additional - however much one wants.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר בִּקְרִיעָה, וַהֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּתוֹסֶפֶת. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: תְּחִילַּת קְרִיעָה — טֶפַח, וְתוֹסֶפֶת — כׇּל שֶׁהוּ.
human_translation: Ulla said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Meir that rending and the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda that an extension That is also taught Rabbi Yosei says: initial rending one handbreadth, and extension is any amount.
llm_translation: Ula said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Meir in tearing, and the halakha is according to Rabbi Yehuda in adding. It was also taught similarly: Rabbi Yosei says: The beginning of tearing is a handbreadth, and adding is however much.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אָמְרוּ לוֹ מֵת אָבִיו וְקָרַע, מֵת בְּנוֹ וְהוֹסִיף, תַּחְתּוֹן — מִתְאַחֶה, עֶלְיוֹן — אֵינוֹ מִתְאַחֶה.
human_translation: The Sages taught they said to his father died, and he rent his son died, and he added lower may be mended. upper may not be mended,
llm_translation: The sages taught: If his father died and he tore (his garment), if his son died and he added (tearing), for a stepfather - he may mend, for a father-in-law - he may not mend.

hebrew_text: מֵת בְּנוֹ וְקָרַע, מֵת אָבִיו וְהוֹסִיף, עֶלְיוֹן — מִתְאַחֶה, תַּחְתּוֹן — אֵינוֹ מִתְאַחֶה.
human_translation: his son died, and he rent his father died, and he added upper may be mended, the lower may not be mended.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "If his son dies and he tears (his garments), if his father dies and he adds (tearing), the upper (garment) - he diminishes, the lower (garment) - he does not diminish."

hebrew_text: מֵת אָבִיו, מֵת אִמּוֹ, מֵת אָחִיו, מֵתָה אֲחוֹתוֹ — קוֹרֵעַ קֶרַע אֶחָד לְכוּלָּן. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה אוֹמֵר: עַל כּוּלָּן קֶרַע אֶחָד, עַל אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ קֶרַע אֶחָד, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין מוֹסִיפִין עַל קֶרַע אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ.
human_translation: his father died, his mother died, his brother died, and his sister died, he may make one rent for all of them. Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: For all one rent, for his father and mother another rent, as one must not add a rent for his father and mother.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "If one's father dies, if one's mother dies, if one's brother dies, if one's sister dies — one tears one garment for all of them. Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: For all of them, one tears one garment; for one's father and mother, one tears one garment, because we do not add on for the tearing for one's father and mother."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: לְפִי שֶׁאֵינָן בְּתוֹסֶפֶת.
human_translation: What is the reason Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Because they cannot be added;
llm_translation: What is the reason? Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Because they are not included in the additional measure.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה. וּמִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי הַמֵּיקֵל בְּאֵבֶל! אֲבֵילוּת לְחוּד, קְרִיעָה לְחוּד.
human_translation: Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira. And did Shmuel say this? But didn’t Shmuel say the halakha is in accordance with the statement lenient mourning; mourning are discrete rending are discrete,
llm_translation: Samuel said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yehudah ben Beteira. And who said so? Didn't Samuel say: The halakha is according to the lenient opinion in matters of mourning! Lamentation separately, tearing separately.

hebrew_text: עַד הֵיכָן קוֹרֵעַ — עַד טִיבּוּרוֹ, וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: עַד לִבּוֹ. אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין רְאָיָה לְדָבָר, זֵכֶר לַדָּבָר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְקִרְעוּ לְבַבְכֶם וְאַל בִּגְדֵיכֶם״.
human_translation: Until where he rend until his navel. Some say: Until his heart. Although there is no proof for the matter an allusion to this matter, as it is stated: “And rend your hearts, and not your garments”
llm_translation: Until where does one rend? Until his heart, and some say: Until his garment. Even though there is no proof for the matter, it is a remembrance of the matter, as it is said: "Rend your hearts, and not your garments."

hebrew_text: הִגִּיעַ לְטִיבּוּרוֹ — מַרְחִיק שָׁלֹשׁ אֶצְבָּעוֹת וְקוֹרֵעַ. נִתְמַלֵּא מִלְּפָנָיו — מַחְזִירוֹ לַאֲחוֹרָיו. נִתְמַלֵּא מִלְּמַעְלָה — הוֹפְכוֹ מִלְּמַטָּה. וְהַקּוֹרֵעַ מִלְּמַטָּה וּמִן הַצְּדָדִין — לֹא יָצָא. אֶלָּא שֶׁכֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל פּוֹרֵם מִלְּמַטָּה.
human_translation: he reached his navel, he should move away three fingerbreadths and make rent. became full in the front, he should turn front to back it became full above, he should turn it the bottom. But one who rends at the bottom or at the sides has not fulfilled The High Priest, however, may tear at the bottom
llm_translation: He reached his navel - he extends three fingers and tears. If it is filled from in front of him - he returns it behind him. If it is filled from above - he turns it from below. And one who tears from below and from the sides - has not fulfilled his obligation. Rather, the High Priest tears from below.

hebrew_text: פְּלִיגוּ בַּהּ רַב מַתְנָה וּמָר עוּקְבָא, וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דַּאֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל וְלֵוִי. חַד אָמַר: כֹּל שִׁבְעָה קוֹרֵעַ, לְאַחַר שִׁבְעָה — מוֹסִיף. וְחַד אָמַר: כׇּל שְׁלֹשִׁים קוֹרֵעַ, לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים — מוֹסִיף.
human_translation: Rav Mattana and Mar Ukva disagreed about and both of them in the name of Shmuel’s father and Levi. One said: all seven he makes rent; after seven he adds And one said: all thirty days he makes after thirty he adds
llm_translation: They disputed it: Rav Matna and Mar Ukva, and both of them from the lineage of the father of Shmuel and Levi. One said: Anyone who tears seven, after seven - adds. And one said: Anyone who tears thirty, after thirty - adds.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא: מַאן דְּאָמַר כׇּל שִׁבְעָה קוֹרֵעַ, אַמַּאי — דְּלֹא נִיתַּן לְשׁוֹלְלוֹ, אֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר מָר: הָאִשָּׁה שׁוֹלַלְתּוֹ לְאַלְתַּר, הָכָא נָמֵי?!
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira strongly objects to this: the one who said all seven he makes rent, why he may not tack it But that which the Master said a woman may tack immediately, here also
llm_translation: Rebbe Zeira objects to her: Who says that anyone who tears seven garments, why? - because it is not given to him to take it off, but this that the Master said: "The woman undresses him immediately," here too?!

hebrew_text: הָתָם מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹד אִשָּׁה הוּא.
human_translation: There due to the woman’s honor,
llm_translation: There, because of the honor of a woman, it is.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר כׇּל שְׁלֹשִׁים קוֹרֵעַ, אַמַּאי — דְּלֹא נִיתַּן לְאַחוֹתוֹ. אֶלָּא לְאָבִיו וּלְאִמּוֹ, דְּלֹא נִיתַּן לְאַחוֹתוֹ לְעוֹלָם, הָכִי נָמֵי?!
human_translation: the one who said all thirty days one must make rent why one is not given mend But for one’s father or mother, which is not given ever mend it, so too
llm_translation: The one who says, "Anyone who is thirty tears," why? Because it is not given to his sister. Rather, to his father and to his mother, for it is never given to his sister, is it not so?!

hebrew_text: הָתָם מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹד אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ הוּא.
human_translation: There due to the honor due to his father and mother.
llm_translation: There, because of the honor of his father and mother, he is.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַיּוֹצֵא בְּבֶגֶד קָרוּעַ לִפְנֵי הַמֵּת — הֲרֵי זֶה גּוֹזֵל אֶת הַמֵּתִים וְאֶת הַחַיִּים.
human_translation: The Sages taught One who goes out before the deceased in a rent garment steals from the dead, And from the living,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who goes out with a torn garment before the deceased — behold, this one steals from the dead and the living.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר, הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ: הַשְׁאִילֵנִי חֲלוּקְךָ וְאֵלֵךְ וַאֲבַקֵּר אֶת אַבָּא שֶׁהוּא חוֹלֶה, וְהָלַךְ וּמְצָאוֹ שֶׁמֵּת — קוֹרֵעַ וּמְאַחוֹ, וּכְשֶׁיָּבֹא לְבֵיתוֹ מַחֲזִיר לוֹ חֲלוּקוֹ, וְנוֹתֵן לוֹ דְּמֵי קִרְעוֹ. וְאִם לֹא הוֹדִיעוֹ — הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִגַּע בּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: one who says to his fellow: Lend me your cloak and I will go and visit my father because he is sick, and he goes and finds that has died, he rends and mend it And when he returns home, he returns the cloak and pays him the value of the rent, But if one did not inform he must not touch it,
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says, one who says to his fellow: "Lend me your sickle and I will go and check on my father who is ill," and he goes and finds him dead — he rends and mourns, and when he comes back home, he returns his sickle to him, and gives him the price of its rental. But if he did not inform him — he should not touch it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חוֹלֶה שֶׁמֵּת לוֹ מֵת — אֵין מוֹדִיעִין אוֹתוֹ שֶׁמֵּת, שֶׁמָּא תִּטָּרֵף דַּעְתּוֹ עָלָיו. וְאֵין מְקָרְעִין בְּפָנָיו, וּמְשַׁתְּקִין אֶת הַנָּשִׁים מִפָּנָיו.
human_translation: The Sages taught of a sick dies, do not inform him that died, lest he lose control of his mind And may not rend in his presence, And we silence the women in his presence,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If a person is sick and dies, we do not inform him that he has died, lest his mind become distressed. We do not tear our garments in his presence, and we silence the women from wailing before him.

hebrew_text: וּמְקָרְעִין לַקָּטָן מִפְּנֵי עׇגְמַת נֶפֶשׁ. וְקוֹרְעִין עַל חָמִיו וְעַל חֲמוֹתוֹ, מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד אִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: And rend of a minor child in order to arouse grief. And one rends for his father-in-law or mother-in-law, although due to the honor of his wife,
llm_translation: And tear for the minor because of distress of soul. And tearing on his father and on his mother, because of the honor of his wife.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, תָּנָא בְּאֵבֶל רַבָּתִי: אָבֵל לֹא יַנִּיחַ תִּינוֹק בְּתוֹךְ חֵיקוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמְּבִיאוֹ לִידֵי שְׂחוֹק, וְנִמְצָא מִתְגַּנֶּה עַל הַבְּרִיּוֹת.
human_translation: And Rav Pappa said: taught in Evel Rabbati : A mourner should not place child in his lap because will bring him to laughter, and he will be disgraced in other people
llm_translation: And Rav Papa said, it was taught in a braita in the matter of mourning: One in mourning should not place a baby in his lap, because it may lead to laughter, and he will be found mocking the creatures.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין מַבְרִין עַל מִטּוֹת זְקוּפוֹת. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַהוֹלֵךְ לְבֵית הָאֵבֶל, אִם הָיָה לִבּוֹ גַּס בּוֹ — יַבְרוּהוּ עַל מִטּוֹת כְּפוּיוֹת. וְאִם לָאו — יַבְרוּהוּ עַל מִטּוֹת זְקוּפוֹת.
human_translation: And provide the meal only on an upright bed The Sages taught one who goes to the house of the mourner, if he is confident with him they provide him with the meal of comfort on overturned beds. And if not he should be fed on upright beds.
llm_translation: And one does not spread a bed on raised beds. The Rabbis taught: One who goes to a house of mourning, if his heart is arrogant within him, they should spread a bed for him on low beds. And if not, they should spread a bed for him on raised beds.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אִיתְּרַע בֵּיהּ מִילְּתָא, עַל לְגַבֵּיהּ אַבָּא בַּר מָרְתָא, דְּהוּא אַבָּא בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי. רָבָא זָקֵיף, אַבָּא בַּר מָרְתָא כָּפֵי. אֲמַר: כַּמָּה לֵית בֵּיהּ דַּעְתָּא לְהַאי צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: something happened to Rava, Abba bar Marta, who Abba bar Minyomi, entered him. Rava stood upright, Abba bar Marta overturned said: How lacking in sense is this Torah scholar.
llm_translation: Rava was troubled by a matter, Abba bar Marta was with him, who is Abba bar Minyomei. Rava was standing, Abba bar Marta was sitting. He said: How much wisdom does this young man have to challenge the elders.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַהוֹלֵךְ מִמָּקוֹם לְמָקוֹם
human_translation: The Sages taught one who was going from place to place
llm_translation: The rabbis taught: one who walks from place to place

hebrew_text: אִם יָכוֹל לְמַעֵט בְּעִסְקוֹ — יְמַעֵט, וְאִם לָאו — יְגַלְגֵּל עִמָּהֶן.
human_translation: if he can reduce his business, he should reduce and if not, he may carry on with them,
llm_translation: If he can do a little in his business - he should do a little, and if not - he should roll with them.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מֵאֵימָתַי כּוֹפִין אֶת הַמִּטּוֹת — מִשֶּׁיֵּצֵא מִפֶּתַח בֵּיתוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: מִשֶּׁיִּסָּתֵם הַגּוֹלֵל.
human_translation: The Sages taught From when do overturn beds? From when is taken out of the opening of his house; the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. Rabbi Yehoshua says: From when the is sealed the grave cover.
llm_translation: The sages taught: From when do we tie the bed ropes? - From when he leaves the entrance of his house, the words of Rabbi Eliezer. Rabbi Yehoshua says: From when the scroll is rolled up.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁמֵּת רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הַזָּקֵן, כֵּיוָן שֶׁיָּצָא מִפֶּתַח בֵּיתוֹ אָמַר לָהֶם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: כְּפוּ מִטּוֹתֵיכֶם. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁנִּסְתַּם הַגּוֹלֵל, אָמַר לָהֶם רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: כְּפוּ מִטּוֹתֵיכֶם. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: כְּבָר כָּפִינוּ עַל פִּי זָקֵן.
human_translation: an incident which Rabban Gamliel the Elder died, once left the opening of his house, Rabbi Eliezer said to Overturn your beds. And once the was sealed the grave cover, Rabbi Yehoshua said to them: Overturn your beds. They said to him: We already overturned in accordance with the Elder,
llm_translation: The incident when Rabban Gamliel the Elder died, once he exited the entrance of his house, he said to them, "Rabbi Eliezer: Make your beds." And once the skullcap was covered, Rabbi Yehoshua said to them, "Make your beds." They said to him, "We have already made them according to the elder's mouth."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מֵאֵימָתַי זוֹקְפִין אֶת הַמִּטּוֹת בְּעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — מִן הַמִּנְחָה וּלְמַעְלָה. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר הוּנָא: אַף עַל פִּי כֵן אֵינוֹ יוֹשֵׁב עָלֶיהָ עַד שֶׁתֶּחְשַׁךְ. וּלְמוֹצָאֵי שַׁבָּת, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ לֵישֵׁב אֶלָּא יוֹם אֶחָד — חוֹזֵר וְכוֹפֶה.
human_translation: The Sages taught From when do stand beds upright on Friday; From minḥa onward. Rabba bar Huna said: Even so, one may not sit down on until it becomes dark And at the conclusion of Shabbat, even if he has only one day to sit he must again overturn
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: From when do we arrange the beds on Erev Shabbat? — From the Mincha prayer onwards. Rabbah bar Huna said: Nevertheless, one should not lie on it until it gets dark. And at the conclusion of Shabbat, even though one only has time to sit for one day, he should still rearrange and make the bed.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַכּוֹפֶה מִטָּתוֹ, לֹא מִטָּתוֹ בִּלְבַד הוּא כּוֹפֶה, אֶלָּא כׇּל מִטּוֹת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ הוּא כּוֹפֶה. וַאֲפִילּוּ יֵשׁ לוֹ עֶשֶׂר מִטּוֹת בַּעֲשָׂרָה מְקוֹמוֹת — כּוֹפֶה אֶת כּוּלָּן. וַאֲפִילּוּ חֲמִשָּׁה אַחִין וּמֵת אֶחָד — כּוּלָּן כּוֹפִין.
human_translation: The Sages taught one who overturn his bed, he overturns not only his bed, but rather he overturns all the beds he has in his house. And even if he has ten beds in ten places, he overturns them all. And even five brothers and one died, all of them overturn
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who covers his bed, he is not just covering his bed alone, rather, any beds that he has within his house he is covering. And even if he has ten beds in ten different places, he covers all of them. And even if there are five brothers and one of them dies, all of them cover.

hebrew_text: וְאִם הָיְתָה מִטָּה הַמְיוּחֶדֶת לְכֵלִים — אֵין צָרִיךְ לִכְפּוֹתָהּ. דַּרְגֵּשׁ — אֵין צָרִיךְ לִכְפּוֹתוֹ, אֶלָּא זוֹקְפוֹ. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: דַּרְגֵּשׁ מַתִּיר אֶת קַרְבִּיטָיו וְהוּא נוֹפֵל מֵאֵילָיו.
human_translation: If, however, it is a bed designated garments he is not required to overturn it. It is not necessary to overturn a dargash , but rather he stands it upright. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: a dargash , one loosens its loops [ karbitav ], and it falls on its own.
llm_translation: And if the bed was designated for vessels - it is not necessary to cover it. A footstool - it is not necessary to cover it, but to stand it. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: a footstool permits his knives and it falls from his hands.

hebrew_text: מַאי דַּרְגֵּשׁ? אָמַר עוּלָּא: עַרְסָא דְגַדָּא.
human_translation: What dargash ? Ulla said: luck [ gada ] bed,
llm_translation: What is "dargesh"? Ula said: The axe handle of a fish.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה גַּבֵּי מֶלֶךְ, דִּתְנַן: כׇּל הָעָם מְסוּבִּים עַל הָאָרֶץ, וְהוּא מֵיסֵב עַל הַדַּרְגֵּשׁ. מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּעַד הָאִידָּנָא לָא אוֹתְבִינֵּיהּ, וְהַשְׁתָּא מוֹתְבִינַן לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Rabba said to him: However, if so, with regard to a king as we learned all the people recline on the ground, and he, reclines on a dargash . Is there anything upon which we would not have seated him until now, but now, we seat him on it?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabba: Rather, regarding a king, as we learned: "All the people are standing on the ground, and he is sitting on a platform." When is there a difference? Until now, we did not understand it, but now we understand it.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: מַאי קוּשְׁיָא? מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַאֲכִילָה וּשְׁתִיָּה, דְּעַד הָאִידָּנָא לָא אוֹכְלִינֵּיהּ וְלָא אַשְׁקִינֵּיהּ, הַשְׁתָּא אוֹכְלִינֵּיהּ וְאַשְׁקִינֵּיהּ!
human_translation: Rav Ashi strongly objects to this: What is the difficulty just as it is in eating and drinking, until now, we did not feed him or give him drink, now we feed him and give him drink
llm_translation: He (Rav Ashi) strongly objects to her (the woman's) (statement): What is the difficulty? Since it was (the food and drink) prepared for eating and drinking, until now I have not eaten it nor have I drunk it, now I will eat it and drink it!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אִי קַשְׁיָא — הָא קַשְׁיָא, דִּתְנַן: דַּרְגֵּשׁ אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לִכְפּוֹתוֹ אֶלָּא זוֹקְפוֹ. וְאִי עַרְסָא דְגַדָּא, אַמַּאי אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לִכְפּוֹתוֹ? הָא תְּנַן: הַכּוֹפֶה מִטָּתוֹ, לֹא מִטָּתוֹ בִּלְבַד הוּא כּוֹפֶה, אֶלָּא כׇּל מִטּוֹת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ כּוֹפֶה!
human_translation: Rather, if it difficult, this difficult, as we learned It is not necessary to overturn a dargash , but rather he stands it upright. But if it is luck bed, why is it not necessary to overturn it? Didn’t we learn: One who overturn his bed overturns not only his bed, but rather he overturns all the beds in his house,
llm_translation: Rather, if it is difficult - this is the difficulty, as we learned: One who smooths does not need to press it, only to stand it up. And if it is a large bed, why does one not need to press it? This is what we learned: One who strikes his bed, he is not only striking his bed alone, but he is striking all the beds that he has in his house!

hebrew_text: וּמַאי קַשְׁיָא? מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַמִּטָּה הַמְיוּחֶדֶת לְכֵלִים. דְּתַנְיָא: אִם הָיְתָה מִטָּה הַמְיוּחֶדֶת לְכֵלִים — אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לִכְפּוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: And what difficult just as it is in a bed designated for garments, as it is taught If it is a bed designated for garments, one is not required to overturn it.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And what is the difficulty? Because it is considered a bed designated for utensils. For it was taught: If it was a bed designated for utensils - there is no need to overturn it.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אִי קַשְׁיָא הָא קַשְׁיָא: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: דַּרְגֵּשׁ, מַתִּיר קַרְבִּיטָיו וְהוּא נוֹפֵל מֵאֵילָיו. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ עַרְסָא דְגַדָּא, מַאי קַרְבִּיטִין אִית לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Rather if it difficult, this is the difficulty: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: a dargash , one loosens the loops and it falls on its own. And if it enters your mind a luck bed, what loops does it have?
llm_translation: Rather, this is difficult, that is difficult: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: He stumbles, he loosens his knife and it falls from his hand. And if it enters your mind, the handle of a fish, what knives does it have?

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן, וְרַב תַּחְלִיפָא בַּר מַעְרְבָא שְׁמֵיהּ, דַּהֲוָה שְׁכִיחַ בְּשׁוּקָא דְגִילְדָּאֵי: מַאי דַּרְגֵּשׁ — עַרְסָא דְצַלָּא.
human_translation: When Ravin came one of the Sages, whose name was Rav Taḥalifa from the West, who was frequently in the market of leather workers, said to him: What is a dargash ? a leather bed.
llm_translation: When Ravin came, he said to him: That one from the Sages, and Rav Tachlifa bar Ma'arva is his name, who was often in the market of Gildaei. What is "dargesh"? - A bolt of shade.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: דַּרְגֵּשׁ — סֵירוּגוֹ מִתּוֹכוֹ, מִטָּה — סֵירוּגָהּ עַל גַּבָּהּ.
human_translation: It was also stated Rabbi Yirmeya said: A dargash its interlacing from the inside, a bed its interlacing from the outside,
llm_translation: It was stated: Naḥmani said, Rabbi Yirmeya said: Darges - its lattice from within it, from below - its lattice on top of it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אַחָא אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אַחָא אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי: מִטָּה שֶׁנַּקְלִיטֶיהָ יוֹצְאִין — זוֹקְפָהּ וְדַיּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov bar Aḥa said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel It was also stated Rabbi Ya’akov bar Aḥa said in the name of Rabbi Asi: A bed whose posts [ naklitin ] extend, may be stood upright and that is sufficient.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yaakov bar Acha said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: The halacha is according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. It was also stated: Rabbi Yaakov bar Acha said Rabbi Assi: From a bed that has been dismantled, its occupants may leave - if it is standing, it is sufficient.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יָשֵׁן עַל גַּבֵּי כִּסֵּא, עַל גַּבֵּי אוּדְיָינִי גְּדוֹלָה, עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע — לֹא יָצָא יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שֶׁלֹּא קִיֵּים כְּפִיַּית הַמִּטָּה.
human_translation: The Sages taught sleeps on a chair, on a large mortar, on the ground, he does not fulfill his obligation, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: because he did not fulfill overturning the bed.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One who sleeps on the back of a chair, on the back of a large peg, or on the ground - he has not fulfilled his obligation. Rabbi Yochanan said: Unless he has fulfilled the leaning of the bed.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מְכַבְּדִין וּמַרְבִּיצִין בְּבֵית הָאֵבֶל, וּמְדִיחִין קְעָרוֹת וְכוֹסוֹת וּצְלוֹחִיּוֹת וְקִיתוֹנִיּוֹת בְּבֵית הָאֵבֶל. וְאֵין מְבִיאִין אֶת הַמּוּגְמָר וְאֶת הַבְּשָׂמִים לְבֵית הָאֵבֶל.
human_translation: The Sages taught One may sweep and sprinkle in the house of a mourner, and one may wash bowls, cups, jugs, and pitchers in the house of a mourner. But one may not bring incense or spices into the house of a mourner.
llm_translation: The sages taught: One may honor and comfort mourners in the house of mourning, and may rinse bowls, cups, and dishes in the house of mourning. However, one may not bring the final meal and spices to the house of mourning.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָא תָּנֵי בַּר קַפָּרָא: אֵין מְבָרְכִין לֹא עַל הַמּוּגְמָר וְלֹא עַל הַבְּשָׂמִים בְּבֵית הָאֵבֶל. בָּרוֹכֵי הוּא דְּלָא מְבָרְכִין, הָא אֵתוֹיֵי — מַיְיתִינַן!
human_translation: Is that so? But doesn’t bar Kappara teach One may not recite a blessing either over incense or over fragrant spices in the house of a mourner? one may not recite a blessing but one may bring them
llm_translation: I am not? But didn't Bar Kappara teach: One does not recite blessings neither over the shrouded body nor over the spices in the house of mourning. Those who do recite blessings, they are not reciting blessings, but rather — they are bringing trouble!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּבֵית הָאֵבֶל, הָא — בְּבֵית הַמְנַחֲמִין.
human_translation: It is not difficult. Here, to the house of a mourner, there, to the house of the consolers,
llm_translation: Not difficult: this - in the house of mourning, this - in the house of comforters.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין מוֹלִיכִין לְבֵית הָאֵבֶל, לֹא בְּטַבְלָא, וְלֹא בְּאִסְקוּטְלָא, וְלֹא בְּקָנוֹן, אֶלָּא בְּסַלִּים. וְאֵין אוֹמְרִים בִּרְכַּת אֲבֵלִים בַּמּוֹעֵד, אֲבָל עוֹמְדִין בְּשׁוּרָה וּמְנַחֲמִין, וּפוֹטְרִין אֶת הָרַבִּים.
human_translation: One does not bring to the house of mourning on a small tray [ tavla ], in a bowl [ iskutla ], or in a narrow-mouthed basket [ kanon ], but rather in baskets. And the mourners’ blessing is not recited on a Festival, but stand in a row and console And dismiss the many
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One does not bring to the house of mourning, neither with a tambourine, nor with a flute, nor with a harp, but with cymbals. And one does not recite the blessing of mourners on a festival, but stands in a row and consoles, and dismisses the crowd.

hebrew_text: אֵין מַנִּיחִין אֶת הַמִּטָּה בָּרְחוֹב, שֶׁלֹּא לְהַרְגִּיל אֶת הַהֶסְפֵּד. וְלֹא שֶׁל נָשִׁים לְעוֹלָם, מִפְּנֵי הַכָּבוֹד.
human_translation: The bier is not set down in the street so as not to encourage eulogies. And of women never due to their honor.
llm_translation: We do not place the bed in the street, so as not to accustom the mourning. And not the women's bed forever, because of honor.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ מוֹלִיכִין בְּבֵית הָאֵבֶל, עֲשִׁירִים — בִּקְלָתוֹת שֶׁל כֶּסֶף וְשֶׁל זָהָב, וַעֲנִיִּים — בְּסַלֵּי נְצָרִים שֶׁל עֲרָבָה קְלוּפָה, וְהָיוּ עֲנִיִּים מִתְבַּיְּישִׁים. הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ הַכֹּל מְבִיאִין בְּסַלֵּי נְצָרִים שֶׁל עֲרָבָה קְלוּפָה, מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹדָן שֶׁל עֲנִיִּים.
human_translation: The Sages taught At first, would be brought to the house of the mourner The wealthy in baskets of silver and gold, and the poor baskets of peeled willow branches. And the poor were embarrassed, instituted that everyone should bring in baskets of peeled willow branches, due to the honor of the poor.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Initially, they would lead the wealthy individuals into the house of mourning with cushions of silver and gold, and the poor individuals with baskets of peeled willow branches, and the poor would feel ashamed. They established that everyone should bring baskets of peeled willow branches, out of respect for the poor.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ מַשְׁקִין בְּבֵית הָאֵבֶל, עֲשִׁירִים — בִּזְכוּכִית לְבָנָה, וַעֲנִיִּים — בִּזְכוּכִית צְבוּעָה, וְהָיוּ עֲנִיִּים מִתְבַּיְּישִׁין. הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ הַכֹּל מַשְׁקִין בִּזְכוּכִית צְבוּעָה, מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹדָן שֶׁל עֲנִיִּים.
human_translation: The Sages taught At first, they would serve in the house of the mourner wealthy in white glass, and poor in colored glass. And the poor were embarrassed, instituted that all should serve drinks in colored glass due to the honor of the poor.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Initially, they would provide drinks in the house of mourning, the wealthy - in glass vessels, and the poor - in colored vessels, and the poor would be embarrassed. They instituted that everyone should be provided drinks in colored vessels, out of respect for the poor.

hebrew_text: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ מְגַלִּין פְּנֵי עֲשִׁירִים וּמְכַסִּין פְּנֵי עֲנִיִּים, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהָיוּ מוּשְׁחָרִין פְּנֵיהֶן מִפְּנֵי בַצּוֹרֶת, וְהָיוּ עֲנִיִּים מִתְבַּיְּישִׁין. הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ מְכַסִּין פְּנֵי הַכֹּל, מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹדָן שֶׁל עֲנִיִּים.
human_translation: at first they would uncover the faces of the wealthy and cover the faces of the poor, because their faces were blackened by famine. And the poor were embarrassed instituted that everyone’s face should be covered, due to the honor of the poor.
llm_translation: Initially, they would reveal the faces of the wealthy and cover the faces of the poor, because their faces would be pale due to hunger, and the poor would be embarrassed. They established that the faces of everyone should be covered, out of respect for the dignity of the poor.

hebrew_text: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ מוֹצִיאִין עֲשִׁירִים בְּדַרְגֵּשׁ, וַעֲנִיִּים
human_translation: at first the wealthy would take out on a dargash , and the poor
llm_translation: Initially, they would bring out the wealthy with dignity, and the poor...

hebrew_text: בִּכְלִיכָה, וְהָיוּ עֲנִיִּים מִתְבַּיְּישִׁין. הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ הַכֹּל מוֹצִיאִין בִּכְלִיכָה, מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹדָן שֶׁל עֲנִיִּים.
human_translation: on a plain bier and the poor were embarrassed. instituted that everyone should be taken out on a plain bier, due to the honor of the poor.
llm_translation: In their vessels, and they were embarrassed. They established that everyone should bring out in their vessels, out of respect for the poor.

hebrew_text: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ מַנִּיחִין אֶת הַמּוּגְמָר תַּחַת חוֹלֵי מֵעַיִם מֵתִים, וְהָיוּ חוֹלֵי מֵעַיִם חַיִּים מִתְבַּיְּישִׁין. הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ מַנִּיחִין תַּחַת הַכֹּל, מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹדָן שֶׁל חוֹלֵי מֵעַיִם חַיִּים.
human_translation: at first they would place incense under those who died with an intestinal disease, And those who were alive with an intestinal disease were embarrassed instituted that incense should be placed under everyone, due to the honor of those with an intestinal disease who were living.
llm_translation: Initially, they would place the mugmar beneath the dead intestinal patients, and the living intestinal patients would feel ashamed. They established that it should be placed beneath everyone, out of respect for the living intestinal patients.

hebrew_text: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ מַטְבִּילִין אֶת הַכֵּלִים עַל גַּבֵּי נִדּוֹת מֵתוֹת, וְהָיוּ נִדּוֹת חַיּוֹת מִתְבַּיְּישׁוֹת. הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ מַטְבִּילִין עַל גַּבֵּי כׇּל הַנָּשִׁים, מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹדָן שֶׁל נִדּוֹת חַיּוֹת. בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה מַטְבִּילִין עַל גַּבֵּי זָבִין מֵתִים, וְהָיוּ זָבִין חַיִּים מִתְבַּיְּישִׁין. הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיְּהוּ מַטְבִּילִין עַל גַּב הַכֹּל, מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹדָן שֶׁל זָבִין חַיִּים.
human_translation: at first they would immerse the utensils by died menstruating, And the living menstruating women were embarrassed. instituted that by all women must be immersed, due to the honor of living menstruating women. at first they would immerse the utensils zavin , who died, And the living zavin felt embarrassed. instituted that by all must be immersed, due to the honor of the living zavin .
llm_translation: In the beginning, they would immerse the vessels on top of the impurity of the dead, and the impure dead would be embarrassed. They established that they should immerse on top of all women, out of respect for the impure dead. Initially, they would immerse on top of the impurity of the living male discharge, and the living dischargers would be embarrassed. They established that they should immerse upon everyone, out of respect for the living dischargers.

hebrew_text: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיְתָה הוֹצָאַת הַמֵּת קָשָׁה לִקְרוֹבָיו יוֹתֵר מִמִּיתָתוֹ, עַד שֶׁהָיוּ קְרוֹבָיו מַנִּיחִין אוֹתוֹ וּבוֹרְחִין. עַד שֶׁבָּא רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְנָהַג קַלּוּת רֹאשׁ בְּעַצְמוֹ, וְיָצָא בִּכְלֵי פִשְׁתָּן, וְנָהֲגוּ הָעָם אַחֲרָיו לָצֵאת בִּכְלֵי פִשְׁתָּן. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: וְהָאִידָּנָא נְהוּג עָלְמָא אֲפִילּוּ בְּצַרְדָּא בַּר זוּזָא.
human_translation: at first taking the dead out was more difficult for the relatives than the death, to the point that relatives would abandon and run away. until Rabban Gamliel came and acted frivolity, taken out in linen garments. And the people practice after him taken out in linen garments. Rav Pappa said: And nowadays, everyone follows the practice even in hemp garments [ tzerada ] a dinar.
llm_translation: In the beginning, the removal of the deceased was more difficult for his relatives than his actual death, until his relatives would leave him and flee. Until Rabban Gamliel came and personally took charge of the matter, and he went out wearing linen garments, and the people followed him in wearing linen garments. Rav Papa said: And nowadays, it is customary for people to go out even in a linen undershirt.

hebrew_text: אֵין מַנִּיחִין אֶת הַמִּטָּה בָּרְחוֹב. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אֵין מוֹעֵד בִּפְנֵי תַּלְמִיד חָכָם, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן חֲנוּכָּה וּפוּרִים.
human_translation: The bier is not set down in the street Rav Pappa said: no a Festival in the presence Torah scholar, And all the more so Hanukkah and Purim,
llm_translation: We do not place the bed in the street. Rav Papa said: One does not schedule a meeting in front of a Torah scholar, and all the more so Hanukkah and Purim.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּפָנָיו, אֲבָל שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו — לָא. אִינִי?! וְהָא רַב כָּהֲנָא סַפְדֵיהּ לְרַב זְבִיד מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא בְּפוּם נַהֲרָא! אָמַר רַב פַּפֵּי: יוֹם שְׁמוּעָה הֲוָה, וְכִבְפָנָיו דָּמֵי.
human_translation: But this applies only in presence However, not in his presence not Is that so? But didn’t Rav Kahana eulogize Rav Zevid from Neharde’a in Pum Nahara Rav Pappa said: It was the day news and is considered as in his presence.
llm_translation: These are the words in his presence, but not in his presence - no. Is it not so?! And behold, Rav Kahana rebuked Rav Zebid from Nehardea in the presence of the river! Rav Pappi said: It was a day of hearing, and like in his presence are the consequences.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: הֶסְפֵּד עַל לֵב, דִּכְתִיב: ״עַל שָׁדַיִם סוֹפְדִים״. טִיפּוּחַ בַּיָּד. קִילּוּס בָּרֶגֶל.
human_translation: Ulla said: hesped on the heart, as it is written: “Striking [ sofedim ] the breasts” tipuaḥ with hand killus with foot
llm_translation: Ula said: Eulogize upon the heart, as it is written: "Upon breasts they lament." Clapping with the hand. Stomping with the foot.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמְקַלֵּס — לֹא יְקַלֵּס בְּסַנְדָּל, אֶלָּא בְּמִנְעָל, מִפְּנֵי הַסַּכָּנָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught One who stomps his foot on the ground should not stomp with a sandal, but rather a shoe, due to the danger
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One who curses — should not curse with a sandal, but with a shoe, due to danger.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אָבֵל, כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּיעְנַע רֹאשׁוֹ — שׁוּב אֵין מְנַחֲמִין רַשָּׁאִין לֵישֵׁב אֶצְלוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Once a mourner nods his head the consolers may no longer sit next to him,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "But once his head is bowed, the wicked are not comforted to sit beside him."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַכֹּל חַיָּיבִין לַעֲמוֹד מִפְּנֵי נָשִׂיא, חוּץ מֵאָבֵל וְחוֹלֶה. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לַכֹּל אוֹמְרִים לָהֶם ״שֵׁבוּ״, חוּץ מֵאָבֵל וְחוֹלֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan further said: All are obligated to stand presence of the Nasi , except for a mourner and one who is sick. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: To all one says: Be seated, except for a mourner and one who is sick.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: Everyone is obligated to stand up before a prince, except for a mourner and a sick person. And Rabbi Yochanan said: To everyone we say "Sit down," except for a mourner and a sick person.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אָבֵל, יוֹם רִאשׁוֹן אָסוּר לֶאֱכוֹל לֶחֶם מִשֶּׁלּוֹ, מִדַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לִיחֶזְקֵאל: ״וְלֶחֶם אֲנָשִׁים לֹא תֹאכֵל״. רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף מְחַלְּפִי סְעוֹדָתַיְיהוּ לַהֲדָדֵי.
