human_translation: Rav Yehuda said in the name of Rav: A mourner first day is prohibited from eating of his own bread. From the Merciful One says to Ezekiel “Nor eat the bread of men” Rabba and Rav Yosef would exchange their meals with each other.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: On Shabbat, it is forbidden to eat bread that belongs to him, as the Merciful One said to Ezekiel: "And human bread you shall not eat." Rabbah and Rav Yosef would exchange their meals with each other.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מֵת בְּעִיר — כׇּל בְּנֵי הָעִיר אֲסוּרִין בַּעֲשִׂיַּית מְלָאכָה.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda said in the name of Rav: dies in a city, all of the residents of that city are prohibited from performing work
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: "If one dies in the city - all the inhabitants of the city are prohibited from performing labor."

hebrew_text: רַב הַמְנוּנָא אִיקְּלַע לְדֵרוּ מָתָא, שְׁמַע קוֹל שִׁיפּוּרָא דְשָׁכְבָא. חֲזָא הָנָךְ אִינָשֵׁי דְּקָא עָבְדִי עֲבִידְתָּא, אֲמַר לְהוּ: לֶיהְווֹ הָנָךְ אִינָשֵׁי בְּשַׁמְתָּא. לָא שָׁכְבָא אִיכָּא בְּמָתָא?! אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: חֲבוּרָתָא אִיכָּא בְּמָתָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִי הָכִי, שַׁרְיָא לְכוּ.
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna happened Darumata he heard the sound of a shofar had died he saw some people doing work he said to them: Let these people be under an excommunication. Is there not a dead in town? They said to him: There are groups in the town, He said to them: If so, it is permitted
llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna happened upon a certain village, he heard the sound of a rooster crowing. He saw people who were engaged in work, he said to them: "Let the people of this place be diligent." Is there no rooster in the village?! They said to him: "There is a group in the village." He said to them: "If so, you are permitted."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: כׇּל הַמִּתְקַשֶּׁה עַל מֵתוֹ יוֹתֵר מִדַּאי, עַל מֵת אַחֵר הוּא בּוֹכֶה. הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא דַּהֲוָת בְּשִׁיבָבוּתֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא, הֲווֹ לַהּ שִׁבְעָה בְּנֵי, מִית חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ, הֲווֹת קָא בָּכְיָא בִּיתִירֻתָא עֲלֵיהּ. שְׁלַח לַהּ רַב הוּנָא: לָא תַּעַבְדִי הָכִי! לָא אַשְׁגְּחָה בֵּיהּ. שְׁלַח לַהּ: אִי צָיְיתַתְּ — מוּטָב, וְאִי לָא — צְבִית זְוַודְתָּא לְאִידַּךְ מִית, וּמִיתוּ כּוּלְּהוּ. לְסוֹף אֲמַר לַהּ: תִּימוּשׁ זְוַודְתָּא לְנַפְשִׁיךְ, וּמִיתָא.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda said further in the name of Rav: Anyone who grieves excessively over his dead will weep for another a certain woman in the neighborhood of Rav Huna had seven sons. One of them died and she wept for him excessively. Rav Huna sent to her: Do not do this. she took no heed of him. He sent to her: If you listen to me, it is well, but if not, prepare shrouds for another death. and they all died. In the end, he said to her: prepare shrouds for yourself, and she died.
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Anyone who mourns excessively for his deceased, mourns for another deceased. There was a certain woman in the neighborhood of Rav Huna who had seven sons, one of whom died. She was crying excessively for him. Rav Huna sent to her: Do not act in this manner! I do not pay attention to it. He sent to her: If you listen — good, and if not — I will slaughter a fat chicken for you, and all of them will die. In the end, he said to her: Prepare a fat chicken for yourself, and you will die.

hebrew_text: ״אַל תִּבְכּוּ לְמֵת וְאַל תָּנוּדוּ לוֹ״. ״אַל תׇּבְכּוּ לְמֵת״ — יוֹתֵר מִדַּאי, ״וְאַל תָּנוּדוּ לוֹ״ — יוֹתֵר מִכְּשִׁיעוּר. הָא כֵּיצַד? שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים לְבֶכִי, וְשִׁבְעָה לְהֶסְפֵּד, וּשְׁלֹשִׁים לְגִיהוּץ וּלְתִסְפּוֹרֶת. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ — אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: אִי אַתֶּם רַחְמָנִים בּוֹ יוֹתֵר מִמֶּנִּי.
human_translation: “Weep not for the dead, neither bemoan him” “Weep not for the dead” excessive “neither bemoan him” more than the measure How so? Three days for weeping, and seven for eulogizing, and thirty for ironing and for cutting hair. From this forward the Holy One, Blessed be He, says: Do not be more merciful with than I am.
llm_translation: "Do not cry for the dead, and do not eulogize him." "Do not cry for the dead" - more than necessary, "and do not eulogize him" - more than the measure. How so? Three days for crying, and seven for eulogizing, and thirty for shaving and counting. From here onward - the Holy One, blessed be He, said: 'You are more merciful with him than I am.'"

hebrew_text: ״בְּכוּ בָכוֹ לַהוֹלֵךְ״, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: לַהוֹלֵךְ בְּלֹא בָּנִים. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי לָא אֲזַל לְבֵי אִבְלָא אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָזֵיל בְּלָא בְּנֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּכוּ בָכוֹ לַהוֹלֵךְ כִּי לֹא יָשׁוּב עוֹד וְרָאָה אֶת אֶרֶץ מוֹלַדְתּוֹ״. רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: זֶה שֶׁעָבַר עֲבֵירָה וְשָׁנָה בָּהּ.
human_translation: “Weep sore for him that goes away.” Rav Yehuda said: to one who leaves without children Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi go to a house of mourning only for one who passed away without children, as it is written: “Weep sore for him that goes away; for he shall return [ yashuv ] no more, nor see his native land” Rav Huna said: is who committed a transgression and repeated it,
llm_translation: "‘Weep, weep for the one who goes away,’ said Rav Yehudah: for one who goes away without children. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi did not go to the house of mourning except for one who goes away without children, as it is written: ‘Weep, weep for the one who goes away, for he shall not return again and see the land of his birth.’ Rav Huna said: This refers to one who committed a transgression and repeated it."

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָבַר אָדָם עֲבֵירָה וְשָׁנָה בָּהּ — הוּתְּרָה לוֹ. הוּתְּרָה לוֹ סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: נַעֲשֵׂית לוֹ כְּהֶיתֵּר.
human_translation: Rav Huna to his reasoning, Rav Huna said: Once a person commits a transgression and repeats it, it becomes permitted to him. Does it enter your mind permitted? Rather, say It becomes as though it were permitted,
llm_translation: Rav Huna according to his reasoning, as Rav Huna said: Once a person commits a transgression and repeats it - it becomes permitted for him. It becomes permitted for him - is it according to your opinion?! Rather say: It becomes for him as if permitted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: אָבֵל, שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים יִרְאֶה אֶת עַצְמוֹ כְּאִילּוּ חֶרֶב מוּנַּחַת לוֹ בֵּין שְׁתֵּי יַרְיכוֹתָיו. מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה עַד שִׁבְעָה — כְּאִילּוּ מוּנַּחַת לוֹ כְּנֶגְדּוֹ בְּקֶרֶן זָוִית, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ — כְּאִילּוּ עוֹבֶרֶת כְּנֶגְדּוֹ בַּשּׁוּק.
human_translation: Rabbi Levi said: A mourner the first three days should see himself as though a sword were lying between his two thighs, From the third to the seventh as if were lying opposite him in the corner, From this forward it is as if was moving before him in the marketplace,
llm_translation: Rabbi Levi said: A mourner, for the first three days, will see himself as if a sword is placed between his two thighs. From three to seven days — as if a sword is placed opposite him at a diagonal. Beyond that — as if a sword is passing by him in the marketplace.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא שֶׁל נָשִׁים לְעוֹלָם מִפְּנֵי הַכָּבוֹד. אָמְרִי נְהַרְדָּעֵי: לֹא שָׁנוּ
human_translation: And of women never due to honor. Neharde’a say: They only taught
llm_translation: "And not the obligation of women forever because of honor. The Nehardeans said: They did not teach differently."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא חָיָה. אֲבָל שְׁאָר נָשִׁים — מַנִּיחִין.
human_translation: a woman in childbirth, But other women may be set down
llm_translation: Rather, she is alive. But other women - we leave.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ שְׁאָר הַנָּשִׁים, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתָּמׇת שָׁם מִרְיָם וַתִּקָּבֵר שָׁם״ — סָמוּךְ לַמִּיתָה קְבוּרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Even other women as it is written: “And Miriam died there and was buried there” the burial was close to death.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Even other women, as it is written: "And Miriam died there and was buried there" - close to death is burial.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אַף מִרְיָם בִּנְשִׁיקָה מֵתָה. אָתְיָא ״שָׁם״ ״שָׁם״ מִמֹּשֶׁה. וּמִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא נֶאֱמַר בָּהּ ״עַל פִּי ה׳״ — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁגְּנַאי הַדָּבָר לְאוֹמְרוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said Miriam also died by kiss, This is derived “there” “there” with regard to Moses. For what was it not stated with regard to her, “by the mouth of the Lord”? because it would be unseemly to say such a thing,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: Even Miriam died from a kiss. It is derived "there" "there" from Moses. And why is it not stated in it "by the mouth of the Lord" - because it is derogatory to say it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: לָמָּה נִסְמְכָה מִיתַת מִרְיָם לְפָרָשַׁת פָּרָה אֲדוּמָּה? לוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה פָּרָה אֲדוּמָּה מְכַפֶּרֶת — אַף מִיתָתָן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים מְכַפֶּרֶת. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לָמָּה נִסְמְכָה מִיתַת אַהֲרֹן לְבִגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה? מָה בִּגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה מְכַפְּרִין — אַף מִיתָתָן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים מְכַפֶּרֶת.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said: Why was death of Miriam juxtaposed to the portion the red heifer? To tell you: Just as the red heifer atones so too, the death of the righteous atones Rabbi Elazar said: Why was death of Aaron juxtaposed to the priestly garments? just as the priestly garments atone so too, the death of the righteous atones
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi said: Why is the death of Miriam juxtaposed to the portion of the red heifer? To tell you: Just as the red heifer atones, so too the death of the righteous atones. Rabbi Elazar said: Why is the death of Aaron juxtaposed to the priestly garments? Just as the priestly garments atone, so too the death of the righteous atones.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מֵת פִּתְאוֹם — זוֹ הִיא מִיתָה חֲטוּפָה, חָלָה יוֹם אֶחָד וָמֵת — זוֹ הִיא מִיתָה דְּחוּפָה. רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: זוֹ הִיא מִיתַת מַגֵּפָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בֶּן אָדָם הִנְנִי לוֹקֵחַ מִמְּךָ אֶת מַחְמַד עֵינֶיךָ בְּמַגֵּפָה״, וּכְתִיב: ״וָאֲדַבֵּר אֶל הָעָם בַּבֹּקֶר וַתָּמׇת אִשְׁתִּי בָּעָרֶב״.
human_translation: The Sages taught dies suddenly this is death snatching. became sick for a day and died, this is an expedited death. Rabbi Ḥananya ben Gamliel says: This is death at a stroke, as it is stated: “Son of man, behold, I am about to take away from you the delight of your eyes at a stroke” And it is written: “So I spoke to the people in the morning and at evening my wife died”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "Sudden death" - this is death by a sudden stroke, he fell ill one day and died - this is death by a sudden stroke. Rabbi Hananiah ben Gamliel says: this is death by plague, as it is stated: "Son of man, behold, I take away from you the desire of your eyes with a plague," and it is written: "And I spoke to the people in the morning, and my wife died in the evening."

hebrew_text: שְׁנֵי יָמִים וָמֵת — זוֹ הִיא מִיתָה דְּחוּיָה. שְׁלֹשָׁה — גְּעָרָה. אַרְבָּעָה — נְזִיפָה. חֲמִשָּׁה — זוֹ הִיא מִיתַת כׇּל אָדָם.
human_translation: two days and died, this is a quickened death. three rebuke. four reprimand. five this is the death of all people.
llm_translation: Two days and he dies - this is a delayed death. Three - rebuke. Four - stoning. Five - this is the death of all men.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָנִין, מַאי קְרָא: ״הֵן קָרְבוּ יָמֶיךָ לָמוּת״. ״הֵן״ — חַד, ״קָרְבוּ״ — תְּרֵי, ״יָמֶיךָ״ — תְּרֵי, הָא חֲמִשָּׁה. ״הֵן״ חַד, שֶׁכֵּן בְּלָשׁוֹן יְוָנִי קוֹרִין לְאַחַת ״הֵן״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanin said: What is the verse “Behold, your days approach that you must die” “Behold [ hen ]” one; “approach [ karvu ],” two; “your days [ yamekha ],” two; this is five. hen one? Because in the Greek language they call one hen .
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanin said, what is the verse: "Behold, your days are drawing near to die." "Behold" - one, "drew near" - two, "your days" - two, totaling five. "Behold" is one, as in the Greek language they read "hen" as one.

hebrew_text: מֵת בַּחֲמִשִּׁים שָׁנָה — זוֹ הִיא מִיתַת כָּרֵת. חֲמִשִּׁים וּשְׁתַּיִם שָׁנָה — זוֹ הִיא מִיתָתוֹ שֶׁל שְׁמוּאֵל הָרָמָתִי. שִׁשִּׁים — זוֹ הִיא מִיתָה בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם.
human_translation: dies when fifty years this is death through karet , fifty-two years this is the death of Samuel from Ramah. sixty, this is death at the hand of Heaven.
llm_translation: Deceased at fifty years - this is the death of karet. Fifty-two years - this is the death of Shmuel the Ramatite. Sixty - this is death by the hand of Heaven.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: מַאי קְרָא — דִּכְתִיב: ״תָּבֹא בְּכֶלַח אֱלֵי קֶבֶר״, ״בְּכֶלַח״ בְּגִימַטְרִיָּא שִׁיתִּין הָווּ.
human_translation: Mar Zutra said: What is the verse As it is written: “You shall come to your grave in a ripe age [ bekhelaḥ ]” “ripe age” [ bekhelaḥ ] has the numerical value of sixty,
llm_translation: Master Zutra said: What is the verse referring to? As it is written: "You will come to your grave in full vigor," "in full vigor" in gematria equals sixty-two.

hebrew_text: שִׁבְעִים — שֵׂיבָה. שְׁמוֹנִים — גְּבוּרוֹת, דִּכְתִיב: ״יְמֵי שְׁנוֹתֵינוּ בָהֶם שִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה וְאִם בִּגְבוּרוֹת שְׁמוֹנִים שָׁנָה״. אָמַר רַבָּה: מֵחֲמִשִּׁים וְעַד שִׁשִּׁים שָׁנָה — זוֹ הִיא מִיתַת כָּרֵת. וְהַאי דְּלָא חָשֵׁיב לְהוּ — מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹדוֹ שֶׁל שְׁמוּאֵל הָרָמָתִי.
human_translation: seventy old age. eighty strength, as it is written: “The days of our years are seventy, or if by reason of strength, eighty years” Rabba said: from fifty to sixty years is death by karet . And all of these years were not counted due to the honor of Samuel from Ramah,
llm_translation: Seventy — old age. Eighty — strength, as it is written: "The days of our years are seventy years, and if with strength, eighty years." Rabbah said: From fifty to sixty years — this is the age of cutting off. And the reason it is not considered for them is out of respect for Samuel the Ramathite.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף כִּי הֲוָה בַּר שִׁיתִּין, עֲבַד לְהוּ יוֹמָא טָבָא לְרַבָּנַן, אָמַר: נְפַקִי לִי מִכָּרֵת. אָמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: נְהִי דִּנְפַק לֵיהּ מָר מִכָּרֵת דִּשְׁנֵי, מִכָּרֵת דְּיוֹמֵי מִי נָפֵיק מָר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נְקוֹט לָךְ מִיהָא פַּלְגָא בִּידָךְ.
human_translation: when Rav Yosef turned sixty he made a holiday for the Sages. he said: I have passed karet . Abaye said to him: Master, though you have passed the karet of years, have you, Master, escaped the karet of days? He said to him: Grasp at least half in your hand,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef, when he was a six-year-old boy, used to make a feast for the Rabbis every year. He said, "Bring me a knife." Abaye said to him, "Since the master has asked for a knife that is different from the usual knife, from where does the master get this knife?" He said to him, "Take for yourself half of it in your hand."

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ פִּתְאוֹם, הֲווֹ קָא דָּיְיגִי רַבָּנַן, תְּנָא לְהוּ זוּגָא דְּמֵהַדְיָיב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ לִגְבוּרוֹת, אֲבָל הִגִּיעַ לִגְבוּרוֹת — זוֹ הִיא מִיתַת נְשִׁיקָה.
human_translation: Rav Huna died suddenly, the Sages were concerned Zuga from Hadayeiv taught them They taught only when had not reached strength, But if he had reached strength this is death by way of a kiss.
llm_translation: Rav Huna suddenly passed away, the Rabbis were distressed. They taught them the pair of scholars: They only taught that if he did not reach the buttocks, but if he reached the buttocks - that is the death of a kiss.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: חַיֵּי, בְּנֵי וּמְזוֹנֵי, לָא בִּזְכוּתָא תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא, אֶלָּא בְּמַזָּלָא תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא. דְּהָא רַבָּה וְרַב חִסְדָּא תַּרְוַיְיהוּ רַבָּנַן צַדִּיקֵי הֲווֹ, מָר מְצַלֵּי וְאָתֵי מִיטְרָא וּמָר מְצַלֵּי וְאָתֵי מִיטְרָא,
human_translation: Rava said: life, children, and sustenance do not depend on merit, but rather they depend upon fate. As, Rabba and Rav Ḥisda were both pious Sages; Sage pray and rain would fall, and Sage pray and rain would fall.
llm_translation: Rava said: Life, children, and sustenance, do not depend on merit, rather they depend on luck. For Rabba and Rav Ḥisda, both were righteous scholars, one would pray for rain and it would come, and the other would pray for rain and it would come.

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא חֲיָה תִּשְׁעִין וְתַרְתֵּין שְׁנִין, רַבָּה חֲיָה אַרְבְּעִין. בֵּי רַב חִסְדָּא שִׁיתִּין הִלּוּלֵי, בֵּי רַבָּה שִׁיתִּין תִּיכְלֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda lived for ninety-two years, Rabba lived for forty The house of Rav Ḥisda sixty wedding feasts, house of Rabba sixty calamities.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda lived ninety-two years, Rabba lived forty years. In the house of Rav Ḥisda there were sixty wedding feasts, in the house of Rabba there were sixty cooks.

hebrew_text: בֵּי רַב חִסְדָּא סְמִידָא לְכַלְבֵי וְלָא מִתְבְּעֵי, בֵּי רַבָּה נַהֲמָא דִשְׂעָרֵי לְאִינָשֵׁי וְלָא מִשְׁתְּכַח.
human_translation: In the house of Rav Ḥisda the finest flour [ semida ] for the dogs, and it was not asked after, In the house of Rabba, barley bread for people, and it was not found
llm_translation: House of Rav Hisda: Smida for dogs and not for cats; House of Rabba: Nahama of barley for people and not for animals.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: הָנֵי תְּלָת מִילֵּי בְּעַאי קַמֵּי שְׁמַיָּא, תַּרְתֵּי יְהַבוּ לִי, חֲדָא לָא יְהַבוּ לִי: חוּכְמְתֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא, וְעוּתְרֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא, וִיהַבוּ לִי. עִנְוְתָנוּתֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא, לָא יְהַבוּ לִי.
human_translation: Rava said: These three things I requested from Heaven, two were given to me, one was not given to me: wisdom of Rav Huna and the wealth of Rav Ḥisda and they were given to me. humility of Rabba bar Rav Huna, it was not given to me.
llm_translation: And Rava said: Those three things I asked for from Heaven, two were given to me, one was not given to me: The wisdom of Rav Huna, and the wealth of Rav Hisda, were given to me. The humility of Rabba bar Rav Huna, was not given to me.

hebrew_text: רַב שְׂעוֹרִים אֲחוּהּ דְּרָבָא הֲוָה יָתֵיב קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, חַזְיֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה קָא מְנַמְנֵם. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לֵימָא לֵיהּ מָר דְּלָא לְצַעֲרַן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מָר לָאו שׁוֹשְׁבִינֵיהּ הוּא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כֵּיוָן דְּאִימְּסַר מַזָּלָא, לָא אַשְׁגַּח בִּי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לִיתְחֲזֵי לִי מָר. אִיתְחֲזִי לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמָר צַעֲרָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כִּי רִיבְדָּא דְכוּסִילְתָּא.
human_translation: Rav Seorim, Rava’s brother, sat before Rava, he saw that was dozing, said to Master, tell him, not to torment me. said to Master, are you not a friend of said to him: Since fate has been handed over no longer pays heed to me. said to Master, appear to me appeared to him. said to Master, did you have pain He said to him: Like the prick when letting blood.
llm_translation: Rav Se'orim, the brother of Rava, was sitting before Rava. He saw that he was dozing off. He said to him: "Let the Master tell me something to keep me awake." He said to him: "Is the Master not satisfied with his sitting?" He said to him: "Since my luck has been handed over, I am not concerned." He said to him: "Let the Master look at me." He looked at him. He said to him: "Did the Master have any trouble?" He said to him: "It is the dispute of the wise."

hebrew_text: רָבָא הֲוָה יָתֵיב קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, חַזְיֵיהּ דְּקָא מְנַמְנֵם. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לֵימָא לֵיהּ מָר דְּלָא לְצַעֲרַן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מָר לָאו אָדָם חָשׁוּב הוּא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאן חֲשִׁיב, מַאן סְפִין, מַאן רְקִיעַ!
human_translation: Rava sat before Rav Naḥman, he saw that was dozing, said to Master, tell not to torment me. said to him: Master, are you not an important person said to him: who is important? Who is honorable? Who is complete?
llm_translation: Rava was sitting before Rav Nachman, he saw that he was dozing off. He said to him: "Let the Master say something to keep us awake." He said to him: "Is the Master not a distinguished person?" He said to him: "Who is distinguished, who is counted, who is firmament!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לִיתְחֲזֵי לִי מָר. אִתְחֲזִי לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמָר צַעֲרָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּמִישְׁחַל בִּנִיתָא מֵחֲלָבָא, וְאִי אָמַר לִי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא זִיל בְּהָהוּא עָלְמָא כִּד הֲוֵית — לָא בָּעֵינָא, דִּנְפִישׁ בִּיעֲתוּתֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to Master, appear to me he appeared to him. said to him: Master, did you have pain said to him: Like the removal of hair from milk, were the Holy One, Blessed be He, to say to me: Go to that world, as you were, I would not want to go, for the fear of is great.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Show me, sir." He showed it to him. He said to him: "Did the master have any sorrow?" He said to him: "Like one who built from milk, and if the Holy One, blessed be He, had not said to me, 'Go into that world as you were' — I would not have wanted, for it is difficult for him."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הֲוָה קָאָכֵיל תְּרוּמָה. אִיתְחֲזִי לֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תְּרוּמָה קָא אָכֵילְנָא, וְלָאו קוֹדֶשׁ אִיקְּרִי? חֲלַפָא לֵיהּ שַׁעְתָּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar was eating teruma , appeared to him. He said to I am eating teruma ; is it not called sacred? The moment passed,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar was eating terumah. They saw him, he said to them: "I am eating terumah, and not kodesh?" He changed the subject.

hebrew_text: רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אִיתְחֲזִי לֵיהּ בְּשׁוּקָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּשׁוּקָא כִּבְהֵמָה? אִיתַא לְגַבֵּי בֵּיתָא.
human_translation: appeared to Rav Sheshet in the marketplace. said to in the market like an animal? Come to house
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet saw him in the market, he said to him: In the market like an animal? He came to his house.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אִיתְחֲזִי לֵיהּ (בְּשׁוּקָא), אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִיתְּרַח לִי תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין, וְאַהְדְּרֵי[הּ] לְתַלְמוּדַאי, דְּאָמְרִיתוּ: אַשְׁרֵי מִי שֶׁבָּא לְכָאן וְתַלְמוּדוֹ בְּיָדוֹ. בְּיוֹם תְּלָתִין אֲתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי כּוּלֵּי הַאי? קָא דָחֲקָא רַגְלֵיהּ דְּבַר נָתָן, וְאֵין מַלְכוּת נוֹגַעַת בַּחֲבֶירְתָּהּ אֲפִילּוּ כִּמְלֹא נִימָא.
human_translation: appeared to Rav Ashi in the marketplace. said to Give me thirty days so that I may review my studies, for you say Fortunate is he who comes here with his learning in his hand. On the thirtieth day came said to What is all of this? The foot of bar Natan is pushing and one sovereignty does not overlap with its counterpart, even one hairbreadth.
llm_translation: Rav Ashei saw him (in the market), he said to him: "I have been waiting for you for thirty days, and return to my studies, for you have said: 'Fortunate is he who comes here with his studies in his hand.'" On the thirtieth day he came. He said to him: "What is all this?" He was pushing his foot against a stone, and the kingdom does not touch even the edge of her garment as much as a hair's breadth.

hebrew_text: רַב חִסְדָּא, לָא הֲוָה יָכֵיל לֵיהּ, דְּלָא הֲוָה שָׁתֵיק פּוּמֵּיהּ מִגִּירְסָא, סְלֵיק יְתֵיב בְּאַרְזָא דְּבֵי רַב. פְּקַע אַרְזָא וּשְׁתַק, וִיכֵיל לֵיהּ.
human_translation: was unable Rav Ḥisda because his mouth was never silent from study. went sat on the cedar the study hall of the Sages. The cedar cracked and was silent able to him.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda, was not able to tolerate him, for he did not remain silent in the presence of the lecture; he went and sat in the cedar tree of the house of Rav. He broke a cedar branch and remained silent, and he was able to tolerate him.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חִיָּיא לָא הֲוָה מָצֵי לְמִיקְרַבא לֵיהּ, יוֹמָא חַד אִידְּמִי לֵיהּ כְּעַנְיָא, אֲתָא טָרֵיף אַבָּבָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַפֵּיק לִי רִיפְתָּא, אַפִּיקוּ לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְלָאו קָא מְרַחֵם מָר אַעַנְיָא? אַהָהוּא גַּבְרָא אַמַּאי לָא קָא מְרַחֵם מָר? גַּלִּי לֵיהּ, אַחְוִי לֵיהּ שׁוֹטָא דְנוּרָא, אַמְצִי לֵיהּ נַפְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: could not come near Rabbi Ḥiyya, One day appeared to him as a poor person. He came and knocked on the door. He said to Bring out bread for me, he took out for him. said Master, do you not have mercy on a poor person? Why, then, do you not have mercy upon that man, revealed to him, showed him a fiery rod surrendered to him.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya did not find it possible to bring him close, one day he appeared to him as a poor person, a raven came, he said to him: "Bring me a piece of bread," they brought it to him. He said to him: "Is it not the case that the Master is not merciful to the poor?" That man revealed himself to him, he turned into a flame of fire, he found himself dead.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נָשִׁים בַּמּוֹעֵד מְעַנּוֹת, אֲבָל לֹא מְטַפְּחוֹת. רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: הַסְּמוּכוֹת לַמִּטָּה מְטַפְּחוֹת.
human_translation: On a Festival women may wail but they may not clap [ metapeḥot ] Rabbi Yishmael says: Those who are close to the bier may clap.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Women may prepare food on a festival, but may not knead dough. Rabbi Yishmael says: Those close to the ground may knead dough.

hebrew_text: בְּרָאשֵׁי חֳדָשִׁים, בַּחֲנוּכָּה וּבְפוּרִים — מְעַנּוֹת וּמְטַפְּחוֹת, בְּזֶה וָזֶה — לֹא מְקוֹנְנוֹת. נִקְבַּר הַמֵּת — לֹא מְעַנּוֹת וְלֹא מְטַפְּחוֹת.
human_translation: On New Moons, Hanukkah and Purim, may wail and clap On both and on they may not lament. the deceased has been buried they may neither wail nor clap.
llm_translation: In the beginning of the months, on Hanukkah and Purim — wailing and smiting, in this and in that — are not established. When a person dies — neither wailing nor smiting.

hebrew_text: אֵיזֶהוּ עִינּוּי — שֶׁכּוּלָּן עוֹנוֹת כְּאַחַת, קִינָה — שֶׁאַחַת מְדַבֶּרֶת וְכוּלָּן עוֹנוֹת אַחֲרֶיהָ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלַמֵּדְנָה בְנוֹתֵיכֶם נֶהִי וְאִשָּׁה רְעוּתָהּ קִינָה״.
human_translation: What is wailing? when they all wail together a lament? when one speaks and they all answer after her as it is stated: “And teach your daughters wailing and everyone her neighbor lamentation”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is 'affliction'? — That they all answer together. What is 'lamentation'? — That one speaks and they all answer after her, as it is stated: "And let your daughters learn lamentation, and one another woman her dirge."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא הוּא אוֹמֵר ״בִּלַּע הַמָּוֶת לָנֶצַח וּמָחָה ה׳ אֱלֹהִים דִּמְעָה מֵעַל כׇּל פָּנִים וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: But with regard to the future, states: “He will destroy death forever; and the Lord, God, will wipe away tears from off all faces
llm_translation: However, in the future to come, it says, "Death will be swallowed up forever, and the Lord GOD will wipe away tears from all faces, etc."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי אֲמַרַן? אָמַר רַב: ״וַיי לְאָזְלָא, וַיי לַחֲבִילָא״.
human_translation: What do say? Rav said: Woe over him who is departing; woe over the pledge,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of "amaran"? Rav said: "Woe to Azel, woe to the bundle."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, נְשֵׁי דְּשַׁכְנְצִיב אֲמַרַן הָכִי: ״וַיי לָאָזְלָא, וַיי לַחֲבִילָא״. וְאָמַר רָבָא, נְשֵׁי דְשַׁכְנְצִיב אָמְרָן: ״גּוּד גַּרְמָא מִכַּכָּא וְנִמְטֵי מַיָּא לְאַנְטִיכִי״.
human_translation: Rava said: The women Shekhantziv, would say as follows: Woe over him who is departing; woe over the pledge. And Rava said: The women of Shekhantziv would say The bone has been removed from the jaw and the water returns to the kettle.
llm_translation: Rava said, the women of Shachnezib say thus: "Woe to the one who goes, woe to the one who stays." And Rava said, the women of Shachnezib say: "A knot from a palm tree, and water drips into a bucket."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא, נְשֵׁי דְשַׁכְנְצִיב אָמְרָן: ״עֲטוֹף וְכַסּוֹ טוּרֵי, דְּבַר רָמֵי וּבַר רַבְרְבֵי הוּא״. וְאָמַר רָבָא: נְשֵׁי דְשַׁכְנְצִיב אָמְרָן: ״שְׁייוֹל אִצְטְלָא דְמֵלָתָא לְבַר חוֹרִין, דִּשְׁלִימוּ זְווֹדֵיהּ״.
human_translation: And Rava said: The women of Shekhantziv would say Wrap and cover the mountains as the son of the high and distinguished. Rava said: The women of Shekhantziv would say: Lend a cloak of fine wool for a free man whose sustenance has been depleted.
llm_translation: And Rava said, the women of Shachnezib say: "Wrapped and covered are the mountains, a matter lofty and grand it is." And Rava said, the women of Shachnezib say: "The chain of the mantle of the Master of Freedom, they have completed its links."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא, נְשֵׁי דְשַׁכְנְצִיב אָמְרָן: ״רָהֵיט וְנָפֵיל אַמַּעְבָּרָא וִיזוּפְתָּא יָזֵיף״. וְאָמַר רָבָא, נְשֵׁי דְשַׁכְנְצִיב אָמְרָן: ״אֲחַנָא תַּגָּרֵי אַזַּבְזָגֵי מִיבַּדְקוּ״. וְאָמַר רָבָא, נְשֵׁי דְשַׁכְנְצִיב אָמְרָן: ״מוֹתָא כִּי מוֹתָא וּמַרְעִין חִיבוּלְיָא״.
human_translation: And Rava said: The women of Shekhantziv would say: runs and tumbles at the ford and he borrows. And Rava said: The women of Shekhantziv would say: Our brothers, the merchants, will be examined at their places And Rava said: The women of Shekhantziv would say: Death is like death, and suffering is like interest.
llm_translation: And Rava said, the women of Shachnazib say: "A rider and a fallen one, a mule and a mare will mate." And Rava said, the women of Shachnazib say: "A brother of a brother, a sister of a sister, they will be examined." And Rava said, the women of Shachnazib say: "Death for death, and bitterness for bitterness."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: ״טוֹב לָלֶכֶת אֶל בֵּית אֵבֶל וְגוֹ׳״ עַד ״וְהַחַי יִתֵּן אֶל לִבּוֹ״ — דְּבָרִים שֶׁל מִיתָה: דְּיִסְפֹּד — יִסְפְּדוּנֵיהּ, דְּיִקְבַּר — יִקְבְּרוּנֵיהּ, דְּיִטְעֹן — יִטְעֲנוּנֵיהּ, דִּידַל — יְדַלּוּנֵיהּ.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Meir would say “It is better to go to the house of mourning and the living will lay it to his heart” Matters relating to death. that eulogizes will be eulogized that buries will be buried that loads will be treated that raises will raise over him.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir would say, "It is good to go to a house of mourning, etc." until "and the living will take it to heart" - matters of death: when they eulogize it, they shall eulogize it; when they bury it, they shall bury it; when they carry it, they shall carry it; with regard to a poor person, they shall lighten it.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: דְּלָא יְדַל — יְדַלּוּנֵיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי טוֹב אֲמׇר לְךָ עֲלֵה הֵנָּה וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: And some say: who does not raise himself will be raised as it is written: For it is better to be told, step up here,
llm_translation: And there are those who say: that he should not cease - they should cease him, as it is written: "For it is good that I say to you, 'Go up there, etc.'"

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כְּשֶׁמֵּתוּ בָּנָיו שֶׁל רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל נִכְנְסוּ אַרְבָּעָה זְקֵנִים לְנַחֲמוֹ, רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. אֲמַר לָהֶם רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן: דְּעוּ שֶׁחָכָם גָּדוֹל הוּא וּבָקִי בְּאַגָּדוֹת, אַל יִכָּנֵס אֶחָד מִכֶּם לְתוֹךְ דִּבְרֵי חֲבֵירוֹ. אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: וַאֲנִי אַחֲרוֹן.
human_translation: The Sages taught When the sons of Rabbi Yishmael died, four Elders entered to console him: Rabbi Tarfon, Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, and Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Tarfon said to them: Know that is a great Sage and well versed in aggadot . Let none of you interrupt the words of another, Rabbi Akiva said: And I last.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: When the sons of Rabbi Yishmael passed away, four elders came to comfort him: Rabbi Tarfon, Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah, and Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Tarfon said to them: Know that he is a great sage and knowledgeable in aggadah, let not one of you enter into the words of his fellow. Rabbi Akiva said: And I am the last.

hebrew_text: פָּתַח רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וְאָמַר: רַבּוּ עֲוֹנוֹתָיו, תְּכָפוּהוּ אֲבָלָיו, הִטְרִיחַ רַבּוֹתָיו פַּעַם רִאשׁוֹנָה וּשְׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, opened and said Many are his sins. his bereavements came in succession he troubled his teachers once and a second time
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael began and said: "His sins, let them seize him, but not his father; his many troubles wearied him the first and second time."

hebrew_text: נַעֲנָה רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן וְאָמַר: ״וַאֲחֵיכֶם כׇּל בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל יִבְכּוּ אֶת הַשְּׂרֵפָה״. וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה נָדָב וַאֲבִיהוּא שֶׁלֹּא עָשׂוּ אֶלָּא מִצְוָה אַחַת, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּקְרִיבוּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן אֶת הַדָּם אֵלָיו״ — כָּךְ, בָּנָיו שֶׁל רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon answered and said: “But let your brethren, the whole house of Israel, bewail the burning that the Lord has kindled” Are matters not a fortiori : If, with regard to Nadav and Avihu, who had performed only one mitzva as it is written: “And the sons of Aaron brought the blood to him” this the sons of Rabbi Yishmael, all the more so
llm_translation: Rabbi Tarfon answered and said: "And your brothers, all the house of Israel, shall weep over the burning." Is it not a simple logical inference: If Nadav and Avihu, who only transgressed one commandment, as it is written: "And the sons of Aaron brought the blood to him" - so much more so, the sons of Rabbi Yishmael, how much more so.

hebrew_text: נַעֲנָה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי וְאָמַר: ״וְסָפְדוּ לוֹ כׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל וְקָבְרוּ אוֹתוֹ״, וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה אֲבִיָּה בֶּן יָרׇבְעָם שֶׁלֹּא עָשָׂה אֶלָּא דָּבָר אֶחָד טוֹב, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״יַעַן נִמְצָא בוֹ דָּבָר טוֹב״ — כָּךְ, בָּנָיו שֶׁל רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaGelili answered and said: “And all Israel shall mourn for him, and bury him” Are matters not a fortiori : If, with regard to Abijah, son of Jeroboam, who did only one good thing, as it is written: “Because in him there is found some good thing this the sons of Rabbi Yishmael all the more so
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean answered and said: "And all Israel shall mourn for him and bury him," and are these not logical arguments: Just as Abijah the son of Jeroboam who did only one good thing, as it is written about him: "Because there is found in him something good" — so too, the sons of Rabbi Ishmael — all the more so.

hebrew_text: מַאי דָּבָר טוֹב? רַבִּי זֵירָא וְרַבִּי חִינָּנָא בַּר פָּפָּא, חַד אָמַר: שֶׁבִּיטֵּל מִשְׁמַרְתּוֹ וְעָלָה לָרֶגֶל, וְחַד אָמַר: שֶׁבִּיטֵּל פַּרְדְּסָאוֹת שֶׁהוֹשִׁיב יָרׇבְעָם אָבִיו עַל הַדְּרָכִים שֶׁלֹּא יַעֲלוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל לָרֶגֶל.
human_translation: What one thing Rabbi Zeira and Rabbi Ḥinnana bar Pappa One said: He abandoned his guard post. And he went up for the pilgrimage Festival. And one said: He removed the guards [ pardesaot ] that his father, Jeroboam, had placed along the roads so that Israel would not go up for the pilgrimage Festivals.
llm_translation: "What is a good thing?" Rabbi Zeira and Rabbi Chinana bar Papa, one said: that he removed his guard and went up on foot, and one said: that he removed the orchards that Jeroboam his father had placed on the roads so that Israel would not go up on foot."

hebrew_text: נַעֲנָה רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה וְאָמַר: ״בְּשָׁלוֹם תָּמוּת וּבְמִשְׂרְפוֹת אֲבוֹתֶיךָ הַמְּלָכִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים [אֲשֶׁר הָיוּ לְפָנֶיךָ כֵּן] יִשְׂרְפוּ לָךְ״, וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה צִדְקִיָּהוּ מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה שֶׁלֹּא עָשָׂה אֶלָּא מִצְוָה אַחַת, שֶׁהֶעֱלָה יִרְמְיָה מִן הַטִּיט — כָּךְ, בָּנָיו שֶׁל רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya answered and said: “But you shall die in peace; and with the burnings of your fathers, the former kings that were before you, so shall they make a burning for you” Are matters not a fortiori : If, with regard to Zedekiah, king of Judea, who had performed one mitzva for he had Jeremiah lifted out of the mire this the sons of Rabbi Yishmael all the more so
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah responded and said: "You shall die in peace, and with the burnings of your fathers, the former kings who were before you, so they shall burn for you." And are these not a fortiori arguments: Just as King Zedekiah of Judah, who only performed one commandment, for he brought Jeremiah up from the pit — so too, the sons of Rabbi Ishmael — how much more so.

hebrew_text: נַעֲנָה רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְאָמַר: ״בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא יִגְדַּל הַמִּסְפֵּד בִּירוּשָׁלִַם כְּמִסְפַּד הֲדַדְרִימּוֹן [בְּבִקְעַת מְגִידּוֹ]״, וְאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אִלְמָלֵא תַּרְגּוּמֵיהּ דְּהַאי קְרָא, לָא הֲוָה יָדַעְנָא מַאי קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva answered and said: “On that day shall there be a great mourning in Jerusalem, like the mourning of Hadadrimmon in the valley of Megiddon” Rav Yosef said: Had it not been for the translation of this verse, we would not have known what it is saying,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva answered and said: "On that day, the mourning in Jerusalem will be as great as the mourning for Hadad-Rimmon in the valley of Megiddo." And Rav Yosef said: "If not for the Aramaic translation of this verse, we would not have known what it is saying."

hebrew_text: בְּעִידָּנָא הָהוּא יִסְגֵּי מִסְפְּדָא בִּירוּשְׁלֶם כְּמִסְפְּדָא דְּאַחְאָב בַּר עָמְרִי דִּקְטַל יָתֵיהּ הֲדַדְרִימּוֹן בַּר טַבְרִימּוֹן, וּכְמִסְפֵּד דְּיֹאשִׁיָּה בַּר אָמוֹן דִּקְטַל יָתֵיהּ פַּרְעֹה חֲגִירָא בְּבִקְעַת מְגִידּוֹ.
human_translation: At that time the mourning in Jerusalem will be as great as the mourning over Ahab, son of Omri, who was slain by Hadadrimmon, son of Tabrimmon, and like the mourning over Josiah, son of Amon, who was slain by Pharaoh the lame in the valley of Megiddon.
llm_translation: In that time, that one lamented in Jerusalem like the lamentation of Ahab son of Omri who was killed by Hadadrimmon son of Tabrimmon, and like the lamentation of Josiah son of Ammon who was killed by Pharaoh Haggirah in the Valley of Megiddo.

hebrew_text: וַהֲלֹא דְּבָרִים קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה אַחְאָב מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁלֹּא עָשָׂה אֶלָּא דָּבָר אֶחָד טוֹב, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהַמֶּלֶךְ הָיָה מׇעֳמָד בַּמֶּרְכָּבָה נֹכַח אֲרָם״ — כָּךְ, בָּנָיו שֶׁל רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: Are matters not a fortiori : If, with regard to Ahab, king of Israel, who did one good thing as it is written: “And the king was propped up in his chariot facing Aram” this, all the more so the sons of Rabbi Yishmael
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And are not these things a fortiori: And what Ahab king of Israel who did only one good thing, as it is written: 'And the king stood in his chariot facing Aram' — so, the sons of Rabbi Ishmael — how much more so." English translation:

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַבָּה בַּר מָרִי: כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ בְּצִדְקִיָּהוּ ״בְּשָׁלוֹם תָּמוּת״, וּכְתִיב ״וְאֶת עֵינֵי צִדְקִיָּהוּ עִוֵּר״! אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שֶׁמֵּת נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּר בְּיָמָיו.
human_translation: Rava said to Rabba bar Mari: It is written with regard to Zedekiah: “You shall die in peace,” but it is written: “And he put out Zedekiah’s eyes” said to him: Rabbi Yoḥanan said as follows: that Nebuchadnezzar died in lifetime
llm_translation: Rava said to Rabba bar Mari: It is written in it about Zedekiah, "You shall die in peace," and it is written, "But Zedekiah's eyes shall be put out!" He said to him, thus said Rabbi Yochanan: Nebuchadnezzar died in his days.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא לְרַבָּה בַּר מָרִי, כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ בְּיֹאשִׁיָּהוּ: ״לָכֵן הִנְנִי אוֹסִיפְךָ עַל אֲבוֹתֶיךָ וְנֶאֱסַפְתָּ אֶל קִבְרוֹתֶיךָ בְּשָׁלוֹם״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיּוֹרוּ הַיּוֹרִים לַמֶּלֶךְ יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ״, וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: שֶׁעֲשָׂאוּהוּ כִּכְבָרָה!
human_translation: And Rava said to Rabba bar Mari: It is written with regard to Josiah: “Behold, therefore I will gather you unto your fathers, and you shall be gathered into your grave in peace” and it is written: “And the archers shot at King Josiah; And Rabbi Yehuda said Rav said: they made like a sieve.
llm_translation: And Rava said to Rabba bar Mari, it is written in it in Josiah: "Therefore, behold, I will gather you to your fathers, and you shall be gathered to your grave in peace." And it is written: "And the archers shot at King Josiah." And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: They made him like a sieve!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שֶׁלֹּא חָרַב בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ בְּיָמָיו.
human_translation: said to him: Rabbi Yoḥanan said as follows: that the Temple was not destroyed in his lifetime,
llm_translation: He said to him, thus said Rabbi Yochanan: "The Holy Temple did not fall in his days."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין מְנַחֲמִין רַשָּׁאִין לוֹמַר דָּבָר עַד שֶׁיִּפְתַּח אָבֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַחֲרֵי כֵן פָּתַח אִיּוֹב אֶת פִּיהוּ״, וַהֲדַר: ״וַיַּעַן אֱלִיפַז הַתֵּימָנִי״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The consolers are not permitted to speak words until the mourner opens As it is stated: After this Job opened his mouth” And afterward: “And Eliphaz the Temanite answered
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: One does not console a mourner until he opens his mouth, as it is stated: "After this, Job opened his mouth" (Job 3:1), and then it is written: "Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מִנַּיִן לָאָבֵל שֶׁמֵּיסֵב בָּרֹאשׁ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶבֲחַר דַּרְכָּם וְאֵשֵׁב רֹאשׁ וְאֶשְׁכּוֹן כְּמֶלֶךְ בַּגְּדוּד כַּאֲשֶׁר אֲבֵלִים יְנַחֵם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: From where the mourner reclines at the head [ rosh ] As it is stated: “I chose out their way, and sat as chief [ rosh ], and dwelt as a king in the army, as one that comforts [ yenaḥem ] the mourners”
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: From where do we derive that a mourner should sit with his head uncovered? As it is stated: "I will choose their way and sit as chief, and dwell like a king in the troop, as one who comforts mourners."

hebrew_text: ״יְנַחֵם״ — אַחֲרִינֵי מַשְׁמַע! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: ״יִנָּחֵם״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: yenaḥem means that he comforts others, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: is written yinaḥem ,
llm_translation: "Yenachem" - after implications! Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "Yinachem" is written.

hebrew_text: מָר זוּטְרָא אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״וְסָר מִרְזַח סְרוּחִים״. ״מִרְזָח״ — נַעֲשֶׂה שַׂר לִסְרוּחִים.
human_translation: Mar Zutra said: from here: “And the revelry [ mirzaḥ ] of those who stretched themselves out shall pass away [ sar ]” mirzaḥ , [ ] is made a prince [ sar ] over those who stretched out
llm_translation: Mar Zutra said from here: "And remove the dross from the silver." "Dross" - will become a prince for the rebels.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר חֲנִינָא: מִנַּיִן לְחָתָן שֶׁמֵּיסֵב בָּרֹאשׁ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כְּחָתָן יְכַהֵן פְּאֵר״, מָה כֹּהֵן בָּרֹאשׁ — אַף חָתָן בָּרֹאשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina said: From where that a groom reclines at the head As it is stated: “As a bridegroom decks himself [ yekhahen ] with a garland” Just as a priest [ kohen ] at the head so too, a bridegroom at the head
llm_translation: Rabbi Ḥama son of Ḥanina said: From where do we derive that a groom should be seated at the head of the table? As it is stated: "Like a groom who adorns himself with a turban" (Isaiah 61:10). Just as a priest stands at the head of the congregation, so too should a groom be seated at the head of the table.

hebrew_text: וְכֹהֵן גּוּפֵיהּ מְנָלַן? דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״וְקִדַּשְׁתּוֹ״, לְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁבִּקְדוּשָּׁה: לִפְתּוֹחַ רִאשׁוֹן, וּלְבָרֵךְ רִאשׁוֹן, וְלִיטּוֹל מָנָה יָפָה רִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: From where do we the priest himself As the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: “You shall sanctify him, with regard to all matters of sanctity: To be first to begin to be first to recite the Grace and to be first to take a portion
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And how does the priest himself benefit? For it was taught in the school of Rabbi Ishmael: 'And you shall sanctify him,' for every matter of sanctity: to open first, and to bless first, and to take the best portion first."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: קָשָׁה יְצִיאַת נְשָׁמָה מִן הַגּוּף
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said: The soul’s departure from the body is as difficult
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chanina: difficult the departure of the soul from the body.

hebrew_text: כְּצִיפּוֹרֵי בְּפִי הַוֶּושֶׁט. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: כְּפִטּוּרֵי בְּפִי וֶושֶׁט.
human_translation: as for a knotted rope [ tzippori ] to pass through an eye [ veshet ] Rabbi Yoḥanan said: as for a halyard [ pitirei ] to pass through an eye [ veshet ].
llm_translation: Like birds in the mouth of a weaver's shuttle. Rabbi Yochanan said: Like sparrows in the mouth of a weaver's shuttle.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי בַּר חַיְתָא: הַנִּפְטָר מִן הַמֵּת, לֹא יֹאמַר לוֹ ״לֵךְ לְשָׁלוֹם״, אֶלָּא ״לֵךְ בְּשָׁלוֹם״. הַנִּפְטָר מִן הַחַי, לֹא יֹאמַר לוֹ ״לֵךְ בְּשָׁלוֹם״, אֶלָּא ״לֵךְ לְשָׁלוֹם״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Levi bar Ḥayyata said: One who departs from the deceased should not say to him: Go to peace, but rather Go in peace. One who departs from the living should not say to him: Go in peace, but rather Go to peace.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Levi bar Chayta said: One who is departing from the deceased, should not say to him "Go in peace," but rather "Go in peace." One who is departing from the living, should not say to him "Go in peace," but rather "Go in peace."

hebrew_text: הַנִּפְטָר מִן הַמֵּת, לֹא יֹאמַר לוֹ ״לֵךְ לְשָׁלוֹם״, אֶלָּא ״לֵךְ בְּשָׁלוֹם״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַתָּה תָּבֹא אֶל אֲבוֹתֶיךָ בְּשָׁלוֹם״.
human_translation: One who departs from the deceased should not say to him: Go to peace, but rather: Go in peace, as it is stated: “And you shall go to your fathers in peace;
llm_translation: The one who is released from the dead, should not say to him "Go in peace," but rather "Go in peace," as it is said: "And you shall come to your fathers in peace."

hebrew_text: הַנִּפְטָר מִן הַחַי, לֹא יֹאמַר לוֹ ״לֵךְ בְּשָׁלוֹם״, אֶלָּא ״לֵךְ לְשָׁלוֹם״, שֶׁהֲרֵי דָּוִד שֶׁאָמַר לְאַבְשָׁלוֹם ״לֵךְ בְּשָׁלוֹם״, הָלַךְ וְנִתְלָה, יִתְרוֹ שֶׁאָמַר לְמֹשֶׁה ״לֵךְ לְשָׁלוֹם״, הָלַךְ וְהִצְלִיחַ.
human_translation: One who departs from the living should not say to him: Go in peace, but rather: Go to peace, as David said to Absalom: “Go in peace” he went and was hanged; Jethro said to Moses: “Go to peace” he went and was successful.
llm_translation: The one who departs from the living, one should not say to him "Go in peace," but rather "Go to peace," for David said to Avshalom "Go in peace," and he went and was hanged; Yitro, however, said to Moshe "Go to peace," and he went and succeeded.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: כׇּל הַיּוֹצֵא מִבֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ, וּמִבֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, זוֹכֶה וּמְקַבֵּל פְּנֵי שְׁכִינָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יֵלְכוּ מֵחַיִל אֶל חָיִל יֵרָאֶה אֶל אֱלֹהִים בְּצִיּוֹן״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Levi said: Anyone who leaves from the synagogue to the study hall or from the study hall to the synagogue, merits to receive the Divine Presence, as it is stated: “They go from strength to strength, every one of them appears before God in Zion”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Levi said: Anyone who goes out from the synagogue to the study hall, and from the study hall to the synagogue, merits and receives the presence of the Divine Presence, as it is said: "They will go from strength to strength; each one will appear before God in Zion."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר רַב: תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים אֵין לָהֶם מְנוּחָה אֲפִילּוּ לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יֵלְכוּ מֵחַיִל אֶל חָיִל יֵרָאֶה אֶל אֱלֹהִים בְּצִיּוֹן״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi said Rav said: Torah scholars have no rest, even in the World-to-Come, as it is stated: “They go from strength to strength, every one of them appears before God in Zion.”
llm_translation: Rav Chiya bar Ashe said in the name of Rav: The students of the sages have no rest even in the World to Come, as it is stated: "They will go from strength to strength; each one will appear before God in Zion."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ וְאֵלּוּ מְגַלְּחִין וּסְלִיקָא לַהּ מַסֶּכֶת מוֹעֵד קָטָן
llm_translation: We will return to you, and these are the ones who shave and bring out the tractate Moed Katan.
